original: byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya bas rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid yin pas des na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer🔽na zhes bya ba ni 'dir brda sprod pa dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas @163a * //
analyzed: byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya bas rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid yin pas des na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni 'dir brda sprod pa dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas @163a * //
translated: The supreme desire of the agent is the object, because they are established by their own characteristics, they are not mutually dependent. Therefore, the meaning of the reason “because they are dependent” is not established.

original: pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: “If” means that the grammarians say that the reason “because they are dependent” is not established in the Madhyamaka’s statement, “Because they are dependent, they are not tenable.”

original: de dag na re kho bo cag gi brda sprod pa'i byed pa po'i sde tshan las rang dbang ni byed pa po'o //🔽bsgrub pa'i mchog ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: de dag na re kho bo cag gi brda sprod pa'i byed pa po'i sde tshan las rang dbang ni byed pa po'o // bsgrub pa'i mchog ni byed pa po'o //
translated: They say, “In our grammar, the class of agents is independent, the supreme object is the agent,

original: byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so //
analyzed: byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so //
translated: the supreme desire of the agent is the object,

original: las kyis mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: las kyis mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par sbyin pa'o //
translated: and that which is desired by the object is the perfect gift.

original: gnas pa las dgar ba ni dbral ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las dgar ba ni dbral ba'o //
translated: The separation from abiding is separation.

original: kun 'dzin pa ni gzhi'o zhes 'byung bas de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid yin pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kun 'dzin pa ni gzhi'o zhes 'byung bas de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid yin pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is said that “the all-pervading is the basis,” they are established by their own intrinsic reality, and they are not mutually dependent. Therefore your reason is not established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: sun 'byin par byed pa la brkam pa nyid kyis de la gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa la brkam pa nyid kyis de la gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: “Those who are greedy for refutation will be greatly harmed by it.”

original: kho bo'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya bas byed pa po dang las dag gi byed pa dang las zhes tha snyad gdags pa nyid la phan tshun rgyu'i dngos por nye par 'gro ba yod pa yin par bsgrubs pa des sun 'byin pa la
analyzed: kho bo'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya bas byed pa po dang las dag gi byed pa dang las zhes tha snyad gdags pa nyid la phan tshun rgyu'i dngos por nye par 'gro ba yod pa yin par bsgrubs pa des sun 'byin pa la
translated: “Because my reason is dependent” establishes that the agent and action are merely designated as “agent” and “action,” and that they are mutually related as cause and effect.

original: brkam pa nyid kyis brda sprod pa bde la rgyu med pa dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu tha mi dad pa dang / bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa mi rigs pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa yod pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: brkam pa nyid kyis brda sprod pa bde la rgyu med pa dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu tha mi dad pa dang / bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa mi rigs pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa yod pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause, the nonexistence of the path of liberation and heaven, and the consequence that all action would be pointless.🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause

original: de'i 'bras bu med pa dang / thar pa dang mtho ris kyi lam mi 'thad pa dang / bya ba thams cad don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur bas klan ka de mi rung ngo zhes ston to //🔽ci ltar zhe na zhes bya bas ni ci ltar de la gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu med pa dang / thar pa dang mtho ris kyi lam mi 'thad pa dang / bya ba thams cad don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur bas klan ka de mi rung ngo zhes ston to // ci ltar zhe na zhes bya bas ni ci ltar de la gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause

original: de la re zhig ci ltar rgyu med pa'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig ci ltar rgyu med pa'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The fault of the nonexistence of the effect and cause🔽The fault of the nonexistence of the effect

original: 'di la rang dbang ni byed pa po'i zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang las sgrub pa'i thabs mkhas pa la rang dbang yod pa'i phyir las la ltos pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di la rang dbang ni byed pa po'i zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang las sgrub pa'i thabs mkhas pa la rang dbang yod pa'i phyir las la ltos pa nyid yin la /
translated: Here, “independence” is the agent, and that is also dependent on action, because it is the skillful means for accomplishing action.🔽And the “supreme desire of the agent” is action, and that is also dependent on the agent.

original: byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang byed pa po la ltos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa po dang las dag gi byed pa po dang las zhes tha snyad gdags pa nyid la ni phan tshun rgyu'i dngos
analyzed: byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang byed pa po la ltos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa po dang las dag gi byed pa po dang las zhes tha snyad gdags pa nyid la ni phan tshun rgyu'i dngos
translated: Therefore, the designation of the agent and action as agent and action is the mutual dependence of the entities of cause and effect.

original: por nye bar 'gro ba yod pa yin na de yang byed pa po dang las dag ltos pa med par smra ba la mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: por nye bar 'gro ba yod pa yin na de yang byed pa po dang las dag ltos pa med par smra ba la mi 'thad pas /
translated: But since that is untenable for one who advocates the agent and action are independent,

original: de'i phyir byed pa po dang las dag la rgyu med par gyur to zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa po dang las dag la rgyu med par gyur to zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: therefore it is said that the agent and action would be without a cause.

original: ci ltar 'bras bu dang rgyu mi @163b 'thad pa'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: ci ltar 'bras bu dang rgyu mi @163b 'thad pa'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir de ltar /
translated: To demonstrate how the great fault of the non-tenability of cause and effect arises, it is said:

original: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i mthus bya ba nyid kyis 'bras bu zhes bya zhing lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu tshogs su zin kyang de yod na 'byung ba nyid kyi 'bras bu'i rgyu zhes bya na ltos pa med pa la ni rgyu med pa yang rgyur mi
analyzed: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i mthus bya ba nyid kyis 'bras bu zhes bya zhing lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu tshogs su zin kyang de yod na 'byung ba nyid kyi 'bras bu'i rgyu zhes bya na ltos pa med pa la ni rgyu med pa yang rgyur mi
translated: an effect nor a cause would be tenable.

original: rung la / de'i 'bras bu med pa yang 'bras bur mi rung ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rung la / de'i 'bras bu med pa yang 'bras bur mi rung ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Through the power of the individual determination of causes and conditions, that which is an action is called an effect. Even if the collection of cooperating causes is complete, if it exists, it is called the cause of the effect. But if it is not dependent, then that which is without cause is not suitable as a cause, and that which is without an effect is not suitable as an effect. This is the intended meaning.

original: ji ltar bya ba dang / byed pa po dang / byed pa dag mi rigs pa'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar bya ba dang / byed pa po dang / byed pa dag mi rigs pa'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the great harm that ensues from the untenability of action, agent, and instrument, he says:

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽de med na ni bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed mi rigs //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / de med na ni bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed mi rigs //
translated: Moreover,🔽if that does not exist, then action, agent, and instrument are untenable.

original: 'bras bu de med na bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de med na bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag mi rigs te /
translated: If that effect does not exist, then action, agent, and instrument are untenable.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi bya ba de yang byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya bas byed pa po la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi bya ba de yang byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya bas byed pa po la ltos pa yin la /
translated: Also, the activity of worldly objects such as pots is supreme in the desire of the agent, and thus it depends on the agent.

original: bum pa sgrub nus pa'i rtsol ba la thabs shes pa ma brjed pa'i mkhas pa la rang dbang ni byed pa po'i zhes bya ba de yang byed pa po gzhan la mi ltos shing /🔽las la ltos pa yin /
analyzed: bum pa sgrub nus pa'i rtsol ba la thabs shes pa ma brjed pa'i mkhas pa la rang dbang ni byed pa po'i zhes bya ba de yang byed pa po gzhan la mi ltos shing / las la ltos pa yin /
translated: The pot is the supreme object of the activity of the agent, and that also does not depend on another agent, but it depends on the object.🔽The pot is established by many branches of establishment, and the supreme object of the activity of those branches of establishment is the agent.

original: bum pa sgrub pa'i yan lag du mas bsgrub par bya ba de nyid kyi sgrub pa'i yan lag las sgrub pa'i mchog ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba de yang byed pa po dang las dag la ltos pa yin na ltos pa med pa la ni de dag
analyzed: bum pa sgrub pa'i yan lag du mas bsgrub par bya ba de nyid kyi sgrub pa'i yan lag las sgrub pa'i mchog ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba de yang byed pa po dang las dag la ltos pa yin na ltos pa med pa la ni de dag
translated: That also depends on the agent and the object.

original: med de / gcad par bya ba'i shing med na bcad pa dang gcod pa po dang gcod pa dag med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: med de / gcad par bya ba'i shing med na bcad pa dang gcod pa po dang gcod pa dag med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If they were independent, then those would not exist, just as if the tree to be cut does not exist, then the cutting, the cutter, and the act of cutting would not exist.

original: ci ltar chos dang chos ma yin pa dag yod pa ma yin pa'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar chos dang chos ma yin pa dag yod pa ma yin pa'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the great harm that ensues from the non-existence of right and wrong, he says:

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: bya ba la sogs mi rigs na //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs mi rigs na //
translated: if action and so on are not tenable,

original: chos dang chos min yod ma yin //
analyzed: chos dang chos min yod ma yin //
translated: right and wrong do not exist.

original: bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag mi rigs na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag mi rigs na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If action, agent, and instrument are not tenable, then right and wrong do not exist.

original: pha rol po'i tshul las chos dang chos ma yin pa dag ni bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag gis gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: pha rol po'i tshul las chos dang chos ma yin pa dag ni bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag gis gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The opponent’s view is that right and wrong are established by action, agent, and instrument, and that they are manifested by them.

original: ci ste yang rang gi sde pa la 'di skad ces 'du byed rnams la byed pa po dang tshor ba po med pa'i phyir byed pa po med pa'i skyon gyis mi gnod de chos dang chos ma yin pa dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyi bya ba'i khyad
analyzed: ci ste yang rang gi sde pa la 'di skad ces 'du byed rnams la byed pa po dang tshor ba po med pa'i phyir byed pa po med pa'i skyon gyis mi gnod de chos dang chos ma yin pa dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyi bya ba'i khyad
translated: But if you say to our schools, “The error of the absence of an agent does not apply to us because we assert that actions and agents exist in the sense of the body, speech, and mental actions that are the nature of virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena,”

original: par gyi bdag nyid du @164a * //
analyzed: par gyi bdag nyid du @164a * //
translated: then this is the Sautrāntika position.

original: khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag sngar dbu ma pas brda sprod pa dag la /🔽de med na ni bya ba dang // byed pa po dang byed mi rigs //
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag sngar dbu ma pas brda sprod pa dag la / de med na ni bya ba dang // byed pa po dang byed mi rigs //
translated: The Madhyamaka previously said to the grammarians:🔽If it does not exist, then action🔽and the agent and instrument are illogical.

original: zhes bya bas ltos pa med pa la ni bya ba dang byed pa po la byed pa de dag med de /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ltos pa med pa la ni bya ba dang byed pa po la byed pa de dag med de /
translated: In the absence of dependence, action, agent, and instrument do not exist.

original: gcad par bya ba'i shing med na gcad pa dang / gcod pa po dang gcod pa dag med pa bzhin no zhes smras pas ltos pa med pa la byed pa po med pa'i skyon gyi gnod pa yod do zhes bshad pa de kho bo cag mdo sde pa'i phyogs la mi gnod de /
analyzed: gcad par bya ba'i shing med na gcad pa dang / gcod pa po dang gcod pa dag med pa bzhin no zhes smras pas ltos pa med pa la byed pa po med pa'i skyon gyi gnod pa yod do zhes bshad pa de kho bo cag mdo sde pa'i phyogs la mi gnod de /
translated: The fault of the nonexistence of an agent in the absence of dependence does not undermine our Sautrāntika standpoint.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽kho bo cag mdo sde pa'i phyogs la 'du byed rnams la brda sprod pa po dag gis brtags pa'i rang dbang ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'i byed pa po dang tshor ba po med pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa la byed pa po med pa'i
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / kho bo cag mdo sde pa'i phyogs la 'du byed rnams la brda sprod pa po dag gis brtags pa'i rang dbang ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'i byed pa po dang tshor ba po med pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa la byed pa po med pa'i
translated: Why?🔽The fault of the nonexistence of an agent in the absence of dependence does not undermine our Sautrāntika standpoint because we do not assert that agents and experiencers exist as the grammarians imagine, that is, as independent entities.

original: skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba des mi gnod de kho bo cag gi phyogs la rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa ni kun rdzob tu byed pa por khas blangs la /
analyzed: skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba des mi gnod de kho bo cag gi phyogs la rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa ni kun rdzob tu byed pa por khas blangs la /
translated: We Sautrāntikas do not assert that the collection of causes and conditions is an agent in the ultimate truth.

original: des bya ba'i chos dang chos ma yin pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi bya ba'i khyad par can dag ni las nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir brda sprod pa bdag gis brtags pa'i bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag med pas /
analyzed: des bya ba'i chos dang chos ma yin pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi bya ba'i khyad par can dag ni las nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir brda sprod pa bdag gis brtags pa'i bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag med pas /
translated: Since we accept that the phenomena of action and nonaction, which are the specific activities of body, speech, and mind, are karma, the faults you ascribe to us, that we Followers of the Middle Way are without activity, agent, or action, do not apply to us.

original: khyed dbu ma pas ltos pa med pa la byed pa po med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa de kho bo cag la mi gnod do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas ltos pa med pa la byed pa po med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa de kho bo cag la mi gnod do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: You say that we would incur the fault of having no agent without dependence, but that fault does not apply to us.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis //
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis //
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary here says:

original: rgyu phan 'dogs pa tshogs pa tsam tha snyad du byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pas de la ltos pas nyid kyi chos dang chos ma yin pa dag las kyi sgrar brjod pa'i phyir byed pa po med na de la ltos pa'i las mi 'grub pa'i phyir
analyzed: rgyu phan 'dogs pa tshogs pa tsam tha snyad du byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pas de la ltos pas nyid kyi chos dang chos ma yin pa dag las kyi sgrar brjod pa'i phyir byed pa po med na de la ltos pa'i las mi 'grub pa'i phyir
translated: Since we accept that the mere assembly of causes that benefit is the agent conventionally, and since that is dependent on phenomena and nonphenomena, which are called “actions,” if there were no agent, the actions that depend on it would not be established.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa dag med pa'i skyon gyis mi gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa dag med pa'i skyon gyis mi gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: The error of the nonexistence of Dharma, nondharma and so on does not undermine us,

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because the reasoning of dependence is not undermined.

original: khyed mdo sde pa dag la brda sprod pa ba dag gis brtags pa'i rang dbang ni byed pa po zhes bya ba de lta bu med du zin kyang dngos po rgyu rkyen las 'byung ba rnams la rgyu rkyen gang dag gis phan 'dogs pa tshogs pa tsam dag🔽tha snyad du byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pas byed pa po de la ltos pa nyid kyis chos dang chos ma yin pa dag las kyi sgrar brjod pa'i phyir khyed la yang khyed rang gis brtags pa'i byed pa po med na de la ltos pa'i las
analyzed: khyed mdo sde pa dag la brda sprod pa ba dag gis brtags pa'i rang dbang ni byed pa po zhes bya ba de lta bu med du zin kyang dngos po rgyu rkyen las 'byung ba rnams la rgyu rkyen gang dag gis phan 'dogs pa tshogs pa tsam dag tha snyad du byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pas byed pa po de la ltos pa nyid kyis chos dang chos ma yin pa dag las kyi sgrar brjod pa'i phyir khyed la yang khyed rang gis brtags pa'i byed pa po med na de la ltos pa'i las
translated: You Sautrantikas may say that although the independent creator imputed by grammarians does not exist, still you accept that things that arise from causes and conditions are creators conventionally, in the sense that the mere assembly of causes and conditions that benefit them🔽is a creator. Therefore, since you rely on a creator, you also rely on Dharma and nondharma, which are called karma.

original: mi 'grub pa'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa dag med pa'i @164b skyon gyis mi gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'grub pa'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa dag med pa'i @164b skyon gyis mi gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, since the creator imputed by you does not exist, the error of the nonexistence of Dharma, nondharma and so on does not undermine you, because the karma that relies on it is not established.

original: gnod pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be only harmful.

original: gnod pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir ltos pa'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnod pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir ltos pa'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for the harm, he says, because the principle of dependence is not tenable.

original: rgyu phan 'dogs pa tshogs pa tsam tha snyad du byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa de med na gang la ltos nas las 'grub par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu phan 'dogs pa tshogs pa tsam tha snyad du byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa de med na gang la ltos nas las 'grub par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mere collection of causes and conditions that are beneficial is accepted as the agent conventionally, then in the absence of that, in dependence on what would karma be accomplished? It would not be accomplished.

original: las mi 'grub na chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa dag med pa'i skyon gyis mi gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: las mi 'grub na chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa dag med pa'i skyon gyis mi gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: If karma is not accomplished, then the error that virtue and nonvirtue, etc., do not exist would not be harmful.

original: gnod pa kho nar 'gyur bas de'i phyir khyed kyis kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnod pa kho nar 'gyur bas de'i phyir khyed kyis kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It would be only harmful. Therefore, you must accept the meaning of the reason, “because they are dependent,” he says. This is the meaning.

original: ltos pa med par smra ba rnams la chos dang chos ma yin pa med pas ci ltar de'i 'bras bu med pa'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir de ltar ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: ltos pa med par smra ba rnams la chos dang chos ma yin pa med pas ci ltar de'i 'bras bu med pa'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir de ltar ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: In order to teach this, it is said:

original: chos dang chos min med na ni //
analyzed: chos dang chos min med na ni //
translated: If Dharma and non-Dharma do not exist,

original: de las byung ba'i 'bras bu med //🔽chos dang chos ma yin pa dag med na de dag las byung ba'i 'bras bu lha dang mi dang sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags kyi 'gro ba dag tu /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'bras bu med // chos dang chos ma yin pa dag med na de dag las byung ba'i 'bras bu lha dang mi dang sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags kyi 'gro ba dag tu /
translated: the effect arising from them does not exist.

original: lus dang dbang po dang longs spyod 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i bdag nyid 'grub pa dag med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang longs spyod 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i bdag nyid 'grub pa dag med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If Dharma and non-Dharma do not exist, the effect arising from them does not exist. The effect arising from them is the accomplishment of the nature of the desired and undesired body, faculties, and resources in the realms of gods, humans, hell beings, animals, and ghosts.🔽This is what is said.

original: ci ltar thar pa dang mtho ris kyi lam mi 'thad pa dang bya ba thams cad de na med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: ci ltar thar pa dang mtho ris kyi lam mi 'thad pa dang bya ba thams cad de na med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir de ltar /
translated: To demonstrate the great faults that would ensue, such as how the paths to liberation and to the higher realms would be untenable and how all actions would be meaningless, the treatise states:🔽If there were no effects,

original: 'bras bu med na thar pa dang // mtho ris 'gyur ba'i lam mi 'thad //
analyzed: 'bras bu med na thar pa dang // mtho ris 'gyur ba'i lam mi 'thad //
translated: The paths to liberation and to the higher realms would be untenable.

original: bya ba dag ni thams cad kyang //
analyzed: bya ba dag ni thams cad kyang //
translated: All actions

original: don med nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: don med nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Would be meaningless.🔽If there were no effects, the paths to liberation and to the higher realms would be untenable.

original: 'bras bu med na thal bar 'gyur ba'i lam rnal 'byor pa dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du btang ba'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'bras bu med na thal bar 'gyur ba'i lam rnal 'byor pa dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du btang ba'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur la /
translated: The path to liberation, which is the cultivation of the eightfold path of the noble ones preceded by the correct view, would be untenable.

original: mtho ris su 'gyur ba'i lam tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dang / bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa la mngon par brtson pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mtho ris su 'gyur ba'i lam tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dang / bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa la mngon par brtson pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The path to the higher realms, which is the practice of taking up discipline and striving in concentration and meditative absorption, would be untenable.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba thams cad don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba thams cad don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: then it follows that all mundane and supramundane activities would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir de ltar byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yin par rtog pa la gnod spa chen po de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba bzlog @165a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yin par rtog pa la gnod spa chen po de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba bzlog @165a * //
translated: Thus, since these great faults would arise if one imagines that an unreal agent performs an unreal action, or that an unreal action is performed by an unreal agent,

original: dka' bar rig nas byed pa po dang las dag ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i nyes dmigs bstan nas phyogs phyi ma yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dka' bar rig nas byed pa po dang las dag ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i nyes dmigs bstan nas phyogs phyi ma yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: one should understand that agent and action are related. This is a statement that, having shown the faults of the opponent’s position, one should correctly adopt the other position.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs kha na ma tho ba med pa ci skad bstan pa de yod pa'i phyir byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yin par sgrub pa'i phyogs de mi 'thad par bstan to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs kha na ma tho ba med pa ci skad bstan pa de yod pa'i phyir byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yin par sgrub pa'i phyogs de mi 'thad par bstan to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Thus, because the faultless reason has been taught, it has been demonstrated that the position that a non-agent performs a non-action and a non-action is the object of the activity of a non-agent is untenable. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: de ltar dam bcas pa'i don nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa yang bsgrubs zin te /
analyzed: de ltar dam bcas pa'i don nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa yang bsgrubs zin te /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the thesis has been established and the second step has been completed.

original: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa gnyis pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa gnyis pa bstan zin to //
translated: The two theses that a non-agent does not perform a non-action and a non-action is not the object of the activity of a non-agent have been demonstrated.

original: da ni byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa gsum pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa gsum pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: actual and non-actual agent.🔽In order to present the opponent’s position, it is said that according to the

original: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam grangs kyi tshul smra ba dag na re rnam grangs las byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba smras
analyzed: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam grangs kyi tshul smra ba dag na re rnam grangs las byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba smras
translated: pūrvapārṭhikas, there is no error because the actual and non-actual agent🔽performs the actual and non-actual action.🔽Here, the pūrvapārṭhikas say that in our system, the agent, in virtue of

original: te / 'dir rnam grangs kyi tshul smra bar 'os pa pa dag na re kho bo cag gi phyogs la byed pa po ni srog gi rdzas kyi rnam grangs la ltos na yin par gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: te / 'dir rnam grangs kyi tshul smra bar 'os pa pa dag na re kho bo cag gi phyogs la byed pa po ni srog gi rdzas kyi rnam grangs la ltos na yin par gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: being a different state of the substance of life, is actual.

original: lus kyi rdzas kyi rnam grangs la ltos na ma yin par gyur pa yang yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi rdzas kyi rnam grangs la ltos na ma yin par gyur pa yang yin no //
translated: But in relation to the categories of the substance of the body, it is not a real agent.

original: las kyang 'jim pa dang rgyu spun la sogs pa rgyu'i rnam grangs la ltos na yin par gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: las kyang 'jim pa dang rgyu spun la sogs pa rgyu'i rnam grangs la ltos na yin par gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: Also, in relation to the categories of causes such as clay and thread, action is a real cause.🔽But in relation to the categories of effects such as a vase and a cloth, it is not a real cause.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rnam grangs la ltos na ma yin par gyur pa yang ma yin pas de'i phyir byed pa po de las de byed cing las de yang byed pa po de'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi sgrub pa snga
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rnam grangs la ltos na ma yin par gyur pa yang ma yin pas de'i phyir byed pa po de las de byed cing las de yang byed pa po de'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi sgrub pa snga
translated: Therefore, since the agent performs that action and that action is the activity of that agent, the error of the first two proofs

original: ma gnyis kyi skyon kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma gnyis kyi skyon kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
translated: does not exist in our position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /🔽byed pa por gyur ma gyur pa //
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa / byed pa por gyur ma gyur pa //
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:🔽A real or unreal agent

original: gyur ma gyur te mi byed do //
analyzed: gyur ma gyur te mi byed do //
translated: Does not perform a real or unreal action.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says:

original: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa ni bya ba dang ldan pa dang bya ba dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa ni bya ba dang ldan pa dang bya ba dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the existent and nonexistent agent” refers to the agent who possesses activity and the agent who does not possess activity.

original: @165b las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang bya ba dang ldan pa dang bya ba dang mi ldan pa'o //🔽des de mi byed cing /
analyzed: @165b las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang bya ba dang ldan pa dang bya ba dang mi ldan pa'o // des de mi byed cing /
translated: The phrase “the existent and nonexistent action” refers to the action that is possessed and the action that is not possessed.

original: de de'i bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de de'i bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The existent and nonexistent agent does not perform the existent and nonexistent action.🔽The existent and nonexistent action is not performed by the existent and nonexistent agent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: yin dang ma yin gyur pa ni /
analyzed: yin dang ma yin gyur pa ni /
translated: How could the existent and nonexistent🔽be one, since they are mutually contradictory?

original: phan tshun 'gal bas ga la gcig /'di ltar yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa ni phan tshun 'gal bas gcig la dus gcig tu mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bas ga la gcig /'di ltar yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa ni phan tshun 'gal bas gcig la dus gcig tu mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, the existent and nonexistent are not tenable as one at one time, since they are mutually contradictory.

original: gal te yin na ni ci ltar ma yin par 'gyur ci ste ma yin na ni ci ltar yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni ci ltar ma yin par 'gyur ci ste ma yin na ni ci ltar yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If something is existent, how could it be nonexistent? If it is nonexistent, how could it be existent?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na me la tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid dang grang ba'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na me la tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid dang grang ba'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, in the world, the essential nature of heat and the essential nature of cold are not observed in fire.

original: gnas gcig pa'i 'gal ba dang gcig gis gcig bsal ba'i 'gal ba dang 'jig rten la grags pa'i 'gal ba de dag yod pa'i phyir des de mi byed cing de de'i bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas gcig pa'i 'gal ba dang gcig gis gcig bsal ba'i 'gal ba dang 'jig rten la grags pa'i 'gal ba de dag yod pa'i phyir des de mi byed cing de de'i bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because there is contradiction of being in the same place, contradiction of one negating the other, and contradiction in terms of what is renowned in the world, therefore it does not perform that action and that is not its action.

original: ci ste rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i phyir yin par gyur pa yang yin la bya ba dang byed pa'i sngon rol na byed pa po nyid du med pa'i phyir ma yin par gyur pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: ci ste rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i phyir yin par gyur pa yang yin la bya ba dang byed pa'i sngon rol na byed pa po nyid du med pa'i phyir ma yin par gyur pa yang yin pas /
translated: But if you say, “Since it exists as the essence of a substance, it is existent, and since it does not exist as an agent prior to action and the agent, it is nonexistent.🔽Thus, because it exists as both at the same time in dependence on that, there is no error,”

original: de ltar ltos pa'i dbang gis gcig la yang dus gcig na gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir pha rol po dag na re byed pa po srog gi rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i phyir yin par🔽gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ltos pa'i dbang gis gcig la yang dus gcig na gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir pha rol po dag na re byed pa po srog gi rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i phyir yin par🔽gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: here the opponent says, “Since the agent exists as the essence of the life-force substance, it is existent.🔽Since it does not exist as an agent prior to action and the agent, it is nonexistent.

original: gcad pa'i bya ba dang / byed pa shing dang sta re la sogs pa'i sngon rol na byed pa po gcod pa po nyid du med pa'i phyir ma yin par gyur ba yang ma yin pas de ltar rdzas kyi gnas skabs la ltos nas spyod pa'i gnas skabs ma yin par gyur ba dang
analyzed: gcad pa'i bya ba dang / byed pa shing dang sta re la sogs pa'i sngon rol na byed pa po gcod pa po nyid du med pa'i phyir ma yin par gyur ba yang ma yin pas de ltar rdzas kyi gnas skabs la ltos nas spyod pa'i gnas skabs ma yin par gyur ba dang
translated: Because the agent of the action of cutting, the axe and so on, does not exist prior to the action of cutting, it is not the case that the agent of the action of cutting exists prior to the action of cutting.

original: / spyod pa'i gnas skabs la ltos nas rdzas kyi gnas skabs yin par gyur pa'i dbang gis dngos po gcig la yang dus gcig na gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir des de byed cing de de'i bya ba yin pas dbu ma pas ci skad smras pa'i skyon med🔽do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / spyod pa'i gnas skabs la ltos nas rdzas kyi gnas skabs yin par gyur pa'i dbang gis dngos po gcig la yang dus gcig na gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir des de byed cing de de'i bya ba yin pas dbu ma pas ci skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the state of the substance, the state of activity is not the case, and in dependence on the state of activity, the state of the substance is the case. Thus, because both exist simultaneously in a single entity, it performs that and that is its action. Therefore, the fault stated by the Madhyamaka does not exist.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: ltos pa'i nges pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pas bkag pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa'i nges pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pas bkag pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the necessity of dependence will be refuted, and because the reductio argument that applies to both positions has already refuted them, there is no error.

original: ltos pa'i nges pa yang me dang bud shing brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa las /🔽gal te me ltos shing yin la //
analyzed: ltos pa'i nges pa yang me dang bud shing brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa las / gal te me ltos shing yin la //
translated: The necessity of dependence will be refuted later in the chapter “Examination of Fire and Fuel,”🔽where it says:🔽If fire depends on fuel,

original: gal te shing ltos me yin na //🔽gang la ltos pa'i me dang shing //
analyzed: gal te shing ltos me yin na // gang la ltos pa'i me dang shing //
translated: and if fuel depends on fire,🔽With respect to what

original: dang por grub pa gang zhig yin //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid @166a * //
analyzed: dang por grub pa gang zhig yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid @166a * //
translated: is fire and fuel established?

original: yod par 'dod pa yang sngar yin par gyur pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyogs gnyis su bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pas bkag zin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag la ci skad bstan pa'i skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod par 'dod pa yang sngar yin par gyur pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyogs gnyis su bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pas bkag zin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag la ci skad bstan pa'i skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: And because the assertion that fire and fuel exist inherently as the same or different has already been refuted by the reductio argument that applies to both positions, the proponents of the two positions cannot escape the errors that have been shown to follow from their positions.

original: gal te mchod sbyin ni byed pa po nyid kyang yin la byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyang yin pas dpe med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir pha rol po dag sngar dbu ma pas yin🔽par gyur pa dang ma yin par gyur pa dgag pa'i phyogs gnyis su rjes su dpag pa'i dpe bstan pa ma grub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pas kho bo cag la gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te mchod sbyin ni byed pa po nyid kyang yin la byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyang yin pas dpe med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir pha rol po dag sngar dbu ma pas yin par gyur pa dang ma yin par gyur pa dgag pa'i phyogs gnyis su rjes su dpag pa'i dpe bstan pa ma grub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pas kho bo cag la gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin te /
translated: But if you say that because the sacrificer is both an agent and not an agent, there is no example, therefore it is not refuted by inference,🔽then here the opponent says that because the two positions of the refutation of the existent and nonexistent agent by the Madhyamaka are not established as examples of inference, the Madhyamaka’s inference does not refute us.

original: de dag na re khyed dbu ma pas sngar byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs la don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa /
analyzed: de dag na re khyed dbu ma pas sngar byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs la don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa /
translated: They say that in the position of the previous inference that the existent agent does not perform the existent action, the existent agent in the ultimate is not established as an example.

original: lhas byin zhes bya ba brten te brtags pa dang / mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las dge ba dang mi dge ba mi byed de /
analyzed: lhas byin zhes bya ba brten te brtags pa dang / mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las dge ba dang mi dge ba mi byed de /
translated: The refutation of the thesis that the self is the appropriator of the body is as follows:🔽The self is not the appropriator of the body because it is permanent, like space.🔽The refutation of the thesis that the self is the support of the body is as follows:🔽The self is not the support of the body because it is permanent, like space.🔽The refutation of the thesis that the self is the support of the faculties is as follows:🔽The self is not the support of the faculties because it is permanent, like space.🔽The refutation of the thesis that the self is the goer is as follows:🔽The self is not the goer because it is permanent, like space.🔽The refutation of the thesis that the self is the experiencer of the result of karma is as follows:🔽The self is not the experiencer of the result of karma because it is permanent, like space.🔽The refutation of the thesis that the self is the appropriator of the body is as follows:🔽The self is not the appropriator of the body because it is permanent, like space.

original: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs la don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs la don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba
translated: The refutation of the thesis that the self is the support of the body is as follows:🔽The self is not the support of the body because it is permanent, like space.🔽The refutation of the thesis that the self is the support of the faculties is as follows:🔽The self is not the support of the faculties because it is permanent, like space.🔽The refutation of the thesis that the self is the goer is as follows:🔽The self is not the goer because it is permanent, like space.🔽The refutation of the thesis that the self is the experiencer of the result of karma is as follows:🔽The self is not the experiencer of the result of karma because it is permanent, like space.🔽The refutation of the thesis that the self is the appropriator of the body is as follows:

original: bstan te brtag pa dang / mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan te brtag pa dang / mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The self is not the appropriator of the body because it is permanent,

original: las yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi las bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed par rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs la don dam par byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de🔽ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs la don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po bdag lhas byin ma yin par gyur pa'i
analyzed: las yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi las bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed par rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs la don dam par byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs la don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po bdag lhas byin ma yin par gyur pa'i
translated: Because it is an action, like the action of making an offering.🔽In the context of inferring that that which is not a goer does not perform going, ultimately that which is not a goer, Devadatta, does not perform the action of going in his continuum because he is dependent on another, like that which is not a maker of offerings.

original: bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin te /
translated: In the context of inferring that that which is not an action is not the object of that which is not a goer, ultimately that which is not an action in the continuum of Devadatta is not the object of that which is not a goer, Devadatta, because it is not an action.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de dag mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de dag mi 'grub ste /
translated: The example you cite is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang gi tshe mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi las yin par gyur @166b pa'i grogs byed pa de'i tshe na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi las yin par gyur pa byed pa yang yin la /🔽de'i tshe na lhas byin gyi las yin par gyur pa de mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi tshe mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi las yin par gyur @166b pa'i grogs byed pa de'i tshe na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi las yin par gyur pa byed pa yang yin la / de'i tshe na lhas byin gyi las yin par gyur pa de mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yang yin no //
translated: Why?🔽When Devadatta, who is an actual performer of a sacrifice, assists an actual rite, at that time Devadatta, who is an actual performer of a sacrifice, performs an actual rite.🔽At that time, that rite, which is an actual rite of Devadatta, is also the action of Devadatta, who is an actual performer of a sacrifice.

original: gang gi tshe mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi las ma yin par gyur pa'i grogs byed pa de'i tshe na mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa yang yin
analyzed: gang gi tshe mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi las ma yin par gyur pa'i grogs byed pa de'i tshe na mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa yang yin
translated: When Devadatta, who is not an actual performer of a sacrifice, assists an actual rite, at that time Devadatta, who is not an actual performer of a sacrifice, performs an actual rite.

original: la / de'i tshe na lhas byin gyi las ma yin par gyur pa de mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: la / de'i tshe na lhas byin gyi las ma yin par gyur pa de mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yang yin no //
translated: At that time, the action of the non-existent Devadatta is also the action of the non-existent performer of the sacrifice.

original: des na khyed kyi dpe mchod sbyin bzhin zhes bya ba dang mchod sbyin gyi las bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag med pa'i phyir khyed kyi rjes su dpag pa snga ma de dag gis kho bo cag la gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na khyed kyi dpe mchod sbyin bzhin zhes bya ba dang mchod sbyin gyi las bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag med pa'i phyir khyed kyi rjes su dpag pa snga ma de dag gis kho bo cag la gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since your examples “like the sacrifice,” “like the action of the sacrifice,” “like the non-existent performer of the sacrifice,” and “like the non-existent action of the continuum of the sacrifice” do not exist, your previous inferences do not invalidate us.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary himself says:

original: lhas byin gyi rgyud la mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i cha dang / mchod sbyin gyi bya ba ma yin par gyur pa'i char grub pa nyid dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /🔽lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las la mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i cha dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i cha gnyis yod pa dang / lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las mchod sbyin gyi bya ba yin par gyur pa'i cha dang /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi rgyud la mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i cha dang / mchod sbyin gyi bya ba ma yin par gyur pa'i char grub pa nyid dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te / lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las la mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i cha dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i cha gnyis yod pa dang / lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las mchod sbyin gyi bya ba yin par gyur pa'i cha dang /
translated: Because we assert that the aspect of Devadatta not being the performer of the sacrifice and the aspect of the action not being the performance of the sacrifice are the very examples, there is no fault.🔽There are two aspects of Devadatta’s action: the aspect of being the performer of the sacrifice and the aspect of not being the performer of the sacrifice, and there are two aspects of Devadatta’s action: the aspect of being the performance of the sacrifice and the aspect of not being the performance of the sacrifice.

original: bya ba ma yin par gyur pa'i cha gnyis yod pa las mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i cha dang / mchod sbyin gyi bya ba ma yin par gyur pa'i char grub pa nyid kho bo dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin par gyur pa'i cha gnyis yod pa las mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i cha dang / mchod sbyin gyi bya ba ma yin par gyur pa'i char grub pa nyid kho bo dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because we assert that the aspect of Devadatta not being the performer of the sacrifice and the aspect of the action not being the performance of the sacrifice are the very examples,

original: kho bo la dpe ma grub pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: kho bo la dpe ma grub pa'i skyon med do //
translated: we are not at fault in that we have no example.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ci ste rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag dbu ma pa'i byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang rjes su dpag pa'i
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ci ste rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag dbu ma pa'i byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang rjes su dpag pa'i
translated: The extensive explanation is the same as before.

original: phyogs la 'di skad ces dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /🔽ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa la byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa gzhan yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: phyogs la 'di skad ces dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin / ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa la byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa gzhan yod pa yin nam /
translated: If you proponents of two possibilities say that the agent that is both existent and nonexistent does not perform the action that is both existent and nonexistent, then in that case, what is the meaning of the thesis that you have asserted?🔽Does the action that is both existent and nonexistent in the continuum of Devadatta exist or not?

original: 'on te byed pa po med pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa po med pa yin /
translated: Or is the agent that is both existent and nonexistent nonexistent?

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gal te byed pa po gzhan yod pa yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
analyzed: gal te byed pa po gzhan yod pa yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
translated: If the agent that is both existent and nonexistent exists, then your thesis is undermined.

original: ci ste byed pa po med pa yin na ni dpe med do zhe na /🔽de ni rigs @167a * //
analyzed: ci ste byed pa po med pa yin na ni dpe med do zhe na / de ni rigs @167a * //
translated: But if the agent that is both existent and nonexistent does not exist, then there is no example.🔽That is not correct.

original: pa ma yin to /
analyzed: pa ma yin to /
translated: That is not right.

original: bdag mchod sbyin zhes bya ba byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa nyid dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs la 'di skad ces dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang
analyzed: bdag mchod sbyin zhes bya ba byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa nyid dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs la 'di skad ces dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang
translated: The example is presented to show that the agent of the action of giving, Devadatta, is not established as an agent in the continuum of Devadatta, who is both existent and nonexistent.🔽In the case of the inference that an action that is both existent and nonexistent is not the action of an agent who is both existent and nonexistent, it is said that the meaning of the thesis is this:

original: / ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa gzhan gyi bya ba yin nam 'on te bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: / ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa gzhan gyi bya ba yin nam 'on te bya ba ma yin /
translated: Is the action that is both existent and nonexistent in the continuum of Devadatta the action of another agent who is both existent and nonexistent or is it not an action?

original: des cir 'gyur gal te byed pa po gzhan gyi bya ba yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur gal te byed pa po gzhan gyi bya ba yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
translated: What follows from that? If it is the action of another agent, then the thesis is undermined.

original: ci ste bya ba ma yin na ni dpe med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bya ba ma yin na ni dpe med do zhe na /
translated: But if it is not an action, then there is no example.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa bdag lhas byin gyi bya ba nyid du ma grub pa de nyid dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba brgal ba dang lan de
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa bdag lhas byin gyi bya ba nyid du ma grub pa de nyid dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba brgal ba dang lan de
translated: That is not a correct response, because the example of the action of Yajñadatta in the continuum of Yajñadatta is not established as the action of Devadatta, who is not the self of Yajñadatta.

original: dag sngar brtag pa dang po'i byed pa po dang las la so sor sbyar ba dag 'dir brtag pa gsum pa'i byed pa po dang las la gcig tu bsdus te rgyas par sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dag sngar brtag pa dang po'i byed pa po dang las la so sor sbyar ba dag 'dir brtag pa gsum pa'i byed pa po dang las la gcig tu bsdus te rgyas par sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The response to the objection and the objection itself are applied to the third chapter in the same way they were applied to the first chapter, but here they are applied extensively and combined into one.

original: brtag pa gsum pa bstan to //
analyzed: brtag pa gsum pa bstan to //
translated: The third chapter has been explained.

original: de'i phyir de ltar re zhig phyogs mthun pa la brten pa'i byed pa po dang las rnam par bzhag pa dag don dam pa po ma yin pas rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni de
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar re zhig phyogs mthun pa la brten pa'i byed pa po dang las rnam par bzhag pa dag don dam pa po ma yin pas rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni de
translated: Therefore, in this way, the presentation of the agent and action that is based on the concordant side is not ultimate. Thus the meaning of the reason stated in the first chapter is not established.

original: yan chad du phyogs mthun pa gsum la brten pa'i byed pa po dang las rnam par gzhag pa dag mi 'thad par brtag pa bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /🔽phyogs mthun pa gsum ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: yan chad du phyogs mthun pa gsum la brten pa'i byed pa po dang las rnam par gzhag pa dag mi 'thad par brtag pa bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te / phyogs mthun pa gsum ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
translated: The summary of the presentation of the agent and action based on the three criteria is as follows:🔽The three criteria are that that which is an existent agent does not perform that which is an existent action, that which is an existent action is not the object of activity of that which is an existent agent, and that which is a nonexistent agent does not perform that which is a nonexistent action.

original: las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa dag ste /
analyzed: las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa dag ste /
translated: The three criteria are that that which is a nonexistent action is not the object of activity of that which is a nonexistent agent, that which is an existent and nonexistent agent does not perform that which is an existent and nonexistent action, and that which is an existent and nonexistent action is not the object of activity of that which is an existent and nonexistent agent.

original: de dag don dam par rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pas sngar rab tu byed pa'i dang por pha rol pos don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched @167b dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de dag don dam par rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pas sngar rab tu byed pa'i dang por pha rol pos don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched @167b dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Since they are utterly untenable in the ultimate, the meaning of the reason stated by the opponent in the first chapter, “The aggregates, elements, and faculties certainly exist in the ultimate,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do / // / bam po bzhi bcu gnyis pa /
translated: because the Bhagavān, in dependence on them, taught the agent and action,” is not established.

original: de ltar phyogs mthun pa gsum mi 'thad par brtag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs mthun pa gsum mi 'thad par brtag pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the analysis of the untenability of the three similar positions,

original: da ni phyogs mi mthun pa drug po dag mi 'thad par rim bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni phyogs mi mthun pa drug po dag mi 'thad par rim bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
translated: now the untenability of the six dissimilar positions will be taught in order.

original: de la re zhig byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: de la re zhig byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
translated: First, one should consider whether an existent agent performs a nonexistent action, a nonexistent action is performed by an existent agent, an existent agent performs an existent action, or a nonexistent agent performs a nonexistent action.

original: las yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa gnyis pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: las yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa gnyis pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: The second pair of alternatives should be considered:

original: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir gal te byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa byed cing /
analyzed: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir gal te byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa byed cing /
translated: To demonstrate the prior position, he says, “If an existent agent performs a nonexistent action,

original: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa yang las yin par gyur pa byed pas skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa yang las yin par gyur pa byed pas skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and a nonexistent agent performs an existent action, there is no error.”

original: 'di na smra ba sum brgya drug cu rtsa gsum yod pas de dag las kha cig na re byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa byed de /
analyzed: 'di na smra ba sum brgya drug cu rtsa gsum yod pas de dag las kha cig na re byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa byed de /
translated: Here, since there are 363 proponents, some say: An existent agent performs a nonexistent action.

original: dper na bum pa dang snam bu byed pa'i byed pa po yin par gyur pa yod pas bum pa dang snam bu'i las ma yin par gyur cing med pa byed pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang snam bu byed pa'i byed pa po yin par gyur pa yod pas bum pa dang snam bu'i las ma yin par gyur cing med pa byed pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, it is like the existent agent who is the agent of a pot and a cloth acting on the nonexistent, which is not the action of a pot and a cloth.

original: kha cig na re byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa byed de /
analyzed: kha cig na re byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa byed de /
translated: Some say: An existent action is performed by a nonexistent agent.

original: dper na bum pa dang snam bu'i bya ba dang byed pa'i snga rol na byed pa po ma yin par gyur cing med pas 'jim pa dang rgyu spun gyi las yin par gyur cing yod pa yod pa lta bu yin pas /
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang snam bu'i bya ba dang byed pa'i snga rol na byed pa po ma yin par gyur cing med pas 'jim pa dang rgyu spun gyi las yin par gyur cing yod pa yod pa lta bu yin pas /
translated: For example, it is like the existent action of clay and thread, which is the action of a pot and cloth, existing prior to the action and agent of a pot and cloth, which is nonexistent and not an agent.

original: des na khyed kyi sgrub pa snga ma gsum gyi skyon kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na khyed kyi sgrub pa snga ma gsum gyi skyon kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the faults of your first three proofs do not apply to our position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽byed pa po dang las dag ni //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / byed pa po dang las dag ni //
translated: Here it is said:🔽An existent agent

original: gyur pa ma gyur mi byed de //
analyzed: gyur pa ma gyur mi byed de //
translated: does not perform a nonexistent action.

original: ma gyur pa yang gyur mi byed //
analyzed: ma gyur pa yang gyur mi byed //
translated: Nor does a nonexistent agent

original: ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smras so //
translated: perform an existent action.

original: gang gis ci zhig mi byed ce na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gang gis ci zhig mi byed ce na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a question from the opponent.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed la byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa yang las yin par gyur pa mi byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed la byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa yang las yin par gyur pa mi byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said: “A real agent does not perform a unreal action, and an unreal agent does not perform a real action.”

original: de gnyis ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste phyogs yin no //
translated: These two are the thesis and the position.

original: de gnyis kyi sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the property that is to be established of those two,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: it is said: “Why is that?”

original: 'di ltar / 'dir yang skyon der thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dir yang skyon der thal bar 'gyur /
translated: Here, the same error would follow.

original: @168a * // yin par gyur pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyogs su bstan pa'i skyon de dag nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te //
analyzed: @168a * // yin par gyur pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyogs su bstan pa'i skyon de dag nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te //
translated: Because the same errors that are shown to pertain to the positions of reality and unreality would follow.

original: byed pa po dang las rnam pa de lta bu dag tu yongs su rtog na 'dir yang gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i skyon byed pa po yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa dang / las la byed pa po med pa dang / las yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa dang /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las rnam pa de lta bu dag tu yongs su rtog na 'dir yang gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i skyon byed pa po yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa dang / las la byed pa po med pa dang / las yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa dang /
translated: If you imagine that the agent and action are like that, then here, as was previously explained, the error is that an existent agent has no activity, an existent action has no activity,🔽and an existent agent has no action.

original: byed pa po la las med pa dang / byed pa po dang las ma yin par gyur pa dag la rgyu med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed la /
analyzed: byed pa po la las med pa dang / byed pa po dang las ma yin par gyur pa dag la rgyu med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed la /
translated: Therefore, an existent agent does not perform a nonexistent action,

original: las ma yin par gyur pa yang byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: las ma yin par gyur pa yang byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin no //
translated: and a nonexistent action is not the activity of an existent agent.

original: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed la las yin par gyur pa yang byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed la las yin par gyur pa yang byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin no //
translated: A nonexistent agent does not perform an existent action, and an existent action is not the activity of a nonexistent agent.

original: de dag gi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed la /
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that inference, he says, ultimately, an existent agent does not perform a nonexistent action.

original: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed de zhes dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed de zhes dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi /
translated: An existent agent does not perform a nonexistent action, and an existent action is not performed by a nonexistent agent.

original: sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni rgyas par snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni rgyas par snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The remaining parts of the syllogism are as before.

original: 'di ltar sbyar te don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyar te don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
translated: The syllogism is: Ultimately, Devadatta, who is an existent agent, does not perform an action that is a nonexistent entity in the continuum of Devadatta,

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: because he is an existent agent, just as Yajñadatta, who is an existent agent.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, an action that is a nonexistent entity in the continuum of Devadatta is not the action of Devadatta, who is an existent agent,🔽because it is an action that is a nonexistent entity in the continuum of Devadatta, just like the action of Yajñadatta.

original: las ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: las ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is not karma, like the karma of the ritual of sacrifice that is not karma.

original: de bzhin du don dam par byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin par gyur pa mi byed de byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin par gyur pa mi byed de byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa
translated: Similarly, ultimately Devadatta, who is not an agent, does not perform the karma of the continuum of Devadatta, because he is not an agent, like the ritual of sacrifice that is not an agent.

original: bzhin no // don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bzhin no // don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the karma of the continuum of Devadatta, which is karma, is not the action of Devadatta, who is not an agent,

original: las yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: las yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is karma, like the karma of the continuum of the ritual of sacrifice.

original: brgal ba dang lan dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: brgal ba dang lan dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The arguments and responses should be applied here as appropriate, as before.
