original: da ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa @168b bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de bzhin du /🔽byed pa po dang las dag ni //
analyzed: da ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa @168b bstan pa'i phyir / de bzhin du / byed pa po dang las dag ni //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that an existent agent does not perform an existent or a non-existent action, and that an existent or non-existent action is not the action of an existent agent,🔽he says:🔽Likewise, an existent or non-existent🔽agent does not perform

original: gyur dang bcas pa ma gyur dang // gyur ma gyur pa mi byed de //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gyur dang bcas pa ma gyur dang // gyur ma gyur pa mi byed de // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: an existent or non-existent action.

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa dang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed la las ma yin par gyur pa dang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa dang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed la las ma yin par gyur pa dang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma
translated: An existent agent does not perform a non-existent action, nor does he perform an existent or non-existent action. An existent or non-existent action is not the action of an existent agent.

original: yin te / 'dir las ma yin par gyur pa smos pa ni snga ma brnan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / 'dir las ma yin par gyur pa smos pa ni snga ma brnan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the mention of a non-existent action is for the sake of emphasis.

original: de dag ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste phyogs yin no //
translated: These are the theses, the positions.

original: de dag gi sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the Dharma of their refutation, he says:

original: gtan tshigs gong du bstan phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gong du bstan phyir ro // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las bya ba med pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa la rgyu med pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa phan tshun 'gal bas ga la gcig ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las bya ba med pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa la rgyu med pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa phan tshun 'gal bas ga la gcig ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reasons have been taught above.

original: 'dir de dag gi rjes su dpag pa yang 'di ltar sbyar te /🔽don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
analyzed: 'dir de dag gi rjes su dpag pa yang 'di ltar sbyar te / don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
translated: Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa bzhin no //🔽don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa bzhin no //🔽don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
translated: Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an existent agent, just as Yajñadatta is.

original: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, ultimately, that which is not an existent action in Devadatta’s continuum is not an action of Devadatta, who is an existent agent.

original: las ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyu kyi las ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: las ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyu kyi las ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is not an existent action, just as that which is not an existent action in Yajñadatta’s continuum is not an action of Yajñadatta.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po yin par gyur ba lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po yin par gyur ba lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, that which is both an existent and nonexistent action in Devadatta’s continuum is not an action of Devadatta, who is an existent agent.

original: las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is both an existent and nonexistent action, just as that which is both an existent and nonexistent action in Yajñadatta’s continuum is not an action of Yajñadatta.

original: brgal ba dang lan dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: brgal ba dang lan dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The objections and responses are to be applied here as well, as before, as appropriate.

original: da ni byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du /🔽byed pa po dang las dag ni //
analyzed: da ni byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du / byed pa po dang las dag ni //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the non-performance of the non-existent action by the existent and non-existent agent, and the non-performance of the existent and non-existent action by the non-existent agent, he says:🔽Likewise, the existent and non-existent

original: ma gyur pa ni gyur bcas dang // gyur ma gyur pa mi byed de //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /🔽byed pa @169a * //🔽po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa dang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed la /
analyzed: ma gyur pa ni gyur bcas dang // gyur ma gyur pa mi byed de // zhes bya ba smras te / byed pa @169a * // po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa dang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed la /
translated: agent does not perform the existent and non-existent action.🔽The non-existent agent does not perform the existent action, nor does he perform the existent and non-existent action.

original: las yin par gyur pa dang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: las yin par gyur pa dang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The existent and non-existent action is not the action of the non-existent agent.

original: 'dir yang las yin par gyur pa smos pa ni snga ma brnan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang las yin par gyur pa smos pa ni snga ma brnan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, too, the mention of the existent action is for the sake of emphasis.

original: de dag ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste phyogs yin no //
translated: These are the propositions, the positions.

original: de dag gi sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the Dharma of their refutation, he says:

original: gtan tshigs gong du bstan phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gong du bstan phyir ro // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.

original: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa la rgyu med pa dang / las yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa phan tshun 'gal bas ga la gcig ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dir de dag gi rjes su dpag pa yang 'di ltar sbyar te don dam par byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa ni lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa la rgyu med pa dang / las yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa phan tshun 'gal bas ga la gcig ces bstan pa'i phyir ro // 'dir de dag gi rjes su dpag pa yang 'di ltar sbyar te don dam par byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa ni lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
translated: Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.🔽Because the reasons have been taught above.

original: las yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: las yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an existent action, like the existent action in the continuum of Yajñadatta.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, that which is an existent or nonexistent action in the continuum of Devadatta is not the activity of Devadatta, who is an existent or nonexistent agent.

original: las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin pa dang ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an existent or nonexistent action, like the existent or nonexistent action in the continuum of Yajñadatta.

analyzed: brgal ba dang lan dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The objections and responses should be applied here as appropriate, as before.

original: da ni byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: da ni byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
translated: Now, an existent or nonexistent agent does not perform an existent action, an existent action is not the activity of an existent or nonexistent agent, an existent or nonexistent agent does not perform a nonexistent action,

original: las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the second pair of theses, that the agent of an unreal action and the non-action of an unreal agent are unreal, he says:

original: de bzhin du /🔽byed pa por gyur ma gyur ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du / byed pa por gyur ma gyur ni //
translated: Similarly,🔽The real and unreal agent

original: las su gyur dang ma gyur pa //🔽mi byed ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: las su gyur dang ma gyur pa // mi byed ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Does not perform a real or unreal action.🔽The real and unreal agent does not perform a real or unreal action.

original: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed @169b pa dang /
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed @169b pa dang /
translated: The real agent does not perform the non-action of a real or unreal agent. The real agent does not perform the non-action of a real or unreal agent.🔽The unreal agent does not perform a real or unreal action.

original: las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: The unreal agent does not perform a real or unreal action.

original: de dag ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste phyogs yin no //
translated: These are the theses, the positions.

original: de dag gi sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang gtan tshigs ni gong du bstan pas shes par bya /
analyzed: de dag gi sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang gtan tshigs ni gong du bstan pas shes par bya /
translated: In order to teach the Dharma of their practice, here the reason should be understood as taught above.

original: 'dir yang dam bcas pa la khyad par yod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni rgyas par snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir yang dam bcas pa la khyad par yod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni rgyas par snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, only the thesis is different; the remaining parts of the syllogism are the same as before.🔽How could an existent and a nonexistent agent be mutually contradictory?

original: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa phan tshun 'gal bas ga la gcig ces bya ba dang / las yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa la rgyu med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dag gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa phan tshun 'gal bas ga la gcig ces bya ba dang / las yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa la rgyu med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dag gis shes par bya'o //
translated: And how could an existent action be without activity, and how could a nonexistent action be without a cause?

original: 'dir de dag gi rjes su dpag pa yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir de dag gi rjes su dpag pa yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: Here, their inference is stated as follows:

original: don dam par byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
analyzed: don dam par byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
translated: Ultimately, Devadatta, who is an existent and nonexistent agent, does not perform an existent action in the continuum of Devadatta.

original: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Because he is both an existent and a non-existent agent, like Yajñadatta who is both an existent and a non-existent agent.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, that which is an existent action in Devadatta’s continuum is not the activity of Devadatta who is both an existent and a non-existent agent,

original: las yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: las yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is an existent action, like the action that is an existent action in Yajñadatta’s continuum.

original: de bzhin du don dam par byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de //
translated: In the same way, ultimately, that which is an existent action is not performed by Devadatta who is both an existent and a non-existent agent,

original: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: because he is both an existent and a non-existent agent, like Yajñadatta who is both an existent and a non-existent agent.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa ni byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te ;
translated: That which is not an action in the continuum of Devadatta is not the activity of Devadatta, who is and is not an agent,

original: las ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: las ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is not an action, just like the action that is not in the continuum of Yajñadatta.

original: brgal ba dang lan dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: brgal ba dang lan dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The objections and responses are to be applied here as appropriate, as before.

original: de ltar byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i phyogs la phyogs mthun pa gsum dang phyogs mi mthun pa drug ste spyir dgur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i phyogs la phyogs mthun pa gsum dang phyogs mi mthun pa drug ste spyir dgur shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in the context of the analysis of the agent and action, one should understand that there are nine possibilities: three that are concordant and six that are discordant.

original: gal te 'dir pha rol po dag na re de ltar byed pa po yang med la las kyang med na khyod kyis rgyu med pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gang dag bstan pa de dag thams cad khyod la rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro zhes zer
analyzed: gal te 'dir pha rol po dag na re de ltar byed pa po yang med la las kyang med na khyod kyis rgyu med pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gang dag bstan pa de dag thams cad khyod la rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro zhes zer
translated: If the opponent says, “If there is no agent and no action, then all of the errors that you have ascribed to us, such as the error that things arise without a cause, will apply to you,”

original: ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: The opponent’s position is drawn out from the root text.🔽The response to that is:

original: gang gi phyir de ltar @170a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar @170a * //
translated: Because it is so,

original: brtags na / byed po las la brten byas shing //
analyzed: brtags na / byed po las la brten byas shing //
translated: when analyzed, the agent depends on the action,

original: las kyang byed po de nyid la //
analyzed: las kyang byed po de nyid la //
translated: and the action

original: brten nas 'byung ba /🔽de'i phyir byed pa po dang las nyid la byed pa po dang las kyi rgyu yod pa ni tha snyad par phan tshun ltos pa nyid yin gyi de ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa /
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba / de'i phyir byed pa po dang las nyid la byed pa po dang las kyi rgyu yod pa ni tha snyad par phan tshun ltos pa nyid yin gyi de ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa /
translated: arises in dependence on the agent.

original: grub pa'i rgyu ni ma mthong ngo /
analyzed: grub pa'i rgyu ni ma mthong ngo /
translated: Therefore, the cause of the agent and the cause of the action are mutually dependent in terms of conventional expressions. Apart from that, no other cause of their establishment is seen.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /🔽byed pa po ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te / byed pa po ni /
translated: This is what is said.🔽The agent

original: las la brten cing las la gnas //
analyzed: las la brten cing las la gnas //
translated: depends on the action and abides in the action.

original: las la ltos nas byed pa po //
analyzed: las la ltos nas byed pa po //
translated: The agent is imputed in dependence on the action.

original: zhes gdags shing brjod do //
analyzed: zhes gdags shing brjod do //
translated: It is expressed in that way.

original: de'i las kyang byed pa po de nyid la brten nas 'byung zhing de'i las zhes gdags shing brjod do //
analyzed: de'i las kyang byed pa po de nyid la brten nas 'byung zhing de'i las zhes gdags shing brjod do //
translated: And the action also arises in dependence on that very agent and is imputed and expressed as “its action.”

original: de'i phyir de gnyis ni ltos pa can du gdags pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid du grub pa dang ma grub pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis ni ltos pa can du gdags pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid du grub pa dang ma grub pa med do //
translated: Therefore, these two are imputed in dependence, but they are not established or not established by their own intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir de ltar de gnyis yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du khas ma blangs pas dbu ma'i lam du gdags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar de gnyis yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du khas ma blangs pas dbu ma'i lam du gdags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since those two are not accepted as existent or nonexistent, they are designated as the middle way.

original: gdags pa de ma gtogs par de nyid 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gdags pa de ma gtogs par de nyid 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan ma mthong ngo //
translated: Apart from that designation, we do not see any other characteristic that establishes them.

original: de lta bas na rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi lan gdab dka' ba dang / dpe'i skyon yod pa dang / gtan tshigs gzhan du rtog na yang don 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /🔽sngar pha rol po dag gis don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi lan gdab dka' ba dang / dpe'i skyon yod pa dang / gtan tshigs gzhan du rtog na yang don 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te / sngar pha rol po dag gis don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, the response to the argument stated at the beginning of the treatise is difficult because the meaning of the reason is not established, there is a fault in the example, and if the reason is conceived differently, it would be contradictory. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Previously, the opponent said, “In the ultimate truth, the aggregates, constituents, and bases of perception exist because the Bhagavān taught the agent and action in dependence on them.”

original: 'di na gang med pa la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de la brten nas byed pa po dang las ma bstan te /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de la brten nas byed pa po dang las ma bstan te /
translated: The Transcendent Lord has not taught that an agent and action exist in dependence on that which does not exist here.🔽For example, it is like the horns of a donkey or a camel.🔽If the reason is established ultimately, then the meaning is not established. If the reason is established conventionally, then the meaning is contradictory.

original: dper na bong bu dang rnga mo'i rva dag bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs don dam par sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid yin la kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin zhing dpe yang med pas pha rol po dag gi phyogs
analyzed: dper na bong bu dang rnga mo'i rva dag bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs don dam par sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid yin la kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin zhing dpe yang med pas pha rol po dag gi phyogs
translated: Since there is no example, the opponent’s position

original: ma grub po //
analyzed: ma grub po //
translated: is not established.

original: gang dag don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang dag don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Some say that in the ultimate truth the aggregates, constituents, and bases exist.🔽This is because the Transcendent Lord has said that there is an appropriator and that there is that which is appropriated.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba nyid gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba nyid gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to refute them, it is said:

original: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: The appropriator should be understood in the same way.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dra bar bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni gang zag tu smra ba dag phung po ni nye bar blang ba yin la gang zag ni nye bar len pa po yin no zhes zer ba dgag pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa'i
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dra bar bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni gang zag tu smra ba dag phung po ni nye bar blang ba yin la gang zag ni nye bar len pa po yin no zhes zer ba dgag pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa'i
translated: The second half of the verse is stated in order to refute the proponents of the person who say that the aggregates are the appropriated and the person is the appropriator.

original: phyed gong ma 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyed gong ma 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The first half of the verse is explained in order to refute that.🔽Just as is taught means just as the effort of teaching is taught.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ci @170b skad bstan pa'i 'bad pa nye bar bstan pa bzhin du'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang las dag bsal ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ci @170b skad bstan pa'i 'bad pa nye bar bstan pa bzhin du'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang las dag bsal ba bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as the agent and action are refuted,

original: nyer len zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: nyer len zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa ste /
translated: appropriation is the appropriated.

original: dngos po'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yongs su gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yongs su gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to show that it is to be viewed as a condition of a thing, the appropriator and the appropriated are mentioned.

original: gang la dngos po yod pa de la byed pa po du ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang la dngos po yod pa de la byed pa po du ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because if something is a thing, it must be a manifold agent.

original: nye bar len pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dngos po ste nye bar len pa po gang zag dang nye bar blang ba phung po gnyi ga la spyir snyegs so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dngos po ste nye bar len pa po gang zag dang nye bar blang ba phung po gnyi ga la spyir snyegs so //
translated: The term appropriator refers to both the appropriating person and the appropriated aggregates.

original: gang la dngos po yod pa de la byed pa po'i sde tshan du gtogs pa byed pa po dang las dang byed pa dang yang dag par sbyin pa dang / blang ba la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la dngos po yod pa de la byed pa po'i sde tshan du gtogs pa byed pa po dang las dang byed pa dang yang dag par sbyin pa dang / blang ba la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the person exists as a real entity, then the categories of agent, action, instrument, giver, receiver, and so on would exist.

original: ci skad bstan pa'i 'bad pa ni ci ltar byed pa po las la brten cing las kyang byed pa po la brten nas 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci skad bstan pa'i 'bad pa ni ci ltar byed pa po las la brten cing las kyang byed pa po la brten nas 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the agent and action are taught to arise in dependence on each other,

original: nye bar len pa po yang nye bar blang ba la brten cing nye bar blang ba yang nye bar len pa po la brten nas 'byung bar 'gyur bas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag gi nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yang nye bar blang ba la brten cing nye bar blang ba yang nye bar len pa po la brten nas 'byung bar 'gyur bas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag gi nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang
translated: so too the appropriator and the appropriated would arise in dependence on each other.

original: ba nyid ni don dam pa pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: ba nyid ni don dam pa pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni / de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: But it is not ultimate.🔽Thus, the statement, “One should understand appropriation in the same way,” is the explanation of the verse.

original: zhes bya ba'i bshad pa yin te de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste phyogs yin no //🔽de'i sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bshad pa yin te de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste phyogs yin no // de'i sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir ci ltar zhe na /
translated: This is the thesis, the position.

original: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate the property that is to be established, he says, “Why? Because the agent and action are refuted.”

original: bsal ba zhes bya ba ni bkag pa'o //
analyzed: bsal ba zhes bya ba ni bkag pa'o //
translated: “Refuted” means denied.🔽“Why?” means “for what reason?”

original: phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don te gang gi phyir de ltar byed pa po dang las dag bsal ba bstan pa de nyid kyis nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag kyang bsal bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te
analyzed: phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don te gang gi phyir de ltar byed pa po dang las dag bsal ba bstan pa de nyid kyis nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag kyang bsal bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te
translated: The meaning of the passage is this: since the refutation of the agent and action is demonstrated in this way, one should understand that the appropriator and the appropriated are also refuted.

original: / ci ltar byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i skabs su byed po yin par gyur pa de las su gyur pa mi byed do //🔽byed po ma yin gyur pa yang //
analyzed: / ci ltar byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i skabs su byed po yin par gyur pa de las su gyur pa mi byed do // byed po ma yin gyur pa yang //
translated: In the context of the analysis of the agent and action, it is said, “The existent agent does not perform the existent action.”

original: las su ma gyur mi byed do //
analyzed: las su ma gyur mi byed do //
translated: “The non-existent agent does not perform the non-existent action.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci skad bstan pa thams cad kyis 'dir yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci skad bstan pa thams cad kyis 'dir yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that all the teachings such as these are relevant here.

original: de dag gi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir de la phyogs tsam zhig bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir de la phyogs tsam zhig bstan par bya ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate their inferences, we will teach just a fraction of them here.

original: don dam par len pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba nye bar blang ba yin pa gyur pa phung po zhes bya ba /
analyzed: don dam par len pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba nye bar blang ba yin pa gyur pa phung po zhes bya ba /
translated: Ultimately, the appropriator Devadatta, who is a real thing, does not appropriate the appropriated aggregates.

original: de'i sgrar brjod pa dag len par mi byed par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i sgrar brjod pa dag len par mi byed par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: This should be understood in terms of the words of the root verse.

original: nye bar blang ba la ltos pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba la ltos pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bzhin no //
translated: Because they depend on the appropriated aggregates, they are like a sacrifice.

original: don dam par nye bar len pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba nye bar @171a * //
analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba nye bar @171a * //
translated: Ultimately, the non-appropriator Devadatta, who is a real thing, does not appropriate the appropriated aggregates.

original: blang ba ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed pa dang / nye bar len pa po yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba nye bar blang ba yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed de zhes bya ba dag la yang dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zas kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag la lhag
analyzed: blang ba ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed pa dang / nye bar len pa po yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba nye bar blang ba yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed de zhes bya ba dag la yang dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zas kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag la lhag
translated: He does not take up what is not to be taken up, and he is the appropriator, and Devadatta, who is and is not, is the appropriated object, and he does not take up what is and is not to be taken up.

original: ma dag ni rgyas par snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma dag ni rgyas par snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The rest is as extensive as before.

original: de dag ni nye bar len pa po brtag pa'i phyogs mthun pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni nye bar len pa po brtag pa'i phyogs mthun pa gsum yin no //
translated: These are the three similar counterparts of the analysis of the appropriator.

original: de bzhin du don dam par nye bar blang ba yin par gyur pa yang nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba'i nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par nye bar blang ba yin par gyur pa yang nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba'i nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, ultimately, that which is the appropriated object is not the appropriated object of Devadatta, who is the appropriator,

original: nye bar len pa po la ltos pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi nye bar blang ba ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po la ltos pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi nye bar blang ba ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: because it depends on the appropriator, just like the appropriated object of the continuum of Yajña is not.

original: don dam par nye bar blang ba ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba ni nye bar blang ba ma yin pa dang nye bar blang ba yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len
analyzed: don dam par nye bar blang ba ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len pa po ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba ni nye bar blang ba ma yin pa dang nye bar blang ba yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len
translated: Lhejin is not a appropriator who is not an appropriator ultimately, and Lhejin is not an appropriator who is and is not an appropriator.

original: pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba'i nye bar blang ba ma yin te zhes bya ba dag la yang dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni rgyas par snga ma bzhin
analyzed: pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba'i nye bar blang ba ma yin te zhes bya ba dag la yang dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni rgyas par snga ma bzhin
translated: The remainder of the parts of the proof are the same as before.

original: no zhes bya ba dag ni nye bar blang ba brtag pa'i phyogs mthun pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba dag ni nye bar blang ba brtag pa'i phyogs mthun pa gsum yin no //
translated: These are the three similar triads of the analysis of the appropriated.🔽The dissimilar triads should be stated in the same way.

original: de bzhin du phyogs mi mthun pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs mi mthun pa drug po dag kyang byed pa po dang las kyi skabs su bstan pa bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs mi mthun pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs mi mthun pa drug po dag kyang byed pa po dang las kyi skabs su bstan pa bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The six dissimilar triads should be applied in the appropriate order, as in the case of the agent and action.

original: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba yin par 'gyur ba la sogs pa dag don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni brtag pa dgu po dag mi 'thad pa'i rigs pa bstan to /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba yin par 'gyur ba la sogs pa dag don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni brtag pa dgu po dag mi 'thad pa'i rigs pa bstan to /
translated: Since the appropriator and that appropriated do not ultimately exist, this shows the reasoning for the untenability of the nine analyses.

original: 'dir yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pas med pa dang / gtan tshigs gzhan du rtog na yang don 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin na //
analyzed: 'dir yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pas med pa dang / gtan tshigs gzhan du rtog na yang don 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin na //
translated: Here, the meaning of the reason is not established, the example is not established, the probandum and the property of the probandum are not present, and if the reason is conceived as something else, the meaning is contradictory. This is the summary and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: ci ltar don dam par byed pa po dang las dang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag mi 'thad pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang mi 'thad par 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar don dam par byed pa po dang las dang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag mi 'thad pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang mi 'thad par 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the agent, action, appropriator, and that appropriated are untenable ultimately, so all things are similar in being untenable.

original: ci ltar don dam par byed pa po dang las dag gi nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag bsal ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar don dam par byed pa po dang las dag gi nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag bsal ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the appropriator and that appropriated by the agent and action are refuted in the ultimate,🔽so too should the remaining things

original: byed pa po dang las dag gis //🔽dngos po lhag ma 'ang shes par bya //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag gis // dngos po lhag ma 'ang shes par bya //
translated: be understood through the agent and action.

original: rang dang @171b gzhan la grags pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / yon tan dang yon tan can dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa dngos po lhag ma rnams kyang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rang dang @171b gzhan la grags pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / yon tan dang yon tan can dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa dngos po lhag ma rnams kyang shes par bya ste /
translated: The remaining things, such as cause and effect, quality and possessor of quality, characteristic and basis of characteristic, part and whole, and so on, which are renowned to both ourselves and others, should be understood in the same way.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la brten cing 'bras bu yang rgyu la brten nas 'grub pa la sogs pa dag tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la brten cing 'bras bu yang rgyu la brten nas 'grub pa la sogs pa dag tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the establishment of cause and effect and so on is dependent, and because the effect is established in dependence on the cause and so on, they are posited conventionally, but they are not ultimate.

original: rgyu yang 'bras bu skyed par byed pa na yin par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'bras bu skyed par byed pa na yin par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When a cause generates an effect, it is called “that which has become.”

original: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin par gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is other than that is “that which has not become.”

original: 'bras bu yang yang bskyed par bya ba na yin par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang yang bskyed par bya ba na yin par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When it repeatedly produces an effect, it is called “that which has become.”

original: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin par gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is other than that is “that which has not become.”

original: de bzhin du yon tan dang yon tan can la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan dang yon tan can la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, the remaining pairs, such as the possessor of qualities and the possessed, should be applied.

original: brtag pa'i phyogs dgu dgur dbye zhing mi 'thad pa dang de dag ltos te gdags pa ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan gang gis kyang de dag 'grub par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: brtag pa'i phyogs dgu dgur dbye zhing mi 'thad pa dang de dag ltos te gdags pa ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan gang gis kyang de dag 'grub par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad par bstan par bya'o //
translated: The nine topics should be divided into nine parts, and it should be shown that the characteristics of those are not tenable in any other way, except for the non-tenability of those and their mutual dependence.

original: da ni byed pa po dang las dang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang yon tan dang yon tan can dang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa dngos po brten nas 'grub pa ci skad bstan pa de dag tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin par slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas tshig le'ur byas pa dag gis bsgrubs te /
analyzed: da ni byed pa po dang las dang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang yon tan dang yon tan can dang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa dngos po brten nas 'grub pa ci skad bstan pa de dag tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin par slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas tshig le'ur byas pa dag gis bsgrubs te /
translated: Now, the master's own words in the verses establish that all things that are established in dependence, such as agent and action, appropriator and appropriated, cause and effect, quality and qualified, definition and definiendum, part and whole, and so on, are conventional and not ultimate.

original: mdor bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mdor bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha briefly taught this in sutra:

original: de nyid la brten nas 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de nyid la brten nas 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Here, the author of the commentary, relying on that,

original: de dag bye brag tu bshad pa rgya cher ston to //
analyzed: de dag bye brag tu bshad pa rgya cher ston to //
translated: teaches the detailed explanation of those.

original: de la 'grel pa byed pas ci'i phyir de dag bye brag tu bshad pa'i dgos pa dang bsam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'grel pa byed pas ci'i phyir de dag bye brag tu bshad pa'i dgos pa dang bsam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, in order to teach the purpose and intention of the detailed explanation, the author of the commentary says:

original: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dag gi don dam pa pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa de dag gi mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu de bsal bar 'dod pas slob dpon gyis bka' stsal pa'i lung
analyzed: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dag gi don dam pa pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa de dag gi mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu de bsal bar 'dod pas slob dpon gyis bka' stsal pa'i lung
translated: in order to remove the pain of their attachment, the master Nāgārjuna,

original: khas blangs nas cung zad dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: khas blangs nas cung zad dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: having accepted the scriptures of the Buddha, will analyze them a little.

original: don dam par 'o ma yin par gyur pa ni zho yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
analyzed: don dam par 'o ma yin par gyur pa ni zho yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
translated: Ultimately, what is milk does not make what is yogurt,🔽because it depends on the effect, like, for example, the two causes of a sprout.

original: 'bras bu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid mi byed par rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid mi byed par rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This shows the inference that the nature of the effect is not made by the nature of the cause.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the property of the subject, the proving property, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na rgyu spun @172a * //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun @172a * //
translated: For example, the two causes of a sprout

original: gyi ngo bo nyid ni 'bras bu snam bu'i ngo bo nyid la ltos pa'i phyir zho'i ngo bo nyid mi byed pa de bzhin du 'o ma'i ngo bo nyid kyang 'bras bu zho'i ngo bo nyid la ltos pa'i phyir zho'i ngo bo nyid mi byed do //
analyzed: gyi ngo bo nyid ni 'bras bu snam bu'i ngo bo nyid la ltos pa'i phyir zho'i ngo bo nyid mi byed pa de bzhin du 'o ma'i ngo bo nyid kyang 'bras bu zho'i ngo bo nyid la ltos pa'i phyir zho'i ngo bo nyid mi byed do //
translated: The nature of milk does not produce the nature of curd because it depends on the nature of the effect, curd.

original: dngos po lhag ma gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽gal te mthong ba dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga ma de la mngon sum dang 'gal ba dang grags pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer
analyzed: dngos po lhag ma gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro // gal te mthong ba dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga ma de la mngon sum dang 'gal ba dang grags pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer
translated: The same goes for the remaining entities.🔽If you say that it is undermined by what is seen and what is renowned,

original: ba yin no //
analyzed: ba yin no //
translated: the opponents say that the previous inference of the Madhyamikas is undermined by contradiction with direct perception and contradiction with what is renowned.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says here:

original: dam bcas pa khyad par can byas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa khyad par can byas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “There is no error because a specific thesis is made.”

original: mngon sum dang grags pa ni kun rdzob yin gyi kho bos ni don dam par dgag pa byas pa'i phyir de dag dang 'gal ba'i skyon med do //
analyzed: mngon sum dang grags pa ni kun rdzob yin gyi kho bos ni don dam par dgag pa byas pa'i phyir de dag dang 'gal ba'i skyon med do //
translated: Direct perception and what is renowned are conventional, but we refute them ultimately, so we do not commit the error of contradicting them.

original: yang na don dam par smra ba rnams 'dod pa'i 'o ma ni bsams pa'i zho'i rgyu ma yin te 'o ma yin pa'i dper na de las gzhan pa'i 'o ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston to //
analyzed: yang na don dam par smra ba rnams 'dod pa'i 'o ma ni bsams pa'i zho'i rgyu ma yin te 'o ma yin pa'i dper na de las gzhan pa'i 'o ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston to //
translated: Or, the milk desired by those who speak of ultimate reality is not the cause of the curd that is intended, because it is milk, like milk that is different from that. This shows the inference that refutes the nature of the cause.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proof, and the example, respectively.🔽For example, the conventional cause, milk, is not the cause of the curd that is intended by the opponent in the ultimate sense, because it is milk.

original: dper na tha snyad pa'i rgyu 'o ma ni 'o ma yin pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis bsams pa'i don dam pa pa'i zho'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du pha rol po dag smra bar 'dod pa don dam pa pa'i 'o ma yang 'o ma yin
analyzed: dper na tha snyad pa'i rgyu 'o ma ni 'o ma yin pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis bsams pa'i don dam pa pa'i zho'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du pha rol po dag smra bar 'dod pa don dam pa pa'i 'o ma yang 'o ma yin
translated: In the same way, the milk that is desired to be spoken of by the opponent in the ultimate sense is not the cause of curd in the ultimate sense, because it is milk.

original: pa'i phyir // pha rol po dag gis bsams pa'i don dam pa pa'i zho'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir // pha rol po dag gis bsams pa'i don dam pa pa'i zho'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: because it is not the cause of the curd that the opponent intends to refer to as ultimate.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The same is to be applied in a similar way to the rest.

original: de bzhin du don dam pa smra bar 'dod pa'i zho ni 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam pa smra bar 'dod pa'i zho ni 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, the curd that the proponent of the ultimate intends to refer to as ultimate is not the cause of the milk that the opponent intends to refer to as ultimate,🔽because it depends on milk, like curd that is different from that.

original: 'o ma la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i zho bzhin no zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: 'o ma la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i zho bzhin no zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This demonstrates the inference that refutes the nature of the effect.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example are to be applied in order.🔽For example, the conventional effect, curd, is not the cause of the milk that the opponent intends to refer to as ultimate, because it depends on milk, like curd that is different from that.

original: dper na tha snyad pa'i 'bras bu zho ni 'o ma la ltos pa'i phyir pha rol po dag smra bar 'dod pa don dam pa pa'i 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin pa bzhin du pha rol po dag smra bar 'dod pa don dam pa pa'i zho yang 'o
analyzed: dper na tha snyad pa'i 'bras bu zho ni 'o ma la ltos pa'i phyir pha rol po dag smra bar 'dod pa don dam pa pa'i 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin pa bzhin du pha rol po dag smra bar 'dod pa don dam pa pa'i zho yang 'o
translated: Likewise, the curd that the proponent of the ultimate intends to refer to as ultimate is not the effect of the milk that the opponent intends to refer to as ultimate, because it depends on milk, like curd that is different from that.

original: ma la ltos pa'i phyir pha rol po dag smra bar 'dod pa don dam pa pa'i 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: ma la ltos pa'i phyir pha rol po dag smra bar 'dod pa don dam pa pa'i 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: Because it depends on the mother, the other party’s desired object, the ultimate milk, is not the cause of the ultimate curd.

original: lhag ma rnams @172b la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams @172b la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The remaining arguments should be applied in the same way, as appropriate.

original: yang na don dam par zho ni 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na don dam par zho ni 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Or, one should understand that ultimately curd is not the effect of milk,

original: rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na snam bu bzhin no zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa gtan tshigs dang dpe rigs mi mthun pas rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na snam bu bzhin no zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa gtan tshigs dang dpe rigs mi mthun pas rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: because it depends on its cause, just like a cloth. This shows an inference that has a reason and example that are discordant with the negated object, the intrinsic reality of the effect.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example.

original: dper na snam bu ni rgyu spun la ltos pa'i phyir 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin pa de bzhin du don dam pa pa'i zho yang rgyu 'o ma la ltos pa'i phyir don dam pa pa'i 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na snam bu ni rgyu spun la ltos pa'i phyir 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin pa de bzhin du don dam pa pa'i zho yang rgyu 'o ma la ltos pa'i phyir don dam pa pa'i 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: For example, just as a cloth is not the effect of milk because it depends on thread as its cause, so too ultimately curd is not the effect of ultimate milk because it depends on ultimate milk as its cause.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The rest should be applied in the same way, as appropriate.🔽Here, some say: “Ultimately, milk does not produce curd.

original: 'dir kha cig na re don dam par 'o ma ni zho mi byed de zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gal te tha snyad du byed pa yin na ni dpe med pa dang phyogs snga ma la gnod do //
analyzed: 'dir kha cig na re don dam par 'o ma ni zho mi byed de zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gal te tha snyad du byed pa yin na ni dpe med pa dang phyogs snga ma la gnod do //
translated: If the meaning of that thesis is conventionally, then there is no example and the opponent’s position is undermined.

original: ci ste rang gi bya ba mi byed pa nyid yin na ni de lta na yang dpe med pa dang ma nges pa nyid de thams cad kyang bya ba so sor nges pa byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pas sngar
analyzed: ci ste rang gi bya ba mi byed pa nyid yin na ni de lta na yang dpe med pa dang ma nges pa nyid de thams cad kyang bya ba so sor nges pa byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pas sngar
translated: But if it is the nonperformance of its own function, then there is no example and it is not established because all things perform their own specific functions.”🔽This is the commentary by Sthiramati.

original: don dam par 'o ma yin par gyur pa ni zho yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
analyzed: don dam par 'o ma yin par gyur pa ni zho yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
translated: “Ultimately, milk that has become milk does not produce curd that has become curd

original: 'bras bu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag bzhin no zhes bsgrubs pa de la 'dir slob dpon blo brtan na re dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag bzhin no zhes bsgrubs pa de la 'dir slob dpon blo brtan na re dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
translated: because it depends on the effect, like the two pieces of wood.”

original: gal te don dam par ni mi byed pa la tha snyad du ni byed do zhes dam 'cha' ba yin na ni des na khyod kyi dpe med pa dang / phyogs snga ma la gnod pas mi rung ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par ni mi byed pa la tha snyad du ni byed do zhes dam 'cha' ba yin na ni des na khyod kyi dpe med pa dang / phyogs snga ma la gnod pas mi rung ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you assert that ultimately it does not produce, but conventionally it does, then your example is not established and it is not suitable to fault the opponent’s position. Why?

original: 'o mas don dam par zho ma byed la tha snyad du ni byed pa'i dpe yang de dang mthun pa las blang dgos na khyod kyi dpe rgyu spun dag gis ni don dam par yang zho mi byed la tha snyad du yang zho mi byed pa yin pas
analyzed: 'o mas don dam par zho ma byed la tha snyad du ni byed pa'i dpe yang de dang mthun pa las blang dgos na khyod kyi dpe rgyu spun dag gis ni don dam par yang zho mi byed la tha snyad du yang zho mi byed pa yin pas
translated: If you must take as an example something that ultimately does not produce yogurt from milk but conventionally does, then your example of the two causes of yogurt must be that ultimately they do not produce yogurt and conventionally they do not produce yogurt.

original: 'o ma'i dper mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'o ma'i dper mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is not suitable as an example of milk.

original: gzhan yang khyod kyis sngar ni don dam par 'o mas zho mi byed do zhes dam bcas la de 'dir ni don dam par ni mi byed la tha snyad du ni byed par dam bcas pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod kyis sngar ni don dam par 'o mas zho mi byed do zhes dam bcas la de 'dir ni don dam par ni mi byed la tha snyad du ni byed par dam bcas pas /
translated: Moreover, previously you asserted that ultimately milk does not produce yogurt, but here you assert that ultimately it does not produce but conventionally it does.

original: des na sngar dam bcas pa'i phyogs la yang gnod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na sngar dam bcas pa'i phyogs la yang gnod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is not suitable because it also faults your previously asserted position.

original: ci ste khyod kyis dam bcas pa de'i don 'o mas rang gi bya ba zho mi byed pa nyid yin na ni de lta na yang dpe med pa dang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: ci ste khyod kyis dam bcas pa de'i don 'o mas rang gi bya ba zho mi byed pa nyid yin na ni de lta na yang dpe med pa dang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ste /
translated: But if the meaning of your thesis is that milk itself does not perform the action of curd, then even so, it is not correct because the example is not established and the reason is indeterminate.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'o mas rang gi bya ba mi byed pa nyid kyi dpe yang de dang mthun pa las blang dgos na khyod kyi dpe rgyu spun dag gi rang gi bya ba snam bu @173a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'o mas rang gi bya ba mi byed pa nyid kyi dpe yang de dang mthun pa las blang dgos na khyod kyi dpe rgyu spun dag gi rang gi bya ba snam bu @173a * //
translated: Why is it not correct?

original: byed pa yin pas 'o ma'i dper mi rung ngo //🔽gzhan yang khyod kyi gtan tshigs 'bras bu la ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de don dam par 'o ma dang rgyu spun dag gis zho mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin nam /
analyzed: byed pa yin pas 'o ma'i dper mi rung ngo // gzhan yang khyod kyi gtan tshigs 'bras bu la ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de don dam par 'o ma dang rgyu spun dag gis zho mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin nam /
translated: If the example of milk itself not performing its own action must be taken from something similar to it, then your example of cloth is not suitable as an example of milk because the cause, thread, performs the action of cloth.🔽Moreover, your reason, “because it depends on the effect,” is indeterminate because it is not certain whether it is a reason that ultimately milk and thread do not produce curd,

original: 'on te kun rdzob tu rgyu spun dag gis zho mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'on te kun rdzob tu rgyu spun dag gis zho mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: or whether it is a reason that conventionally thread does not produce curd.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te brtag pa snga ma ni khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te brtag pa snga ma ni khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not good, because the former analysis is not accepted.

original: brtag pa phyi ma la yang rgyu spun la sogs pa zho'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid dang snam bu la sogs pa 'o ma'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du grub pa dag dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma la yang rgyu spun la sogs pa zho'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid dang snam bu la sogs pa 'o ma'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du grub pa dag dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin la /
translated: In the latter analysis, the reason, such as the yarn, is not the cause of the curd, and the cloth, etc., is not the effect of the milk. Because they are asserted to be examples, it is not that there is no example.

original: dam bcas pa khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: And because the thesis is specific, it is not that there is no certainty.

original: khyod kyi brtag pa snga ma ltar don dam par 'o mas zho mi byed la /
analyzed: khyod kyi brtag pa snga ma ltar don dam par 'o mas zho mi byed la /
translated: According to your former analysis, milk does not produce curd ultimately.

original: tha snyad du byed par kho bos khas ma blangs kyi don dam pa kho nar mi byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir kho bo la dpe med pa dang phyogs snga ma la gnod pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: tha snyad du byed par kho bos khas ma blangs kyi don dam pa kho nar mi byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir kho bo la dpe med pa dang phyogs snga ma la gnod pa'i skyon med do //
translated: We do not accept that it produces it conventionally, but we do accept that it does not produce it ultimately. Therefore we do not have the fault of having no example and the fault of the opponent’s position being undermined.

original: brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'o mas don dam par rang gi bya ba zho mi byed pa nyid khas blangs pa la ni rgyu spun la sogs pa zho'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid dang / snam bu la sogs pa'o ma'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du grub pa dag dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'o mas don dam par rang gi bya ba zho mi byed pa nyid khas blangs pa la ni rgyu spun la sogs pa zho'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid dang / snam bu la sogs pa'o ma'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du grub pa dag dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin la /
translated: According to the latter analysis, the example is not non-existent because the example of milk not ultimately performing its own function of producing yogurt is accepted, and the example of the cause, such as the seed, not being the cause of yogurt and the cloth not being the effect of milk is also accepted.

original: kho bos don dam par 'o mas zho mi byed de zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can byas pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs 'bras bu la ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya bas don dam par 'o ma dang rgyu spun dag gis zho mi byed par 'grub pa'i phyir
analyzed: kho bos don dam par 'o mas zho mi byed de zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can byas pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs 'bras bu la ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya bas don dam par 'o ma dang rgyu spun dag gis zho mi byed par 'grub pa'i phyir
translated: Since we make the special assertion that ultimately milk does not produce yogurt, our reason, because the effect depends on the cause, proves that ultimately milk and the seed do not produce yogurt.

original: ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin pas /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin pas /
translated: Since it is not uncertain,

original: slob dpon blo brtan gyi klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon blo brtan gyi klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: the objection of master Sthiramati is not good.

original: 'dir grangs can dag gis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs can dag gi gzhung las rgyu la 'bras bu snga na nus pa'i tshul gyis yod pa phyis rkyen rnams kyis bsal bar byed cing 'byung bas rgyu 'o ma la yang 'bras bu zho snga🔽na yod la /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag gis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs can dag gi gzhung las rgyu la 'bras bu snga na nus pa'i tshul gyis yod pa phyis rkyen rnams kyis bsal bar byed cing 'byung bas rgyu 'o ma la yang 'bras bu zho snga na yod la /
translated: Therefore, the effect, yogurt, exists prior to the cause, milk.

original: sa bon la yang myu gu snga na yod /
analyzed: sa bon la yang myu gu snga na yod /
translated: The sprout exists prior to the seed.🔽The pot exists prior to the clay.

original: 'jim pa la yang bum pa snga na yod rgyu spun la yang snam bu snga na yod //
analyzed: 'jim pa la yang bum pa snga na yod rgyu spun la yang snam bu snga na yod //
translated: The cloth exists prior to the thread.

original: rtsi kyang la yang sab ma snga na yod /
analyzed: rtsi kyang la yang sab ma snga na yod /
translated: The rice exists prior to the husk.

original: mer mer po la sogs pa dag la yang mig la sogs pa dag snga na yod do zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston te /
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa dag la yang mig la sogs pa dag snga na yod do zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston te /
translated: The eyes and so on exist prior to the embryo and so on.

original: 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba de dag gi gzhung gzugs pa'i gtan tshigs ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba de dag gi gzhung gzugs pa'i gtan tshigs ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The reasonings that prove the existence of the effect prior to the cause are of five types.

original: med mi byed @173b phyir rgyu len phyir //
analyzed: med mi byed @173b phyir rgyu len phyir //
translated: Because it is not made from nothing, because it is obtained from a cause,

original: thams cad 'byung ba med phyir dang // nus pas nus can byed phyir dang // rgyu yod phyir ni 'bras bu yod //
analyzed: thams cad 'byung ba med phyir dang // nus pas nus can byed phyir dang // rgyu yod phyir ni 'bras bu yod //
translated: Because of the non-existence of everything, because of the potency of the potent, because of the existence of the cause, the effect exists.🔽Because of the non-existence of everything, the effect exists prior to the cause, because of the potency of the potent, the effect exists prior to the cause, and because of the existence of the cause, the effect exists.🔽The effect exists prior to the cause, because of the non-existence of everything, because of the potency of the potent, because of the existence of the cause, because of the non-performance of the non-existent, and because of the grasping of the cause.

original: ces bya bas med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang // rgyu len pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang / nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang /🔽rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa dag go rims bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: ces bya bas med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang // rgyu len pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang / nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang / rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa dag go rims bzhin du ston to //
translated: The effect exists prior to the cause, because of the non-performance of the non-existent, because of the grasping of the cause, because of the non-existence of everything, because of the potency of the potent, and because of the existence of the cause.

original: de la re zhig med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the effect existing prior to the cause, because of the non-performance of the non-existent, he says:

original: 'bras bu snga na yod pa rgyu yod pa nyid kyis byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu snga na yod pa rgyu yod pa nyid kyis byed de /
translated: The effect exists prior to the cause, because of the existence of the cause.

original: med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-performance of the non-existent.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni byed pa med de dper na rus sbal gyi spu la gos byed pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni byed pa med de dper na rus sbal gyi spu la gos byed pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: But if an effect does not exist in a cause, then it cannot be produced, just as cloth cannot be produced from the hairs of a rabbit’s fur.

original: zho la ni byed pa yod pas de'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zho la ni byed pa yod pas de'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But since curd can be produced, therefore the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: 'di na rgyu 'o ma lta bu gang la 'bras bu zho snga na yod pa de la ni rkyen gyis gsal bar byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di na rgyu 'o ma lta bu gang la 'bras bu zho snga na yod pa de la ni rkyen gyis gsal bar byed kyi /
translated: In this world, a cause such as milk that has an effect such as curd that exists prior to it is clarified by a condition.

original: rgyu rus sbal gyi spu lta bu gang la 'bras bu gos snga na med pa de la ni rkyen gyis gsal bar mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu rus sbal gyi spu lta bu gang la 'bras bu gos snga na med pa de la ni rkyen gyis gsal bar mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But a cause such as the hairs of a rabbit’s fur that does not have an effect such as cloth that exists prior to it is not clarified by a condition. Therefore the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: rgyu len pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu len pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the assertion that the effect exists prior to the cause is untenable, the treatise states:🔽If the effect does not exist,🔽what is it that the cause produces?

original: gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na /🔽dper na 'o ma la zho snga na med pa bzhin du rtsi kyang la sogs pa dag kyang med par 'dra bas /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na /🔽dper na 'o ma la zho snga na med pa bzhin du rtsi kyang la sogs pa dag kyang med par 'dra bas /
translated: If the effect does not exist,🔽what is it that the cause produces?🔽If the effect does not exist prior to the cause, then what is it that the cause produces?

original: zho'i don du de'i rgyu 'o ma len par mi byed pa zhig na len par yang byed pas de ltar rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zho'i don du de'i rgyu 'o ma len par mi byed pa zhig na len par yang byed pas de ltar rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it were not so, then just as one would not take milk as the cause for curd, one would not take milk as the cause for curd.

original: gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na dper na rgyu 'o ma la 'bras bu zho snga na med pa bzhin du 'bras bu rtsi kyang la sogs pa dag kyang snga na med par 'dra bas ci ltar rtsi kyang la sogs pa'i don du de'i rgyu
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na dper na rgyu 'o ma la 'bras bu zho snga na med pa bzhin du 'bras bu rtsi kyang la sogs pa dag kyang snga na med par 'dra bas ci ltar rtsi kyang la sogs pa'i don du de'i rgyu
translated: If the effect did not exist prior to the cause, then just as curd does not exist prior to the cause, milk, the effect, molasses and so on would also be similar in not existing prior to the cause.🔽Why would one not take milk as the cause for molasses and so on?

original: 'o ma len par mi byed pa de bzhin du zho'i don du yang de'i rgyu 'o ma len par mi byed pa zhig na /
analyzed: 'o ma len par mi byed pa de bzhin du zho'i don du yang de'i rgyu 'o ma len par mi byed pa zhig na /
translated: If it were not so, then just as one would not take milk as the cause for molasses and so on, one would not take milk as the cause for curd.

original: de lta ma yin te rtsi kyang la sogs pa'i don du ni de'i rgyu 'o ma len par mi byed la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te rtsi kyang la sogs pa'i don du ni de'i rgyu 'o ma len par mi byed la /
translated: But it is not so. One does not take milk as the cause for molasses and so on, but one does take milk as the cause for curd.

original: zho'i don du ni de'i rgyu 'o ma len par byed pas de ltar rgyu len pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zho'i don du ni de'i rgyu 'o ma len par byed pas de ltar rgyu len pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, because one takes the cause, the effect definitely exists prior to it.

original: thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa bstan pa'i phyir gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na /
analyzed: thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa bstan pa'i phyir gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na /
