translated: If the effect does not exist prior to the cause, then just as curd does not exist in milk, so the three worlds would arise from what does not exist, like curd.🔽But they do not arise.🔽Therefore, because all things do not arise, you assert that the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: dper na 'o ma la zho snga na med pa bzhin du 'jig rten @174a * //
analyzed: dper na 'o ma la zho snga na med pa bzhin du 'jig rten @174a * //
translated: If the effect does not exist prior to the cause, then just as curd does not exist in milk, so the three worlds would arise from what does not exist, like curd.🔽But they do not arise.🔽Therefore, because all things do not arise, you assert that the effect exists prior to the cause.🔽If the effect does not exist prior to the cause, then just as curd does not exist in milk, so the three worlds would arise from what does not exist, like curd.🔽But they do not arise.🔽Therefore, because all things do not arise, you assert that the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: gsum po dag kyang med par 'dra bas zho bzhin du 'jig rten gsum po dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: gsum po dag kyang med par 'dra bas zho bzhin du 'jig rten gsum po dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: If the effect does not exist prior to the cause, then just as curd does not exist in milk, so the three worlds would arise from what does not exist, like curd.

original: de dag mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: de dag mi 'byung bas /
translated: But they do not arise.

original: de ltar thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, because all things do not arise, you assert that the effect exists prior to the cause.🔽If the effect does not exist prior to the cause, then just as curd does not exist in milk, so the three worlds would arise from what does not exist, like curd.🔽But they do not arise.🔽Therefore, because all things do not arise, you assert that the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na dper na rgyu 'o ma la 'bras bu zho snga na med pa bzhin du 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum po dag kyang snga na med par 'dra bas ci ltar rgyu 'o ma las 'bras bu zho 'byung ba bzhin
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na dper na rgyu 'o ma la 'bras bu zho snga na med pa bzhin du 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum po dag kyang snga na med par 'dra bas ci ltar rgyu 'o ma las 'bras bu zho 'byung ba bzhin
translated: If the effect does not exist prior to the cause, then just as curd does not exist in milk, so the three worlds would arise from what does not exist, like curd.🔽But they

original: du rgyu 'o ma la 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum po dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: du rgyu 'o ma la 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum po dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: It is logical that the three worlds would arise from the cause, milk, but that is not the case.

original: de ltar ma yin te rgyu 'o ma las 'bras bu zho ni 'byung gi /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te rgyu 'o ma las 'bras bu zho ni 'byung gi /
translated: The result, yogurt, arises from the cause, milk,

original: 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum po dag ni mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum po dag ni mi 'byung bas /
translated: but the three worlds do not arise from it.

original: de ltar thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, because everything does not arise, the result exists prior to the cause.

original: nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the assertion that the result exists prior to the cause is illogical because that which is able produces that which is able,

original: gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na /
translated: if the result did not exist prior to the cause,🔽why is it that the potter produces a pot only from that which is able, clay, and not from everything?

original: ci'i phyir rdza mkhan nus pas 'jim pa nus pa can dag kho na las bum pa sgrub par byed cing thams cad las mi byed par nges pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rdza mkhan nus pas 'jim pa nus pa can dag kho na las bum pa sgrub par byed cing thams cad las mi byed par nges pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Why is it certain that he does not produce it from everything?

original: de ltar nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin par sems so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ltar nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin par sems so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, because that which is able produces that which is able, the result exists prior to the cause.

original: gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na dper na rgyu nus pa can 'jim pa la 'bras bu bum pa snga na med pa bzhin du rgyu 'o ma la sogs pa dag la yang 'bras bu bum pa snga na med par 'dra bas ci ltar rdzas🔽mkhan mi nus pas /🔽rgyu 'o ma la sogs pa nus pa can ma yin pa dag las 'bras bu bum pa sgrub par mi byed pa de bzhin du rdza mkhan nus pas rgyu 'jim pa nus pa can dag las kyang 'bras bu bum pa sgrub par mi byed pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na dper na rgyu nus pa can 'jim pa la 'bras bu bum pa snga na med pa bzhin du rgyu 'o ma la sogs pa dag la yang 'bras bu bum pa snga na med par 'dra bas ci ltar rdzas mkhan mi nus pas / rgyu 'o ma la sogs pa nus pa can ma yin pa dag las 'bras bu bum pa sgrub par mi byed pa de bzhin du rdza mkhan nus pas rgyu 'jim pa nus pa can dag las kyang 'bras bu bum pa sgrub par mi byed pa zhig na /
translated: If the effect does not exist prior to the cause, then just as the effect, the vase, does not exist prior to the cause, the capable clay, in the same way, the effect, the vase, would also not exist prior to the cause, the milk and so on.🔽Why? Because the potter is not capable of producing the effect, the vase, from the cause, the milk and so on.🔽Just as the potter who is not capable of producing the effect, the vase, from the cause, the milk and so on, which are not capable of producing the vase, in the same way, the potter who is capable of producing the vase would not produce the effect, the vase, from the cause, the clay and so on, which are capable of producing the vase.

original: de lta ma yin te rdza mkhan nus pas rgyu 'jim pa nus pa can dag kho na las 'bras bu bum pa sgrub par byed cing rdza mkhan mi nus pas rgyu 'o ma la sogs pa nus pa can ma yin pa thams cad las 'bras bu bum pa
analyzed: de lta ma yin te rdza mkhan nus pas rgyu 'jim pa nus pa can dag kho na las 'bras bu bum pa sgrub par byed cing rdza mkhan mi nus pas rgyu 'o ma la sogs pa nus pa can ma yin pa thams cad las 'bras bu bum pa
translated: But that is not the case. The potter who is capable of producing the vase produces the effect, the vase, from the cause, the clay and so on, which are capable of producing the vase. The potter who is not capable of producing the vase does not produce the effect, the vase, from the cause, the milk and so on, which are not capable of producing the vase.

original: sgrub par mi byed par nges par 'di 'byung bar 'gyur bas de ltar nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin par sems so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sgrub par mi byed par nges par 'di 'byung bar 'gyur bas de ltar nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin par sems so zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it definitely arises after the cause, it is established that the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the effect exists prior to the cause because the cause exists,

original: 'dis kyang 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho nar mngon te /🔽gang med pa la ni rgyu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pas gal te 'bras bu snga na med par @174b gyur na de la yang rgyu'i dngos po med par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin pas de ltar rgyu yod pa'i phyir yang 'bras bu snga
analyzed: 'dis kyang 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho nar mngon te / gang med pa la ni rgyu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pas gal te 'bras bu snga na med par @174b gyur na de la yang rgyu'i dngos po med par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin pas de ltar rgyu yod pa'i phyir yang 'bras bu snga
translated: this also clearly shows that the effect exists prior to the cause.🔽If the effect did not exist prior to the cause, the cause would not exist, because the state of being a cause does not exist for that which is nonexistent.

original: na yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: na yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But since that is not the case, the effect exists prior to the cause because the cause exists.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu gang med pa de la ni rgyu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pas gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na dper na 'bras bu zho la sogs pa gang dag phyis rkyen gyis gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu gang med pa de la ni rgyu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pas gal te 'bras bu snga na med par gyur na dper na 'bras bu zho la sogs pa gang dag phyis rkyen gyis gsal bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, since the state of cause does not exist for any nonexistent effect, if the effect were to exist prior to the cause, then it would follow that the effect, such as yogurt, would exist prior to the conditions that manifest it.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag la yang rgyu'i dngos po 'o ma la sogs pa dag med par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te /🔽de dag la rgyu'i dngos po yod pas de ltar rgyu yod pa'i phyir yang 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag la yang rgyu'i dngos po 'o ma la sogs pa dag med par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te / de dag la rgyu'i dngos po yod pas de ltar rgyu yod pa'i phyir yang 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But that is not so, since the state of cause does not exist for those effects.🔽Therefore, since the cause exists in that way, the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: de ltar 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs ba lnga po de dag gi spyi'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'o ma la ni zho snga na yod pa kho na yin te de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs ba lnga po de dag gi spyi'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'o ma la ni zho snga na yod pa kho na yin te de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate the general inference that the effect exists prior to the cause, he says, Yogurt exists prior to milk because it arises when milk exists.

original: gang la gang snga na med pa de ni de yod kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang la gang snga na med pa de ni de yod kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If the effect does not exist prior to the cause, then even if the cause exists, the effect would not arise.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpes ldog pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpes ldog pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation of the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion by way of the example of the dissimilar class.

original: 'di na rgyu gang la 'bras bu gang snga na med pa dper na bye ma la 'bru mar snga na med pa de ni bye ma de yod kyang 'bru mar 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di na rgyu gang la 'bras bu gang snga na med pa dper na bye ma la 'bru mar snga na med pa de ni bye ma de yod kyang 'bru mar 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the effect does not exist prior to the cause, for example, oil does not exist prior to sand, then even if the sand exists, oil would not arise.

original: rgyu 'o ma la 'bras bu zho snga na yod pa de ni 'o ma de yod na zho 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'o ma la 'bras bu zho snga na yod pa de ni 'o ma de yod na zho 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But if the effect curd exists prior to the cause milk, then if milk exists, curd will arise. Therefore the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: 'di skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'di skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: de la 'dir med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ni phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de la 'dir med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ni phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Here, the statement “because it does not operate on what does not exist” is not the property of the subject, and therefore the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: grangs can dag gi med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyi chos kyis rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs ba de ni phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes ston to //
analyzed: grangs can dag gi med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyi chos kyis rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs ba de ni phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes ston to //
translated: The statement “because it does not operate on what does not exist” is not the property of the subject, and therefore the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: grangs can dag gis phyogs ni chos can rgyu la bsgrub pa'i bya ba chos 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa yin pas /
analyzed: grangs can dag gis phyogs ni chos can rgyu la bsgrub pa'i bya ba chos 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa yin pas /
translated: The Sāṃkhya position is that the subject is the cause and the predicate is the activity of the effect existing prior to it.

original: de'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ni med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ni med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma yin te /
translated: The property of that subject is not the reason, “because it does not operate on what does not exist.”

original: 'di ltar yang ni khyed kyi phyogs rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya ba de de ltar ma yin pas gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos ci skad brjod du zin kyang khyed kyi phyogs mi 'grub mod kyi /🔽'on kyang re zhig rigs @175a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang ni khyed kyi phyogs rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya ba de de ltar ma yin pas gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos ci skad brjod du zin kyang khyed kyi phyogs mi 'grub mod kyi / 'on kyang re zhig rigs @175a * //
translated: In this way, your position is that the effect exists prior to the cause. Since that is not so, the basis is not established. Therefore, even if you state a property of the position, your position is not established.

original: pa'i rgyu thabs tsam gyis brgyud na rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos ni yod pa la byed pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod na tha snyad tsam du yang rung ba zhig na /
analyzed: pa'i rgyu thabs tsam gyis brgyud na rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos ni yod pa la byed pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod na tha snyad tsam du yang rung ba zhig na /
translated: However, if you say that the property of the position that proves the effect exists prior to the cause is posited as existing in terms of the mere method of the cause of reasoning, then that is suitable even conventionally.

original: khyed kyis med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa ni dper na 'ga' zhig sgra rtag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: khyed kyis med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa ni dper na 'ga' zhig sgra rtag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: If you say that it is not posited as nonexistent, then, for example, it would be like someone saying, “The property of the position that proves sound to be permanent is impermanent,” because it is unrelated, it is not a property of the position.

original: khyed kyi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang 'brel pa med pas phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyed kyi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang 'brel pa med pas phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: You say, “Because it is not the case that conditions do not produce that which does not exist,” but that is not a property of the subject because it is not related to the subject. Therefore the meaning of your reason is not established.

original: 'dir gal te grangs can dag na re kho bo cag gis med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de ni gtan tshigs su gzhag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir gal te grangs can dag na re kho bo cag gis med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de ni gtan tshigs su gzhag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, if Sāṃkhyas say, “We do not posit ‘because it is not the case that conditions do not produce that which does not exist’ as a reason.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dper gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dper gzhag pa yin te /
translated: We posit it as a counterexample to the dissimilar class.

original: des na ci ltar nam mkha'i me tog lta bu snga na med pa la ni rkyen gyis gsal bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: des na ci ltar nam mkha'i me tog lta bu snga na med pa la ni rkyen gyis gsal bar mi byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, just as a sky flower, which does not exist earlier, is not clarified by conditions,

original: rgyu 'o ma lta bu gang la 'bras bu zho snga na yod pa de rkyen gyis gsal bar byed pas /
analyzed: rgyu 'o ma lta bu gang la 'bras bu zho snga na yod pa de rkyen gyis gsal bar byed pas /
translated: that which is clarified by conditions, such as milk, which is the cause, is the earlier existent effect.

original: de'i phyir med pa la mi byed pa'i phyogs las bzlog na yod pa la byed par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa la mi byed pa'i phyogs las bzlog na yod pa la byed par 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, if you reverse the position that conditions do not produce that which does not exist, it follows that conditions produce that which does exist.

original: des kyang 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho nar 'grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /🔽chos mi mthun pa'i dper rtag tu yang byed pa'i phyir zhes nye bar sbyor bas /
analyzed: des kyang 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho nar 'grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / chos mi mthun pa'i dper rtag tu yang byed pa'i phyir zhes nye bar sbyor bas /
translated: The author of this commentary, in response to the above objection, which is drawn from the opponent's position, states:🔽Since the example of the dissimilar class is also used as the reason, because of the existence of the effect,

original: gtan tshigs mngon pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs mngon pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid de /
translated: the meaning of the reason is evident. Therefore, in the context of the conventional, the reason is not nonestablished with respect to its meaning and it is not contradictory with respect to its meaning.

original: yod pa la byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang med pa la de srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yod pa la byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang med pa la de srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is because activity is impossible with respect to that which exists and it is possible with respect to that which does not exist.

original: grangs can dag gis med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dper brtag na /🔽des na ci ltar nam mkha'i me tog lta bu snga na med pa la rkyen gyis gsal bar mi byed pa'i phyogs las bzlog na /
analyzed: grangs can dag gis med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dper brtag na /🔽des na ci ltar nam mkha'i me tog lta bu snga na med pa la rkyen gyis gsal bar mi byed pa'i phyogs las bzlog na /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say, Because it is not an activity with respect to that which does not exist. When this is taken as an example of the dissimilar class,🔽then, because of the existence of the effect is the reason.

original: 'o ma la zho snga na yod pa la rkyen gyis gsal bar byed pa'i phyir zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bya dgos pas de ltar med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba las bzlog na yod pa la byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de
analyzed: 'o ma la zho snga na yod pa la rkyen gyis gsal bar byed pa'i phyir zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bya dgos pas de ltar med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba las bzlog na yod pa la byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de
translated: One must apply the syllogism, Because milk, which exists prior to curd, is clarified by conditions, but since it is not applied in that way, it is said, because it is not so, and the opposite of that is, because it is so.

original: gtan tshigs yin par mngon no /
analyzed: gtan tshigs yin par mngon no /
translated: It is evident that that is the reason.

original: de ltar mngon na skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar mngon na skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is evident, what is the fault?

original: de'i phyir re zhig tha snyad kyi phyogs la gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig tha snyad kyi phyogs la gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, first, in the context of conventional reality, there is the fault that the meaning of that reason is not established and that the meaning is contradictory.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar @175b tha snyad rgyu la 'bras bu yod par gyur na yod pa la ni rgyus byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir dper na sgra la mig gis gzung ba nyid mi srid pa bzhin du gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar @175b tha snyad rgyu la 'bras bu yod par gyur na yod pa la ni rgyus byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir dper na sgra la mig gis gzung ba nyid mi srid pa bzhin du gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do
translated: Why is that? It is like this: If conventional reality were the effect existing in the cause, it would be impossible for the cause to produce what already exists. For example, it is impossible for sound to be apprehended by the eyes. The meaning of the reason is not established.

original: // tha snyad du rgyu la 'bras bu med par gyur na ni med pa la ni rgyus byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir dper na bum pa'i rgyu 'jim pa la 'bras bu bum pa med pa rkyen rnams kyis byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // tha snyad du rgyu la 'bras bu med par gyur na ni med pa la ni rgyus byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir dper na bum pa'i rgyu 'jim pa la 'bras bu bum pa med pa rkyen rnams kyis byed pa'i phyir /
translated: If the effect were not present in the cause conventionally, then it would be impossible for the cause to generate it, because it would be nonexistent, just as, for example, a pot is not generated by conditions, since the effect, the pot, is not present in the cause, the clay.

original: khyed kyi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa la byed do zhes dam bcas pa don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: khyed kyi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa la byed do zhes dam bcas pa don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, your thesis that the effect is present in the cause prior to its generation is contradictory.

original: de ltar re zhig grangs can dag gis med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya bas 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa de ni tha snyad kyi phyogs la yang ma grub po //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig grangs can dag gis med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya bas 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa de ni tha snyad kyi phyogs la yang ma grub po //
translated: Thus, since the Sāṃkhyas say that the effect is not generated from what is nonexistent, the statement that the effect is present prior to its generation is not established even from the conventional standpoint.

original: don dam par ni gtan tshigs dang dpe med do zhes bya ba ni gal te de don dam par sgrub na ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs dang dpe med pas shin tu yang mi
analyzed: don dam par ni gtan tshigs dang dpe med do zhes bya ba ni gal te de don dam par sgrub na ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs dang dpe med pas shin tu yang mi
translated: As for the statement that there is no reason or example, if you are proving that in an ultimate sense, then since all phenomena are unarisen in an ultimate sense, there is no reason or example for you, and your thesis is also unarisen.

original: 'grub po // gang la gang snga na yod pa de ni de las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'grub po // gang la gang snga na yod pa de ni de las mi 'byung ste /
translated: That which exists prior to something does not arise from it.🔽For example, it is like the nature of a cause. Therefore, the fault of the subject not being established applies to the thesis.

original: dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gis 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa rnam pa lnga po //
analyzed: dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gis 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa rnam pa lnga po //
translated: The Sāṃkhyas state five proofs that the effect exists in the cause.

original: med mi byed phyir rgyu len phyir //
analyzed: med mi byed phyir rgyu len phyir //
translated: Because it is not made from what does not exist, because it is obtained from the cause,

original: thams cad 'byung ba med phyir dang // nus pas nus can byed phyir dang // rgyu yod phyir na 'bras bu yod //
analyzed: thams cad 'byung ba med phyir dang // nus pas nus can byed phyir dang // rgyu yod phyir na 'bras bu yod //
translated: because everything would arise from everything, because the potent causes the potent, and because the effect exists because the cause exists.

original: ces bya ba de dag thams cad spyir sun dbyung ba'i rigs pa ston te /
analyzed: ces bya ba de dag thams cad spyir sun dbyung ba'i rigs pa ston te /
translated: All of these are taught to be reasonings that refute in general.

original: dper na rgyu'i bdag nyid gang la rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid gang snga na yod pa de ni rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid de la mi 'byung ba de bzhin du grangs can dag gis brtags pa ltar rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par gyur na de yang
analyzed: dper na rgyu'i bdag nyid gang la rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid gang snga na yod pa de ni rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid de la mi 'byung ba de bzhin du grangs can dag gis brtags pa ltar rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par gyur na de yang
translated: For example, that which exists prior to a cause’s nature does not arise from that cause’s nature. In the same way, if the effect existed prior to the cause, as the Sāṃkhyas imagine, then that effect

original: de las mi 'byung bar nges pas des na grangs can dag gis rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par dam bcas pa de la rgyu chos can gyi khyad par 'bras bu 'byung ba de dag bsal cing /🔽rgyu chos can las 'bras bu mi 'byung bar bsgrub pa'i skyon yod pas de'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las mi 'byung bar nges pas des na grangs can dag gis rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par dam bcas pa de la rgyu chos can gyi khyad par 'bras bu 'byung ba de dag bsal cing / rgyu chos can las 'bras bu mi 'byung bar bsgrub pa'i skyon yod pas de'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is certain that it does not arise from that, then the assertion of Sāṃkhyas that the effect exists prior to the cause is refuted by the logical reason of the arising of the effect, which is a property of the subject.🔽Since the fault of proving that the effect does not arise from the cause exists, the meaning of that is that the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: ci ste yang 'di skad ces 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon gdags par 'dod pas med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag nye bar bzhag ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di skad ces 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon gdags par 'dod pas med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag nye bar bzhag ste /
translated: But if one asserts that the fault of the logical reason of the arising of the effect, which is a property of the subject, is imputed to the assertion of those who propound that the effect does not exist prior to the cause, then the reason “because it does not perform the action of arising” and so on is presented.

original: gang la gang snga na med pa de la ni byed pa la sogs pa med de dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin @176a * //
analyzed: gang la gang snga na med pa de la ni byed pa la sogs pa med de dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin @176a * //
translated: That which does not exist prior to something does not perform the action of arising, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: pas de'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis 'bras bu snga na med pa nyid du dam bcas pa la yang byed pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes zer na zhes bya bas ni 'di skad ston to //
analyzed: pas de'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis 'bras bu snga na med pa nyid du dam bcas pa la yang byed pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes zer na zhes bya bas ni 'di skad ston to //
translated: Therefore, the error of refuting activity and so on also applies to the assertion of the Samkhyas that the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: grangs can dag gi gzhung las /
analyzed: grangs can dag gi gzhung las /
translated: The Samkhyas state five proofs in their treatise:

original: med mi byed phyir rgyu len phyir //
analyzed: med mi byed phyir rgyu len phyir //
translated: Because it does not make the nonexistent, because it appropriates the cause,🔽because everything would arise from everything, because the potent would make the potent,

original: thams cad 'byung ba med phyir dang // nus pas nus can byed phyir dang // rgyu yod phyir ni 'bras bu yod //
analyzed: thams cad 'byung ba med phyir dang // nus pas nus can byed phyir dang // rgyu yod phyir ni 'bras bu yod //
translated: and because the effect exists, the cause exists.

original: ces bya ba lnga po de dag gzhung gzugs pa rnam pa lnga zhes bya bar yang sgrub la /
analyzed: ces bya ba lnga po de dag gzhung gzugs pa rnam pa lnga zhes bya bar yang sgrub la /
translated: These five are established as the five proofs of the Samkhya treatise.

original: gzhung gzugs pa ma yin pa rnam pa lnga zhes bya bar yang sgrub ste /
analyzed: gzhung gzugs pa ma yin pa rnam pa lnga zhes bya bar yang sgrub ste /
translated: They are also established as the five non-proofs of the Samkhya treatise.

original: de'i gzhung gzugs pa rnam pa lnga zhes bya bar sgrub pa ni grangs can dag gis grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa'i gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: de'i gzhung gzugs pa rnam pa lnga zhes bya bar sgrub pa ni grangs can dag gis grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa'i gtan tshigs su /
translated: The five proofs of the Samkhya treatise are established as follows: The Samkhyas state the following in their tenets:

original: med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang / rgyu len pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang / thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang / nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang /
analyzed: med pa la mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang / rgyu len pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang / thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang / nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang /
translated: Because it does not act on what does not exist, because the effect would be prior to the cause, because everything would be unproduced, because the potential would produce the possessor of the potential, and because the cause would exist, the effect would be prior to the cause.

original: rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa rnam pa lnga ci skad sngar bstan pa dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa rnam pa lnga ci skad sngar bstan pa dag nyid yin no //
translated: These five types of proofs that the effect is prior to the cause are exactly as they were previously explained.🔽The proof of the five types of nonproofs is as follows.

original: gzhung gzugs pa ma yin pa rnam pa lnga zhes bya bar sgrub pa ni grangs can dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon gdags pa'i gtan
analyzed: gzhung gzugs pa ma yin pa rnam pa lnga zhes bya bar sgrub pa ni grangs can dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon gdags pa'i gtan
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say, “The Buddhists and so on, who say that the effect does not exist prior to the cause, commit the error of stating a subject that is not established in their thesis.”

original: tshigs su med pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba dang / rgyu len pa med pa'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba dang / thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba dang /
analyzed: tshigs su med pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba dang / rgyu len pa med pa'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba dang / thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba dang /
translated: Because there is no activity in the absence of parts, the specific property of the subject is eliminated, because there is no cause of appropriation, the specific property of the subject is eliminated, and because everything is unarisen, the specific property of the subject is eliminated.

original: nus pas nus pa can byed pa med pa'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba dang / rgyu med pa'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes sgrub pa yin pas /
analyzed: nus pas nus pa can byed pa med pa'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba dang / rgyu med pa'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes sgrub pa yin pas /
translated: Because that which is partless has no activity, it is the error of positing a specific attribute of the subject, because there is no cause of appropriation, it is the error of positing a specific attribute of the subject, because everything would be unarisen, it is the error of positing a specific attribute of the subject, because that which is potent does not produce that which is impotent, it is the error of positing a specific attribute of the subject, and because there is no cause, it is the error of positing a specific attribute of the subject.

original: de'i phyir 'dir de dag na re 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi gzhung gzugs pa rnam pa lnga po de dag ni rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa rang gi gzhung gzugs pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir de dag na re 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi gzhung gzugs pa rnam pa lnga po de dag ni rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa rang gi gzhung gzugs pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, in response to this, they say, “The five types of evidence that we use to form our tenets are not evidence that forms our tenets, whereby the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon gdags pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon gdags pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: The reason refutes the assertion of Buddhists and others who say that the effect does not exist prior to the cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di na rgyu gang la 'bras bu gang snga na med pa dper na ri bong @176b rva la rno ba nyid snga na med pa lta bu de la ni de bsal bar bya ba'i byed pa yang med la /
analyzed: 'di na rgyu gang la 'bras bu gang snga na med pa dper na ri bong @176b rva la rno ba nyid snga na med pa lta bu de la ni de bsal bar bya ba'i byed pa yang med la /
translated: Here, if the effect does not exist prior to the cause, for example, the sharpness of a rabbit’s horns does not exist prior to the horns, then the horns do not function to eliminate the effect.

original: de'i don du rgyu len pa yang med /
analyzed: de'i don du rgyu len pa yang med /
translated: Also, one would not apprehend the cause for the sake of the effect.

original: rgyu de las 'bras bu thams cad 'byung ba yang med /
analyzed: rgyu de las 'bras bu thams cad 'byung ba yang med /
translated: Also, all effects would not arise from that cause.

original: de nus pas nus pa can byed pa yang med /
analyzed: de nus pas nus pa can byed pa yang med /
translated: Also, the potent cause would not function to produce the effect.

original: de la rgyu yang med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la rgyu yang med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Also, that cause would not exist.

original: khyed sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la yang 'bras bu snga na med pa de bsal bar bya ba'i byed pa yang med la /
analyzed: khyed sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la yang 'bras bu snga na med pa de bsal bar bya ba'i byed pa yang med la /
translated: In the same way, Buddhists and others who say that the effect does not exist prior to the cause, the effect that does not exist prior to the cause would not function to eliminate the assertion.

original: de'i don du rgyu len pa yang /🔽rgyu de la 'bras bu thams cad 'byung ba yang med /
analyzed: de'i don du rgyu len pa yang / rgyu de la 'bras bu thams cad 'byung ba yang med /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows:🔽The effect does not arise from that cause.

original: de nus pas nus pa can byed pa yang med /
analyzed: de nus pas nus pa can byed pa yang med /
translated: Nor does the cause that possesses potency produce the effect.

original: de la rgyu yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rgyu yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: Nor does the effect exist in the cause.

original: de lta na khyed kyi dam bcas pa de la chos can rgyu'i khyad par 'bras bu rkyen gyis byed pa bsal ba dang / de'i don du rgyu len pa bsal ba dang / rgyu de las 'bras bu 'byung ba bsal ba dang / de nus pas nus pa can byed pa bsal ba dang /
analyzed: de lta na khyed kyi dam bcas pa de la chos can rgyu'i khyad par 'bras bu rkyen gyis byed pa bsal ba dang / de'i don du rgyu len pa bsal ba dang / rgyu de las 'bras bu 'byung ba bsal ba dang / de nus pas nus pa can byed pa bsal ba dang /
translated: In that case, the fault of the refutation of the subject, the particular cause, the production of the effect by conditions, the refutation of the acceptance of the cause for that purpose, the refutation of the arising of the effect from that cause, the refutation of the production of the possessor of potency by potency,

original: de la rgyu yod pa bsal ba'i skyon yod pas khyed rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa de yang mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la rgyu yod pa bsal ba'i skyon yod pas khyed rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa de yang mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: and the refutation of the existence of the cause would exist. Therefore, you who assert that the effect does not exist prior to the cause, your assertion is illogical.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary states:

original: de ni mi gnod de /
analyzed: de ni mi gnod de /
translated: That is not a fault.

original: legs par zin pa ma yin pa de gnyis ka yang bsal bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: legs par zin pa ma yin pa de gnyis ka yang bsal bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because we assert that both of those are to be refuted.

original: khyed kyi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i phyir yod par smra ba de ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i phyogs la mi gnod de /
analyzed: khyed kyi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i phyir yod par smra ba de ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i phyogs la mi gnod de /
translated: You Enumerators assert that the effect is present in the cause, but that assertion does not undermine the position of us Mādhyamikas.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kho bo cag ni khyed grangs can dag gi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par brtag pa legs par zin pa ma yin pa'i mtha' de dang / mdo sde pa la sogs pas rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par brtag pa legs par zin pa ma yin pa'i mtha' de gnyi ga yang bsal bar 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni khyed grangs can dag gi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par brtag pa legs par zin pa ma yin pa'i mtha' de dang / mdo sde pa la sogs pas rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par brtag pa legs par zin pa ma yin pa'i mtha' de gnyi ga yang bsal bar 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because we assert that both of those extremes are to be refuted: the extreme of the assertion by you Enumerators that the effect is present in the cause and the extreme of the assertion by Sautrāntikas and so on that the effect is not present in the cause.

original: des na kho bos ni khyed kyis legs par zin pa ma yin pa'i mtha' bsal ba /
analyzed: des na kho bos ni khyed kyis legs par zin pa ma yin pa'i mtha' bsal ba /
translated: Therefore, we refute the extremes asserted by you.

original: khyod kyis ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i legs par zin pa ma yin pa'i mtha' bsal ba ni kho bo'i grogs byas te /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i legs par zin pa ma yin pa'i mtha' bsal ba ni kho bo'i grogs byas te /
translated: You have helped me to dispel the incorrect extreme of the Sautrāntikas and so on.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus, the Laṅkāvatāra-sūtra says,

original: nga yi bstan pa sun 'byin pa //
analyzed: nga yi bstan pa sun 'byin pa //
translated: Those who revile my teaching

original: ngur smrig gos dag gyon byed cing //
analyzed: ngur smrig gos dag gyon byed cing //
translated: Will wear saffron robes

original: 'bras bu yod dang med smra ba //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod dang med smra ba //
translated: And will speak of existence and nonexistence.

original: ma 'ongs dus na 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dir pha rol po dag na re 'bras bu yod pa @177a * //
analyzed: ma 'ongs dus na 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // 'dir pha rol po dag na re 'bras bu yod pa @177a * //
translated: They will appear in the future.🔽Here, the opponent says that if one says that an existent or nonexistent effect does not arise, this contradicts what is commonly perceived.

original: dang med pa skye ba med do zhes brjod na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: dang med pa skye ba med do zhes brjod na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In order to respond to this, the author of the commentary here says,

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bya ba byed pa la sogs pa dag tha snyad bas khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / don dam par rgyus 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa byed pa bsal ba'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bya ba byed pa la sogs pa dag tha snyad bas khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / don dam par rgyus 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa byed pa bsal ba'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Like an illusory person, it is not to be said that it exists or does not exist, and so on, because it performs functions.

original: bden pa gnyi gar mi 'gal bas skyon med do //🔽thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bden pa gnyi gar mi 'gal bas skyon med do // thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Since it is not contradictory in either truth, there is no fault.🔽The statement “because nothing arises” is a flawed statement here, because the effect exists prior to the cause,🔽because something arises. Since the reason is not established, there is no example even conventionally.

original: 'ga' zhig 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes nye bar sbyor bsam gtan tshigs mngon pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang dpe med do zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis sngar grangs can dag gi thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes nye bar sbyor bsam gtan tshigs mngon pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang dpe med do zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis sngar grangs can dag gi thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa
translated: The author of the commentary himself previously stated that because nothing arises for the Sāṃkhya, the effect exists prior to the cause,

original: kho na yin no zhes gzhung gzugs pa de glags yod pa'i tshig yin pas mi rung bar sun dbyung ba yin te /
analyzed: kho na yin no zhes gzhung gzugs pa de glags yod pa'i tshig yin pas mi rung bar sun dbyung ba yin te /
translated: But that is not correct, because it is a statement that can be refuted, since it is a statement that can be turned around.

original: de ci ltar glags yod pa'i tshig yin zhe na /🔽grangs can dag gi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin te /🔽thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de las bzlog na rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ci ltar glags yod pa'i tshig yin zhe na / grangs can dag gi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin te / thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de las bzlog na rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: How is it a statement that can be turned around?🔽Sāṃkhyas say that the effect exists prior to the cause alone because everything is unarisen.🔽If that is reversed, it must be applied as follows: The effect exists prior to the cause alone because something arises.

original: 'ga' zhig 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bya dgos pas de ltar thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba las bzlog na 'ga' zhig 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de gtan tshigs yin par mngon no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bya dgos pas de ltar thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba las bzlog na 'ga' zhig 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de gtan tshigs yin par mngon no //
translated: Thus it is clear that if the statement “because everything is unarisen” is reversed, the statement “because something arises” is the reason.

original: de ltar mngon na skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar mngon na skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is clear, what is the fault?

original: de'i phyir don dam par rgyu'i 'bras bu yod pa dang gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba lta phar zhog gi re zhig tha snyad du yang de la dpe med pa nyid kyi skyon du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par rgyu'i 'bras bu yod pa dang gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba lta phar zhog gi re zhig tha snyad du yang de la dpe med pa nyid kyi skyon du yang 'gyur te /
translated: Even conventionally, the fault that there is no example would apply to you.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: This is because the effect exists prior to the cause alone,

original: 'ga' zhig 'byung ba'i phyir dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dir pha rol po dag na re de ltar kho bo cag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba'i gtan tshigs thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir mi rung na khyed rgyu la 'bras bu snga
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'byung ba'i phyir dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir ro // 'dir pha rol po dag na re de ltar kho bo cag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba'i gtan tshigs thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir mi rung na khyed rgyu la 'bras bu snga
translated: because there is no example that can be stated, “It is like so and so.”🔽Here, the opponent says: “If you say, ‘The reason that we state that the effect exists prior to the cause is not correct because it does not occur,’ that is a statement that is open to challenge.

original: na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la yang de mi rung ba'i skyon yod pa yin te /
analyzed: na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la yang de mi rung ba'i skyon yod pa yin te /
translated: But the fault that is not correct also applies to your thesis that the effect does not exist prior to the cause.

original: med pa la 'ga' yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma @177b khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: med pa la 'ga' yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma @177b khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary here says:

original: dam bcas pa la skyon yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa la skyon yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Our thesis is not flawed,

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because there is no entailment.🔽We have already explained that there is no fault because we have eliminated the ultimate existence and nonexistence of effects produced by causes.

original: kho bos sngar don dam par rgyus 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa byed pa bsal ba'i phyir skyon med do zhes bshad zin pas de la don dam par rgyus 'bras bu snga na yod pa bsal bar byed do zhes bya bar rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe khyod
analyzed: kho bos sngar don dam par rgyus 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa byed pa bsal ba'i phyir skyon med do zhes bshad zin pas de la don dam par rgyus 'bras bu snga na yod pa bsal bar byed do zhes bya bar rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe khyod
translated: Therefore, since there is no example that would entail the statement “we eliminate the ultimate existence of effects prior to their production by causes,”

original: la med pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi dam bcas pa la skyon med do //
analyzed: la med pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi dam bcas pa la skyon med do //
translated: our thesis is not flawed.

original: 'dis rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan dag kyang btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs mi 'thad par bsal ba 'dis rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba🔽dang / nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / rgyu yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan kyang ci rigs par btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan dag kyang btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs mi 'thad par bsal ba 'dis rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / nus pas nus pa can byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / rgyu yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan kyang ci rigs par btab pa yin no //
translated: This also refutes the responses to the reasonings such as “because it takes on causes.”🔽This refutation of the reason “because all things exist” also refutes the reasons “because it takes on causes,” “because the powerful creates the powerless,” and “because causes exist,” as appropriate.

original: mar me bum pa dmigs par bya ba'i phyir len pa de la yang de'i bsal ba dmigs su med pas rang gi gtan tshigs rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: mar me bum pa dmigs par bya ba'i phyir len pa de la yang de'i bsal ba dmigs su med pas rang gi gtan tshigs rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Also, the response to the response to the reason “because the light of a butterlamp illuminates itself and others” is as follows: “The light of a butterlamp illuminates itself and others because it is light, like the light of a gem.”

original: sngar grangs can dag gi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: sngar grangs can dag gi rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung gzugs pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du ston te /
translated: Previously, it was shown that the reason stated by the Enumerators, “because the effect is obtained,” is not established.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na mar me bum pa mun khrod na 'dug pa dmigs par bya ba'i rgyur lan kyang /
analyzed: dper na mar me bum pa mun khrod na 'dug pa dmigs par bya ba'i rgyur lan kyang /
translated: For example, although a lamp is the cause of the observation of a pot in a dark place,

original: mar me de la bum pa de'i bsal ba dmigs pa snga na med pas /🔽des na ci re zhig bum pa dmigs par bya ba'i rgyu mar me len pa de la bum pa'i bsal ba dmigs pa snga na med pa bzhin du rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: mar me de la bum pa de'i bsal ba dmigs pa snga na med pas / des na ci re zhig bum pa dmigs par bya ba'i rgyu mar me len pa de la bum pa'i bsal ba dmigs pa snga na med pa bzhin du rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med par 'gyur ram /
translated: the observation of the clearing of the pot does not exist prior to the lamp.🔽Therefore, just as the lamp is the cause of the observation of the pot, and the observation of the clearing of the pot does not exist prior to it, would the effect not exist prior to the cause?

original: 'on te bum pa dmigs par bya ba'i rgyur 'jim pa len pa de la bum pa'i bsal ba dmigs pa yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pas /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa dmigs par bya ba'i rgyur 'jim pa len pa de la bum pa'i bsal ba dmigs pa yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pas /
translated: Or, just as clay is the cause of the observation of the pot, the observation of the clearing of the pot exists prior to it.

original: de'i phyir grangs can dag rang gis gtan tshigs rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dam nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //🔽grangs can dag las gang dag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa ma yin mong kyi cha phra ba'i phyir ram /🔽zin gyis non pa'i phyir mi dmigs so zhes zer ba de dag la yang rags pa nyid dang / zil gyis ma non pa nyid snga na med pa las phyis yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa ma yin pas phyogs snga ma la gnod de zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir grangs can dag rang gis gtan tshigs rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dam nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo // grangs can dag las gang dag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa ma yin mong kyi cha phra ba'i phyir ram / zin gyis non pa'i phyir mi dmigs so zhes zer ba de dag la yang rags pa nyid dang / zil gyis ma non pa nyid snga na med pa las phyis yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa ma yin pas phyogs snga ma la gnod de zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Therefore, it is not correct for the Sāṃkhyas to say, “Because we accept the reason, the effect, it is certain.”🔽Some Sāṃkhyas say, “The effect does not exist prior to the cause, but it is not perceived because it is subtle or because it is overwhelmed by the cause.”🔽But since coarseness and non-overwhelmedness exist after the nonexistence of the effect prior to the cause, the former position is undermined.

original: grangs can dag na re rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa yin mod kyi 'bras bu cha phra ba'i phyir dper na du ba dang rdul dang / khug rna la sogs @178a * //
analyzed: grangs can dag na re rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa yin mod kyi 'bras bu cha phra ba'i phyir dper na du ba dang rdul dang / khug rna la sogs @178a * //
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say, “The effect does exist prior to the cause, but it is not perceived because the effect is subtle, like smoke, dust, and mist, etc.,

original: pa bar snang la yin pa de na yod kyang cha phra ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu zil gyis non pa'i phyir dper na skar ma dang zla ba'i 'od la sogs pa nyi mas zil gyis non pa de na yod kyang zil gyis non pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag la yang cha phra ba dang zil gyis
analyzed: pa bar snang la yin pa de na yod kyang cha phra ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu zil gyis non pa'i phyir dper na skar ma dang zla ba'i 'od la sogs pa nyi mas zil gyis non pa de na yod kyang zil gyis non pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag la yang cha phra ba dang zil gyis
translated: and because it is subtle, it is not observed, just as the light of the sun outshines the light of the stars and moon, and though it exists, it is not observed because it is outshone.

original: non pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: non pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: But when it is subtle and outshone,🔽it is not coarse and not outshone, because it becomes coarse and not outshone later, after it was not previously.

original: rags pa nyid dang zil gyis ma non ba nyid snga na med pa las phyis yod par gyur pa'i phyir 'bras bu rags pa nyid dang / zil gyis ma non pa nyid snga na yod pa ma yin pas des na grangs can dag gis phyogs snga ma las rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod do zhes dam bcas pa la gnod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rags pa nyid dang zil gyis ma non ba nyid snga na med pa las phyis yod par gyur pa'i phyir 'bras bu rags pa nyid dang / zil gyis ma non pa nyid snga na yod pa ma yin pas des na grangs can dag gis phyogs snga ma las rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod do zhes dam bcas pa la gnod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, since the effect does not exist prior to the cause, the Samkhya assertion that the effect exists prior to the cause is invalidated and unacceptable.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa yin mod kyi me dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs ni grangs can dag gi gzhung las /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa yin mod kyi me dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs ni grangs can dag gi gzhung las /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say: Although the effect exists prior to the cause, the reason for not observing it is stated in their scriptures:🔽Because it is too distant, too close,

original: ha cang ring phyir nye phyir dang // dbang po nyams phyir yid med phyir //
analyzed: ha cang ring phyir nye phyir dang // dbang po nyams phyir yid med phyir //
translated: because the sense organ is damaged, because there is no mind,🔽because it is subtle, because it is obscured,

original: cha phra phyir dang bsgribs phyir dang // zil gnon phyir dang 'dres phyir ro //🔽zhes 'byung zhes kyang grag go //
analyzed: cha phra phyir dang bsgribs phyir dang // zil gnon phyir dang 'dres phyir ro // zhes 'byung zhes kyang grag go //
translated: because it is overwhelmed, and because it is mixed.🔽They say that what is conceived to be subtle exists as gross.

original: cha phra ba yod par bsams pa gang yin pa de rags par mthong ngo zhes zer ba dag gi dam bcas pa la yang rags pa nyid du yod par rjes su dpog pas cha phra bar yod pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos kyi ngo bo nyid las log
analyzed: cha phra ba yod par bsams pa gang yin pa de rags par mthong ngo zhes zer ba dag gi dam bcas pa la yang rags pa nyid du yod par rjes su dpog pas cha phra bar yod pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos kyi ngo bo nyid las log
translated: Since the Sāṃkhyas’ thesis is also inferred to exist as gross, the existence of subtlety is refuted. Therefore, they say that the error of deviating from the nature of phenomena exists.

original: pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag na re 'bras bu rgyu'i gnas skabs na cha phra ba nyid du yod pa gang yin pa de phyis 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su /
analyzed: pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag na re 'bras bu rgyu'i gnas skabs na cha phra ba nyid du yod pa gang yin pa de phyis 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say: That which exists as subtle in the state of the cause exists as gross in the state of the effect.

original: rags pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rags pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Later, that which is seen as gross in the state of the effect

original: cha phra phyir ni de mi dmigs //
analyzed: cha phra phyir ni de mi dmigs //
translated: Because it is subtle, it is not perceived.

original: med phyir ma yin 'bras las dmigs //🔽zhes zer ba de dag gi dam bcas pa de la yang phyis 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su rags pa nyid du yod par rjes su dpog pas rgyu'i gnas skabs na cha phra ba nyid du yod par 'dod pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir rgyu'i gnas skabs na 'bras bu'i
analyzed: med phyir ma yin 'bras las dmigs // zhes zer ba de dag gi dam bcas pa de la yang phyis 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su rags pa nyid du yod par rjes su dpog pas rgyu'i gnas skabs na cha phra ba nyid du yod par 'dod pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir rgyu'i gnas skabs na 'bras bu'i
translated: It is not that it does not exist, but it is perceived from the effect.🔽The response to that is that the assertion of the opponent is also refuted by the inference that the coarse state exists at the time of the effect.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid cha phra ba nyid du yod par 'dod pa las log pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid cha phra ba nyid du yod par 'dod pa las log pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to assert that the subtle state exists at the time of the cause because the error of the opposite of that would occur.

original: de yang 'di ltar rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar rjes su dpag ste /
translated: This is inferred as follows.🔽For example, just as the effect exists at the time of the effect in the state of being coarse, it does not exist in the state of being subtle because it exists.

original: dper na 'bras bu 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na rags pa nyid du yod pa de yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir cha phra ba nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu rgyu'i gnas skabs na cha phra ba nyid du yod pa de yang yod
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na rags pa nyid du yod pa de yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir cha phra ba nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu rgyu'i gnas skabs na cha phra ba nyid du yod pa de yang yod
translated: In the same way, the effect that exists at the time of the cause in the state of being subtle also exists.

original: pa nyid yin pa'i phyir cha phra ba nyid du yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: pa nyid yin pa'i phyir cha phra ba nyid du yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Because it is not subtle, it does not exist.

original: des na rgyu la 'bras bu cha phra ba nyid du yod par bsams pa gang yin pa de yod par ma grub po //🔽bye brag tu smra ba dag gi dam bcas pa'i phyogs @178b la yang yod pa gang yin pa de ni da ltar yin pas da ltar nyid yod par rjes su dpog pas 'bras bu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi khyad par bsal ba'i phyir chos can
analyzed: des na rgyu la 'bras bu cha phra ba nyid du yod par bsams pa gang yin pa de yod par ma grub po // bye brag tu smra ba dag gi dam bcas pa'i phyogs @178b la yang yod pa gang yin pa de ni da ltar yin pas da ltar nyid yod par rjes su dpog pas 'bras bu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi khyad par bsal ba'i phyir chos can
translated: Therefore, the cause does not exist as the subtle aspect of the effect.🔽The fault of specifying the subject is that the present exists in the position of the thesis of the Vaibhasikas, and since the present is inferred to exist, the distinction of the effect as past or future is eliminated.🔽The fault of specifying the subject is that the present exists in the position of the thesis of the Vaibhasikas, and since the present is inferred to exist, the distinction of the effect as past or future is eliminated.

original: gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus gnyis kyang da ltar bzhin du yod par dam bcas pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa gang yin pa de ni da ltar
analyzed: gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus gnyis kyang da ltar bzhin du yod par dam bcas pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa gang yin pa de ni da ltar
translated: The Sautrantikas say: The past and future exist as the present.

original: nyid yin pas des 'bras bu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhig nas med pa dang / snga na med pa de gnyis da ltar bzhin du yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i khyad par bsal ba'i phyir de gnyis da ltar nyid bzhin du yod par dam bcas pa'i chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: nyid yin pas des 'bras bu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhig nas med pa dang / snga na med pa de gnyis da ltar bzhin du yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i khyad par bsal ba'i phyir de gnyis da ltar nyid bzhin du yod par dam bcas pa'i chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, since the past and future are not established as existing in the way the present exists, it is illogical to say that the past and future exist in the way the present exists.

original: des na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis da ltar bzhin du yod par ma grub po //🔽gang dag rgyu ni 'bras bu byed pa nyid ma yin gyi 'di ltar bsal bar byed do zhes zer ba de dag la yang 'di skad ces gang gis ci zhig bzhin du bsal bar byed ces brgal zhing brtag pa'o zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag las gang
analyzed: des na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis da ltar bzhin du yod par ma grub po // gang dag rgyu ni 'bras bu byed pa nyid ma yin gyi 'di ltar bsal bar byed do zhes zer ba de dag la yang 'di skad ces gang gis ci zhig bzhin du bsal bar byed ces brgal zhing brtag pa'o zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag las gang
translated: Therefore, the past and future are not established as existing in the way the present exists.🔽Those who say that the cause does not produce the effect but rather reveals it should be asked, “What reveals what in what way?”

original: dag rgyu ni 'bras bu sdon ma byung ba byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dag rgyu ni 'bras bu sdon ma byung ba byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Some say: The cause does not produce the effect that did not previously exist.

original: 'bras bu rgyu la nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa bsal bar byed pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag la rgyus 'bras bu bsal bar byed pa de rkyen gang gi dngos po ci zhig bsal bar byed pa bzhin du bsal bar byed ces brgal zhing
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu la nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa bsal bar byed pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag la rgyus 'bras bu bsal bar byed pa de rkyen gang gi dngos po ci zhig bsal bar byed pa bzhin du bsal bar byed ces brgal zhing
translated: and the effect is already present in the cause in the manner of a potency, it is removed.

original: brtag pa ston to //
analyzed: brtag pa ston to //
translated: This is the argument and investigation that is taught.

original: gal te mar mes bum pa yod par gyur ba bsal bar byed pa bzhin du'o zhe na zhes bya bas ni gal te de skad ces zer na'o //
analyzed: gal te mar mes bum pa yod par gyur ba bsal bar byed pa bzhin du'o zhe na zhes bya bas ni gal te de skad ces zer na'o //
translated: If you say, “Just as a lamp removes the existence of a pot,”

original: phyogs de'i lan ni skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par don dam par mar me ni bum pa bsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs de'i lan ni skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par don dam par mar me ni bum pa bsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: then the reply to that position is that ultimately a lamp does not remove a pot,🔽because it is not tenable that a lamp and a pot are simultaneous.

original: mig gi yul yin pa'i phyir dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dang / reg pa yin pa'i phyir dang brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs dag gi phyir dper na bong ba bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa dag gis lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni /🔽sngar rkyen brtag pa'i skabs ltag 'og dag tu rjes su dpag pa dag gis de skad bstan zin to /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu gsum pa /🔽grangs can dag las gang dag mkhas par rlom pa dag 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: mig gi yul yin pa'i phyir dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dang / reg pa yin pa'i phyir dang brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs dag gi phyir dper na bong ba bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa dag gis lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni / sngar rkyen brtag pa'i skabs ltag 'og dag tu rjes su dpag pa dag gis de skad bstan zin to / // / bam po bzhi bcu gsum pa / grangs can dag las gang dag mkhas par rlom pa dag 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: Because it is the object of the eye, because it is obstructive, because it is physical, because it is tangible, because it is expressible, and so on.🔽🔽We have already responded to this with inferences such as, “It is like a donkey.”🔽🔽This is explained in the earlier chapter on conditions.🔽🔽Some who are proud of their knowledge among the Samkhyas say this:🔽🔽

original: 'bras bu ma skyes pa dang zhig pa dag kyang nus pa'i bdag nyid du yod pas de'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes @179a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes pa dang zhig pa dag kyang nus pa'i bdag nyid du yod pas de'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes @179a * //
translated: and because it is the object of the eye sense faculty, because it is obstructed, because it is physical, because it is tangible, because it is expressible, and so on.

original: bya'i / gsal ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs can dag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung 'dzugs pa'i skabs ston te /
analyzed: bya'i / gsal ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs can dag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod par gzhung 'dzugs pa'i skabs ston te /
translated: The passage beginning “But it does not exist in the nature of the manifest” teaches the context of the Sāṃkhya’s assertion that the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: 'dir de dag na re 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ma skyes pa dang 'das pa zhig pa dag kyang nus pa'i bdag nyid du yod pas de'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir de dag na re 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ma skyes pa dang 'das pa zhig pa dag kyang nus pa'i bdag nyid du yod pas de'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya'i /
translated: Here they say, “The future effect that has not yet arisen and the past effect that has already ceased exist in the nature of potency. Therefore it is called the effect that exists prior to the cause.

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But it does not exist in the nature of the manifest.”

original: rgyus 'bras bu byed do zhes bya ba yang byed do zhes bya ba la don du ma yod pa'i phyir sgra de'i don ni rgyu 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba yin par rnam par bshad do zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag na re rgyus 'bras
analyzed: rgyus 'bras bu byed do zhes bya ba yang byed do zhes bya ba la don du ma yod pa'i phyir sgra de'i don ni rgyu 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba yin par rnam par bshad do zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag na re rgyus 'bras
translated: The passage beginning “The statement ‘The cause produces the effect’ is explained as follows” teaches the Sāṃkhya’s assertion that the cause becomes the nature of the effect.

original: bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba yang byed do zhes bya ba'i sgra ni med pa gdong byed pa dang / yod pa yang khyad par du byed pa dang / rgyu'i dngos po de nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nyid spangs nas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du gzhan du 'gyur bar byed pa la sogs pa don du ma dag la 'jug ste /
analyzed: bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba yang byed do zhes bya ba'i sgra ni med pa gdong byed pa dang / yod pa yang khyad par du byed pa dang / rgyu'i dngos po de nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nyid spangs nas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du gzhan du 'gyur bar byed pa la sogs pa don du ma dag la 'jug ste /
translated: The word “produces” is used in the sense of making what does not exist face to face, in the sense of distinguishing what does exist, in the sense of causing that which is a cause to abandon its own nature and transform into another nature, the nature of the effect, and so on, in the sense of many meanings.

original: skabs 'dir ni rgyu'i dngos po de nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nyid spangs nas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du gzhan du 'gyur bar byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni rgyu'i dngos po de nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nyid spangs nas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du gzhan du 'gyur bar byed pa yin pas /
translated: In this context, the word “produces” is used in the sense of causing that which is a cause to abandon its own nature and transform into another nature, the nature of the effect.

original: sgra de'i don ni rgyu 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba yin par rnam par bshad do zhes zer ro //🔽ci ste 'bras bu ma skyes pa dang / zhig pa dag yod par ci ltar shes par bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gis /
analyzed: sgra de'i don ni rgyu 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba yin par rnam par bshad do zhes zer ro // ci ste 'bras bu ma skyes pa dang / zhig pa dag yod par ci ltar shes par bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gis /
translated: Therefore the meaning of the word “produces” is explained as “the cause transforms into the nature of the effect.”

original: sangs rgyas pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: If you ask, “How do you know that a nonarisen and disintegrated effect exists?” this is a statement anticipating the qualms of the Buddhist.

original: ci ste khyed sangs rgyas pa dag na re 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ma skyes pa dang 'das pa zhig pa dag yod par ci ltar shes par bya zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: ci ste khyed sangs rgyas pa dag na re 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ma skyes pa dang 'das pa zhig pa dag yod par ci ltar shes par bya zhes zer na'o //
translated: But if you Buddhists say, “How do we know that future results and past cessations exist?”

original: de'i lan du kho bo cag gis kyang tshig tsam gyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag yod par mi 'grub kyi tshad mas bsgrub dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i lan du kho bo cag gis kyang tshig tsam gyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag yod par mi 'grub kyi tshad mas bsgrub dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: We reply, “We do not establish the existence of past and future states by mere words, but by valid cognition. Therefore,

original: 'bras bu snga na med pa dang bzhig nas med pa dag ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu snga na med pa dang bzhig nas med pa dag ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: we know that results that have not yet arisen and those that have ceased exist because they are included in time.”

original: dper na da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To demonstrate this, we say, “For example, it is like the present result.”

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na da ltar gyi 'bras bu ni da ltar gyi dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / da ltar gyi zhes bstan pa'i phyir yod pa kho nar shes par bya ba de bzhin du 'bras bu snga na med pa ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba dang zhig nas med pa 'das pa zhes bya ba dag kyang 'das pa'i dus kyis bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi 'bras bu ni da ltar gyi dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / da ltar gyi zhes bstan pa'i phyir yod pa kho nar shes par bya ba de bzhin du 'bras bu snga na med pa ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba dang zhig nas med pa 'das pa zhes bya ba dag kyang 'das pa'i dus kyis bsdus pa dang /
translated: For example, because the present effect is included in the present time and because it is indicated as present, it is known to exist.🔽In the same way, because the future effect that does not exist prior to it is included in the future time and because it is indicated as future, it is known to exist.

original: @179b ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa'i zhes bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir yod pa kho nar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: @179b ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa'i zhes bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir yod pa kho nar shes par bya'o //
translated: And because the past effect that does not exist after disintegration is included in the past time and because it is indicated as past, it is known to exist.

original: gal te 'bras bu skyes pa'i dus na rgyu ci ltar ma zhig can zhes bya ba yang grangs can dag gis /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu skyes pa'i dus na rgyu ci ltar ma zhig can zhes bya ba yang grangs can dag gis /
translated: If the Sāṃkhya says, “When the effect has arisen, how could the cause disintegrate?”

original: sangs rgyas pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: this is a statement anticipating the doubts of the Buddhist.
