original: kho bo cag gi rgyu 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur pa yin par rnam par bshad pa de la gal te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi rgyu 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur pa yin par rnam par bshad pa de la gal te /
translated: In our explanation, the cause becomes the entity of the effect.

original: khyed sangs rgyas pa dag na re 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ci ltar ma zhig par yod ces zer na'o //
analyzed: khyed sangs rgyas pa dag na re 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ci ltar ma zhig par yod ces zer na'o //
translated: You Buddhists say, “When the effect is produced, how could the cause exist without disintegrating?”

original: de'i lan du kho bo cag gis kyang tshig tsam gyis de mi 'grub kyi tshad mas bsgrub dgos pas de'i phyir rgyu ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan du kho bo cag gis kyang tshig tsam gyis de mi 'grub kyi tshad mas bsgrub dgos pas de'i phyir rgyu ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te /
translated: In response to that, we also say, “That is not established by mere words; it must be established by valid knowledge. Therefore the cause exists without disintegrating at the time the effect is produced.

original: nges par skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nges par skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it definitely arises, like the nature of the effect itself.”

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example are to be applied in order.🔽For example, the nature of the effect is definitely, without a doubt, produced from the cause, and therefore at the time the effect is produced, the effect itself exists without disintegrating.

original: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ni rgyu las nges par gdon mi za ba kho nar skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu nyid skye ba'i dus na 'bras bu nyid ma zhig pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du rgyu'i bdag nyid kyang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du nges
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ni rgyu las nges par gdon mi za ba kho nar skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu nyid skye ba'i dus na 'bras bu nyid ma zhig pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du rgyu'i bdag nyid kyang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du nges
translated: In the same way, the nature of the cause is definitely, without a doubt, produced from the cause.

original: par gdon mi za ba kho nar skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: par gdon mi za ba kho nar skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because the effect is definitely generated, the cause definitely does not disintegrate at the time the effect is generated.🔽Similarly, it should be understood through such reasons as “because it is the cause of cognition that is correct, incorrect, and doubtful,” “because it is the object of another,” and “because cognition does not exist.”

original: de bzhin du shes pa la log pa dang ma log pa dang the tshom can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag na re 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa kho na yin pa'i gtan tshigs nges par skye
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa la log pa dang ma log pa dang the tshom can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag na re 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa kho na yin pa'i gtan tshigs nges par skye
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say that the reason the cause definitely does not disintegrate at the time the effect is generated is because the effect definitely arises.

original: ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar bzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar bzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The term “because” is used in the sense of a defining characteristic, so it is merely an illustration.

original: de bzhin du rgyu ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te /
translated: Similarly, the cause definitely does not disintegrate at the time the effect is generated.

original: shes pa log pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang shes pa ma log pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa the tshom can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro /
analyzed: shes pa log pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang shes pa ma log pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa the tshom can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro /
translated: Because it is the cause of the cessation of consciousness, because it is the cause of the noncessation of consciousness, because it is the cause of consciousness that is uncertain, because it is the purpose of others, and because consciousness does not exist, it is like the nature of the effect.

original: yang na rgyu 'o ma zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma las 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu 'o ma zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma las 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Or, the moment of the effect called “curds” is not different from the moment of the cause called “milk.”

original: ba las byung ba'i phyir dper na zho'i bdag nyid bzhin zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag rgyu las @180a * //
analyzed: ba las byung ba'i phyir dper na zho'i bdag nyid bzhin zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag rgyu las @180a * //
translated: Because it arises from milk, it is like the nature of curds.

original: 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshad ma yin te /
translated: This is the valid cognition that proves that the effect is not different from the cause, according to the Sāṃkhyas.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na 'bras bu zho'i bdag nyid ni pa las byung ba'i phyir zho'i bdag nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu 'o ma zhes bya'i skad cig ma yang pa las byung ba'i phyir de las 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma gzhan🔽nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu zho'i bdag nyid ni pa las byung ba'i phyir zho'i bdag nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu 'o ma zhes bya'i skad cig ma yang pa las byung ba'i phyir de las 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, because the present moment called milk arises from milk, the subsequent moment called yogurt is not different from it.

original: yang na 'das pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma las da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'das pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma las da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Or, the present moment of eye consciousness is not different from the past moment of eye consciousness,🔽because it is eye consciousness, like the present moment of eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sngar 'o ma dang zho phyogs su byas pas phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin par bsgrubs🔽pa brnan pa'i phyir 'dir 'das pa dang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sngar 'o ma dang zho phyogs su byas pas phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin par bsgrubs🔽pa brnan pa'i phyir 'dir 'das pa dang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa phyogs su byas te /
translated: Since the past and present moments of eye consciousness are not different, the present moment of eye consciousness is not different from the future moment of eye consciousness.🔽Since the future moment of eye consciousness is not different from the present moment of eye consciousness, the future moment of eye consciousness is not different from the past moment of eye consciousness.

original: nang gi dngos po'i rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i tshad ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po'i rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i tshad ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the demonstration of the valid cognition that proves that the effect is not different from the cause of an internal thing.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: gal te rgyu tha dad pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gis /
analyzed: gal te rgyu tha dad pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gis /
translated: If you say that it is not ascertained because of the eye consciousness and so on that have different causes,

original: sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: this is a statement anticipating the qualm of the Saṃkhyas.

original: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag na re ci re zhig mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha mi dad pa'i 'das pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma las da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan🔽nyid ma yin par lta bur 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag na re ci re zhig mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha mi dad pa'i 'das pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma las da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan🔽nyid ma yin par lta bur 'gyur ram /
translated: If you Saṃkhyas say, “In what way is the present moment of eye consciousness not different from the past moment of eye consciousness that is not of a different continuum because it is an eye consciousness?

original: 'on te mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i 'das pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma las da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid yin pa lta bur 'gyur ba ma nges pas /
analyzed: 'on te mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i 'das pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma las da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid yin pa lta bur 'gyur ba ma nges pas /
translated: Or, because it is eye consciousness, it is not definite that it is different from the past moment of eye consciousness of a different continuum, as is the case with the present moment of eye consciousness.

original: des na grangs can dag gi gtan tshigs mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma nges pa nyid do zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: des na grangs can dag gi gtan tshigs mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma nges pa nyid do zhes zer na'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason, because it is eye consciousness, is indefinite.

original: de skad ces zer na de'i lan du kho bo cag grangs can dag kyang 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de skad ces zer na de'i lan du kho bo cag grangs can dag kyang 'di skad ces /
translated: If that is said, then in response to that, we would say to the Enumerators:

original: de dag kyang phyogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag kyang phyogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since they are included within the position, there is no fault.

original: rgyud tha dad pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de dag kyang kho bo cag gi phyogs gzhan nyi ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi gtan @180b tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de dag kyang kho bo cag gi phyogs gzhan nyi ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi gtan @180b tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med
translated: And the eye consciousness and so on of different continua are included in our position, which is called the sun, therefore we do not commit the fallacy of our reason being indeterminate.

original: do / 'di ltar snying stobs dang rngul dang mun pa dag ni brtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i phyir thams cad kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pas rgyud tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: do / 'di ltar snying stobs dang rngul dang mun pa dag ni brtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i phyir thams cad kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pas rgyud tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sattva, rajas and tamas are imputed and omnipresent, everything is the nature of everything, and therefore there are no different continua.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'di man chad 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis phyogs snga ma'i gzhung sun 'byin bston te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'di man chad 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis phyogs snga ma'i gzhung sun 'byin bston te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary below teaches the refutation of the opponent’s position.

original: de la re zhig sngar grangs can dag gis rgyu ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig sngar grangs can dag gis rgyu ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te /
translated: First, the Sāṃkhyas say that the cause definitely does not disintegrate at the time the effect arises.

original: des par skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de sun dbyung ba'i phyir 'dir yang 'das pa'i rgyu phyogs su byed na ni gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des par skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de sun dbyung ba'i phyir 'dir yang 'das pa'i rgyu phyogs su byed na ni gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But if you take the past cause as the subject of the statement, then the error of the unestablished basis of the reason would ensue.

original: 'di na 'bras bu skyes pas rgyu zhes tha snyad gdags pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di na 'bras bu skyes pas rgyu zhes tha snyad gdags pa yin la /
translated: Here, the cause is designated as such because the effect arises.

original: 'bras bu skyes pa de'i tshe na rgyu 'das pa yin pas 'das pa'i rgyus te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa de'i tshe na rgyu 'das pa yin pas 'das pa'i rgyus te /
translated: When the effect arises, the cause has already ceased.

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te zhes phyogs su byed na ni gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon yod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te zhes phyogs su byed na ni gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon yod de /
translated: If you take the past cause as the subject of the statement, then the error of the unestablished basis of the reason would ensue.

original: rgyu 'das pa de ni zhig nas med pa yin pas khyod kyis de ma zhig par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs nges par skye ba'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de'i ma grub pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu 'das pa de ni zhig nas med pa yin pas khyod kyis de ma zhig par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs nges par skye ba'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de'i ma grub pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the past cause has already ceased and does not exist, it is not tenable to state the reason “because it definitely arises” in order to prove that it has not ceased.

original: da ltar gyi rgyu phyogs su byed na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: da ltar gyi rgyu phyogs su byed na ni dpe med de /
translated: If you take the present cause as the subject, the example is not established.

original: de'i 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ste 'bras bu ma skyes ba'i tshe na rgyu ma 'das pa da ltar yod pa de 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te zhes phyogs su byed na ni dpe ma🔽grub pa'i skyon yod de /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ste 'bras bu ma skyes ba'i tshe na rgyu ma 'das pa da ltar yod pa de 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te zhes phyogs su byed na ni dpe ma grub pa'i skyon yod de /
translated: If you take the present cause that has not ceased at the time when the effect has not yet arisen as the subject, and then say, “It is not the case that it ceases at the time when the effect arises,” the error arises that the example is not established.🔽The error arises that the example is not established because at the time when the present cause exists, its effect is not yet established.

original: da ltar gyi rgyu de yod pa'i dus na de'i 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi de ma zhig par bsgrub pa'i dpe 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de ma grub pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: da ltar gyi rgyu de yod pa'i dus na de'i 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi de ma zhig par bsgrub pa'i dpe 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de ma grub pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: The example that you cite to prove that it does not cease, “like the nature of the effect,” is not established.

original: 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa gang yin pa de yang de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa gang yin pa de yang de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: That which is not a different effect is not its cause.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la rgyu rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya🔽bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis /🔽yang na rgyu 'o ma zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma las 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la rgyu rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis / yang na rgyu 'o ma zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma las 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not different, it is like its own nature. Therefore, the fault of refuting the nature of the subject exists, because the thesis that it is not different is inferred and the reason that it is not different is refuted by the reason that it is not a cause.🔽The Sāṃkhyas previously said, “The effect, such as milk, is not different from the cause, such as the moment of milk, because it arises from it, like the nature of milk itself.”

original: ba las byung ba'i phyir dper na zho'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ba las byung ba'i phyir dper na zho'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: Or, the moment of the effect, such as yogurt, is not different from the moment of the cause, such as milk, because it arises from it, like the nature of yogurt itself.

original: yan na 'das pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma las da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin @181a * //
analyzed: yan na 'das pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma las da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin @181a * //
translated: Or, the moment of the present eye consciousness is not different from the moment of the past eye consciousness, because it arises from it, like the nature of the present eye consciousness itself.

original: te / mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de sun 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: te / mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de sun 'byin par byed de /
translated: You say, “Because it is eye consciousness, it is like the present moment of eye consciousness.”🔽But that refutes your own position, because you assert that the effect is not different from the cause.

original: khyed rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin par 'dod pa des na sa bon de yang myu gu de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin par 'dod pa des na sa bon de yang myu gu de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore that seed is not the cause of that sprout, because it is not different from it.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i dper na myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du 'gyur bas /🔽des na khyed rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa nyid rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan ma yin par gyur pas /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i dper na myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du 'gyur bas / des na khyed rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa nyid rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan ma yin par gyur pas /
translated: For example, it would be like the self of the sprout.🔽Therefore, because you assert that the effect is not different from the cause, your thesis that the effect is not different from the cause is undermined.

original: rgyu gang yin pa de 'bras bu'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid bsal ba'i phyir gzhan nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos can rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pa de 'bras bu'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid bsal ba'i phyir gzhan nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos can rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Because the cause is not the cause of the effect, the property of the subject, “the cause is not different from the effect,” is undermined.

original: ma zhig pa zhes bya ba'i don kyang gang yin zhes bya ba ni khyed grangs can dag gi rgyu ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te zhes gang smras pa de'i don kyang gang yin zhes dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ma zhig pa zhes bya ba'i don kyang gang yin zhes bya ba ni khyed grangs can dag gi rgyu ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na ma zhig pa kho na yin te zhes gang smras pa de'i don kyang gang yin zhes dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a question asking, “What is the meaning of the statement by you Enumerators that the cause is only not disintegrated at the time of the arising of the effect?”🔽If you say that it is naturally dormant, then there is no example

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis bag la zha pa'o zhe na ni dpe med do zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag na re /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis bag la zha pa'o zhe na ni dpe med do zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag na re /
translated: If you Enumerators say,

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dus na rgyu de snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa zhes bya ba'i yon tan cha mnyam pa'i rang bzhin gyis bag la zha zhing 'dug gi med par gyur pa ma yin pas ma
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dus na rgyu de snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa zhes bya ba'i yon tan cha mnyam pa'i rang bzhin gyis bag la zha zhing 'dug gi med par gyur pa ma yin pas ma
translated: “The cause is not disintegrated at the time of the arising of the effect,” then at that time the cause is dormant, existing with the nature of the qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas in a state of equilibrium.

original: zhig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not nonexistent.🔽Therefore it is not disintegrated.

original: da lta na rgyu de 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rang bzhin gyis bag la zha zhing 'dug gi zhig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da lta na rgyu de 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rang bzhin gyis bag la zha zhing 'dug gi zhig pa ma yin te /
translated: At the time of the arising of the effect, the cause is naturally dormant, not disintegrated.

original: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pas mi rung ngo //
translated: For example, it is like so-and-so.🔽But if you say that it is not clear, then the error is the same.

original: gal te mi gsal ba'o zhe na yang skyon de nyid do zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag na re 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa zhes bya ba de mi gsal ba yin no zhe na yang dpe med pa'i skyon de nyid
analyzed: gal te mi gsal ba'o zhe na yang skyon de nyid do zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag na re 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa zhes bya ba de mi gsal ba yin no zhe na yang dpe med pa'i skyon de nyid
translated: If the Sāṃkhyas say that the cause does not disintegrate at the time the effect arises, and that it is not clear, then the error of the absence of an example is the same.

original: du 'gyur te /
analyzed: du 'gyur te /
translated: For example, it is like so-and-so.🔽Because there is no example, that is also untenable.

original: mi gsal ba ni bag la zha ba yin la /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni bag la zha ba yin la /
translated: That which is not clear is latent.

original: gsal ba ni bag la ma zha ba yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba ni bag la ma zha ba yin te /
translated: That which is clear is not latent.🔽For example, it is like so-and-so.

original: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir de yang mi rung ngo //🔽zhig pa dang snga na med pa dag yod par rtog pa la ni dpe med pa dang khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis 'bras bu snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag ni yod pa kho
analyzed: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir de yang mi rung ngo // zhig pa dang snga na med pa dag yod par rtog pa la ni dpe med pa dang khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis 'bras bu snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag ni yod pa kho
translated: Because there is no example, that is also untenable.🔽The error of the absence of an example and the contradiction with what you maintain is in the conception that disintegration and prior nonexistence exist.

original: nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: nar shes par bya ste /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas should understand that effects that are nonexistent prior to their cause and that are nonexistent after disintegrating exist.

original: dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / 'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de sun 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / 'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de sun 'byin par byed de /
translated: Because it is subsumed by time and because it is taught by the term “now,” it is like the present effect.

original: zhig nas med pa dang snga na med pa yin na de gnyis da ltar gyi @181b 'bras bu ma yin pas /
analyzed: zhig nas med pa dang snga na med pa yin na de gnyis da ltar gyi @181b 'bras bu ma yin pas /
translated: But if it is nonexistent after disintegration and nonexistent before, then those two are not present effects.🔽Therefore, your example, “like the present effect,” is untenable because it does not exist.

original: khyed kyi dpe da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba med pas mi rung ba dang gzhan yang zhig nas med pa dang snga na med pa zhes sngar khas blangs la da ni de gnyis yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste zhes zer ba ni
analyzed: khyed kyi dpe da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba med pas mi rung ba dang gzhan yang zhig nas med pa dang snga na med pa zhes sngar khas blangs la da ni de gnyis yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste zhes zer ba ni
translated: Moreover, it is untenable to say that what was previously asserted as nonexistent after disintegration and nonexistent before is now to be understood as existing.

original: rang gi khas blangs pas gnod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi khas blangs pas gnod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: This is untenable because it contradicts your own assertions.

original: gal te da ltar yin no zhes /
analyzed: gal te da ltar yin no zhes /
translated: If it is present,

original: da ltar nyid du rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis rgyu nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag na re 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na
analyzed: da ltar nyid du rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis rgyu nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag na re 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na
translated: The example of the non-disintegration of the cause at the time of the arising of the effect

original: rgyu ma zhig pa'i dpe ni da ltar yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ma zhig pa'i dpe ni da ltar yin te /
translated: is the present.

original: dper na da ltar gyi 'bras bu ma zhig par yod pa de bzhin du 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa kho nar yod do zhes zer na /
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi 'bras bu ma zhig par yod pa de bzhin du 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa kho nar yod do zhes zer na /
translated: For example, just as the present effect exists without disintegrating, so too at the time of the arising of the effect, the cause exists without disintegrating.

original: de lta na grangs can dag rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa nyid du smra ba rgyu ma zhig pa da ltar nyid yin par rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la da ltar ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin pas rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis rgyu
analyzed: de lta na grangs can dag rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa nyid du smra ba rgyu ma zhig pa da ltar nyid yin par rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la da ltar ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin pas rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis rgyu
translated: If that is so, then the Sāṃkhya assertion that the cause and effect are not different is refuted by the thesis that the present is inferred to be the non-disintegration of the cause. Since the present is the nature of the effect, it is not the cause.

original: nyid rgyu ma yin par bsal ba'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa kho na yin te zhes sgrub pa'i chos can rgyu zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nyid rgyu ma yin par bsal ba'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig pa kho na yin te zhes sgrub pa'i chos can rgyu zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: In order to avoid the fault of the reason being unestablished, he says, “because the effect arises from the cause that has ceased,” but that is also illogical, because there is the fault of the subject, the cause, being excluded, since the cause definitely has not ceased at the time the effect arises.

original: da ltar gyi 'bras bu yang rdzas su yod pa nyid du mi 'grub ste ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'bras bu yang rdzas su yod pa nyid du mi 'grub ste ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the present effect is not established as substantially existent because it has not arisen.🔽Since that is not established as existent, there is no example.

original: de yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis 'bras bu snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis 'bras bu snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas previously said, “The effect that does not exist before and that does not exist after cessation is known to exist alone.🔽Because it is included in time, and because it is taught, it is like the present effect.”

original: dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / 'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes gang smras pa'i dpe da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba de rdzas su yod par mi 'grub par //
analyzed: dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / 'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes gang smras pa'i dpe da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba de rdzas su yod par mi 'grub par //
translated: The example that was stated, “It is like the present effect,” is not established as substantially existent.

original: sun 'byin par ston te da ltar gyi 'bras bu yang ma skyes pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi dpe da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba de med pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sun 'byin par ston te da ltar gyi 'bras bu yang ma skyes pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi dpe da ltar gyi 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba de med pas mi rung ngo //
translated: The present effect is not established as substantially existent because it has not yet arisen. Therefore, since the present effect is not a substantially existent thing, the example of the present effect that the opponent cites is not suitable.

original: 'dis dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs gnyis la yang skyon gyis len btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi 'bras bu rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub pa 'dis /
analyzed: 'dis dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs gnyis la yang skyon gyis len btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi 'bras bu rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub pa 'dis /
translated: This refutes the two reasons that the Sāṃkhya state, “Because it is subsumed by time” and “Because it is taught.”

original: sngar grangs can dag gis 'bras bu snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sngar grangs can dag gis 'bras bu snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: The Sāṃkhya previously said, “The effect that does not exist before and that does not exist after cessation should be understood to exist.

original: dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / 'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de gnyis la yang da ltar gyi 'bras bu rdzas su yod @182a * //
analyzed: dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / 'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de gnyis la yang da ltar gyi 'bras bu rdzas su yod @182a * //
translated: Because it is subsumed by time and because it is taught.” The two reasons that they state are refuted by the fact that the present effect is not established as a substantially existent thing.

original: par ma grub pas da ltar gyi dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang mi 'grub la da ltar gyi zhes bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang mi 'grub par gtan tshigs kyi skyon gyis lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: par ma grub pas da ltar gyi dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang mi 'grub la da ltar gyi zhes bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang mi 'grub par gtan tshigs kyi skyon gyis lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The response is flawed because the reason is not established, since the present time is not established, and because the present is not established.🔽Similarly, the other position should be stated as appropriate.

original: de bzhin du gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sngar grangs can dag gis rgyu 'o ma zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma las 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sngar grangs can dag gis rgyu 'o ma zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma las 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba'i skad cig ma gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say: The present moment of milk is not a different thing from the effect, the subsequent moment of yogurt.

original: ba las byung ba'i phyir dper na zho'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ba las byung ba'i phyir dper na zho'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the source, like the nature of yogurt itself.

original: yang na 'das pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma las da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'das pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma las da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Or, the present moment of eye consciousness is not a different thing from the past moment of eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de sun dbyung ba'i lan du /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de sun dbyung ba'i lan du /
translated: The reply to the objection that the present moment of visual consciousness is not a homogeneous cause of the future moment of visual consciousness because it is visual consciousness, like the present moment of visual consciousness, is as follows.

original: dbu ma pas 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa gang yin pa de yang de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma pas 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa gang yin pa de yang de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The Madhyamika says that the effect that is not different from the cause is not the cause of that effect,

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la rgyu rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bshad🔽pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la rgyu rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bshad pa de bzhin du /
translated: because it is not different, like its own self. Therefore, the fault of the negation of the intrinsic reality of the subject is present in the thesis that is inferred to be not different, because the cause is eliminated as the cause by the noncause.

original: 'dir bye brag pa la sogs pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs la yang sun dbyung ba'i lan 'dir yang 'das pa'i rgyu phyogs su byed na ni gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: 'dir bye brag pa la sogs pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs la yang sun dbyung ba'i lan 'dir yang 'das pa'i rgyu phyogs su byed na ni gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: In the same way, here, in the position that maintains that the effect is different from the cause, the fault of the subject not being established and so on is present in this reply to the objection, if the past cause is taken as the subject.

original: da ltar gyi rgyu phyogs su byed na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: da ltar gyi rgyu phyogs su byed na ni dpe med de /
translated: If it is a present cause, then there is no example,

original: de'i 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes ci rigs par brjod par bya ba yin no //🔽de ltar re zhig rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi byed par bstan to zhes bya ba ci ltar sngar byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu yin par
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes ci rigs par brjod par bya ba yin no // de ltar re zhig rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi byed par bstan to zhes bya ba ci ltar sngar byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu yin par
translated: because its effect has not yet been established.🔽Thus, it has been demonstrated that a cause that exists does not give rise to an effect that exists.🔽Just as it was previously demonstrated that an existent agent does not perform an existent action,

original: 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi byed par bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi byed par bstan to //
translated: so here it has been demonstrated that a cause that exists does not give rise to an effect that exists.

original: da ni tha snyad du yang rgyu ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed do /
analyzed: da ni tha snyad du yang rgyu ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed do /
translated: Now, it is also demonstrated that a noncause does not give rise to a non-effect.🔽Because it does not exist, just as, for example, the hair of a tortoise does not give rise to a cloth.

original: med pa'i phyir dper na rus sbal gyi spu dag de'i gos mi byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yang ci ltar sngar byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu ma yin
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na rus sbal gyi spu dag de'i gos mi byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yang ci ltar sngar byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu ma yin
translated: Just as it was previously demonstrated that a nonagent does not perform a non-action, so here it has been demonstrated that a noncause does not give rise to a non-effect.

original: par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed par bstan te /
analyzed: par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed par bstan te /
translated: It is taught that a non-actual cause does not produce a non-actual effect.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the thesis, the logical reason, and the example.

original: dper @182b na rus sbal gyi sbu dag ni med pa'i phyir de'i gos mi byed pa de bzhin du rgyu ma yin par gyur pa yang med pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed do //
analyzed: dper @182b na rus sbal gyi sbu dag ni med pa'i phyir de'i gos mi byed pa de bzhin du rgyu ma yin par gyur pa yang med pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed do //
translated: For example, since the hairs of a turtle do not exist, they do not make a garment. In the same way, since a non-actual cause does not exist, it does not produce a non-actual effect.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu la yang rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu la yang rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Similarly, the effect does not have the activity of an actual cause. The only difference is the thesis. The remaining parts of the syllogism are the same as before.

original: ci ltar sngar las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar sngar las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it has been demonstrated that that which is an existent agent does not perform a nonexistent action, and that which is an existent agent does not perform an action that is not existent,🔽so it has been demonstrated that that which is an existent effect does not perform a cause that is not existent, and that which is an existent effect does not perform a cause that is not existent.🔽And just as it has been demonstrated that that which is an existent agent does not perform that which is a nonexistent action, and that which is a nonexistent agent does not perform that which is a nonexistent action,

original: 'dir yang 'bras bu yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'bras bu yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan to //
translated: so it has been demonstrated that that which is an existent effect does not perform that which is a nonexistent cause, and that which is a nonexistent effect does not perform that which is a nonexistent cause.🔽And just as it has been demonstrated that that which is an existent agent does not perform that which is an existent and nonexistent action, and that which is a nonexistent agent does not perform that which is an existent and nonexistent action,🔽so it has been demonstrated that that which is an existent effect does not perform that which is an existent and nonexistent cause, and that which is a nonexistent effect does not perform that which is an existent and nonexistent cause.🔽And just as it has been demonstrated that that which is an existent agent does not perform that which is an action of two kinds, and that which is a nonexistent agent does not perform that which is an action of two kinds,

original: rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag gi phyogs la yang gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang sngar ci ltar byed pa po yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag gi phyogs la yang gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang sngar ci ltar byed pa po yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
translated: so it has been demonstrated that that which is an existent effect does not perform that which is a cause of two kinds, and that which is a nonexistent effect does not perform that which is a cause of two kinds.🔽And just as it has been demonstrated that that which is an existent agent does not perform that which is an action of three kinds, and that which is a nonexistent agent does not perform that which is an action of three kinds,🔽so it has been demonstrated that that which is an existent effect does not perform that which is a cause of three kinds, and that which is a nonexistent effect does not perform that which is a cause of three kinds.

original: las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa /
analyzed: las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa /
translated: Just as it was explained that an existent or nonexistent action is not performed by an existent or nonexistent agent, so here it is explained that an existent or nonexistent cause

original: 'bras bu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa /
translated: does not produce an existent or nonexistent effect, and an existent or nonexistent effect

original: rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa bstan te /
translated: does not have an existent or nonexistent cause.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su smra ba phyogs kyi gos can dag na re rgyu yang gser gyi bdag nyid du ni yin par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su smra ba phyogs kyi gos can dag na re rgyu yang gser gyi bdag nyid du ni yin par gyur pa yin la /
translated: The proponents of the two-truths theory, the Digambara Jains, say: A cause is existent in terms of its nature as gold,

original: sol ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin par gyur pa yin /
analyzed: sol ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin par gyur pa yin /
translated: but it is nonexistent in terms of its nature as charcoal, etc.

original: 'bras bu yang gser gyi bdag nyid du ni yin par gyur pa yin sor gdu ba la sogs pa dbyibs kyi bdag nyid du ni ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no zhes zer bas /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang gser gyi bdag nyid du ni yin par gyur pa yin sor gdu ba la sogs pa dbyibs kyi bdag nyid du ni ma yin par gyur pa bzhin no zhes zer bas /
translated: An effect is existent in terms of its nature as gold, but it is nonexistent in terms of its nature as a ring, etc.

original: de la yang gser gyi rgyu yin par gyur pa ni gser gyi 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi byed de rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun bzhin no //
analyzed: de la yang gser gyi rgyu yin par gyur pa ni gser gyi 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi byed de rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun bzhin no //
translated: A cause that is real does not produce an effect that is real, because it is a cause, like the cause of a real sprout.

original: rgyu ma yin par gyur pa yang 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin par gyur pa yang 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa bzhin no //
translated: A cause that is unreal does not produce an effect that is unreal, because it is dependent, like clay.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu yin par gyur pa yang rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu yin par gyur pa yang rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, an effect that is real is not the activity of a cause that is real.

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an effect, like a cloth.

original: 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa yang rgyu ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa yang rgyu ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin te /
translated: An effect that is unreal is not the activity of a cause that is unreal.🔽Because it is dependent, like a pot.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur bar brjod par bya'o //🔽de ltar re zhig phyogs mthun pa gsum la brten pa'i @183a * //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur bar brjod par bya'o // de ltar re zhig phyogs mthun pa gsum la brten pa'i @183a * //
translated: Thus, both errors are to be stated.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dgag pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, first the refutation of cause and effect based on the three positions of sameness has been explained.

original: da ni ci ltar sngar byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: da ni ci ltar sngar byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
translated: Now just as it was previously explained that an existent agent does not perform a nonexistent action and that an existent agent does not perform the action of a nonexistent action, so too here, an existent cause does not produce a nonexistent effect,

original: 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa dag gi phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa dag gi phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and a nonexistent effect does not have an existent cause.🔽To explain the counterparts’ position,

original: rang gi sde pa bye brag tu smra ba dag na re rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa de byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa bye brag tu smra ba dag na re rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa de byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: the Vaibhāṣika say, “An existent cause produces a nonexistent effect.”🔽To explain the Vaibhāṣika’s inference,

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag gi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni ma yin par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag gi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni ma yin par gyur pa ste /
translated: an effect that has not arisen is nonexistent.

original: gzung du med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzung du med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is not apprehended, it is like a flower in the sky.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni gzung du med pa'i phyir ma yin par gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu ma skyes pa yang gzung du med pa'i phyir ma yin par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni gzung du med pa'i phyir ma yin par gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu ma skyes pa yang gzung du med pa'i phyir ma yin par gyur pa ste /
translated: For example, just as a flower in the sky is not apprehended because it does not exist, so too an unarisen effect is not apprehended because it does not exist.🔽If you say that it is produced by an existent cause, since that which is arisen has no power as a cause, it exists as a non-effect because it has no power as a non-arisen cause.

original: de rgyu yin par gyur pas byed do zhes zer na skyes pa la ni rgyu'i nus pa nyid med kyi ma skyes pa la de yod pas 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa zhes bya ba
analyzed: de rgyu yin par gyur pas byed do zhes zer na skyes pa la ni rgyu'i nus pa nyid med kyi ma skyes pa la de yod pas 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa zhes bya ba
translated: That which is called a non-effect

original: ni 'bras bu snga na med pa da dung ma skyes pa yin par ston te /
analyzed: ni 'bras bu snga na med pa da dung ma skyes pa yin par ston te /
translated: teaches that an effect does not exist prior to it and is not yet arisen.

original: 'bras bu snga na yod pa skyes zin pa yin na ni de la rgyu'i bya ba nyid med pa zhig na rgyu'i bya ba yod pa las na 'bras bu ni snga na med cing ma skyes pa yin par mngon pas /🔽de ni 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu snga na yod pa skyes zin pa yin na ni de la rgyu'i bya ba nyid med pa zhig na rgyu'i bya ba yod pa las na 'bras bu ni snga na med cing ma skyes pa yin par mngon pas / de ni 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: If the effect existed prior to its cause, it would already have arisen. But if it did not exist prior to its cause, then what is the cause of the effect?

original: de rgyu yin par gyur pas skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //🔽ci ste med par 'dra ba la ri bong gi rva ni mi skye la 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba la khyad par ci yod ce na zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag gis dbu ma pa'i dogs pa bsu pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de rgyu yin par gyur pas skyed par byed do zhes zer ro // ci ste med par 'dra ba la ri bong gi rva ni mi skye la 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba la khyad par ci yod ce na zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag gis dbu ma pa'i dogs pa bsu pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: If the effect existed prior to its cause, it would already have arisen. But if it did not exist prior to its cause, then what is the cause of the effect?🔽If the effect existed prior to its cause, it would already have arisen. But if it did not exist prior to its cause, then what is the cause of the effect?🔽If the effect existed prior to its cause, it would already have arisen. But if it did not exist prior to its cause, then what is the cause of the effect?🔽If the effect existed prior to its cause, it would already have arisen. But if it did not exist prior to its cause, then what is the cause of the effect?

original: ci ste dbu ma pa dag 'di skad ces ri bong gi rva dang 'bras bu snga na med pa gnyi ga yang med par 'dra ba las ri bong gi rva ni rgyu yin par gyur pas mi byed la 'bras bu snga na med pa ni rgyu yin par
analyzed: ci ste dbu ma pa dag 'di skad ces ri bong gi rva dang 'bras bu snga na med pa gnyi ga yang med par 'dra ba las ri bong gi rva ni rgyu yin par gyur pas mi byed la 'bras bu snga na med pa ni rgyu yin par
translated: If the effect existed prior to its cause, it would already have arisen. But if it did not exist prior to its cause, then what is the cause of the effect?🔽If the effect existed prior to its cause

original: gyur bas byed pa la khyad par ci yod ces zer na'o //
analyzed: gyur bas byed pa la khyad par ci yod ces zer na'o //
translated: What is the difference between the two?

original: de'i lan du bye brag tu smra ba dag gis ri bong gi rva ni rgyu med pa'i phyir mi skye la 'bras bu ni de lta ma yin pas de ltar rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa skye'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i lan du bye brag tu smra ba dag gis ri bong gi rva ni rgyu med pa'i phyir mi skye la 'bras bu ni de lta ma yin pas de ltar rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa skye'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Vaibhasikas respond: The horns of a rabbit do not arise because they have no cause, but an effect is not like that. Thus, an effect that does not exist is generated because its cause exists.

original: de gnyis snga na @183b med par 'dra mod kyi ri bong gi rva la ni rgyu med pa'i phyir mi skye la 'bras bu la ni rgyu yod pas skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de gnyis snga na @183b med par 'dra mod kyi ri bong gi rva la ni rgyu med pa'i phyir mi skye la 'bras bu la ni rgyu yod pas skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus skyed par byed do //
translated: Although those two are similar in that they do not exist prior to arising, the horns of a rabbit do not arise because they have no cause, but an effect arises because its cause exists. Therefore, a prior nonexistence of an effect is generated by its cause.🔽Or else, it should be ascertained that an effect that does not exist arises, but that which is not an effect does not arise. Therefore, that which arises is a prior nonexistence.

original: yang na 'bras bu med pa nyid ni skye'i 'bras bu ma yin pa ni mi skye bas gang skye ba de ni med pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag 'bras bu snga na med pa ni rgyus🔽skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu med pa nyid ni skye'i 'bras bu ma yin pa ni mi skye bas gang skye ba de ni med pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag 'bras bu snga na med pa ni rgyus🔽skyed par byed kyi /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: A prior nonexistence of an effect is generated by its cause.🔽A prior nonexistence of a cause is generated by its cause.

original: ri bong gi rva lta bu 'bras bu ma yin pa gtan med pa ni rgyus skyed par mi byed pas /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva lta bu 'bras bu ma yin pa gtan med pa ni rgyus skyed par mi byed pas /
translated: A non-existent result that is utterly non-existent, like the horn of a rabbit, is not generated by a cause.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu gang skye ba de ni snga na med pa nyid yin la de rgyus skyes pa ni rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa byed pa yin no zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu gang skye ba de ni snga na med pa nyid yin la de rgyus skyes pa ni rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa byed pa yin no zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it should be ascertained that whatever result is generated is not previously existent and that a cause that has become existent generates a result that has not become existent.🔽Therefore, those who say that a non-existent thing does not arise because it does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit, are proving what is already established.

original: de'i phyir gang dag na re med pa ni mi skye ste med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes zer ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni da ltar 'bras bu ni snga na med kyang skye'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag na re med pa ni mi skye ste med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes zer ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni da ltar 'bras bu ni snga na med kyang skye'i /
translated: The present result arises even though it is not previously existent.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa ri bong gi rva lta bu gtan med pa ni mi skye ba de'i phyir dbu ma pa dag na re med pa ni mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa ri bong gi rva lta bu gtan med pa ni mi skye ba de'i phyir dbu ma pa dag na re med pa ni mi skye ste /
translated: A non-result that is utterly non-existent, like the horn of a rabbit, does not arise. Therefore, those who say that a non-existent thing does not arise because it does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit, are proving what is already established.

original: med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes zer ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes zer ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin pas mi rung ste /
translated: Because it does not exist, like the horn of an ass.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang ri bong gi rva lta bu gtan med pa ni mi skye bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang ri bong gi rva lta bu gtan med pa ni mi skye bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not correct, because it is an establishment of what is already established for us, because it is established that what is utterly nonexistent like the horn of an ass does not arise.

original: dpe yang med do /🔽'bras bu nyid yin na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs nam mkha'i me tog la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de 'bras bu rgyu la snga na med
analyzed: dpe yang med do / 'bras bu nyid yin na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs nam mkha'i me tog la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de 'bras bu rgyu la snga na med
translated: And there is no example.🔽Because if it were an effect, it would not exist.🔽The reason “because it does not exist” is not established in the example, the sky flower, because it is nonexistent.

original: pa mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs yin par sgrub na ni de'i dpe nam mkha'i me tog las blangs pa de mi rung ste /
analyzed: pa mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs yin par sgrub na ni de'i dpe nam mkha'i me tog las blangs pa de mi rung ste /
translated: If the Madhyamika establishes that the reason “because it does not exist” is a reason for nonarising of what is earlier than the cause, then the example of the sky flower that he cites is not correct.

original: nam mkha'i me tog ni 'bras bu ma yin pas gtan tshigs mi skye ba'i phyir de la 'bras bu snga na med pa mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ni 'bras bu ma yin pas gtan tshigs mi skye ba'i phyir de la 'bras bu snga na med pa mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since a sky flower is not a result, the reason is not produced, because it is empty of the phenomenon called “non-arising of a result that does not exist prior to it.”🔽Moreover, if you accept the reason “because it does not exist prior to arising,” there is no example, because that does not exist in the horns of a rabbit.

original: yang na skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs yongs su 'dzin na ni dpe med de ri bong gi rva la de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yang na dbu ma pas med pa ni mi skye ste /
analyzed: yang na skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs yongs su 'dzin na ni dpe med de ri bong gi rva la de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yang na dbu ma pas med pa ni mi skye ste /
translated: Or, if you Madhyamaka assert, “A nonexistent does not arise, because it does not exist, like the horns of a rabbit,” the reason does not exist, because you say that.

original: med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni dpe med de /
translated: If you prove that “because it does not exist prior to the arising of the result,” there is no example.

original: ri bong gi rva la skye ba'i snga rol na med cing phyis skye bar 'gyur ba de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la skye ba'i snga rol na med cing phyis skye bar 'gyur ba de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which does not exist prior to arising and arises later does not exist in the horns of a rabbit.

original: gtan med pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gal te @184a * //
analyzed: gtan med pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gal te @184a * //
translated: If you say that nonexistence itself is the reason, then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gtan med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gtan med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: If you are proving that because the Madhyamikas have no reason, then the reason is not established.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med pa de ri bong gi rva bzhin du gtan med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med pa de ri bong gi rva bzhin du gtan med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect does not exist prior to the cause, it is not utterly nonexistent like the horn of a rabbit.

original: snam bu snga na med pa nyid skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: snam bu snga na med pa nyid skye bar mthong ste /
translated: One sees that the nonexistence of cloth prior to its production is produced.🔽Since there is no valid knowledge other than seeing, one says that the effect does not exist prior to the cause.

original: mthong ba las lhag pa'i tshad ma gzhan med pas des na 'bras bu snga na med pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag na re da ltar 'jig rten na snam bu snga na med pa nyid rgyu spun las phyis
analyzed: mthong ba las lhag pa'i tshad ma gzhan med pas des na 'bras bu snga na med pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag na re da ltar 'jig rten na snam bu snga na med pa nyid rgyu spun las phyis
translated: Vaibhasikas say: In the present world, one sees that the nonexistence of cloth prior to its production later arises from the cause, the threads.

original: 'byung bar mthong ste /
analyzed: 'byung bar mthong ste /
translated: One sees that.

original: mthong ba ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa des na 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus skyed pas rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa byed pa dang / 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa des na 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus skyed pas rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa byed pa dang / 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Seeing is the valid knowledge of direct perception. Therefore, the cause is the cause that generates the non-previously existent effect, and the non-cause is the non-cause that does not generate the non-previously existent effect.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis phyogs snga ma de dag sun dbyung zhing rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis phyogs snga ma de dag sun dbyung zhing rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary refutes those prior positions and in order to demonstrate that the cause that is a cause does not perform the action of the non-cause that is not a cause, and the non-cause that is a cause does not perform the action of the cause that is a cause,

original: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he says, Here it is said... and so on.

original: de la re zhig sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni ma yin par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni ma yin par gyur pa ste /
translated: Regarding that, first, the Vaibhāṣikas say that the non-previously existent effect is not produced by the non-previously existent cause.

original: gzung du med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid dang / ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung du med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid dang / ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the reason “because it is not apprehended” is unestablished, and the error of being indefinite is also present.

original: khyed cag gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: khyed cag gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the reason “because it is not apprehended” that you assert?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / tshad ma thams cad kyis gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar rtog na ni rnam pa thams cad du gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon yod pas rjes su dpag pa des 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni ma yin par gyur pa ste zhes bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / tshad ma thams cad kyis gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar rtog na ni rnam pa thams cad du gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon yod pas rjes su dpag pa des 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni ma yin par gyur pa ste zhes bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If you think that the meaning is “because it is not apprehended by any valid cognition, such as perception or inference,” then the reason is completely unestablished and the reason is indefinite, and therefore you cannot state that the reason “because the effect has not yet arisen” is not a nonestablished reason.

original: mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid de mig gi dbang po dang yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa dag kyang med pa ma🔽yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid de mig gi dbang po dang yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa dag kyang med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you prove that it is not apprehended by direct perception, then the meaning is not established, because things that are not apprehended by direct perception, such as the eye faculty, objects, time, nature, and distant things, etc., are not nonexistent.

original: rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni don ma nges pa nyid de /🔽sprin chags pa las char 'bab par rjes su dpag pa la char pa gzung du med kyang med pa ma @184b yin pa lta bur 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni don ma nges pa nyid de / sprin chags pa las char 'bab par rjes su dpag pa la char pa gzung du med kyang med pa ma @184b yin pa lta bur 'gyur ram /
translated: If you prove that it is not apprehended by inference, then the meaning is not ascertained.🔽Is it like the inference of rain from the gathering of clouds, where rain is not apprehended but is not nonexistent?

original: 'on te ri bong gi rva gtan med par rdzas su dpag pa la gzung du med pa'i phyir gtan med pa lta bur gyur pa ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te ri bong gi rva gtan med par rdzas su dpag pa la gzung du med pa'i phyir gtan med pa lta bur gyur pa ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or is it like the inference of the nonexistence of the rabbit’s horns, where the nonexistence is not apprehended?

original: de lta bas na gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa des 'bras bu ma skyes pa snga na med pa rgyu yod pas byed do zhes bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa des 'bras bu ma skyes pa snga na med pa rgyu yod pas byed do zhes bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, since it cannot be apprehended, the inference “because it is not apprehended” cannot prove that a nonarisen effect that is nonexistent prior to its cause is produced by a cause.

original: 'bras bu med pa nyid ni skye'i /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa nyid ni skye'i /
translated: An effect that is nonexistent arises,🔽but that which is not an effect does not arise.🔽Therefore, it should be ascertained that that which arises is nonexistent.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa ni mi skye bas gang skye ba de ni med pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o zhes smras pa de la yang 'bras bu med pa mi skye bar bstan zin pa'i phyir dang / med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs spyir sbyar ba'i phyir dang de'i dpe yang de bzhin du grub pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa ni mi skye bas gang skye ba de ni med pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o zhes smras pa de la yang 'bras bu med pa mi skye bar bstan zin pa'i phyir dang / med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs spyir sbyar ba'i phyir dang de'i dpe yang de bzhin du grub pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin la /
translated: But since it has already been demonstrated that a nonexistent effect does not arise, and since the reason “because it is not apprehended” is applied generally, and since the example is established in the same way, it is not that the thesis is established by the reason.

original: dpe med pa dang gtan tshigs med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag gis /
analyzed: dpe med pa dang gtan tshigs med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag gis /
translated: And since the example is not nonexistent and the reason is not nonexistent, the Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: yang na 'bras bu med pa nyid ni skye ba'i 'bras bu ma yin pa ni mi skye bas gang skye ba de ni med pa nyid do zhes nges par gzungs bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu med pa nyid ni skye ba'i 'bras bu ma yin pa ni mi skye bas gang skye ba de ni med pa nyid do zhes nges par gzungs bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should definitely understand that what arises is nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir gang dag na re med pa ni mi skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag na re med pa ni mi skye ste /
translated: Thus, those who say that what is nonexistent does not arise,

original: med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes zer ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes zer ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: like the horn of a donkey, are proving what has already been established.

original: dpe yang med de /
analyzed: dpe yang med de /
translated: There is no example.

original: 'bras bu nyid yin na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs nam mkha'i me tog la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de dag sun 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid yin na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs nam mkha'i me tog la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de dag sun 'byin par byed de /
translated: The reason “because it is nonexistent” is not established, since it is not concomitant with the example, a sky flower.🔽Vaibhasikas say: The nonexistence of an effect prior to its cause is not the effect of arising. That which is utterly nonexistent, like the horn of a rabbit, does not arise.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re 'bras bu snga na med pa nyid ni skye ba'i 'bras bu ma yin ri bong gi rva lta bu gtan med pa ni mi skye 'o zhes zer ba'i 'bras bu snga na med pa de yang mi skye bar kho bos
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re 'bras bu snga na med pa nyid ni skye ba'i 'bras bu ma yin ri bong gi rva lta bu gtan med pa ni mi skye 'o zhes zer ba'i 'bras bu snga na med pa de yang mi skye bar kho bos
translated: We say that the nonexistence of an effect prior to its cause does not arise.

original: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i skabs su bkag zin pa'i phyir dang / kho bo'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang snga na med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i skabs su bkag zin pa'i phyir dang / kho bo'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang snga na med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because this has already been refuted in the section on the examination of conditions, and because you say, “because there is no reason for me,” and because you say, “because it does not arise due to nonexistence,” or “because it does not arise due to complete nonexistence,” you apply the reason generally, without differentiating it, and because you say, “my example is like the horn of a rabbit,” it is established in general that all nonexistents are examples of nonarising.

original: gtan med pa'i phyir mi skye'o zhes bye brag tu ma phye bar med pa'i phyir zhes spyir sbyar ba'i phyir dang / kho bo'i dpe ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang med pa thams cad mi skye ba'i dper spyir 'grub pa'i phyir de dag khyed la ma grub pas kho bo grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gtan med pa'i phyir mi skye'o zhes bye brag tu ma phye bar med pa'i phyir zhes spyir sbyar ba'i phyir dang / kho bo'i dpe ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang med pa thams cad mi skye ba'i dper spyir 'grub pa'i phyir de dag khyed la ma grub pas kho bo grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, since these are not established for you, it is not the case that I am establishing what is already established for you.

original: kho bo'i dpe dang gtan tshigs med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo'i dpe dang gtan tshigs med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that I have no example or reason.

original: gzhan yang don dam par 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba ni 'o ma las mi 'byung bar shes par bya ste /
