analyzed: gzhan yang don dam par 'bras bu zho zhes bya ba ni 'o ma las mi 'byung bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that ultimately the so-called effect does not arise from the so-called cause.

original: rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na bum pa skye bar mi rigs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus mi byed pa tshad ma gzhan gyis bsgrub pa ston te /
analyzed: rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na bum pa skye bar mi rigs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus mi byed pa tshad ma gzhan gyis bsgrub pa ston te /
translated: This passage teaches that valid knowledge other than direct perception establishes that a prior non-existent effect is not produced by a cause.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par @185a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par @185a * //
translated: They are, respectively, the subject,🔽the predicate of the probandum,

original: bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the logical reason, and the example.

original: dper na bum pa ni rgyu 'jim pa la ltos pa'i phyir 'o ma las mi 'byung ba de bzhin du zho yang rgyu 'o ma la ltos pa'i phyir 'o ma las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni rgyu 'jim pa la ltos pa'i phyir 'o ma las mi 'byung ba de bzhin du zho yang rgyu 'o ma la ltos pa'i phyir 'o ma las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, because a vase depends on a cause, clay, it does not arise from milk. Likewise, because yogurt depends on a cause, milk, it does not arise from milk.

original: 'dir gzhan dag na re byed pa'i rgyus 'o ma yang bum pa skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i phyir bum pa'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag na re byed pa'i rgyus 'o ma yang bum pa skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i phyir bum pa'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Here, some say that because the cause of yogurt does not prevent the arising of a vase, it is a cause of a vase. In response to that former position, the author of the commentary here says,

original: de skye ba ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skye ba ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it would be pointless to generate it.

original: 'o ma las bum pa skye ba ni 'jig rten gyi mngon sum dang 'gal bas de ltar rtog pa ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'o ma las bum pa skye ba ni 'jig rten gyi mngon sum dang 'gal bas de ltar rtog pa ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the generation of a pot from milk is contradicted by the direct perception of the world, it is not tenable to conceive of it in that way, because it would be pointless.

original: yang na don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i zho ni smra bar 'dod pa'i 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i zho ni smra bar 'dod pa'i 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Or, it should be understood that the curd that is ultimately asserted as the object of desire is not the cause of the milk that is asserted as the object of desire,

original: zho yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: zho yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: because it is curd, like something else. The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the reason, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na snod chen po na 'dug pa'i zho ni zho yin pa'i phyir snod chung du na 'dug pa'i 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu snga na med pa'i zho yang 'bras bu snga na med pa'i zho yin pa'i phyir 'o ma'i rgyu🔽can ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na snod chen po na 'dug pa'i zho ni zho yin pa'i phyir snod chung du na 'dug pa'i 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu snga na med pa'i zho yang 'bras bu snga na med pa'i zho yin pa'i phyir 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, curd that does not exist prior to its cause is not the cause of milk because it is curd that does not exist prior to its cause.

original: de bzhin du byas pa nyid dang / chud za ba nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid dang / rgyu dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byas pa nyid dang / chud za ba nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid dang / rgyu dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir dang /
translated: In the same way, the reasons “because it is produced,” “because it is perishable,” “because it is differentiated by the division of its conditions,” and “because it possesses a cause” should be extensively applied.

original: zho yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gnyis ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: zho yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gnyis ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The two reasons “because it is curd” and “because it exists” are merely illustrations because they are stated in terms of the mode of the term “nature.”

original: 'dir zho ni 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir zho ni 'o ma'i rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: Here curd is not the cause of milk because it is curd.

original: byas pa nyid dang / chud za ba nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid dang / rgyu dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang / chud za ba nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid dang / rgyu dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: and because it is a product, it is perishable, it is differentiated by the division of conditions, it possesses a cause, and so on, like other things.

original: med par 'dra ba las 'bras bu ni rgyu yod pa'i phyir skye la /
analyzed: med par 'dra ba las 'bras bu ni rgyu yod pa'i phyir skye la /
translated: You may say, “An effect arises from a cause because it is similar to what exists,🔽but a rabbit’s horns do not arise because they are not similar to what exists.”🔽This is not good.

original: ri bong gi rva ni rgyu med pa'i phyir mi skye'o zhes gang smras pa de yang bzang po ma yin te zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag gis ri bong gi rva ni rgyu med pa'i phyir mi skye la 'bras bu ni de lta
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ni rgyu med pa'i phyir mi skye'o zhes gang smras pa de yang bzang po ma yin te zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag gis ri bong gi rva ni rgyu med pa'i phyir mi skye la 'bras bu ni de lta
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas previously said, “A rabbit’s horns do not arise because they are not a cause, but an effect arises because it is a cause.

original: ma yin pas de ltar rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa skye'o zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: ma yin pas de ltar rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa skye'o zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: Since an effect is not like that, it is not reasonable to say, ‘An effect arises from a cause because it is similar to what exists.’

original: de'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par gang gi rgyur gang 'dod pa de ni de'i rgyu ma @185b yin par shes par byar nus te skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva'am de las gzhan pa bzhin zhes bya ba smras
analyzed: de'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par gang gi rgyur gang 'dod pa de ni de'i rgyu ma @185b yin par shes par byar nus te skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva'am de las gzhan pa bzhin zhes bya ba smras
translated: It is possible to know that whatever is asserted to be the cause of something ultimately is not its cause, because it does not exist prior to arising, like the horn of a rabbit or something else.

original: te / de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: te / de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva gtan med pa'am /🔽de las gzhan pa 'bras bu snga na med pa'i rgyu dag ni 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir phyi nang gi dngos po gang gi rgyu yang ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu snga na med pa gang gi rgyur gang 'dod pa de
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva gtan med pa'am / de las gzhan pa 'bras bu snga na med pa'i rgyu dag ni 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir phyi nang gi dngos po gang gi rgyu yang ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu snga na med pa gang gi rgyur gang 'dod pa de
translated: For example, the horn of a rabbit is utterly nonexistent.🔽Or, the cause that does not exist prior to the effect is not the cause of any internal or external thing, because it does not exist prior to the arising of the effect.🔽In the same way, it is to be understood that whatever is asserted to be the cause of something that does not exist prior to the effect

original: yang 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir de'i rgyu ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir de'i rgyu ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: is not its cause, because it does not exist prior to the arising of the effect.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe 'di skad ces skye ba'i snga rol na med pa gang yin pa de ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can byas pa'i phyir 'bras bu ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du skye bar mi 'thad pa
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe 'di skad ces skye ba'i snga rol na med pa gang yin pa de ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can byas pa'i phyir 'bras bu ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du skye bar mi 'thad pa
translated: Moreover, when you make the special assertion, “That which does not exist prior to arising arises,” then it is untenable that an effect arises, like the horns of a rabbit.🔽And you assert that it does not possess a cause.

original: dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes dam 'cha' bar byed pa de'i tshe na yang rjes su dpag pa ci skad bstan pa nyid kyis de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes dam 'cha' bar byed pa de'i tshe na yang rjes su dpag pa ci skad bstan pa nyid kyis de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: When you make that assertion, then the previously explained inference refutes that.

original: de ni gyi na zer ba yin no zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas bye brag tu smra ba dag gi gzhung nyams par bya ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de ni gyi na zer ba yin no zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas bye brag tu smra ba dag gi gzhung nyams par bya ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “That is illogical.” This is a statement by the Followers of the Middle Way that refutes the assertions of the Proponents of Differences.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag 'di skad ces /
translated: The Proponents of Differences say:

original: kho bo cag gis med pa skye'o zhes khyad par med par dam bcas kyi skye ba'i snga rol na med pa gang yin pa de ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can byas ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva lta bu gtan med pa ni
analyzed: kho bo cag gis med pa skye'o zhes khyad par med par dam bcas kyi skye ba'i snga rol na med pa gang yin pa de ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can byas ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva lta bu gtan med pa ni
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that something utterly nonexistent, like the horn of an ass, arises.

original: skye bar mi 'thad kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na med pa ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes dam 'cha' bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: skye bar mi 'thad kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na med pa ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes dam 'cha' bar byed do zhe na /
translated: We accept that what is nonexistent prior to the arising of the effect arises.

original: de yang sngar don dam par gang gi rgyu'ang 'dod pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin par shes par byar nus te skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva'am de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa ci skad bstan
analyzed: de yang sngar don dam par gang gi rgyu'ang 'dod pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin par shes par byar nus te skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva'am de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa ci skad bstan
translated: This is also refuted by the previously stated reductio that if you accept that it is a cause ultimately, it is not tenable to say that it is a cause, because it is not tenable that it exists prior to its effect, like the horn of a rabbit or anything else.

original: pa nyid kyis de bsal zin pa'i phyir de ni gyi na zer ba yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid kyis de bsal zin pa'i phyir de ni gyi na zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is mere prattle.

original: don dam par zho ni 'o ma las mi 'byung bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par zho ni 'o ma las mi 'byung bar shes par bya ste /
translated: You should understand that ultimately curd does not arise from milk.

original: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas de'i phyir de ni bdag nyid dbugs 'byin par byed pa tsam du zad do zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus mi byed par tshad mas bsgrub pa'i mjug bsdu🔽ba dang / pha rol po'i dam bcas pa de snying dga' ba tsam du zad do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas de'i phyir de ni bdag nyid dbugs 'byin par byed pa tsam du zad do zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus mi byed par tshad mas bsgrub pa'i mjug bsdu ba dang / pha rol po'i dam bcas pa de snying dga' ba tsam du zad do zhes bstan to //
translated: This concludes the proof by valid cognition that a prior nonexistence is not produced by a cause, and it also teaches that the opponent’s thesis is mere self-satisfaction.🔽It was said, “Nonexistence prior to arising is seen.”

original: de skad ces snga na med pa nyid skye bar mthong ste zhes gang smras pa de nyid kyang ci yang dag par yod pa'am /🔽med pa'am / yod @186a * //
analyzed: de skad ces snga na med pa nyid skye bar mthong ste zhes gang smras pa de nyid kyang ci yang dag par yod pa'am / med pa'am / yod @186a * //
translated: Is it a real existent,

original: med cig skye bar 'gyur zhes brtags na /
analyzed: med cig skye bar 'gyur zhes brtags na /
translated: a non-existent, or something that both exists and does not exist that arises?🔽When this is analyzed,🔽it is not seen in any way.

original: de dag ni rnam pa thams cad du mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag gis snam bu snga na med pa nyid skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam pa thams cad du mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag gis snam bu snga na med pa nyid skye bar mthong ste /
translated: The Vaibhāṣika say, “We see the arising of a prior nonexistence of cloth.

original: mthong ba las lhag pa'i tshad ma gzhan med pa des na 'bras bu snga na med pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de sun dbyung ba'i lan yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba las lhag pa'i tshad ma gzhan med pa des na 'bras bu snga na med pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de sun dbyung ba'i lan yin no //
translated: Since there is no valid cognition other than seeing, the response to the objection that the effect is not previously existent is refuted.

original: de lta bas na mkhas pa rnams kyis ni bum pa la sogs pa dag gi skye ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i skye ba bzhin du tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ma yin par nges par shes te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mkhas pa rnams kyis ni bum pa la sogs pa dag gi skye ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i skye ba bzhin du tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ma yin par nges par shes te /
translated: Therefore, the wise definitely understand that the arising of pots and so on is conventional, not ultimate, like the arising of a person in a magical illusion.

original: mtha' gnyis la mi gnas pa'i blo gros dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus byed par mi 'dod pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la mi gnas pa'i blo gros dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas 'bras bu snga na med pa rgyus byed par mi 'dod pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: Because they possess intelligence that does not abide in the two extremes. This explains how the Followers of the Middle Way do not assert that a cause produces an effect that is not previously existent.🔽Since this is sufficient explanation of the ancillary topic, let us return to the main point.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o zhes bya bas ni bye brag tu smra ba rgyu yin par gyur ba 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa byed pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yin par 'dod
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o zhes bya bas ni bye brag tu smra ba rgyu yin par gyur ba 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa byed pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yin par 'dod
translated: The Proponents of Differences assert that an existent cause produces a nonexistent effect, and that the activity of an existent cause is to produce a nonexistent effect.

original: pa mi 'thad par bsgrub pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: pa mi 'thad par bsgrub pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: The summary of the proof that it is untenable that a cause generates an effect is presented.

original: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa phyogs mthun pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni rgyu ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu yin par gyur pa rgyu ma yin par gyur ba'i bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa phyogs mthun pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni rgyu ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu yin par gyur pa rgyu ma yin par gyur ba'i bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: The phrase “similarly, one should say the same about the other similar cases” means that a noncause does not generate an existent effect, a noncause does not generate a nonexistent effect,🔽a cause does not generate an existent and nonexistent effect, a cause does not generate an effect that is neither existent nor nonexistent,

original: rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / rgyu ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / rgyu ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
translated: a noncause does not generate an effect that is neither existent nor nonexistent, and a noncause does not generate an effect that is both existent and nonexistent.

original: 'bras bu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa rgyu ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu yin par gyur pa rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa rgyu ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu yin par gyur pa rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: The non-action of an unrealized effect and cause is not the action of a realized cause and effect.🔽The non-action of a realized cause and effect is not the action of an unrealized cause and effect.🔽The non-action of an unrealized cause and effect is not the action of a realized cause and effect.🔽The non-action of a realized cause and effect is not the action of an unrealized cause and effect.

original: rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba phyogs mi mthun pa lhag ma lnga po dag la yang byed pa po dang las kyi skabs su bstan pa bzhin ci rigs par brjod par
analyzed: rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa rgyu yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba phyogs mi mthun pa lhag ma lnga po dag la yang byed pa po dang las kyi skabs su bstan pa bzhin ci rigs par brjod par
translated: The remaining five discordant positions should be expressed in the same way as the agent and action in the context of the treatise.

original: bya'o // de ni bye brag pa dag 'dod pa'i yon tan dang / yon tan can dgag pa'i phyir de bzhin du don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan yin par gyur pa dag kyang bum pa zhes bya ba de'i yon tan can @186b yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed de /🔽yon tan can la ltos pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: bya'o // de ni bye brag pa dag 'dod pa'i yon tan dang / yon tan can dgag pa'i phyir de bzhin du don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan yin par gyur pa dag kyang bum pa zhes bya ba de'i yon tan can @186b yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed de / yon tan can la ltos pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas assert that the qualities are different from the quality-possessor, and they assert that the quality-possessor is different from the qualities.🔽In order to refute that, the master Nāgārjuna said:🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.

original: des ni yon tan yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin par gyur pa mi byed par ston te /🔽de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: des ni yon tan yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin par gyur pa mi byed par ston te /🔽de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make the quality-possessor.🔽The quality-possessor does not make the qualities.🔽The qualities do not make

original: dper na smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa de las gzhan pa rgyu spun la sogs pa ni yon tan can snam bu la ltos pa'i phyir dang / rgyu spun zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir /🔽bum pa zhes bya ba de'i yon tan can rtsom par mi byed pa de bzhin du /🔽smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa yin par gyur pa dag kyang /🔽yon tan can bum pa la ltos pa'i phyir dang yon tan zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir bum pa zhes bya ba de'i yon tan can rtsom par mi byed do //
analyzed: dper na smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa de las gzhan pa rgyu spun la sogs pa ni yon tan can snam bu la ltos pa'i phyir dang / rgyu spun zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir / bum pa zhes bya ba de'i yon tan can rtsom par mi byed pa de bzhin du / smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa yin par gyur pa dag kyang / yon tan can bum pa la ltos pa'i phyir dang yon tan zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir bum pa zhes bya ba de'i yon tan can rtsom par mi byed do //
translated: For example, the qualities of form, smell, taste, and tactility that are desired to be spoken about are not the qualities of the cloth that is the basis of those qualities because they are dependent on the cloth that is the basis of those qualities and because they are designated as the qualities of the cloth.🔽In the same way, the qualities of form, smell, taste, and tactility that are desired to be spoken about are not the qualities of the pot that is the basis of those qualities because they are dependent on the pot that is the basis of those qualities and because they are designated as the qualities of the pot.🔽In the same way, the form that is the basis of those qualities that is desired to be spoken about is not composed of the qualities of form, smell, taste, and tactility because it is dependent on the qualities of form, smell, taste, and tactility and because it is designated as the basis of those qualities.

original: de bzhin du don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan can yin par gyur pa snam bu zhes bya ba'i gzugs gzhan yang yon tan yin par gyur pa rgyu spun gyi gzugs la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan can yin par gyur pa snam bu zhes bya ba'i gzugs gzhan yang yon tan yin par gyur pa rgyu spun gyi gzugs la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the form that is the basis of those qualities that is desired to be spoken about is not composed of the qualities of form, smell, taste, and tactility because it is dependent on the qualities of form, smell, taste, and tactility and because it is designated as the basis of those qualities.🔽In the same way, the form that is the basis of those qualities that is desired to be spoken about is not composed of the qualities of form, smell, taste, and tactility because it is dependent on the qualities of form, smell, taste, and tactility and because it is designated as the basis of those qualities.

original: yon tan la ltos pa'i phyir dang tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni yon tan can yin par gyur pa yon tan yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa ston te /
analyzed: yon tan la ltos pa'i phyir dang tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni yon tan can yin par gyur pa yon tan yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa ston te /
translated: “Because it depends on qualities and is designated by convention, like something else” indicates that a possessor of qualities is not an action that is a quality.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan can yin par gyur pa snam bu de las gzhan pa bum pa ni yon tan 'jim pa la ltos pa'i phyir dang / bum pa zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan yin par gyur pa rgyu spun gyi gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pas brtsams pa ma yin pa de bzhin du smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan can yin par gyur pa snam bu zhes
analyzed: dper na smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan can yin par gyur pa snam bu de las gzhan pa bum pa ni yon tan 'jim pa la ltos pa'i phyir dang / bum pa zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan yin par gyur pa rgyu spun gyi gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pas brtsams pa ma yin pa de bzhin du smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan can yin par gyur pa snam bu zhes
translated: For example, a pot, which is a possessor of qualities that is asserted to be a quality, is not composed of the causes—the form, smell, taste, and tactility—of the thread that is asserted to be a quality, because it depends on the quality of clay and because it is designated by the convention “pot.”

original: bya ba'i gzugs gzhan yang yon tan rgyu spun la ltos pa'i phyir dang / snam bu zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan yin par gyur pa rgyu spun gyi gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pas brtsams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i gzugs gzhan yang yon tan rgyu spun la ltos pa'i phyir dang / snam bu zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan yin par gyur pa rgyu spun gyi gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pas brtsams pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, the form of action is not composed of the form, smell, taste, and tactility of the cause, the yarn, because the qualities depend on the cause, the yarn, and because the convention “cloth” is designated.

original: de bzhin du smra bar 'dod pa'i bum pa yang gzugs la sogs pa 'du ba'i rgyu can ma yin par nges te /
analyzed: de bzhin du smra bar 'dod pa'i bum pa yang gzugs la sogs pa 'du ba'i rgyu can ma yin par nges te /
translated: In the same way, it is ascertained that the pot, which is asserted to be a collection, is not the cause of the collection of form and so on,

original: rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni bye @187a * //
analyzed: rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni bye @187a * //
translated: because it depends on causes, like cloth and so on.

original: brag pa'i gzhung las 'du ba can 'du ba'i bya ba yin par 'dod pa dgag pa ston te /
analyzed: brag pa'i gzhung las 'du ba can 'du ba'i bya ba yin par 'dod pa dgag pa ston te /
translated: This refutes the Vṛji’s assertion that the action of collection is a collection.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na snam bu la sogs pa 'du ba can dag ni rang gi rgyu rgyu spun la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa zhes bya ba 'du ba dag gi rgyu can ma yin pa nges pa de bzhin du smra bar
analyzed: dper na snam bu la sogs pa 'du ba can dag ni rang gi rgyu rgyu spun la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa zhes bya ba 'du ba dag gi rgyu can ma yin pa nges pa de bzhin du smra bar
translated: For example, it is certain that a collection such as a cloth is not the cause of the collection called form, smell, taste, and tactility, because it depends on its own cause, such as thread.

original: 'dod pa'i 'du ba can bum pa yang rang gi rgyu 'jim pa la ltos pa'i phyir gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa zhes bya ba 'du ba dag gi rgyu can ma yin par nges so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'du ba can bum pa yang rang gi rgyu 'jim pa la ltos pa'i phyir gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa zhes bya ba 'du ba dag gi rgyu can ma yin par nges so //
translated: In the same way, it is certain that a pot, which is a collection that is desired by the proponent, is not the cause of the collection called form, smell, taste, and tactility, because it depends on its own cause, clay.

original: yang na smra bar 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni bsams pa'i bum par 'du ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na smra bar 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni bsams pa'i bum par 'du ba ma yin te /
translated: Or, the form and so on that are desired by the proponent are not collected in the pot that is intended,

original: yon tan can la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'i gzhung las 'du ba can byed par 'dod pa dgag pa ston te /
analyzed: yon tan can la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'i gzhung las 'du ba can byed par 'dod pa dgag pa ston te /
translated: because they depend on the possessor of the qualities, just like anything else. This is the refutation of the desire to make a collection in the Vaiśeṣika text.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na smra bar 'dod pa'i 'du ba gzugs la sogs pa de las gzhan pa rgyu spun la sogs pa ni yon tan can snam bu la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir 'du ba can yin par bsams pa'i bum par 'du ba ma yin pa de bzhin du
analyzed: dper na smra bar 'dod pa'i 'du ba gzugs la sogs pa de las gzhan pa rgyu spun la sogs pa ni yon tan can snam bu la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir 'du ba can yin par bsams pa'i bum par 'du ba ma yin pa de bzhin du
translated: For example, the collection of the cause of a cloth, such as thread, which is other than the form, etc., that are desired to be spoken, is considered to be a collection that is dependent on the cloth, etc., that possess qualities. It is not a collection in a pot.

original: smra bar 'dod pa'i 'du ba gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa zhes bya ba dag kyang /
analyzed: smra bar 'dod pa'i 'du ba gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa zhes bya ba dag kyang /
translated: Similarly, the collection of the form, smell, taste, and tactility that are desired to be spoken

original: yon tan can snam bu la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir 'du ba can yin par bsams pa'i bum par 'du ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan can snam bu la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir 'du ba can yin par bsams pa'i bum par 'du ba ma yin no //
translated: is considered to be a collection that is dependent on the cloth, etc., that possess qualities. It is not a collection in a pot.

original: de bzhin du rdzas nyid dang / rgyu can nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yon tan yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas nyid dang / rgyu can nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yon tan yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
translated: So too, one should say, “because of the reasons of substance, having a cause, being an effect, being expressible, being an object of knowledge, and so on.”🔽The previously mentioned reasons such as “because of the dependence on the reason that a real quality does not perform the action of a real quality possessor,

original: yon tan can yin par gyur pa yon tan yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'du ba yin par gyur pa 'du ba can yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'du ba can yin par gyur pa 'du ba yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar smos pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad
analyzed: yon tan can yin par gyur pa yon tan yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'du ba yin par gyur pa 'du ba can yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / 'du ba can yin par gyur pa 'du ba yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar smos pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad
translated: a real quality possessor does not perform the action of a real quality, a real assembly does not perform the action of a real possessor of an assembly, and a real possessor of an assembly does not perform the action of a real assembly” are merely illustrations because they are stated in terms of the mode of the term “quality.”

original: kyi / gtan tshigs 'di dag gi phyir yang de dag gis de dag mi byed pa dang / de dag gi bya ba ma yin par ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kyi / gtan tshigs 'di dag gi phyir yang de dag gis de dag mi byed pa dang / de dag gi bya ba ma yin par ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: For these reasons, it should be said that they do not perform that action and that it is not their action, as the case may be.

original: yon tan dang yon tan can ma yin par gyur pa la sogs pa dag gi phyogs la @187b yang dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs mthun pa gsum dang
analyzed: yon tan dang yon tan can ma yin par gyur pa la sogs pa dag gi phyogs la @187b yang dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs mthun pa gsum dang
translated: In the case of the positions of the non-possession of qualities and the possession of qualities, etc., the thesis is different, but the remaining parts of the syllogism are the same as before.

original: mi mthun pa drug ste dgu las de yan chad du phyogs mthun pa dang po bstan pa'i lhag ma brgyad po dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa drug ste dgu las de yan chad du phyogs mthun pa dang po bstan pa'i lhag ma brgyad po dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The three similar positions and the six dissimilar positions make nine. Beyond that, the remaining eight similar positions are taught in the first one, and they are to be applied as appropriate in the same way as before.

original: 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: They are applied as follows.

original: yon tan ma yin par gyur ba yon tan can ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / yon tan can ma yin par gyur pa yon tan ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / yon tan yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /

original: yon tan ma yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / yon tan can yin par gyur pa yon tan ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / yon tan yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: yon tan ma yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / yon tan can yin par gyur pa yon tan ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / yon tan yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is not that that which is not a quality is the activity of that which is a quality.🔽It is not that that which is a quality is the activity of that which is not a quality. It is not that that which is not a quality is the activity of that which is and is not a quality.

translated: It is not that that which is and is not a quality is the activity of that which is not a quality.

original: yon tan yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / yon tan can yin par gyur pa yon tan yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / yon tan yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yon tan can yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /

translated: and a real qualified thing does not perform the action of a real quality.

original: yon tan ma yin par gyur pa yon tan yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'du ba dang 'du ba can gyi phyogs la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan ma yin par gyur pa yon tan yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'du ba dang 'du ba can gyi phyogs la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And in the case of the relation of possessor and possessed, the same is so in every way.

original: de bzhin du don dam par lkog shal sogs pa mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa yang ba lang zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par lkog shal sogs pa mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa yang ba lang zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed par shes par bya ste /
translated: So too, in the ultimate sense, it should be understood that a real characteristic such as the dewlap does not indicate a real basis of characteristics called a cow.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la ltos pa'i phyir dper na rta'i mtshan nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshon @188a * //🔽par mi byed pa ston te /🔽de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la ltos pa'i phyir dper na rta'i mtshan nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshon @188a * // par mi byed pa ston te / de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “Because it relies on the basis of those characteristics, like the characteristics of a horse,” demonstrates that a characteristic does not indicate the basis of those characteristics.

original: dper na rta'i mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi rta la ltos pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang mtshon par mi byed pa de bzhin du ba lang gi mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang la ltos pa'i phyir ba lang la mtshon par mi🔽byed do // de bzhin du don dam par ba lang gi rdzas kyang lkog sha la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin te /

original: mtshan nyid la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa'i gzhi ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa'i gzhi ma yin par ston te /
translated: “Because it relies on a definition, like something else,” demonstrates that a basis of a definition does not become a definition.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na ba lang gi rdzas las gzhan pa rta'i rdzas ni rta'i mtshan nyid la ltos pa'i phyir lkog shal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin pa de bzhin du ba lang gi rdzas kyang ba lang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa'i phyir lkog shal la
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na ba lang gi rdzas las gzhan pa rta'i rdzas ni rta'i mtshan nyid la ltos pa'i phyir lkog shal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin pa de bzhin du ba lang gi rdzas kyang ba lang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa'i phyir lkog shal la
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.🔽For example, the substance of a horse, which is different from the substance of an ox, is not a basis of the definition of a horse because it relies on the definition of a horse.

original: sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the substance of an ox is not a basis of the definition of an ox, such as a dewlap, because it relies on the definition of an ox.

original: de bzhin du lkog shal la sogs pa dag ba lang gi rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa dang / ba lang gi rdzas kyang lkog shal la sogs pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni des de mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lkog shal la sogs pa dag ba lang gi rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa dang / ba lang gi rdzas kyang lkog shal la sogs pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni des de mi byed pa dang /
translated: Thus it is said that it does not perform that action and that is not its action.

original: de de'i bya ba ma yin par byed pa po dang / las kyi mu dgu'i tshul bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de de'i bya ba ma yin par byed pa po dang / las kyi mu dgu'i tshul bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The nine modes of agent and action should be applied in the appropriate way.🔽So too, all similar and dissimilar cases should be applied.

original: de bzhin du phyogs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang phyogs mthun pa gsum dang / mi mthun pa drug ste dgu las de yan tshad du phyogs mthun pa dang po bstan pa'i lhag ma brgyad po dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang phyogs mthun pa gsum dang / mi mthun pa drug ste dgu las de yan tshad du phyogs mthun pa dang po bstan pa'i lhag ma brgyad po dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Here there are three similar and six dissimilar cases, making nine. The first of these is explained here and the remaining eight similar cases and six dissimilar cases should be applied in the appropriate way as before.

original: 'di ltar sbyar te mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyar te mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: This is how it is applied: That which is not a characteristic does not characterize that which is not a basis of characteristics, and that which is not a basis of characteristics is not characterized by that which is not a characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: That which is and is not a characteristic does not characterize that which is and is not a basis of characteristics, and that which is and is not a basis of characteristics is not characterized by that which is and is not a characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par @188b gyur ba mtshon par mi byed pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par @188b gyur ba mtshon par mi byed pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang /
translated: A characteristic that is a characteristic does not characterize a basis of characteristics that is not a basis of characteristics.🔽A basis of characteristics that is not a basis of characteristics is not characterized by a characteristic that is a characteristic. A characteristic that is not a characteristic does not characterize a basis of characteristics that is a basis of characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang /
translated: A basis of characteristics that is a basis of characteristics is not characterized by a characteristic that is not a characteristic. A characteristic that is a characteristic does not characterize a basis of characteristics that is and is not a basis of characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid ma yin bar gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang /🔽mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid ma yin bar gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang /
translated: The definition that is the basis of the definition and that which is not the basis of the definition does not indicate that which is the definition and that which is not the definition.🔽That which is not the definition does not indicate that which is the basis of the definition and that which is not the basis of the definition.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed pa dang /
translated: That which is the basis of the definition and that which is not the basis of the definition does not indicate that which is not the definition and that which is not the definition.🔽That which is the definition and that which is not the definition does not indicate that which is the basis of the definition and that which is not the basis of the definition.🔽That which is the basis of the definition does not indicate that which is the definition and that which is not the definition.🔽That which is the definition and that which is not the definition does not indicate that which is not the basis of the definition.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshon par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The basis of those characteristics does not become the characteristic, nor does it become the characterized.

original: de bzhin du don dam par lag pa la sogs pa yan lag yin par gyur pa dag kyang lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur pa rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par lag pa la sogs pa yan lag yin par gyur pa dag kyang lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur pa rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: So too, ultimately, those limbs such as the hand that have become limbs do not compose the body that has become the possessor of limbs, called Devadatta.🔽Because it depends on the possessor of limbs, like roots, trunks, and so on.

original: yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir dper na rtsa ba dang sdong po la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes bya bas ni yan lag yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa ston te /
analyzed: yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir dper na rtsa ba dang sdong po la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes bya bas ni yan lag yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa ston te /
translated: This demonstrates that those limbs that have become limbs do not compose the body that has become the possessor of limbs.

original: de dag nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi gzhi ma yin par gyur pa mtshan nyid yin pa dang ma yin chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The basis of those does not become the characteristic, nor does it become the characterized, nor does it become the example, respectively.

original: dper na rtsa ba dang sdong po la sogs pa yan lag dag ni yan lag can shing ljon pa la ltos pa'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur pa rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa
analyzed: dper na rtsa ba dang sdong po la sogs pa yan lag dag ni yan lag can shing ljon pa la ltos pa'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur pa rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa
translated: For example, the parts such as the roots and trunk are not the agent that composes the whole tree that is called “Devadatta” because they rely on the whole tree.

original: yan lag yin par gyur pa dag kyang yan lag can lus la ltos pa'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur pa rtsom par byed pa ma yin no /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu bzhi pa /🔽de bzhin du don dam @189a * //
analyzed: yan lag yin par gyur pa dag kyang yan lag can lus la ltos pa'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur pa rtsom par byed pa ma yin no / // / bam po bzhi bcu bzhi pa / de bzhin du don dam @189a * //
translated: Similarly, the parts such as the hands are not the agent that composes the whole that is called “Devadatta” because they rely on the whole body.

original: par lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur pa yang lag pa la sogs pa yan lag yin par gyur pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: par lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur pa yang lag pa la sogs pa yan lag yin par gyur pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, ultimately the whole that is called “Devadatta” is not composed of the parts that are called “hands” and so on,

original: yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dper na shing ljon pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni yan lag can yin par gyur pa yan lag yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dper na shing ljon pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni yan lag can yin par gyur pa yan lag yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par ston te /
translated: because it relies on the parts, just like a tree. This shows that the whole that is called “Devadatta” is not the action of the parts that are called “hands” and so on.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na yan lag can shing ljon pa ni yan lag rtsa ba dang sdong po la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa yan lag yin par gyur pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na yan lag can shing ljon pa ni yan lag rtsa ba dang sdong po la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa yan lag yin par gyur pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.🔽For example, a tree, which is a whole, is not created by its parts, such as its roots and trunk, because it depends on them.

original: can yin par gyur pa yang yan lag rkang pa la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir /🔽lag pa la sogs pa'i yan lag yin par gyur pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: can yin par gyur pa yang yan lag rkang pa la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir / lag pa la sogs pa'i yan lag yin par gyur pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, Devadatta, who is a whole, is not created by his parts, such as his feet,🔽because he depends on them.

original: yang na smra bar 'dod pa'i so ma shar ma zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa yan lag dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na smra bar 'dod pa'i so ma shar ma zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa yan lag dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Or, the so-called Devadatta, who is desired to be spoken of, is apprehended as not created by his parts, such as his hands.

original: yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dang / yan lag can yin pa'i phyir dper na bha ba shar ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyud tha dad pa'i yan lag can rgyud tha dad pa'i yan lag gi bya ba ma yin par ston te /🔽de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na yan lag can rgyud tha dad pa bha ba shar ma ni yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dang yan lag can yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i yan lag la sogs pa yan lag gis brtsams pa ma yin pa de bzhin du yan lag can rgyud
analyzed: yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dang / yan lag can yin pa'i phyir dper na bha ba shar ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyud tha dad pa'i yan lag can rgyud tha dad pa'i yan lag gi bya ba ma yin par ston te / de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na yan lag can rgyud tha dad pa bha ba shar ma ni yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dang yan lag can yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i yan lag la sogs pa yan lag gis brtsams pa ma yin pa de bzhin du yan lag can rgyud
translated: The phrase “because it depends on its parts and because it is a whole” is an example that shows that a different continuum’s whole is not the action of its different continuum’s parts.🔽The phrase “because it depends on its parts” is the subject, the phrase “because it is a whole” is the predicate, the phrase “like a chariot” is the example, and the phrase “a different continuum’s whole” is the application.🔽For example, a different continuum’s whole, a chariot, does not depend on its different continuum’s parts, etc., because it depends on its parts and because it is a whole.

original: tha dad pa som shar ma yang yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dang yan lag can yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i lag pa la sogs pa yan lag dag gis brtsams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa som shar ma yang yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dang yan lag can yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i lag pa la sogs pa yan lag dag gis brtsams pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, a different continuum’s whole, a chariot, does not depend on its different continuum’s parts, etc., because it depends on its parts and because it is a whole.

original: yang na don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i lag pa la sogs pa yan lag ni so ma shar ma zhes bya ba yan lag can rtsom par byed pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i lag pa la sogs pa yan lag ni so ma shar ma zhes bya ba yan lag can rtsom par byed pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Or, the limbs such as hands that are asserted to be ultimately existent are not limbs that are the agent of the whole, because they are limbs that are dependent on the whole, like anything else.

original: yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyud tha dad pa'i yan lag can byed pa ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyud tha dad pa'i yan lag can byed pa ma yin par ston te /
translated: This shows that the limbs of a different continuum are not the agent of the whole.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na rgyud tha dad pa bha ba shar ma'i yan lag dag ni yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad @189b pas so ma shar ma zhes bya ba yan lag can rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyud tha dad pa so
analyzed: dper na rgyud tha dad pa bha ba shar ma'i yan lag dag ni yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad @189b pas so ma shar ma zhes bya ba yan lag can rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyud tha dad pa so
translated: For example, the limbs of Bhava Sharman of a different continuum are not the agent of the whole called Bhava Sharman of a different continuum, because they are limbs that are dependent on the whole.

original: ma shar ma'i yan lag can dag kyang yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa bha ba shar ma zhes bya ba yan lag can rtsom par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma shar ma'i yan lag can dag kyang yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa bha ba shar ma zhes bya ba yan lag can rtsom par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: and the one with the non-arisen part is not the one that composes the different continuums, the one with the arisen part, because it depends on the one with the arisen part.

original: 'dir yang dam bcas pa'i don la sogs pa rnam par brtag pa rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang phyogs mthun pa gsum dang / mi mthun pa drug ste dgu las de yan chad du phyogs mthun pa dang po bstan pa'i lhag ma brgyad po dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang dam bcas pa'i don la sogs pa rnam par brtag pa rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang phyogs mthun pa gsum dang / mi mthun pa drug ste dgu las de yan chad du phyogs mthun pa dang po bstan pa'i lhag ma brgyad po dag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Here, too, the analysis of the meaning of the thesis, etc., is extensive, as before. Here, too, there are three similar and six dissimilar ones, making nine. Beyond that, the remaining eight of the first similar one are taught, and they are to be applied as appropriate, as before.

original: 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: It is to be applied in this way:

original: yan lag ma yin par gyur pa yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa yan lag ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: yan lag ma yin par gyur pa yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa yan lag ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang /
translated: One does not perform that which is not a part as that which is not a whole, one does not perform that which is not a whole as that which is not a part, one does not perform that which is a part and not a part as that which is a whole and not a whole,

original: yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur ba yan lag yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag yin par gyur pa yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur ba yan lag yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag yin par gyur pa yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang /
translated: one does not perform that which is a whole and not a whole as that which is a part and not a part, one does not perform that which is a part as that which is not a whole,

original: yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa yan lag yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin par gyur pa yan lag yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can yin par gyur pa yan lag ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang /🔽yan lag yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yan lag yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa yan lag yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin par gyur pa yan lag yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can yin par gyur pa yan lag ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yan lag yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: That which is not an owner of parts does not commence that which is an existent part. That which is not a part does not commence that which is an existent part. That which is an owner of parts does not commence that which is a nonexistent part.🔽That which is a part does not commence that which is an owner of parts. That which is an owner of parts does not commence that which is a nonexistent part.

original: yan lag ma yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yan lag ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: yan lag ma yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yan lag ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: That which is a part does not commence that which is an owner of parts. That which is not an owner of parts does not commence that which is a nonexistent part.🔽That which is not a part does not commence that which is an owner of parts. That which is not an owner of parts does not commence that which is a nonexistent part.🔽That which is not a part does not commence that which is an owner of parts.

original: yan lag yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can yin par gyur pa yan lag yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: yan lag yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can yin par gyur pa yan lag yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: That which is a part and not a part does not compose that which is a part-possessor, and that which is a part-possessor does not compose that which is a part and not a part.

original: yan lag yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa yan lag yin @190a * //🔽pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //🔽yang gzhan yang 'di la yan lag can de yan lag dag la cha shas kyis 'jug par 'dod dam /
analyzed: yan lag yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed pa dang / yan lag can ma yin par gyur pa yan lag yin @190a * // pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i brtsam par bya ba ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o // yang gzhan yang 'di la yan lag can de yan lag dag la cha shas kyis 'jug par 'dod dam /
translated: That which is a part and not a part does not compose that which is not a part-possessor, and that which is not a part-possessor does not compose that which is a part and not a part.🔽Moreover, in this regard, do you assert that the part-possessor pervades the parts by means of a part?

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug par 'dod ces bya bas ni yan lag can lhas byin zhes bya ba de lag pa la sogs pa yan lag re re dag la cha shas re res 'jug par 'dod dam /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug par 'dod ces bya bas ni yan lag can lhas byin zhes bya ba de lag pa la sogs pa yan lag re re dag la cha shas re res 'jug par 'dod dam /
translated: Or do you assert that it pervades by its whole?

original: lag pa la sogs pa yan lag re re la bdag nyid thams cad rdzogs pa re res 'jug par 'dod ces brtag pa rnam par ston to //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa yan lag re re la bdag nyid thams cad rdzogs pa re res 'jug par 'dod ces brtag pa rnam par ston to //
translated: The first hypothesis is that the self is present in its entirety in each part, such as the hand.🔽The first hypothesis is untenable.

original: de la brtag pa snga ma ltar mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi rkang pa la sogs pa dag de'i cha shas lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin
analyzed: de la brtag pa snga ma ltar mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi rkang pa la sogs pa dag de'i cha shas lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin
translated: If the self is present in its entirety in each part, then the self called Devadatta, which is present in its entirety in the foot, etc., which are parts of Devadatta, is not present in its entirety in the hand, etc., which are also parts of Devadatta.

original: pa de rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa de rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The self is not present in its entirety in the hand, etc.,

original: de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is not present in the foot, etc., just as the warp threads are not present in the woof threads.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example are to be supplied in the appropriate order.

original: dper na lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i cha shas yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i cha shas yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The self called Devadatta, which is present in its entirety in the foot, etc., which are parts of Devadatta, is not present in its entirety in the hand, etc., which are also parts of Devadatta.

original: snam bu'i yan lag rgyu spun la sogs pa de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir yan lag rgyu spun la sogs pa de dag lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i cha shas yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de rtsom par byed🔽pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i cha shas yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de /🔽de'i yan lag rkang pa la sogs pa de dag tu yang ma zhugs pa'i phyir yan lag rkang pa la sogs pa de dag kyang lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i cha shas yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de rtsom par
analyzed: snam bu'i yan lag rgyu spun la sogs pa de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir yan lag rgyu spun la sogs pa de dag lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i cha shas yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i cha shas yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de / de'i yan lag rkang pa la sogs pa de dag tu yang ma zhugs pa'i phyir yan lag rkang pa la sogs pa de dag kyang lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i cha shas yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de rtsom par
translated: Because the parts of the cloth, such as the warp and weft, do not enter the parts of the cloth, such as the warp and weft, the parts of the cloth, such as the warp and weft, do not compose the part of the whole Devadatta that is located in the part of the body that is the hand.

original: byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, because the part of the whole Devadatta that is located in the part of the body that is the hand does not enter the parts of the body, such as the feet, the parts of the body, such as the feet, do not compose the part of the whole Devadatta that is located in the part of the body that is the hand.

original: brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'thad mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi bdag nyid lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de de'i rkang pa la sogs pas brtsams pa🔽ma yin te /
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'thad mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi bdag nyid lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de de'i rkang pa la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin te /
translated: If you assert the latter mode of analysis, then the self that is the bearer of the parts, called Devadatta, does not begin with his feet and so on.

original: de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir dper na ba lang la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir dper na ba lang la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it does not enter into them, it is like a cow and so on.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na ba lang la sogs pa yan lag can gyi @190b bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i yan lag rkang pa la sogs pa de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir ba lang la sogs pa yan lag can gyi
analyzed: dper na ba lang la sogs pa yan lag can gyi @190b bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i yan lag rkang pa la sogs pa de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir ba lang la sogs pa yan lag can gyi
translated: For example, the self that is the bearer of the parts, called Devadatta, does not begin with his feet and so on, because it does not enter into them, like a cow and so on, which are bearers of parts.

original: bdag nyid gang yin pa de lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i yan lag rkang pa la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /🔽lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi bdag nyid yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de yang lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i yan lag rkang pa la sogs pa de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya
analyzed: bdag nyid gang yin pa de lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i yan lag rkang pa la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin pa de bzhin du / lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi bdag nyid yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de yang lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i yan lag rkang pa la sogs pa de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya
translated: Just as the self, which is Devadatta, is not composed of his limbs, such as his feet,

original: ba yan lag can gyi bdag nyid yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i yan lag rkang pa la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ba yan lag can gyi bdag nyid yan lag lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can de'i yan lag rkang pa la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, the self, which is Devadatta, is not composed of his limbs, such as his feet, because the self, which is Devadatta, does not exist in the limbs, such as his feet.

original: de la brtag pa snga ma la ni yan lag can cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du gyur la /
analyzed: de la brtag pa snga ma la ni yan lag can cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du gyur la /
translated: In the former analysis, the possessor of parts would have parts.

original: brtag pa phyi ma la ni yan lag can mang po nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir de la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma la ni yan lag can mang po nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir de la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, one should not form a conception of it.

original: yan lag can de yan lag dag la cha shas kyis 'jug pa zhes bya ba brtag pa snga ma la ni yan lag can cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du gyur pas /
analyzed: yan lag can de yan lag dag la cha shas kyis 'jug pa zhes bya ba brtag pa snga ma la ni yan lag can cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du gyur pas /
translated: In the former analysis, since the possessor of parts would possess parts,

original: bye brag pa dag nyid yan lag can cha shas med pa nyid du 'dod pa dang 'gal la /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag nyid yan lag can cha shas med pa nyid du 'dod pa dang 'gal la /
translated: it would contradict the Vaiśeṣika assertion that the possessor of parts is partless.

original: yan lag can de yan lag dag la bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug pa zhes bya ba brtag pa phyi ma la ni yan lag can mang po nyid du 'gyur bas bye brag pa dag nyid yan lag can gcig nyid du 'dod pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir bye
analyzed: yan lag can de yan lag dag la bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug pa zhes bya ba brtag pa phyi ma la ni yan lag can mang po nyid du 'gyur bas bye brag pa dag nyid yan lag can gcig nyid du 'dod pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir bye
translated: In the latter analysis, since the possessor of parts would be manifold, it would contradict the Vaiśeṣika assertion that the possessor of parts is one.

original: brag pa dag gis yan lag dang yan lag can de la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brag pa dag gis yan lag dang yan lag can de la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Vaiśeṣikas should not form a conception of the possessor of parts and parts.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa'i dang por gtan tshigs smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo
