analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa'i dang por gtan tshigs smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo
translated: Here the meaning of the chapter is that since the opponent asserts that the aggregates and so on exist, the first chapter states that the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The conclusion is that the agent and action are shown to be essenceless.🔽This is the result of valid cognition.

original: byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa brgyad pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol pos phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di'i
analyzed: byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa brgyad pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol pos phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di'i
translated: In this chapter, the eighth chapter, the analysis of the agent and action, the meaning of the chapter is seen to be the result of valid cognition.

original: dang por don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dang por don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The opponent asserts that the aggregates and so on exist essentially.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i gtan @191a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i gtan @191a * //
translated: Because the Bhagavān, in dependence on them, taught the agent and action.

original: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the meaning of the syllogism is stated to be unestablished, it teaches that the agent and action are essenceless.

original: byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes bya ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes bya ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste
translated: To show what the benefit is of teaching that the agent and action are essenceless, and to show that this teaching of the essencelessness of the agent and action is not a mere dry scholastic exercise, but is rather a teaching that is to be practiced, the text says that it is to be established by means of a scriptural source that inspires confidence.

original: / de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' dag las /
analyzed: / de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' dag las /
translated: Therefore, all of the Mahāyāna sūtras

original: lus dang ngag dang yid dag gis mngon par 'dus byed pa med pa ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' 'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dag grub pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid dag gis mngon par 'dus byed pa med pa ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' 'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dag grub pa yin te /
translated: The absence of mental activity with body, speech, and mind is right action.

original: des ni byed pa po dang las gnyi ga ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i khungs bstan to //
analyzed: des ni byed pa po dang las gnyi ga ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i khungs bstan to //
translated: This passage proves that neither the agent nor the action has any essence.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the same way, the Perfection of Wisdom in a Hundred Thousand Lines in the chapter “Requested by Suvikrāntavikrāmin” says:

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la byed pa po'am byed du 'jug pa po med do //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la byed pa po'am byed du 'jug pa po med do //
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin, there is no agent in form, nor is there anything that causes action.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la byed pa po'am byed du 'jug pa po med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la byed pa po'am byed du 'jug pa po med do //
translated: There is no agent in feeling, in perception, in volitional factors, or in consciousness, nor is there anything that causes action.

original: gzugs la byed pa po'am byed du 'jug pa po med pa dang / tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la byed pa po'am /
analyzed: gzugs la byed pa po'am byed du 'jug pa po med pa dang / tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la byed pa po'am /
translated: There is no agent in form, nor is there anything that causes action; there is no agent in feeling, in perception, in volitional factors, or in consciousness, nor is there anything that causes action.

original: byed du 'jug pa po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las /
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las /
translated: And likewise, in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, the Blessed Lady says:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ma bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ma bgyis pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is not made.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽“Śāradvatīputra, it is because the creator is not apprehended.”

original: shar dva ti'i bu byed pa po de dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa dag grub pa yin te /
analyzed: shar dva ti'i bu byed pa po de dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa dag grub pa yin te /
translated: This passage proves that the creator is essenceless.

original: de dag gis ni byed pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i khungs bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni byed pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i khungs bstan to //
translated: These passages show the sources that prove that the creator is essenceless.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Similarly, in the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines, the Blessed Lady says:

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni dge ba'am mi dge ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni dge ba'am mi dge ba ma yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, form is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa yang dge ba'am mi dge ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa yang dge ba'am mi dge ba ma yin no //
translated: Feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are not virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: gzugs dge ba'am mi dge ba ma yin pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa dge ba'am mi dge ba ma yin pa gang yin @191b pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes
analyzed: gzugs dge ba'am mi dge ba ma yin pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa dge ba'am mi dge ba ma yin pa gang yin @191b pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes
translated: That form is not virtuous or nonvirtuous, and that feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are not virtuous or nonvirtuous is the perfection of wisdom.

original: bya bas ni las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i khungs bstan to //
analyzed: bya bas ni las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i khungs bstan to //
translated: This passage shows that the scriptures that prove that action lacks entityness are established.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan yin te /
translated: The establishment of those scriptures that inspire confidence is the quality of the teaching that agents and actions lack entityness.

original: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyis byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyis byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore I have not taught that agents and actions lack entityness through mere dry sophistry of my own invention.

original: 'di ltar lung de dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar lung de dag kyang yod do //
translated: Thus, these scriptures exist.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las byed pa po dang las la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsungs pa de dag 'dir bstan bcos 'dis rab tu grub par bsgrubs pa ni slob dpon gyi zhal
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las byed pa po dang las la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsungs pa de dag 'dir bstan bcos 'dis rab tu grub par bsgrubs pa ni slob dpon gyi zhal
translated: Since the agent, action, and so on are said to be essenceless in the limitless Mahayana sutras, the master Nagarjuna's treatise, the Finely Woven, establishes that.

original: snga nas kyis mkhyen rlabs yin no //🔽slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: snga nas kyis mkhyen rlabs yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: This was composed by the master Nagarjuna.

original: byed pa po dang las brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa brgyad pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa brgyad pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the eighth chapter, the analysis of the agent and action, in the root text of the glorious wisdom lamp, composed by the master Bhavaviveka.

original: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba
analyzed: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the appropriator and the appropriated are essenceless, the ninth chapter is begun in order to refute the special attributes that are discordant with emptiness.

original: la / dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
analyzed: la / dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
translated: The word “power” in the phrase “in order to demonstrate that the appropriator and the appropriated are essenceless, the ninth chapter is begun in order to refute the special attributes that are discordant with emptiness” should be understood to have the sense of a promise, and it should be understood to be related to the text that follows.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no // de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The meaning of the words is as before.🔽In this context, the promise is as follows.

original: da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the appropriator and the appropriated are essenceless, the ninth chapter is begun in order to refute the special attributes that are discordant with emptiness.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas 'dir yang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas 'dir yang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du
translated: The treatise was composed by the author of the treatise, who in the first chapter of the examination of conditions made the assertion that all things are unproduced.🔽

original: byas nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: Since the treatise author, in the first chapter of the Treatise on the Middle Way, set forth the thesis that all things are unarisen, here he is speaking in terms of the reason for engaging in that thesis, as it was set forth in the treatise.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Emptiness is his own position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The position of the opponent, who is not in accord with that, is as follows.

original: 'di lta ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: The opponent asserts that the aggregates, constituents, and sources exist by their own entities.🔽The “distinction” is the opponent’s prior position that proves the existence of the aggregates, constituents, and sources.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'og nas /
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'og nas /
translated: The opponent’s position is stated below:🔽Seeing, hearing, and so on,

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor sogs dang @192a * //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor sogs dang @192a * //
translated: and feeling and so on,

original: yang dbang byas pa //
analyzed: yang dbang byas pa //
translated: are controlled.

original: gang gi yin pa de dag gi / snga rol de yod kha cig smra //
analyzed: gang gi yin pa de dag gi / snga rol de yod kha cig smra //
translated: Some say that it exists prior to them.

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If things do not exist,

original: lta la sogs pa ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could seeing, etc. exist?

original: de phyir de dag snga rol na //
analyzed: de phyir de dag snga rol na //
translated: Therefore, prior to them,

original: dngos po gnas pa de yod do //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa de yod do //
translated: the enduring thing exists.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang zag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba dag yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang zag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba dag yin no //
translated: Thus, some assert that the appropriator and the appropriated exist inherently, and they adduce such arguments as “prior to them” as proofs that the person exists.

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The refutation of that is as follows: The ninth chapter is composed in order to refute that.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa dgu pa rtsom zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa dgu pa rtsom zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In terms of the meaning of the passage that will be cited later, the ninth chapter is composed in order to demonstrate that the appropriator and the appropriated are essenceless.

original: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dgu pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dgu pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du
translated: The meaning of the following passage from the ninth chapter of the Root Verses on the Middle Way, which analyzes the appropriator and the appropriated, is that since the appropriator and the appropriated are shown to be essenceless,

original: byas nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: byas nas de skad smras so //
translated: it is said from that point of view.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin //
translated: What is the result of this chapter?

original: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: By what mode is that result attained?

original: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The result is the demonstration that the appropriator and the appropriated are essenceless.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: Since that result is attained by the mode of refuting the specific attributes that are discordant with emptiness, the author of the commentary first taught the result, which is the means and that which arises from the means, in this context of the transition to the next chapter.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The following is stated in order to show the specific counter-correlate of emptiness.

original: rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par /
translated: In the immediately preceding chapter, it says:

original: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: Likewise, understand appropriation.

original: zhes smos pa der /
analyzed: zhes smos pa der /
translated: There, it explains:🔽The appropriator, which is a real existent, does not appropriate the appropriated, which is a real existent, nor does it appropriate the appropriated, which is an unreal existent, nor does it appropriate the appropriated, which is both a real and unreal existent.

original: nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa dang / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa nye bar blang ba yin par gyur pa dang ma yin par gyur pa dang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed do zhes bshad pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa dang / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa nye bar blang ba yin par gyur pa dang ma yin par gyur pa dang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed do zhes bshad pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: Here, in response to that, it says, “Here, some say,” and so on.

original: smras te / rang gi sde pa dag don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: smras te / rang gi sde pa dag don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Our schools say that ultimately the aggregates, constituents, and sources exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las dag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs sun dbyung ba'i zhar la byed pa dang las brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las dag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs sun dbyung ba'i zhar la byed pa dang las brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par /
translated: In that chapter it says,

original: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: Understand appropriation in the same way.

original: zhes smos pas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag dgag pa'i phyogs rnam pa dgus de dag @192b bkag tu zin kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa rang gi sde pa dag las /
analyzed: zhes smos pas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag dgag pa'i phyogs rnam pa dgus de dag @192b bkag tu zin kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa rang gi sde pa dag las /
translated: Although the ninefold analysis refutes the appropriator and the appropriated, some of our own schools cling to them.🔽The Vātsīputrīya school cannot bear that, so they say this.

original: gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore it says:🔽Some say that prior to the appropriator🔽There is seeing, hearing, and so on,

original: de'i phyir / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor sogs dang yang dbang byas pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor sogs dang yang dbang byas pa //
translated: And feeling and so on,

original: gang gi yin pa de dag gi / snga rol de yod kha cig smra //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gang gi yin pa de dag gi / snga rol de yod kha cig smra //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Which are controlled by it.

original: de la lta zhes bya ba ni 'dis lta bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la lta zhes bya ba ni 'dis lta bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: The term “seeing” is explained as follows: “It is seeing because it causes seeing.”

original: byed pa po bdag snga na gnas pa de byed pa mig 'dis lta bar byed pa'i phyir mig ni lta ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: byed pa po bdag snga na gnas pa de byed pa mig 'dis lta bar byed pa'i phyir mig ni lta ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the explanation of the agent. The self, which is the prior basis, is the agent. The eye is the instrument because it causes seeing.🔽The same applies to hearing and so on.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: nyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni nyan pa dang snom pa dang myong bar byed pa dang reg par byed pa dang yid ches bya ba dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni nyan pa dang snom pa dang myong bar byed pa dang reg par byed pa dang yid ches bya ba dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi dang por lta ba dang nyan pa bstan pa dag go zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni snom pa dang myong bar byed pa dang reg par byad pa dang yid ces bya ba gang dag gi dang🔽po lta ba dang nyan pa bstan pa de dag ni /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi dang por lta ba dang nyan pa bstan pa dag go zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni snom pa dang myong bar byed pa dang reg par byad pa dang yid ces bya ba gang dag gi dang🔽po lta ba dang nyan pa bstan pa de dag ni /
translated: The term “and so on” refers to the nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The term “and so on” refers to the

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // zhes bya ba yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // zhes bya ba yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: Seeing, hearing, etc.

original: des dbang po drug car bsdus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des dbang po drug car bsdus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the six sense faculties.

original: tshor zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba yin no //🔽sogs zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa dang sems pa la sogs pa gang dag gi dang por tshor ba bstan pa dag go zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs gang dag gi dang por tshor
analyzed: tshor zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba yin no // sogs zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa dang sems pa la sogs pa gang dag gi dang por tshor ba bstan pa dag go zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs gang dag gi dang por tshor
translated: The word “feeling” is vedanā.🔽The word “etc.” includes consciousness, contact, mental attention, and volition, etc.🔽The word “etc.” includes the aggregates of form, consciousness, and the mental factors, which are the first of those aggregates in which feeling is taught.

original: ba bstan pa de dag ni tshor sogs zhes bya ba yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te des ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba bstan pa de dag ni tshor sogs zhes bya ba yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te des ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “etc.” includes all dharmas that are mental or associated with the mind.

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun bsdu ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni smras pa dang ma smras pa kun bsdu ba'i don te /
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun bsdu ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni smras pa dang ma smras pa kun bsdu ba'i don te /
translated: The word “and” has the sense of including all, meaning including both what is stated and what is not stated.

original: smras pa ni lta ba dang nyan pa dang tshor ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa ni lta ba dang nyan pa dang tshor ba'o //
translated: What is stated is seeing, hearing, and feeling.

original: ma smras pa ni dbang po dang sems dang sems las byung ba lhag ma rnams te /
analyzed: ma smras pa ni dbang po dang sems dang sems las byung ba lhag ma rnams te /
translated: What is not stated is the remaining faculties, mind, and mental factors.

original: de dag kun 'dir bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag kun 'dir bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “and” is to include all of those here.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yid ches pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang sems dang sems las byung ba lhag ma 'dir bsdu ba dag kyang 'di'i khongs su gtogs pa yin par yid ches pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yid ches pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang sems dang sems las byung ba lhag ma 'dir bsdu ba dag kyang 'di'i khongs su gtogs pa yin par yid ches pa'i don to //
translated: The word “also” has the sense of confidence, meaning that the remaining faculties, mind, and mental factors that are included here are included in this category.

original: dbang byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbang du byas pa la 'jug pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'di ni dbang @193a * //
analyzed: dbang byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbang du byas pa la 'jug pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'di ni dbang @193a * //
translated: The word “dominance” is used in the sense of being controlled, meaning that the first half of this verse is about the eye faculty.

original: po dang sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad bsdu ba'i dbang du byas pa yin pas de la 'jug pa'i don te /
analyzed: po dang sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad bsdu ba'i dbang du byas pa yin pas de la 'jug pa'i don te /
translated: Because it is the domain of the mind and mental factors, it is the meaning of engagement.

original: des na tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis dbang po drug dang rnam par shes pa drug dang sems dang sems las byung ba mang po pa thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis dbang po drug dang rnam par shes pa drug dang sems dang sems las byung ba mang po pa thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus the first half of the verse means that the six sense faculties, six consciousnesses, and many mental factors are all included.🔽Therefore some say: “Prior to those eyes and so on,🔽those feelings and so on, and that appropriator exists.”🔽Those eyes and so on, those feelings and so on, and that appropriator exist.

original: de'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa de dag nye bar len pa po gang gi yin pa'i lta ba la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa de dag gi snga rol na nye bar lon pa po de yod do zhes kha cig smra ste zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa dbang po drug dang /🔽rnam par shes pa drug dang / sems las byung ba sa mang po pa thams cad ni nye bar blang ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa de dag nye bar len pa po gang gi yin pa'i lta ba la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa de dag gi snga rol na nye bar lon pa po de yod do zhes kha cig smra ste zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa dbang po drug dang /🔽rnam par shes pa drug dang / sems las byung ba sa mang po pa thams cad ni nye bar blang ba yin la /
translated: Some say: “Prior to those eyes and so on, those feelings and so on, and that appropriator exists.”

original: bdag snga na gnas pa zhes bya ba gang zag ni nye bar len pa po yin pas de'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba de dag gang zag nye bar len pa po gang gi nye bar blang ba yin pa'i lta ba la sogs pa
analyzed: bdag snga na gnas pa zhes bya ba gang zag ni nye bar len pa po yin pas de'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba de dag gang zag nye bar len pa po gang gi nye bar blang ba yin pa'i lta ba la sogs pa
translated: because the appropriator is the person and the appropriated is the eyes and so on.

original: nye bar blang ba de dag gi snga rol na gang zag nye bar len pa po de yod do zhes kha cig smra ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba de dag gi snga rol na gang zag nye bar len pa po de yod do zhes kha cig smra ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Some say: The appropriator exists prior to the appropriated.

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni rang gi sde pa thams cad kyis de ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir gnas ma'i bu'i sde ba dag ste /
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni rang gi sde pa thams cad kyis de ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir gnas ma'i bu'i sde ba dag ste /
translated: Some means the Vātsīputrīya because all Buddhist schools do not accept that.

original: de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar ston to zhes bya bas ni nye bar blang ba'i snga rol na nye bar len pa po yod do zhes kha cig smra ba ni rang gi sde pa thams cad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar ston to zhes bya bas ni nye bar blang ba'i snga rol na nye bar len pa po yod do zhes kha cig smra ba ni rang gi sde pa thams cad ma yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “they say” indicates that not all Buddhist schools say that the appropriator exists prior to the appropriated.

original: nyan thos gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag de skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag de skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: The Sravakas of the Vatsiputriya school say this.🔽This is the opponent's position,

original: de ni pha rol pos dam bcas pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa po nye bar blang ba'i snga rol na yod do zhes zer ba de ni phyogs snga ma smra ba dag gi dam bcas pa nye bar gzhag pa
analyzed: de ni pha rol pos dam bcas pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa po nye bar blang ba'i snga rol na yod do zhes zer ba de ni phyogs snga ma smra ba dag gi dam bcas pa nye bar gzhag pa
translated: the opponent's thesis,

original: ste phyogs yin no //
analyzed: ste phyogs yin no //
translated: the opponent's position.

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpes rjes su dpag pa ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpes rjes su dpag pa ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The proof and the example of the inference will be taught later.

original: de dag 'di skad ces zer te /🔽'di ltar nye bar len pa po gnas na nye bar blang ba de dag shes par byar rung ste /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces zer te / 'di ltar nye bar len pa po gnas na nye bar blang ba de dag shes par byar rung ste /
translated: They say this:🔽The appropriator exists prior to the appropriation, because the appropriation is suitable to be known by it.

original: de la ltos nas de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bstan te /
analyzed: de la ltos nas de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bstan te /
translated: This shows the application of the proof by concomitance.

original: des ni sgrub pa'i chos ston to //
analyzed: des ni sgrub pa'i chos ston to //
translated: This teaches the probandum.

original: gzhan du dam bcas na /
analyzed: gzhan du dam bcas na /
translated: If you assert otherwise,

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
translated: then the entity does not exist.

original: lta la sogs pa ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could there be seeing, etc. ?

original: zhes bya bas ni ldog pa'i sgo nas nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni ldog pa'i sgo nas nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bstan te /
translated: This shows the application of the syllogism by way of the contrapositive.

original: des ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ston to //
analyzed: des ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ston to //
translated: This teaches the example of similarity.

original: des na / de phyir de dag snga rol na //
analyzed: des na / de phyir de dag snga rol na //
translated: Therefore, prior to them,

original: dngos po gnas pa de yod do //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa de yod do //
translated: the enduring thing exists.🔽This is the concluding statement.

original: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa nye bar gzhag pa'i @193b mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa nye bar gzhag pa'i @193b mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Thus, the conclusion is the statement of the thesis and the result of the valid cognition.🔽Therefore, as before, what is the inference by way of the evidence and example?

original: de lta bas na snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs dang dpe mngon pas rjes su dpag pa ci zhes bya ba ni ci ltar sngar don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te zhes dam bcas pa la gtan tshigs dang
analyzed: de lta bas na snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs dang dpe mngon pas rjes su dpag pa ci zhes bya ba ni ci ltar sngar don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te zhes dam bcas pa la gtan tshigs dang
translated: This is the question. As before, the thesis is stated: “In reality, the aggregates, elements, and faculties certainly exist.” The evidence and example are stated:

original: dpe dag yod pa de bzhin du 'dir nye bar len pa po nye bar blang ba'i snga rol na yod par dam bcas pa la yang rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bstan pas ni nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: dpe dag yod pa de bzhin du 'dir nye bar len pa po nye bar blang ba'i snga rol na yod par dam bcas pa la yang rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bstan pas ni nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir ro
translated: Just as in the example, so too, in the case of the thesis that the appropriator exists prior to the appropriated, the syllogism is stated by way of the forward process, “because of being an appropriator.”🔽The syllogism is stated by way of the reverse process, “because of being an appropriator,” and the example is stated by way of the forward process, “just as a weaver exists prior to the cloth and so on.”🔽The syllogism is stated by way of the reverse process, “because of being an appropriator,” and the example is stated by way of the forward process, “just as a weaver exists prior to the cloth and so on.”

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs mngon la ldog pa'i sgo nas nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bstan pas ni dper na sab ma mkhan rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe mngon pas 'dir rjes su dpag🔽pa ni 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs mngon la ldog pa'i sgo nas nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bstan pas ni dper na sab ma mkhan rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe mngon pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The syllogism is stated by way of the reverse process, “because of being an appropriator,” and the example is stated by way of the forward process, “just as a weaver exists prior to the cloth and so on.”🔽The syllogism is stated by way of the reverse process, “because of being an appropriator,” and the example is stated by way of the forward process, “just as a weaver exists prior to the cloth and so on.”🔽The syllogism is stated by way of the reverse process, “because of being an appropriator,” and the example is stated by way of the forward process, “just as a weaver exists prior to the cloth and so on.”🔽The syllogism is stated by way of the reverse process, “because of being an appropriator,” and the example is stated by way of the forward process, “just as a weaver exists prior to the cloth and so on.”🔽The syllogism is stated by way of the reverse process, “because of being an appropriator,” and the example is stated by way of the forward process, “just as a weaver exists prior to the cloth and so on.”🔽The syllogism is stated by way of the reverse process, “because of being an appropriator,” and the example is stated by way of the forward process, “just as a weaver exists prior to the cloth and so on.”🔽The syllogism is stated by way of the reverse process, “because of being an appropriator,” and the example is stated by way of the forward process, “just as a weaver exists prior to the cloth and so on.”

original: nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa'i pha rol na gnas pa yod de nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di na gang nye bar len pa po yin pa de ni nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na gnas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa'i pha rol na gnas pa yod de nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di na gang nye bar len pa po yin pa de ni nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na gnas pa kho na yin te /
translated: The syllogism is stated by way of the reverse process, “because of being an appropriator,” and the example is stated by way of the forward process,

original: dper na sab ma mkhan rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: dper na sab ma mkhan rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, the application of the syllogism,

original: chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and the example of a similar class are applied in order.

original: 'di na gang nye bar len pa po yin pa de ni nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na gnas pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: 'di na gang nye bar len pa po yin pa de ni nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na gnas pa kho na yin pas /
translated: Here, one who is an appropriator exists prior to the appropriated.

original: dper na sab ma mkhan ni nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir rtsi rkyang la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag pa'i snga rol na gnas pa yin pa de bzhin du gang zag nye bar len pa po de yang nye bar len pa po yin pa'i
analyzed: dper na sab ma mkhan ni nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir rtsi rkyang la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag pa'i snga rol na gnas pa yin pa de bzhin du gang zag nye bar len pa po de yang nye bar len pa po yin pa'i
translated: For example, a weaver exists prior to such things as thread, which are appropriated because he is an appropriator. In the same way, the person who is an appropriator exists prior to the aggregates, which are appropriated because he is an appropriator.

original: phyir lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na gnas pa kho na yin no 'dir gal te dbu ma dag na re khyod kyis gang zag nye bar lan pa po phyogs su byas pas de kho bo cag la ma grub pa'i phyir
analyzed: phyir lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na gnas pa kho na yin no 'dir gal te dbu ma dag na re khyod kyis gang zag nye bar lan pa po phyogs su byas pas de kho bo cag la ma grub pa'i phyir
translated: Here, if Madhyamikas say, “Since you posit the person as the appropriator, it is not established for us.

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa dang / gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa dang / gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, any of your reasons have the fault of being unestablished or having an unestablished basis,”🔽then in order to dispel that, the other inference positing the appropriated as the subject is stated:

original: yang na lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag ni nye bar len pa po snga na gnas pa dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag ni nye bar len pa po snga na gnas pa dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
translated: Or the appropriated such as seeing and hearing are known to possess the appropriator that exists prior to them

original: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas nye bar blang ba phyogs su byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan bstan te /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas nye bar blang ba phyogs su byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan bstan te /
translated: because they are appropriated, like a rope and so on.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason and the example.

original: @194a * // dper na rtsi kyang la sogs pa dag ni nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po sab ma mkhan sdan gnas pa dang ldan par shes par bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: @194a * // dper na rtsi kyang la sogs pa dag ni nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po sab ma mkhan sdan gnas pa dang ldan par shes par bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, since the cloth is that which is appropriated, it is known to be possessed by the appropriator, the weaver.

original: lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa dag kyang nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po gang zag sdan na gnas pa dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa dag kyang nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po gang zag sdan na gnas pa dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, since seeing, hearing and so on are that which is appropriated, it is known that the appropriator, the person, possesses them.

original: de'i phyir nye bar blang ba nye bar len par byed pa nyid kyis nye bar len pa po nye bar len pa po zhes grags par 'gyur zhing nye bar len pa pos nye bar blang ba nyid kyis kyang nye bar blang ba nye bar blang ba zhes grags
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar blang ba nye bar len par byed pa nyid kyis nye bar len pa po nye bar len pa po zhes grags par 'gyur zhing nye bar len pa pos nye bar blang ba nyid kyis kyang nye bar blang ba nye bar blang ba zhes grags
translated: Therefore, since the appropriated is the appropriator, the appropriator is known as the appropriator and since the appropriator is the appropriated, the appropriated is known as the appropriated.

original: par 'gyur bas gnyi ga 'grub bo zhes bya ba dag ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma gnyis kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: par 'gyur bas gnyi ga 'grub bo zhes bya ba dag ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma gnyis kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: This is the conclusion of the two previous inferences,

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: and they are to be applied in order.

original: des na kho bo cag gis don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: des na kho bo cag gis don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, since we have said, “In reality, the aggregates and so on exist,🔽because the Bhagavān taught the appropriator and that appropriated in dependence on them,” then that statement is not undermined.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the result of valid knowledge.

original: de ltar nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba yod pas grub pa des na kho bo cag gis sngar byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i dang por de skad ces dam bcas pa de nyams pa med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba yod pas grub pa des na kho bo cag gis sngar byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i dang por de skad ces dam bcas pa de nyams pa med do zhes zer te /
translated: Since the appropriator and that appropriated exist in this way, the result is that the thesis we stated earlier in the first chapter, “Examination of the Agent and Action,” is not undermined.

original: de ni phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the opponent’s position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary🔽says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:🔽Prior to seeing, hearing, etc.

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor la sogs pa nyid kyi ni //🔽snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor la sogs pa nyid kyi ni // snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //
translated: and feeling, etc.🔽what is the thing that endures?

original: de ni gang gis gdags par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //🔽de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang med na gang dag la brten nas 'di nye bar len pa po'o zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed pa'i nye bar blang ba gzhan 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba smras te
analyzed: de ni gang gis gdags par bya // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang med na gang dag la brten nas 'di nye bar len pa po'o zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed pa'i nye bar blang ba gzhan 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba smras te
translated: What is it that is imputed?🔽In order to teach just that, he says, “Without seeing, etc. and feeling, etc. there is no other appropriation at all in dependence on which this appropriator is imputed.”

original: / lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag la brten nas bdag snga na gnas pa de nye bar len pa po yin no zhes nye bar gdags pa yin na /
analyzed: / lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag la brten nas bdag snga na gnas pa de nye bar len pa po yin no zhes nye bar gdags pa yin na /
translated: If the self that endures prior to seeing, etc. and feeling, etc. is the appropriator, then it would be tenable to say that the self is the appropriator in dependence on the appropriated, seeing, etc. and feeling, etc.

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag med pa'i snga rol na gang dag la brten nas 'di nye bar len pa'o zhes bya bar 'dogs par byed pa'i nye bar blang ba gzhan 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag med pa'i snga rol na gang dag la brten nas 'di nye bar len pa'o zhes bya bar 'dogs par byed pa'i nye bar blang ba gzhan 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Prior to seeing and so on, there is no appropriator at all that is different from them and in dependence on which they are designated as appropriated.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi dus su lta ba la sogs pa dag nyid kyis de gdags par bya ba yin na lta ba la sogs pa de dag kyang skye ba'i snga rol na med de de dag med na de dag gis gdags🔽par bya zhes bya ba smras so //🔽'dogs pa med na gdags @194b pa yang med pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe nye bar blang ba dag med na de yang med de /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi dus su lta ba la sogs pa dag nyid kyis de gdags par bya ba yin na lta ba la sogs pa de dag kyang skye ba'i snga rol na med de de dag med na de dag gis gdags par bya zhes bya ba smras so // 'dogs pa med na gdags @194b pa yang med pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe nye bar blang ba dag med na de yang med de /
translated: In order to demonstrate that point, he says, If they are designated by those very things such as seeing at the time of conventional usage, then those things such as seeing do not exist prior to arising. If they do not exist, how can they designate the self?🔽He says that if there is no designation, there is no designated object.🔽In order to demonstrate that example, he says, If the appropriated aggregates do not exist, it also does not exist.

original: shing da ba la sogs pa dag med na nags tshal yang med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: shing da ba la sogs pa dag med na nags tshal yang med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Just as if trees do not exist, a forest does not exist.

original: yang na / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs nyid kyi ni //🔽snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //
analyzed: yang na / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs nyid kyi ni // snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //
translated: and feeling and so on,🔽what is the entity that endures?

original: de ni gang gis gdags par bya //
analyzed: de ni gang gis gdags par bya //
translated: By what is it imputed?🔽The meaning is that the appropriator is imputed in dependence on the appropriated.

original: nye bar blang ba la brten nas nye bar len pa po gdags par bya ba nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa gnyis pa 'dis ni lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag la brten nas
analyzed: nye bar blang ba la brten nas nye bar len pa po gdags par bya ba nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa gnyis pa 'dis ni lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag la brten nas
translated: This second verse commentary shows that since the appropriator is imputed in dependence on the appropriated, such as seeing and so on, and the appropriated, such as feeling and so on, the appropriator is imputed in dependence on the appropriated.

original: nye bar len pa po de gdags par bya ba nyid yin pas gang tha snyad du brten nas gdags pa de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa ston to //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po de gdags par bya ba nyid yin pas gang tha snyad du brten nas gdags pa de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa ston to //
translated: Therefore it shows the intention that that which is imputed in dependence on convention has no intrinsic reality ultimately.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni nye bar len pa po'i chos brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid bstan to zhes bya bas ni chos can nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med par bsgrubs pa'i phyogs
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni nye bar len pa po'i chos brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid bstan to zhes bya bas ni chos can nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med par bsgrubs pa'i phyogs
translated: Thus, this passage teaches that the appropriator is dependently imputed.

original: kyi chos ni brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: kyi chos ni brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The property of the subject that is established is that it is dependently imputed.

original: de'i phyir / snga ma bzhin du yan lag lhag ma mngon pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe mngon pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / snga ma bzhin du yan lag lhag ma mngon pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar te / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe mngon pas so //
translated: Therefore, as before, the remaining limbs are supplied, and the syllogism is to be applied as follows:

original: nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med de /
translated: The subject, the appropriator, does not exist prior to the appropriated such as seeing,🔽because it does not exist without them.

original: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proving property, and the example are respectively applied to the statement, “For example, a cloth does not exist prior to its cause, thread.”🔽For example, a cloth is imputed in dependence on its cause, thread, and therefore it does not exist prior to its cause, thread.

original: dper na snam bu ni rgyu spun dag la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa de bzhin du nye bar len pa po de nye bar blang ba dag la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir🔽nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med do //🔽des na nye bar len pa po ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs de nyid kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon nam /
analyzed: dper na snam bu ni rgyu spun dag la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa de bzhin du nye bar len pa po de nye bar blang ba dag la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med do // des na nye bar len pa po ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs de nyid kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon nam /
translated: In the same way, the appropriator is imputed in dependence on the appropriated, and therefore it does not exist prior to the appropriated.🔽Therefore, because the appropriator is not established, the fault that the reason is not established is the meaning of that statement.

original: don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The fault that the meaning is contradictory is the meaning of that statement.

original: de ltar nye bar len pa po ma grub pa'i phyir gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gi rjes su dpag pa rnam gnyis ci skad smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don de dag don dam par sgrub na ni ma grub pa'i skyon chags pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pa po ma grub pa'i phyir gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gi rjes su dpag pa rnam gnyis ci skad smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don de dag don dam par sgrub na ni ma grub pa'i skyon chags pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, since the appropriator is not established, if the two inferences of the Vātsīputrīya are stated in terms of the meaning of the reason, then if they are established ultimately, they are just faulty because they are not established.

original: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon chags pa yin no //🔽don dam par sab ma mkhan dang rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag kyang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba nyid du @195a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon chags pa yin no // don dam par sab ma mkhan dang rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag kyang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba nyid du @195a * //
translated: If they are established conventionally, then they are faulty because they are contradictory.🔽Since weavers, bamboo workers, and so on are not established as the appropriator and the appropriated ultimately, there is no example.

original: ma grub pa'i phyir dpe yang med do zhes bya bas ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gi dpes pa ma mkhan dang rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes bya ba ma grub par bstan to //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i phyir dpe yang med do zhes bya bas ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gi dpes pa ma mkhan dang rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes bya ba ma grub par bstan to //
translated: This teaches that the example of the Vātsīputrīya, “like weavers, bamboo workers, and so on,” is not established.

original: yang gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba ni de dag las gang dag rjes su dpag pa med par lung tsam gyis gang zag yod pa nyid du zhugs pa de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar
analyzed: yang gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba ni de dag las gang dag rjes su dpag pa med par lung tsam gyis gang zag yod pa nyid du zhugs pa de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar
translated: “Some of the Vātsīputrīya say that it is refuted” means that some of them who assert the existence of the person on the basis of scripture alone, without inference, say this.

original: sbyar ro // de'i phyir de dag na re /🔽lung las nye bar len pa po lhar gyur pa snga na gnas pa yod pa lhar 'gyur pa'i las yongs su zad pas mi la sogs pa'i phung po nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po nyid du 'gyur bar grags pas rjes su dpag pas nye bar
analyzed: sbyar ro // de'i phyir de dag na re / lung las nye bar len pa po lhar gyur pa snga na gnas pa yod pa lhar 'gyur pa'i las yongs su zad pas mi la sogs pa'i phung po nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po nyid du 'gyur bar grags pas rjes su dpag pas nye bar
translated: Therefore they say,

original: len pa po med pa nyid du bstan pa kho bo cag mi 'dod de zhes zer te /
analyzed: len pa po med pa nyid du bstan pa kho bo cag mi 'dod de zhes zer te /
translated: “We do not assert that inference teaches that the appropriator does not exist because it is renowned that the appropriator of the aggregates of humans and so on exists as a god who appropriates them due to the exhaustion of the karma that transforms him into a god.”

original: de dag na re lung las nye bar len pa po sngon lhar gyur pa snga na gnas pa yod pa lhar gyur pa'i las yongs su zad pas mi dang dud 'gro dang yi dags  dang sems can dmyal ba'i phung po nye bar blang ba'i nye bar
analyzed: de dag na re lung las nye bar len pa po sngon lhar gyur pa snga na gnas pa yod pa lhar gyur pa'i las yongs su zad pas mi dang dud 'gro dang yi dags  dang sems can dmyal ba'i phung po nye bar blang ba'i nye bar
translated: Some say: A prior existent appropriator who was a god appropriates the aggregates of humans, animals, ghosts and hell beings due to the exhaustion of karma that was a god.🔽

original: len pa po nyid du 'gyur bar grags te /
analyzed: len pa po nyid du 'gyur bar grags te /
translated: They say that scripture declares that the appropriator exists prior to the appropriated, that the appropriator of the aggregates of humans, animals, ghosts and hell beings is the one who previously existed as a god, and that he appropriates them due to the exhaustion of the karma of the gods.🔽Thus, scripture declares, “At that time, at that period of time, he was the lord of the gods, Śakra.”

original: de ltar yang lung las de nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na lha'i dbang po brgya byin du gyur to zhes gsungs pas khyed dbu ma pas nye bar len pa po snga na gnas pa med par bstan pa de kho bo cag mi 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang lung las de nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na lha'i dbang po brgya byin du gyur to zhes gsungs pas khyed dbu ma pas nye bar len pa po snga na gnas pa med par bstan pa de kho bo cag mi 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, you Mādhyamikas do not accept that the appropriator exists prior to the appropriated.

original: don de nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir slob dpon bhattri ha ris rjes su dpag pa sun phyung ba'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /🔽long ba rkang pa'i tshod dpag gis //
analyzed: don de nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir slob dpon bhattri ha ris rjes su dpag pa sun phyung ba'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir / long ba rkang pa'i tshod dpag gis //
translated: In order to dispel that meaning, master Bhāviveka teaches a source that refutes inference.🔽Like a blind man running on a dangerous path

original: nyam da'i lam du rgyug pa ltar //
analyzed: nyam da'i lam du rgyug pa ltar //
translated: by guessing the distance between his feet,

original: rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin pa //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin pa //
translated: those who hold inference to be primary

original: rnam par lhung ba mi dka'o //
analyzed: rnam par lhung ba mi dka'o //
translated: It is not difficult for them to fall.

original: zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: dper na long ba rkang ba'i tshod dpag gis lam bde ba spangs te nyam nga'i lam du rgyug pa shing la sogs pa dag gis brdos pa la rdeg 'cha' zhing rnam par ltung ba mi dkar ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na long ba rkang ba'i tshod dpag gis lam bde ba spangs te nyam nga'i lam du rgyug pa shing la sogs pa dag gis brdos pa la rdeg 'cha' zhing rnam par ltung ba mi dkar ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a blind person, having abandoned the path of happiness, which is measured by the length of his legs, runs on a difficult path and is beaten by trees and so on, and it is not difficult for him to fall.

original: yid ches pa'i lung spangs pa rjes su dpag pa'i tshod dpag gis rtog ge skam po'i lam du rgyug pa dag kyang tshe 'di la yang 'khrul pa'i gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung spangs pa rjes su dpag pa'i tshod dpag gis rtog ge skam po'i lam du rgyug pa dag kyang tshe 'di la yang 'khrul pa'i gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: Similarly, having abandoned the scriptures of trust, those who run on the path of dry logic, which is measured by inference, are harmed by error in this life,

original: tshe phyi ma la yang 'bras bu mi 'dod par rnam par ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la yang 'bras bu mi 'dod par rnam par ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: and in the next life, they will fall without the fruit they desire.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: sgrub pa de ni gang zag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa de ni gang zag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: That proof does not prove the existence of the person.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: lha yab lha'i nye bar blang ba dag nyid la brten nas lha nyid du gdags bar bya ba @195b yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lha yab lha'i nye bar blang ba dag nyid la brten nas lha nyid du gdags bar bya ba @195b yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is said that the self is designated as a god in dependence on the appropriated aggregates of a god.

original: khyed nye bar len pa po lhar gyur pa snga na gnas pa yod pa lhar gyur pa'i las yongs su zad pas mi la sogs pa'i phung po nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po nyid du 'gyur bar 'dod pa de ni lha nyid kyi lta ba
analyzed: khyed nye bar len pa po lhar gyur pa snga na gnas pa yod pa lhar gyur pa'i las yongs su zad pas mi la sogs pa'i phung po nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po nyid du 'gyur bar 'dod pa de ni lha nyid kyi lta ba
translated: You assert that the appropriator of the aggregates of a god who existed previously as a god becomes the appropriator of the aggregates of a human and so on due to the exhaustion of the karma of a god.

original: la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi nye bar len pa po nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi nye bar len pa po nyid yin gyi /
translated: That is the appropriator of the aggregates of a god, such as seeing and so on,

original: mi la sogs pa'i lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi nye bar len pa po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mi la sogs pa'i lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi nye bar len pa po nyid ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the appropriator of the aggregates of seeing and so on of a human and so on.

original: rgyud tha dad pa dang dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa dang dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are different continua and different times.

original: des na nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na nye bar len pa po med do //
analyzed: des na nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na nye bar len pa po med do //
translated: Therefore the appropriator does not exist prior to the appropriated.

original: gzhan yang rkang pa'i tshod dpag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pas rjes su dpag pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir yang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rkang pa'i tshod dpag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pas rjes su dpag pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir yang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, since the analogy of measuring the length of one’s steps also applies to the opponent, it is not established as an inference. Therefore, this is not a correct analogy.

original: khyed na re /🔽long ba rkang pa'i tshod dpag gis //
analyzed: khyed na re / long ba rkang pa'i tshod dpag gis //
translated: You say:🔽Like a blind person who runs on a treacherous path

original: nyam da'i lam du rgyug pa ltar //
analyzed: nyam da'i lam du rgyug pa ltar //
translated: By measuring the length of his steps,

original: rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin pa //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin pa //
translated: Those who hold inference to be primary

original: rnam par ltung ba mi dka'o //
analyzed: rnam par ltung ba mi dka'o //
translated: Will not find it difficult to fall.

original: zhes zer ba'i rkang pa'i tshod dpag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam nyam nga bar 'gro ba yang yod kyi /
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i rkang pa'i tshod dpag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam nyam nga bar 'gro ba yang yod kyi /
translated: The measuring of the length of one’s steps is also an analogy for going on a treacherous path to an opponent.

original: kho bo'i rjes su dpag pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nor ba dag tu 'gro ba med pas des na re zhig rkang ba'i tshod dpag mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam nyam nga ba dag tu 'gro ba lta bur 'gyur ram /
analyzed: kho bo'i rjes su dpag pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nor ba dag tu 'gro ba med pas des na re zhig rkang ba'i tshod dpag mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam nyam nga ba dag tu 'gro ba lta bur 'gyur ram /
translated: But since my inference does not go to an opponent, to a mistaken path, therefore, first, is the measuring of the length of one’s steps an analogy for going on a treacherous path to an opponent?

original: 'on te lung sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs nor ba dag tu mi 'gro ba lta bur 'gyur ba ma nges pas khyod kyi dpe de ma nges pas des na rkang ba'i tshod dpag pa lta bu gang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa
analyzed: 'on te lung sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs nor ba dag tu mi 'gro ba lta bur 'gyur ba ma nges pas khyod kyi dpe de ma nges pas des na rkang ba'i tshod dpag pa lta bu gang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa
translated: Or, if it is a nonobservation sign that is a consequence of a scriptural proof, then it is not definite that it does not proceed to a mistaken object that is discordant with the sign.🔽Therefore, your example is indefinite.🔽Thus, it is not established that whatever exists in the discordant class is a consequence.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid yin par ma grub pa la lung sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa lta bu gang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa de yang rkang pa'i tshod dpag pa lta bu nyid yin par ma grub pas de ni rigs pa ma yin🔽no // gzhan yang /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid yin par ma grub pa la lung sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa lta bu gang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa de yang rkang pa'i tshod dpag pa lta bu nyid yin par ma grub pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no // gzhan yang /
translated: It is also not established that whatever does not exist in the discordant class is like the example of the measure of the foot. Therefore this is not logical.

original: rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba gtsor 'dzin pa ni ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba gtsor 'dzin pa ni ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is illogical because it is a downfall to hold a sign that is a mere semblance of a correct sign.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na dag bstan pa'i 'di ni nor ba med pa'i phyir de dag gtsor 'dzin pa dag ltung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na dag bstan pa'i 'di ni nor ba med pa'i phyir de dag gtsor 'dzin pa dag ltung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The master's own teaching of the clear realization and reality is unerring, so those who hold that as chief do not fall.

original: gzhan dag gi rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba bstan pa gtsor 'dzin bdag ni ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang khyed kyi sgrub pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba bstan pa gtsor 'dzin bdag ni ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang khyed kyi sgrub pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But I, who hold as chief the teaching of the other's fallacious inference, do fall, so your proof is not correct.🔽Moreover, because the scriptures are general, doubt arises, so it is not correct to hold that as chief.

original: gzhan yang / lung spyi yin pas the tshom skye ba'i phyir yang de nyid las nges par gzung ba mi rigs te zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa'i dpal gyi mgur nas gsungs pa'i lung ni spyi yin pas des na khyed pa gang🔽zag yod do zhes gsungs pa yang lung @196a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang / lung spyi yin pas the tshom skye ba'i phyir yang de nyid las nges par gzung ba mi rigs te zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa'i dpal gyi mgur nas gsungs pa'i lung ni spyi yin pas des na khyed pa gang zag yod do zhes gsungs pa yang lung @196a * //
translated: Because the scriptures spoken from the glorious throat of the Bhagavat who realized reality are general, they are not to be held as chief.

original: gcig yin la /
analyzed: gcig yin la /
translated: The statement that the person exists is one scripture.

original: deng la gang zag med do zhes gsungs pa yang lung gnyis pa yin pas de la the tshom skye ba'i phyir lung de nyid las gang zag yod pa 'am med pa nges par gzung ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: deng la gang zag med do zhes gsungs pa yang lung gnyis pa yin pas de la the tshom skye ba'i phyir lung de nyid las gang zag yod pa 'am med pa nges par gzung ba mi rigs te /
translated: The second scriptural passage is the statement, “There is no person.” Since doubt arises with regard to that, it is not correct to ascertain the existence or nonexistence of the person from that scriptural passage alone.

original: lung de sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa las nges par gzung bar rigs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: lung de sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa las nges par gzung bar rigs so zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that it is correct to ascertain the person from the inferential cognition that proves the person.

original: de'i phyir lung dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis don tha dad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis don tha dad pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, scripture and inference are not different in meaning.

original: rjes su dpag pas gang zag med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gang zag med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the person is taught to be nonexistent by inference,

original: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that scripture is not different in meaning from inference.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is the cause for realizing a meaning that is not directly perceived, it is like the nature of inference itself.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi bdag nyid ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lung yang mngon sum ma yin pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi bdag nyid ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lung yang mngon sum ma yin pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i
translated: For example, the nature of inference is not a different object from inference because it is the cause of realizing an object that is not directly perceived.

original: phyir rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa ma yin no //🔽des na sngar kho bos nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med de /
analyzed: phyir rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa ma yin no // des na sngar kho bos nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med de /
