translated: In the same way, scripture is not a different object from inference because it is the cause of realizing an object that is not directly perceived.🔽Therefore, you should understand that the meaning of the previously stated inference is established: The appropriator does not exist prior to that appropriated,

original: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa bstan pa de'i don grub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa bstan pa de'i don grub par shes par bya'o //
translated: because it is the object of designation, just as a cloth does not exist prior to the threads that are its cause.

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag las kha cig rjes su dpag pa la zhe sngad  pa dag dbu ma pas lung dang / rjes su dpag pa don tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa de la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston to//
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag las kha cig rjes su dpag pa la zhe sngad  pa dag dbu ma pas lung dang / rjes su dpag pa don tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa de la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston to//
translated: Some say that the Sūtra master’s statement that scripture and inference are not different in meaning is undermined by the nonerroneous contradiction of the following inference.

original: de'i phyir de dag na re lung gi rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag na re lung gi rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, they say that scripture is definitely different in meaning from inference.

original: de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum bzhin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum bzhin no zhes zer te /
translated: Because the object is different from it, it is like direct perception.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They say that scripture, inference, and direct perception are the three valid cognitions.

original: dper na mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du lung yang rjes su dpag pa de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag la las don🔽tha dad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du lung yang rjes su dpag pa de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag la las don tha dad pa kho na yin no //
translated: Likewise, because scripture is a different object from inference, it is a different object from inference.

original: de nyid brnan pa dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid brnan pa dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To reiterate that and to teach the result of valid knowledge, he says:

original: de ltar yang rjes su dpag pa ni dbang pos gzung ba'i don @196b gyi yul can yin la sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma'i dbang po las 'das pa mtho ris dang byang grol gyi yul can yin pas de'i phyir lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don tha🔽dad pa kho na yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ltar yang rjes su dpag pa ni dbang pos gzung ba'i don @196b gyi yul can yin la sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma'i dbang po las 'das pa mtho ris dang byang grol gyi yul can yin pas de'i phyir lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa kho na yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus inference is a valid knowledge that has as its object a sense object apprehended by the sense faculties, but the valid knowledge characterized by scripture has as its object the sense object of the heavens and liberation that is beyond the sense faculties. Therefore scripture is a different object from inference.

original: lung dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis don tha dad pa kho na yin par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: lung dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis don tha dad pa kho na yin par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: If someone says, “How do you know that scripture and inference are different objects?”

original: rjes su dpag pa ni dbang pos gzung ba'i rtags du ba'i don gyi rtags can me rjes su dpog pa la sogs pa'i yul can yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni dbang pos gzung ba'i rtags du ba'i don gyi rtags can me rjes su dpog pa la sogs pa'i yul can yin la /
translated: Inference is the subject that infers the signifier fire from the sign smoke apprehended by the sense faculty.🔽The subject that specifically understands the object of valid knowledge defined as sound is the subject that specifically understands heaven and nirvana, which are beyond the domain of the sense faculties.

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma zhes bya ba lung gi dbang po'i spyod yul las 'das pa'i mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa bye brag tu rtogs pa'i yul can yin pas de gnyis don tha dad pa kho na yin pa las khyed dbu ma pas de
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma zhes bya ba lung gi dbang po'i spyod yul las 'das pa'i mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa bye brag tu rtogs pa'i yul can yin pas de gnyis don tha dad pa kho na yin pa las khyed dbu ma pas de
translated: Therefore, those two are objects that are completely different.🔽You Madhyamikas teach that those two are not different objects.

original: gnyis don tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnyis don tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: This is a contradiction, a fault that is undeceiving.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las yul tha dad pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las yul tha dad pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Scripture is not a different object from inference.

original: rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par mtho ris rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir dang / rgyu bcad pa las skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid byang grol rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par mtho ris rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir dang / rgyu bcad pa las skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid byang grol rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: You say that the meaning of the reason is not established because the special result, high rebirth, is to be inferred from the special cause, and because the state of liberation, which is characterized by the absence of birth, is to be inferred from the cessation of the cause.

original: khyed na re sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma ni dbang po las 'das pa mtho ris dang byang grol gyi yul can yin pas zhes zer ba de ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang yin pas don tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed na re sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma ni dbang po las 'das pa mtho ris dang byang grol gyi yul can yin pas zhes zer ba de ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang yin pas don tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: You say that the valid knowledge that is the definition of sound is a subject that has as its object the transcendent high rebirth and liberation. But since that is also the object of inference, it is not a different object.

original: 'di ltar lung las rgyu'i khyad par dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te 'jug pa las 'bras bu'i khyad par 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mtho ris 'thob pa dang / rgyu'i khyad par bsam gtan bzhi skyed par byed pa las 'bras bu'i khyad par gzugs na spyod pa'i mtho ris 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung las rgyu'i khyad par dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te 'jug pa las 'bras bu'i khyad par 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mtho ris 'thob pa dang / rgyu'i khyad par bsam gtan bzhi skyed par byed pa las 'bras bu'i khyad par gzugs na spyod pa'i mtho ris 'thob pa dang /
translated: Thus, from scripture, it is said that from the cause, the special feature of taking up the path of the ten virtuous actions, the result, the special feature of obtaining the higher realms of the desire realm, arises.🔽From the cause, the special feature of generating the four absorptions, the result, the special feature of obtaining the higher realms of the form realm, arises.🔽From the cause, the special feature of generating the four formless meditative attainments, the result, the special feature of obtaining the higher realms of the formless realm, arises.

original: rgyu'i khyad par gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi skyed par byed pa las 'bras bu'i khyad par gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mtho ris 'thob par gsungs pa de dag kyang rgyu'i khyad par de dag gis 'bras bu'i khyad par de dag 'thob par rjes su🔽dpag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi skyed par byed pa las 'bras bu'i khyad par gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mtho ris 'thob par gsungs pa de dag kyang rgyu'i khyad par de dag gis 'bras bu'i khyad par de dag 'thob par rjes su🔽dpag par bya ba yin la /
translated: These are to be inferred as the result of those special features of the cause.

original: lung las rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa bcad pa las 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par gsungs pa de yang rgyu'i par da 'bras bu'i khyad par de 'thob par rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir khyed
analyzed: lung las rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa bcad pa las 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par gsungs pa de yang rgyu'i par da 'bras bu'i khyad par de 'thob par rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir khyed
translated: Because the scriptures state that nirvana, which is characterized by the nonarising of effects, is attained from the elimination of the causes, karma and affliction, and because that attainment of the distinction of the effect from the distinction of the cause is to be inferred.

original: kyi gtan tshigs de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid yin pas /🔽kho bos lung dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis yul tha @197a * //
analyzed: kyi gtan tshigs de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid yin pas / kho bos lung dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis yul tha @197a * //
translated: Therefore your reason, “because the object is different,” is not established.

original: dad pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa med do //
analyzed: dad pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa med do //
translated: Therefore there is no error or contradiction in our teaching that scripture and inference are not different objects.

original: yang na mtho ris dang thar pa yod do zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung gang yin pa de ni don ci lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: yang na mtho ris dang thar pa yod do zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung gang yin pa de ni don ci lta ba bzhin te /
translated: Or, the statement “heaven and liberation exist” is a statement of the Tathāgata, and it is just as it is.

original: de brjod pa'i phyir de'i tshig bzhin pas rjes su dpag pa kho nas mtho ris la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid skyon de nyid du 'gyur bas zhes bya bas ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtho ris dang thar pa yod do🔽zhes gsungs pa'i lung gang yin pa de yang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas gzhan dag gis de don ci lta ba bzhin yin par rtogs pa'i phyir lung dang rjes su dpag pa don tha dad pa ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: de brjod pa'i phyir de'i tshig bzhin pas rjes su dpag pa kho nas mtho ris la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid skyon de nyid du 'gyur bas zhes bya bas ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtho ris dang thar pa yod do zhes gsungs pa'i lung gang yin pa de yang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas gzhan dag gis de don ci lta ba bzhin yin par rtogs pa'i phyir lung dang rjes su dpag pa don tha dad pa ma yin par ston te /
translated: In order to express that, since one realizes higher rebirth and so on by means of inference alone, just like the words of that scripture, the meaning of the reason is not established, and that is the fault.🔽Thus he demonstrates that scripture and inference are not different in meaning, because others realize the meaning of that scripture just as it is by means of inference.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: That scripture is the subject, the property to be established is higher rebirth and liberation exist, the property that establishes that is the reason, the example is like the words of that scripture, and the conclusion is that therefore the Tathāgata said that higher rebirth and liberation exist.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pas mtho ris dang thar pa yod do zhes gsungs pa de'i tshig ni mtho ris dang thar pa zhes bya ba'i don de brjod pa yin pa'i phyir don ci lta ba bzhin yin par rjes su dpag par bya ba de bzhin du de🔽bzhin gshegs pas mtho ris dang thar pa yod do zhes gsungs pa'i lung gang yin pa de yang mtho ris dang thar pa zhes bya ba'i don de brjod pa yin pa'i phyir don ci lta ba bzhin yin par rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pas mtho ris dang thar pa yod do zhes gsungs pa de'i tshig ni mtho ris dang thar pa zhes bya ba'i don de brjod pa yin pa'i phyir don ci lta ba bzhin yin par rjes su dpag par bya ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas mtho ris dang thar pa yod do zhes gsungs pa'i lung gang yin pa de yang mtho ris dang thar pa zhes bya ba'i don de brjod pa yin pa'i phyir don ci lta ba bzhin yin par rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pas /
translated: For example, the words of the Tathagata, “There is high rebirth and liberation,” are inferred to be just as they are, because they express the meaning of “high rebirth and liberation.”🔽Likewise, the scriptures of the Tathagata, “There is high rebirth and liberation,” are inferred to be just as they are, because they express the meaning of “high rebirth and liberation.”

original: rjes su dpag pa kho nas mtho ris dang byang grol la sogs pa gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i phyir lung dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis dang tha dad pa ma yin pas khyod kyi gtan tshigs de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa kho nas mtho ris dang byang grol la sogs pa gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i phyir lung dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis dang tha dad pa ma yin pas khyod kyi gtan tshigs de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub
translated: Since high rebirth and liberation are realized by inference alone, scripture and inference are not different. Therefore, your reason, “because the object is different,” is not established.

original: pa nyid kyi skyon nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa nyid kyi skyon nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The error would be just that.

original: de'i phyir de ni rjes su dpag pa la sdang bar ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rjes su dpag pa la sdang bar ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the conclusion: he is teaching that he is hostile to inference.

original: de ltar lung dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis don tha dad pa ma yin pas gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag na re //🔽lung las nye bar len pa po lhar gyur pa snga na gnas pa yod pa lhar 'gyur ba'i las yongs su zad pas mi la sogs pa'i phung po nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po nyid du 'gyur ba grags pas rjes su dpag pas nye bar
analyzed: de ltar lung dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis don tha dad pa ma yin pas gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag na re // lung las nye bar len pa po lhar gyur pa snga na gnas pa yod pa lhar 'gyur ba'i las yongs su zad pas mi la sogs pa'i phung po nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po nyid du 'gyur ba grags pas rjes su dpag pas nye bar
translated: Thus, since scripture and inference are not different in meaning, the Vatsiputrīya say:

original: len pa po med pa nyid du bstan pa kho bo cag mi 'dod de /🔽long ba rkang pa'i tshod dpag gis //
analyzed: len pa po med pa nyid du bstan pa kho bo cag mi 'dod de / long ba rkang pa'i tshod dpag gis //
translated: Since it is well known that a previously existing appropriator of the state of a god appropriates the aggregates of a human and so on when the karma that transforms into the state of a god is exhausted, it is not our position that the teaching of the nonexistence of an appropriator is taught by inference.🔽Just as a blind man runs on a treacherous path

original: nyam nga'i lam du rgyug pa ltar //
analyzed: nyam nga'i lam du rgyug pa ltar //
translated: by measuring the distance with his feet,

original: rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin pa //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin pa //
translated: those who hold inference to be primary

original: rnam par ltung ba mi dka' 'o //
analyzed: rnam par ltung ba mi dka' 'o //
translated: will not find it difficult to fall.

original: zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de ni rjes su dpag pa la sdang bar ston pa'i tshig tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de ni rjes su dpag pa la sdang bar ston pa'i tshig tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Thus, it is said that the opponent’s argument is mere verbal expression that reveals his hatred of inference.

original: des rjes su dpag pa sun 'byin pa ni ma yin no zhes @197b bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des rjes su dpag pa sun 'byin pa ni ma yin no zhes @197b bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not an argument that refutes inference.

original: yang gzhan yang khyod 'dod pa ltar //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang khyod 'dod pa ltar //
translated: Moreover, according to your assertion,

original: lta la sogs pa med par yang //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa med par yang //
translated: even without seeing and so on,

original: gal te de ni gnas gyur na //🔽de med par yang de dag ni //
analyzed: gal te de ni gnas gyur na // de med par yang de dag ni //
translated: if it is the appropriator,🔽then without doubt,

original: yod par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
analyzed: yod par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
translated: seeing and so on would exist even though it does not exist.

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag ste /🔽lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa po la mi ltos pa nye bar blang ba nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni sngar dbu ma pas /🔽lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs nyid kyi ni //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag ste / lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa po la mi ltos pa nye bar blang ba nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni sngar dbu ma pas / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs nyid kyi ni //
translated: Seeing and so on🔽because it proves that seeing and so on are the appropriated without depending on the appropriator.

original: snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //🔽de ni gang gis gdags par bya //
analyzed: snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //🔽de ni gang gis gdags par bya //
translated: The earlier passage from Lucid Words that says, “The Madhyamikas do not accept that things exist essentially even conventionally” is not a refutation of the opponent’s argument.🔽The passage from Lucid Words that says, “The Madhyamikas do not accept that things exist essentially even conventionally” is not a refutation of the opponent’s argument.

original: zhes bshad pas brgal zhing brtag par byas pa yang pha rol pos de'i ga la mi bzod pas skabs 'dir gal te 'di skad ces dngos po de ni lta ba la sogs pa dag med pa yang rang nyid kyis rab tu grub par yod do zhes zer na
analyzed: zhes bshad pas brgal zhing brtag par byas pa yang pha rol pos de'i ga la mi bzod pas skabs 'dir gal te 'di skad ces dngos po de ni lta ba la sogs pa dag med pa yang rang nyid kyis rab tu grub par yod do zhes zer na
translated: Since the opponent cannot possibly accept this, in this context, if one says, “That thing exists, even though seeing and so on do not exist, it exists by itself,”

original: / de'i lan du tshig le'ur byas pa 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽lta ba la sogs pa dag med par yang gal te dngos po de rang nyid kyis rab tu grub cing gnas pa yod do zhes brjod na /🔽dngos po de med par yang lta ba la sogs pa de dag rang nyid kyis rab tu grub cing gnas pa yod par 'gyur bar the tshom med de /
analyzed: / de'i lan du tshig le'ur byas pa 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar te / lta ba la sogs pa dag med par yang gal te dngos po de rang nyid kyis rab tu grub cing gnas pa yod do zhes brjod na / dngos po de med par yang lta ba la sogs pa de dag rang nyid kyis rab tu grub cing gnas pa yod par 'gyur bar the tshom med de /
translated: then the response is this verse.🔽If one says, “Even though seeing and so on do not exist, that thing exists, it exists by itself,”🔽then without a doubt, even though that thing does not exist, those seeing and so on would exist by themselves.

original: khyod lta ba la sogs pa dag med par yang dngos po de snga na gnas pa yod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: khyod lta ba la sogs pa dag med par yang dngos po de snga na gnas pa yod par 'dod pas /
translated: Since you assert that that thing exists prior to seeing and so on, even though they do not exist.

original: de lta na dngos po de snga na gnas pa med par lta ba la sogs pa de dag yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so de dag gcig med par gcig 'byung na ni 'di lta ste lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba'i
analyzed: de lta na dngos po de snga na gnas pa med par lta ba la sogs pa de dag yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so de dag gcig med par gcig 'byung na ni 'di lta ste lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba'i
translated: Thus, it is the intention that the view that that thing does not exist prior to them would exist.🔽If one arose without the other, then the order of the appropriator and the appropriated would be untenable, because it would be impossible to say, “These phenomena that are appropriated are of this appropriator called Devadatta,”

original: chos 'di dag ni nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba 'di'o //🔽nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba 'di yang nye bar blang ba 'di dag gi'o zhes bya ba'i rim pa de mi srid par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba 'di'o // nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba 'di yang nye bar blang ba 'di dag gi'o zhes bya ba'i rim pa de mi srid par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and “This appropriator called Devadatta is of these appropriated phenomena.”🔽But that order must definitely be accepted.

original: rim pa de ni gdon mi za ba kho nar 'dod par bya dgos so zhes bya bas ni de gnyis gcig la gcig ltos te gdags pa yin pas tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rim pa de ni gdon mi za ba kho nar 'dod par bya dgos so zhes bya bas ni de gnyis gcig la gcig ltos te gdags pa yin pas tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates that because those two are imputed in reliance on each other, they are conventional and not ultimate.

original: ci'i phyir ltos te gdags pa'i rim pa de las blang bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ltos te gdags pa'i rim pa de las blang bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Why is that order of imputation in reliance on each other taught?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / ci yis gang zhig gsal bar byed //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ci yis gang zhig gsal bar byed //
translated: Thus, he says:🔽By what is anything illuminated?

original: gang gis ci zhig gsal bar byed //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gang gis ci zhig gsal bar byed // ces bya ba la sogs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: By what is anyone illuminated?

original: de dag gi tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir ci yis zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa dag la gang yang rung bas so //
analyzed: de dag gi tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir ci yis zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa dag la gang yang rung bas so //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of those words, he says: “By what” refers to any of the faculties such as seeing.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Anything” refers to the seer, the hearer, and so on.

original: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni mngon par byed pa'o //🔽gang gis zhes bya ba ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po la @198a * //
analyzed: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni mngon par byed pa'o // gang gis zhes bya ba ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po la @198a * //
translated: “ Illuminated” means made manifest.

original: sogs pas so //🔽ci zhig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sogs pas so // ci zhig ces bya ba ni /
translated: “ By what” refers to the seer, the hearer, and so on.

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: “ Anything” refers to any of the faculties such as seeing.🔽“ Illuminated” means made manifest.

original: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa 'di'i lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa ni 'di'o zhes mngon par byed pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa 'di'i lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa ni 'di'o zhes mngon par byed pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says: “The seeing and hearing of this seer and hearer and so on is this.”

original: de dag gis ni de dag gcig la gcig ltos te gdags pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni de dag gcig la gcig ltos te gdags pa bstan to //
translated: These show that they are imputed in mutual dependence.🔽Since they are mutually dependent, the appropriator and that appropriated are established conventionally, but not ultimately.

original: de ltar gcig la gcig ltos pas nye bar blang ba dang len pa po dag tha snyad par grub pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bas ni de dag kun rdzob tu tha snyad gdags pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par🔽yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar gcig la gcig ltos pas nye bar blang ba dang len pa po dag tha snyad par grub pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bas ni de dag kun rdzob tu tha snyad gdags pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that they are merely conventional designations, and do not exist ultimately.🔽If you say that they are ultimate because the dependence is definite,🔽this is the statement of an opponent who says that even though they are dependent, they are ultimate because the dependence is definite.

original: gal te ltos pa can yin yang ltos pa nges pas don dam pa pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol pho dag na re de ltar khyed dbu ma pas ltos pa can yin par khas blangs pas /
analyzed: gal te ltos pa can yin yang ltos pa nges pas don dam pa pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol pho dag na re de ltar khyed dbu ma pas ltos pa can yin par khas blangs pas /
translated: Since you Madhyamikas accept that they are dependent,

original: des na nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag phan tshun ltos pa des pas grub pa de nyid don dam par yang yod pa yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: des na nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag phan tshun ltos pa des pas grub pa de nyid don dam par yang yod pa yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: the appropriator and that appropriated are established by that mutual dependence, and that very existence is ultimate existence.

original: de'i lan du ltos pa nges pa mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /🔽gang la ltos nas nye bar blang ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dngos po nye bar blang ba la mi ltos par snga nas nye bar len pa po nyid du grub pa cung zad kyang med la /🔽gang la ltos nas nye bar len pa po 'grub par 'gyur ba'i nye bar blang ba yang nye bar len pa po la mi ltos par snga nas nye bar blang ba'i bdag nyid du grub pa med do /
analyzed: de'i lan du ltos pa nges pa mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis / gang la ltos nas nye bar blang ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dngos po nye bar blang ba la mi ltos par snga nas nye bar len pa po nyid du grub pa cung zad kyang med la / gang la ltos nas nye bar len pa po 'grub par 'gyur ba'i nye bar blang ba yang nye bar len pa po la mi ltos par snga nas nye bar blang ba'i bdag nyid du grub pa med do /
translated: In response to that, in order to demonstrate that it is impossible to ascertain dependence, here the author of the commentary states:🔽Prior to the establishment of the appropriated, there is not the slightest bit of an appropriator established without depending on the appropriated thing in dependence on which the appropriated would be established.🔽Prior to the establishment of the appropriator, there is no appropriated thing established without depending on the appropriator in dependence on which the appropriator would be established.

original: de med na gang la ltos nas nye bar blang bar 'gyur ba'i nye bar blang ba ni nam yang /
analyzed: de med na gang la ltos nas nye bar blang bar 'gyur ba'i nye bar blang ba ni nam yang /
translated: If that is so, then the appropriated thing in dependence on which the appropriator would be established is never established prior to the establishment of the appropriator.

original: de la ltos nas nye bar blang bar mi 'gyur zhing nye bar blang ba ma yin pa gang la ltos nas nye bar len pa po 'gyur ba'i nye bar len pa po yang nam yang de la ltos nas nye bar len pa po ma yin pa ltos pas
analyzed: de la ltos nas nye bar blang bar mi 'gyur zhing nye bar blang ba ma yin pa gang la ltos nas nye bar len pa po 'gyur ba'i nye bar len pa po yang nam yang de la ltos nas nye bar len pa po ma yin pa ltos pas
translated: In dependence on that which is not appropriated, the appropriator would never exist in dependence on that which is not appropriated.

original: des pa yang srid par dka'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽ltos pa nges pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa po la ma ltos pa'i snga rol na /
analyzed: des pa yang srid par dka'o zhes bya ba smras te / ltos pa nges pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa po la ma ltos pa'i snga rol na /
translated: Therefore it is difficult to posit the appropriator and appropriated as existent.

original: nye bar blang ba zhes bya ba rang nyid kyis grub pa dang / nye bar blang ba la ma ltos pa'i snga rol na nye bar len pa po zhes bya ba rang nyid kyis grub pa dus gcig na ba lang gi rva bzhin du yod pa la bya grang na /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba zhes bya ba rang nyid kyis grub pa dang / nye bar blang ba la ma ltos pa'i snga rol na nye bar len pa po zhes bya ba rang nyid kyis grub pa dus gcig na ba lang gi rva bzhin du yod pa la bya grang na /
translated: “The ascertainment of dependence” means that prior to the existence of the appropriator, that which is called “appropriated” would exist by itself, and prior to the existence of the appropriated, that which is called “the appropriator” would exist by itself, just like the horns of a cow existing simultaneously.

original: 'dir nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po dag ni gcig gi snga rol na gcig med pas ngo bo nyid kyis grub pas med pa'i phyir tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po dag ni gcig gi snga rol na gcig med pas ngo bo nyid kyis grub pas med pa'i phyir tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the appropriator and that appropriated do not exist inherently, because one does not exist prior to the other. Therefore, this is a conventional, not an ultimate, analysis.

original: @198b de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽ci med gang zhig ga la yod //
analyzed: @198b de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / ci med gang zhig ga la yod //
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: gang med ci zhig ga la yod //🔽nye bar blang ba ci zhig po //
analyzed: gang med ci zhig ga la yod // nye bar blang ba ci zhig po //
translated: If the appropriated does not exist, how could the appropriator exist?🔽If the appropriator does not exist, how could the appropriated exist?

original: med na nye bar len pa po //
analyzed: med na nye bar len pa po //
translated: If the appropriator does not exist,

original: gang zhig yod po ga la yod //
analyzed: gang zhig yod po ga la yod //
translated: how could the appropriated exist?

original: nye bar len pa po gang zhig po med na nye bar blang ba ci zhig po yang ga la yod de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po gang zhig po med na nye bar blang ba ci zhig po yang ga la yod de /
translated: If the appropriator does not exist, how could the appropriated exist?

original: de ltar de med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid ma nyams so zhes bya ba smras te /🔽nye bar blang ba snga ma med na gang la ltos nas nye bar len pa por 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar de med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid ma nyams so zhes bya ba smras te / nye bar blang ba snga ma med na gang la ltos nas nye bar len pa por 'gyur /
translated: Since this is so, the fault of the reason remains undamaged.🔽If the prior appropriated does not exist, in dependence on what would the appropriator come to exist?

original: nye bar len pa po snga na med na yang gang la ltos nas nye bar blang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po snga na med na yang gang la ltos nas nye bar blang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the prior appropriator does not exist, in dependence on what would the appropriated come to exist?

original: ltos pa de med pa'i phyir sngar gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gi nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa'i snga rol na gnas pa yod de /
analyzed: ltos pa de med pa'i phyir sngar gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gi nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa'i snga rol na gnas pa yod de /
translated: Because that dependence does not exist, the earlier argument of the Vātsīputrīyas that the appropriator exists prior to seeing and so on is undermined.🔽They say that the appropriator exists prior to seeing and so on because it is the appropriator, just as a potter exists prior to the clay and so on.🔽Or they say that seeing, hearing, and so on, which are the appropriated, are known to be possessed by the appropriator that exists prior to them.

original: nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir dper nas bam mkhan rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag ni nye bar len pa po snga na gnas pa dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir dper nas bam mkhan rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag ni nye bar len pa po snga na gnas pa dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
translated: They say that seeing and so on are possessed by the appropriator that exists prior to them because they are the appropriated, just as the clay and so on are possessed by the potter.

original: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang la sogs pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa rnam gnyis smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub par bstan pa'i skyon de nyid ma nyams par so na gnas so //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang la sogs pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa rnam gnyis smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub par bstan pa'i skyon de nyid ma nyams par so na gnas so //
translated: The fault that the meaning of the reason is not established in these two inferences that they set forth remains as it is without being undermined.

original: yang gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag phyir glog par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po thams cad kyi snga rol na dngos po gang zhig po yod par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: yang gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag phyir glog par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po thams cad kyi snga rol na dngos po gang zhig po yod par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: Again, the Vatsiputrīya school says:

original: lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba re re'i snga rol na dngos po nye bar len pa po de yod cing /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba re re'i snga rol na dngos po nye bar len pa po de yod cing /
translated: “It is the entity that exists prior to all such things as seeing, etc.,🔽that is the appropriator of such things as seeing, etc.,

original: lta ba la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi dus gzhan dang gzhan gyi tshe na gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi dus gzhan dang gzhan gyi tshe na gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to //
translated: and it is that which is made manifest at the time of each of the other things such as seeing, etc.”

original: de'i phyir de dag na re /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag na re /
translated: Therefore, they say:

original: khyod lta ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi snga rol na gang zhig gnas pa yod do zhes rnam par brtags nas rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzos nye bar sbyar ba'i tshig gi don la skyon 'dogs pa des ci bya zhes zer te /
analyzed: khyod lta ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi snga rol na gang zhig gnas pa yod do zhes rnam par brtags nas rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzos nye bar sbyar ba'i tshig gi don la skyon 'dogs pa des ci bya zhes zer te /
translated: “What is the use of refuting the meaning of the words that we employ in our own imagination, having imagined that something exists prior to all such things as seeing, etc.?”

original: gal te kho bo cag gi lta ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi snga rol na gang zag de yod par khas blangs na ni de'i tshe khyod kyis nye bar blang ba med par nye bar len pa pos na gnas pa po yod par mi 'thad la /
analyzed: gal te kho bo cag gi lta ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi snga rol na gang zag de yod par khas blangs na ni de'i tshe khyod kyis nye bar blang ba med par nye bar len pa pos na gnas pa po yod par mi 'thad la /
translated: If you accept that the person exists prior to all such things as seeing, then it is untenable that the appropriator exists without appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa po med par yang nye bar blang ba yod par mi 'thad do zhes smra bar rigs na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po med par yang nye bar blang ba yod par mi 'thad do zhes smra bar rigs na /
translated: If you accept that the person exists prior to all such things as seeing, then it is correct to say that it is untenable that the appropriator exists without appropriation, and that it is untenable that appropriation exists without an appropriator.🔽But it is not correct to say that we accept such things,

original: kho bo cag de skad mi zer ba la khyod de skad smra bar mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha @199a * //
analyzed: kho bo cag de skad mi zer ba la khyod de skad smra bar mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha @199a * //
translated: so this is the meaning of the phrase.

original: tshig go // 'on ci ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: tshig go // 'on ci ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: If you ask, “How do you accept it?”

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag ni /🔽lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag ni / lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
translated: we say this:🔽We say that prior to all such things

original: snga rol gang zhig yod pa min //🔽zhes smra ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: snga rol gang zhig yod pa min // zhes smra ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: as seeing, it does not exist.

original: lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na de yod par 'dod do //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na de yod par 'dod do //
translated: We accept that it exists prior to each of such things as seeing.🔽To demonstrate this, it says:

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'on ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'on ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: “How is that?”

original: lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod de /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod de /
translated: It exists prior to each of such things as seeing.

original: lta ba la sogs pa gzhan dag gis /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa gzhan dag gis /
translated: Others, such as seeing, etc.,

original: gzhan gyi tshe na gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe na gsal bar byed de /
translated: make it manifest at other times.

original: lta ba dang nyan pa dang snyom pa dang myong bar byed pa dang lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa dag las lta ba'i ma nyan pa'i ma snyom pa la sogs pa gzhan dag gis gzhan gyi tshe na 'di ni lta ba po'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang nyan pa dang snyom pa dang myong bar byed pa dang lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa dag las lta ba'i ma nyan pa'i ma snyom pa la sogs pa gzhan dag gis gzhan gyi tshe na 'di ni lta ba po'o //
translated: Others, such as seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, the body, and feeling, etc., make it manifest at other times, such as when it is not seeing, not hearing, not smelling, etc.🔽It is said that they make it manifest as the seer,

original: 'di ni nyan pa po'o 'di snom pa po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ni nyan pa po'o 'di snom pa po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the hearer, the smeller, etc.

original: gang gi tshe gang zag de lta ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na lta ba po zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang zag de lta ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na lta ba po zhes bya zhing /
translated: When that person possesses seeing, at that time he is called the seer.

original: lta ba yang de'i nye bar blang ba zhes bya ba la /🔽de'i tshe na gang zag de nyan pa la sogs pa lhag ma gzhan dag gi snga rol na gnas pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: lta ba yang de'i nye bar blang ba zhes bya ba la / de'i tshe na gang zag de nyan pa la sogs pa lhag ma gzhan dag gi snga rol na gnas pa yang yin pas /
translated: And seeing is called his appropriated.🔽At that time, that person also exists prior to the other remaining faculties, such as hearing, etc.,

original: des phyis nyan pa la sogs pa dag nye bar len par yang byed do //
analyzed: des phyis nyan pa la sogs pa dag nye bar len par yang byed do //
translated: and later he appropriates hearing, etc.

original: de bzhin du gang gi tshe gang zag de nyan pa dang ldan pa de'i tshe na nyan pa po zhes bya zhing nyan pa yang de'i nye bar blang ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi tshe gang zag de nyan pa dang ldan pa de'i tshe na nyan pa po zhes bya zhing nyan pa yang de'i nye bar blang ba zhes bya la /
translated: So too, when that person possesses hearing, at that time he is called the hearer and hearing is called his appropriated.

original: de'i tshe na gang zag de lta ba la sogs pa lhag ma gzhan dag gi snga rol na gnas pa gang yin pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na gang zag de lta ba la sogs pa lhag ma gzhan dag gi snga rol na gnas pa gang yin pas /
translated: At that time, the person who exists prior to the remaining faculties such as seeing

original: des phyis lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar len par yang byed do //
analyzed: des phyis lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar len par yang byed do //
translated: later appropriates seeing and so on.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang tshul de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang tshul de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar te /
translated: The same principle should be applied to the remaining faculties as appropriate.

original: lta ba la sogs par re'i snga rol na gang zag gnas pa de lta ba la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis dus gzhan gyi tshe na 'di lta ba po nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po zhes gsal bar byed pas /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs par re'i snga rol na gang zag gnas pa de lta ba la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis dus gzhan gyi tshe na 'di lta ba po nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po zhes gsal bar byed pas /
translated: The person who exists prior to each of the faculties such as seeing is later designated as the seer, the hearer, and the feeler by means of the other faculties such as seeing.

original: de ni lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na med pa yang ma yin la gsal bar byed pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na med pa yang ma yin la gsal bar byed pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the person is not nonexistent prior to seeing and so on, nor is he unapprehendable.

original: de'i phyir de ltar lta ba'am nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa de de las gzhan pa'i nye bar blang ba la ltos pas nye bar len pa po nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid med do zhes
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar lta ba'am nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa de de las gzhan pa'i nye bar blang ba la ltos pas nye bar len pa po nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid med do zhes
translated: Therefore, since that which endures prior to seeing, hearing and so on is established as the appropriator because it relies on the appropriated that is different from it, the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: This is the summary.

original: re zhig de ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: This is the opponent’s position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /🔽lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa / lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: snga rol gal te yod min na //
analyzed: snga rol gal te yod min na //
translated: If it does not exist prior to

original: lta la sogs pa re re yi //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa re re yi //
translated: all such as seeing,

original: snga rol de ni ci ltar @199b yod //
analyzed: snga rol de ni ci ltar @199b yod //
translated: how could it exist prior to🔽each such as seeing?

original: gang gi phyir de lta ba'am nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na yod par 'dod na de la mi ltos pa'i nye bar blang ba de yang nye bar blang ba nyid du mi 'grub la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta ba'am nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na yod par 'dod na de la mi ltos pa'i nye bar blang ba de yang nye bar blang ba nyid du mi 'grub la /
translated: If it is asserted that it exists prior to seeing, hearing and so on, then that appropriated that does not rely on it would not be established as the appropriated.

original: de la ma ltos pa'i nye bar len pa po de yang nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub po zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la ma ltos pa'i nye bar len pa po de yang nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub po zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But if the appropriator does not depend on the appropriated, it is not established as an appropriator.

original: gang gi tshe de lta ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na nyan pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyi nye bar len pa po yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de lta ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na nyan pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyi nye bar len pa po yang ma yin la /
translated: When it possesses seeing, at that time it is not an appropriator of the remaining such as hearing.

original: nyan pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyang de'i nye bar blang ba ma yin pas de'i phyir nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na nye bar len pa po med do //
analyzed: nyan pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyang de'i nye bar blang ba ma yin pas de'i phyir nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na nye bar len pa po med do //
translated: Since the remaining such as hearing are not that which is to be appropriated by that, therefore prior to the appropriated, the appropriator does not exist.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The remaining should be applied in the same way as appropriate.

original: de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa las nye bar blang ba re re'i snga rol na yang nye bar len pa po yod par snga ma bzhin du mi 'grub po zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu lnga pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa las nye bar blang ba re re'i snga rol na yang nye bar len pa po yod par snga ma bzhin du mi 'grub po zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu lnga pa /
translated: Therefore, as before, it is not established that prior to each of the appropriated, the appropriator exists, by inference. This is the summary.

original: yang gzhan yang 'di la nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba rnams lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin no zhe 'am /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang 'di la nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba rnams lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin no zhe 'am /
translated: Moreover, in this regard, those who assert the existence of the appropriator would have to accept that the one who sees is the one who hears and the one who feels, or that they are different.

original: gzhan yin no zhes khas len par 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gal te gnyis su brtag pa gnyi gar yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yin no zhes khas len par 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gal te gnyis su brtag pa gnyi gar yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: The passage beginning with “In this regard, if one investigates whether the appropriator is identical or different, both positions are untenable” teaches that both positions are untenable.

original: de la brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the first position is untenable, it says:

original: gal te re re'i snga rol na //
analyzed: gal te re re'i snga rol na //
translated: If prior to each

original: lta po de nyid nyan po de //
analyzed: lta po de nyid nyan po de //
translated: The seer were the hearer,

original: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The feeler would be the same.

original: gal te lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na nye bar len pa po gcig pu zhig yod par gyur na gang gi tshe de lta ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na ni lta ba po zhes bya /
analyzed: gal te lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na nye bar len pa po gcig pu zhig yod par gyur na gang gi tshe de lta ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na ni lta ba po zhes bya /
translated: If prior to each of seeing and so on, the appropriator alone existed, then when he possesses seeing, he would be called the seer.

original: gang gi tshe de nyan pa dang ldan pa de'i tshe na yang nyan pa po zhes bya /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyan pa dang ldan pa de'i tshe na yang nyan pa po zhes bya /
translated: When he possesses hearing, he would be called the hearer.

original: gang gi tshe de tshor ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na yang tshor ba po zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de tshor ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na yang tshor ba po zhes bya zhing /
translated: When it possesses feeling, it is called the feeler.

original: yul re re 'dzin pa'i dus na dbang po gang dang gang nas sbyor bar byed pa de dang de nye bar len pas de'i phyir lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yul re re 'dzin pa'i dus na dbang po gang dang gang nas sbyor bar byed pa de dang de nye bar len pas de'i phyir lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: And when it is connected with each sense faculty in the context of apprehending each object, it appropriates that sense faculty. Therefore, the seer is the hearer and the feeler.🔽In order to demonstrate that mode, the root text states, “If you assert that the seer is the hearer and the feeler, as the tīrthikas do, then you must also accept that the seer is the toucher.”

original: de nyid kyi tshul bstan pa'i phyir ci ltar mu stegs can dag na re de'i lta ba po de'i lus dang dbang po'i gnas pa dang 'jim pa lta bu dag ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i chos can yin no zhes zer ba ltar 'dod na zhes bya ba
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshul bstan pa'i phyir ci ltar mu stegs can dag na re de'i lta ba po de'i lus dang dbang po'i gnas pa dang 'jim pa lta bu dag ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i chos can yin no zhes zer ba ltar 'dod na zhes bya ba
translated: The tīrthikas say that the seer, the hearer, and the feeler are the self, which is a single entity that is the support for the body and the sense faculties.

original: smras te / de ni mu stegs can dag na re bdag ni brtag pa @200a * //🔽gcig pu khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: smras te / de ni mu stegs can dag na re bdag ni brtag pa @200a * //🔽gcig pu khyab pa yin la /
translated: They also say that the self is a permanent entity that is subject to increase and decrease.

original: de'i lus dang dbang po'i gnas shes pa med pa rtsva dang 'jim pa lta bu dag ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: de'i lus dang dbang po'i gnas shes pa med pa rtsva dang 'jim pa lta bu dag ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i chos can yin te /
translated: The body and faculties of that person are like grass and clods of earth, devoid of consciousness, and they increase and decrease.

original: 'gro ba ni 'gro ba gzhan du 'pho ba'i dus na lus dang dbang po rnams ni kha cig ni skye kha cig ni 'jig gang zag ni bdag gi dngos po yin pas dang po skye ba yang med la /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'gro ba gzhan du 'pho ba'i dus na lus dang dbang po rnams ni kha cig ni skye kha cig ni 'jig gang zag ni bdag gi dngos po yin pas dang po skye ba yang med la /
translated: When one goes to another world, some of the body and faculties are born and some perish, but since the person is the entity of the self, it is neither born in the beginning nor does it perish in the end.

original: tha ma 'jig pa yang med do zhes zer ba lta bur khyed gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa pa dag kyang de ltar 'dod mod ces pha rol pos gzhung bsnan pa yin no //
analyzed: tha ma 'jig pa yang med do zhes zer ba lta bur khyed gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa pa dag kyang de ltar 'dod mod ces pha rol pos gzhung bsnan pa yin no //
translated: The opponent supplies the scriptural reference: “You, the Vātsīputrīyas, assert that.”

original: de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir de yang rnam pa de lta bur ma grags pas da ni de ltar mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir de yang rnam pa de lta bur ma grags pas da ni de ltar mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To demonstrate that this is untenable, he says, “But that is not renowned in that way, so it is not tenable.”

original: mu stegs can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so //🔽yang na / gal te re re'i snga rol na //
analyzed: mu stegs can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so // yang na / gal te re re'i snga rol na //
translated: The intended meaning is that it would follow that they are tīrthikas.🔽If the seer were the hearer,

original: lta po de nyid nyan po de //
analyzed: lta po de nyid nyan po de //
translated: then the self would be multiple.

original: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin par rtog pa la /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin par rtog pa la /
translated: The feeler would be the same as that.🔽In the passage beginning with “The seer would be the same as that,” it is🔽considered that the seer is the same as the hearer and the feeler.

original: gang gi tshe de lta ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi snga na yod pa yin la /🔽gang gi tshe de nyan pa dang ldan pa de'i tshe na lta ba la sogs pa dag ni snga rol na yod pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de lta ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi snga na yod pa yin la / gang gi tshe de nyan pa dang ldan pa de'i tshe na lta ba la sogs pa dag ni snga rol na yod pa yin zhing /
translated: When one has seeing, then hearing and so forth would have to have existed🔽previously. When one has hearing, then seeing and so forth would have to🔽have existed previously. Since the same would have to be said about the🔽remaining senses, it would be possible to say that they exist previously. But it

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin pas snga na yod do zhes tha snyad gdags su rung ba yang de nyid lta ba po yang yin nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin no zhes byar mi rung bar ston to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin pas snga na yod do zhes tha snyad gdags su rung ba yang de nyid lta ba po yang yin nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin no zhes byar mi rung bar ston to //
translated: is not possible to say that the seer is the hearer and the feeler.

original: ci ltar mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: de'i phyir gcig pu rdzas su yod du zin kyang skad cig las lhag par mi gnas pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang tshor ba po nyid yin par mi srid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig pu rdzas su yod du zin kyang skad cig las lhag par mi gnas pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang tshor ba po nyid yin par mi srid de /
translated: Therefore, even though it does exist as a single substance, it does not endure beyond a moment. Thus, it is impossible for it to be the seer, the hearer, or the feeler even conventionally.

original: gcig pu 'thad pa med pa re re'i snga rol na yod par ga la rigs te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gcig pu 'thad pa med pa re re'i snga rol na yod par ga la rigs te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How could it be tenable that it exists prior to each of the single moments?

original: gal te gang zag de gcig pu rtag pa zhig yin na ni de nyid lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin no zhes byar rung grang na /
analyzed: gal te gang zag de gcig pu rtag pa zhig yin na ni de nyid lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin no zhes byar rung grang na /
translated: If the person were a single, permanent entity, it would be possible to say that it is the seer, the hearer, and the feeler.

original: 'u bu cag sangs rgyas pa chos thams cad skad cig mar smra ba la gang zag de rtag par ma grub pas de skad byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'u bu cag sangs rgyas pa chos thams cad skad cig mar smra ba la gang zag de rtag par ma grub pas de skad byar mi rung ngo //
translated: But we Buddhists maintain that all phenomena are momentary. Since the person is not established as permanent, it is not possible to say that.

original: de nyid brnan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid brnan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to emphasize this point,

original: de'i phyir de ni de ltar mi rigs so zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de ltar mi rigs so zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he says, “Therefore, it is not tenable in that way.”

original: ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni de ni de @200b ltar mi rigs so zhes bya ba de ci zhig de ltar mi rigs zhes 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni de ni de @200b ltar mi rigs so zhes bya ba de ci zhig de ltar mi rigs zhes 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a question asking, “What is it that is not reasonable?”

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: de gcig nyid du ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de gcig nyid du ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he said, “It is not reasonable that it is one.”

original: bdag de gcig nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: bdag de gcig nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the self is one.

original: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it not reasonable?🔽Therefore, he said, “because of the fault of the thesis.”

original: de'i phyir dam bcas pa'i skyon gyis skyon chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bcas pa'i skyon gyis skyon chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning is that because of the fault of the thesis that you stated,

original: khyed kyis / lta ba po yang de nyid yin //
analyzed: khyed kyis / lta ba po yang de nyid yin //
translated: “The seer is also the hearer,🔽and the feeler,”

original: nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang de nyid yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i skyon gyis na lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang / gnas skabs tha dad pas de dag gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i skyon chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang de nyid yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i skyon gyis na lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang / gnas skabs tha dad pas de dag gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i skyon chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: the fault is that it is not established that seeing, hearing, and so on are the same because they have different characteristics and different states.

original: gcig pa nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par nyan pa po ni lta ba po las gzhan ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par nyan pa po ni lta ba po las gzhan ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the valid cognition that proves they are not the same, it says, ultimately the hearer is not different from the seer.

original: nyan pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i nyan pa po bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nyan pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i nyan pa po bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the hearer is a hearer, like a hearer of a different continuum.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi nyan pa po ni nyan pa po yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi lta ba po las gzhan yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi nyan pa po yang nyan pa po yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi rgyud
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi nyan pa po ni nyan pa po yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi lta ba po las gzhan yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi nyan pa po yang nyan pa po yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi rgyud
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: kyi lta ba po las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: kyi lta ba po las gzhan yin no //
translated: For example, just as the hearer of the continuum of Yajñadatta, because he is a hearer, is different from the seer of the continuum of Devadatta, in the same way, the hearer of the continuum of Devadatta, because he is a hearer, is different from the seer of the continuum of Devadatta.

original: nyan pa po nyid la sogs pa gzhan nyid du rjes su dpag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni snga ma brnan pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: nyan pa po nyid la sogs pa gzhan nyid du rjes su dpag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni snga ma brnan pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The phrase “the error of the subject’s own nature being refuted” is a reiteration of the previous refutation.

original: pha rol po dag nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod par 'dod pa ni lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang gnas skabs tha dad pas de ni don gyis na nyan pa
analyzed: pha rol po dag nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod par 'dod pa ni lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang gnas skabs tha dad pas de ni don gyis na nyan pa
translated: The opponent asserts that the appropriator exists prior to each of the faculties such as seeing, but since seeing, hearing, and so on have different characteristics and different states, the appropriator is not a single entity.

original: po nyid la sogs pa gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pa yin pas des lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po dag gzhan ma yin zhing gcig pa nyid du 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de la chos can nye bar len pa po de'i rang gi ngo bo gcig pa nyid bsal zhing tha dang par gyur pa'i skyon yod🔽pas lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po yang yin no zhes bya @201a * //
analyzed: po nyid la sogs pa gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pa yin pas des lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po dag gzhan ma yin zhing gcig pa nyid du 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de la chos can nye bar len pa po de'i rang gi ngo bo gcig pa nyid bsal zhing tha dang par gyur pa'i skyon yod pas lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po yang yin no zhes bya @201a * //
translated: Since it is inferred that the seer and so on are different from the appropriator, the assertion of the opponent is refuted by the logical argument that the seer, the hearer, and the feeler are not different and are one.

original: par rtog pa de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: par rtog pa de mi 'thad do //
translated: Since the fault of the thesis of the opponent is thus established, the thought that the seer is the hearer and the feeler is untenable.🔽Now, in order to demonstrate the fault that the seer would not rely on the eye in the inference of sameness, the text says:

original: da ni gcig pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa la lta ba po yang mig la mi ltos pa'i skyon yod par bstan pa'i phyir lta ba po yang gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed de /
analyzed: da ni gcig pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa la lta ba po yang mig la mi ltos pa'i skyon yod par bstan pa'i phyir lta ba po yang gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed de /
translated: The seer would not rely on the eye in order to observe form.

original: nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nyan pa po yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nyan pa po yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the seer is not different from the hearer, for example, the seer is the hearer.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And these are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proof, and the example, respectively.🔽For example, because the hearer is not different from the hearer, the eye does not rely on the eye in order to observe form.

original: dper na nyan pa po ni nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed pa de bzhin du lta ba po dang nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig🔽la ltos par mi byed do //
analyzed: dper na nyan pa po ni nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed pa de bzhin du lta ba po dang nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, because the seer is not different from the hearer, the eye does not rely on the eye in order to observe form.

original: lta ba po nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed pa nyid kyis de bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes
analyzed: lta ba po nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed pa nyid kyis de bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes
translated: Since the seer is inferred to be not different from the hearer, the fault of the subject being refuted is present in the thesis because the seer does not rely on the eye in order to observe form.

original: bya ba yang snga ma bsnan pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: bya ba yang snga ma bsnan pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Action is a word that is added to the previous,

original: pha rol po dag lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang tshor ba po dag gcig pa nyid du 'dod pa ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa yin pas des na lta ba po yang nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pas /
analyzed: pha rol po dag lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang tshor ba po dag gcig pa nyid du 'dod pa ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa yin pas des na lta ba po yang nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pas /
translated: because the opponent asserts that the seer, hearer and feeler are the same, it is inferred that they are not different. Therefore, since the seer is not different from the hearer,🔽just as the hearer does not rely on the eye in order to observe form, so too the seer does not rely on the eye in order to observe form.

original: ci ltar nyan pa po gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed pa de bzhin du lta ba po yang gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed pa nyid kyis mig la ltos pa de bsal ba'i phyir pha rol po
analyzed: ci ltar nyan pa po gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed pa de bzhin du lta ba po yang gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed pa nyid kyis mig la ltos pa de bsal ba'i phyir pha rol po
translated: In order to refute that the seer relies on the eye, the opponent

original: dag gis dam bcas pa de la /
analyzed: dag gis dam bcas pa de la /
translated: asserts that.

original: chos can lta ba po de'i khyad par gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos pa bsal zhing mig la mi ltos pa'i skyon yod pas rjes su dpag pa gnyis pa de'i phyir yang lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang
analyzed: chos can lta ba po de'i khyad par gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos pa bsal zhing mig la mi ltos pa'i skyon yod pas rjes su dpag pa gnyis pa de'i phyir yang lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang
translated: The error of not relying on the eyes would also be committed because the eyes would be eliminated as the specific condition of the seer that observes form.

original: tshor ba po yang yin no zhes bya bar rtog pa de mi 'thad do //🔽de ni de ltar mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan dag ni 'di skad ces gal te de lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod par 'gyur na de lta na lta ba po yang de nyid yin la /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang yin no zhes bya bar rtog pa de mi 'thad do // de ni de ltar mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan dag ni 'di skad ces gal te de lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod par 'gyur na de lta na lta ba po yang de nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is also untenable to conceive that the seer is the hearer and the feeler.

original: nyan pa po yang de nyid yin tshor ba po yang de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan pa po yang de nyid yin tshor ba po yang de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Others say, “It is not tenable that the self exists prior to each of seeing and so on, because in that case the seer would be the hearer and the feeler.

original: de de ltar mi @201b rigs so //
analyzed: de de ltar mi @201b rigs so //
translated: That is not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: skyes bu skar khung tha dad par 'gro ba bzhin du bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes bu skar khung tha dad par 'gro ba bzhin du bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would follow that the self would move from one sense faculty to another, like a person moving from one window to another.

original: bdag ni dbang po gzhan gang du yang 'gro bar mi 'dod do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /🔽gal te re re'i snga rol na //
analyzed: bdag ni dbang po gzhan gang du yang 'gro bar mi 'dod do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni / gal te re re'i snga rol na //
translated: I do not wish to go anywhere else.🔽This is the context of the passage:

original: lta ba po de nyid nyan po de //
analyzed: lta ba po de nyid nyan po de //
translated: If the seer were the hearer,

original: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur //
translated: The feeler would be the seer,🔽And the hearer.

original: de ni de ltar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni de ltar mi rigs so //
translated: That is not tenable.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs 'di la 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta ni de skad ces rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs 'di la 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta ni de skad ces rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The elder Buddhapalita explains this passage as follows:

original: kha cig na re de ni thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bar mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de mi rigs par sun 'byin pa ston te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de ni thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bar mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de mi rigs par sun 'byin pa ston te /
translated: Some say: “That is not a fault of the reductio,

original: skyes bu skar khung tha dad par 'gro ba bzhin du bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba de pha rol po la skyon der thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: skyes bu skar khung tha dad par 'gro ba bzhin du bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba de pha rol po la skyon der thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: because it would then follow that the self would go to other faculties, like a person moving from one window to another.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: pha rol po dag gi gzhung las mig la sogs pa byed pa de dang de nas skyes pa gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i blo dag bdag thams cad du song ba'i phyogs su 'du bas lta ba po la sogs pa dbang po gzhan du 'gro ba med par
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gzhung las mig la sogs pa byed pa de dang de nas skyes pa gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i blo dag bdag thams cad du song ba'i phyogs su 'du bas lta ba po la sogs pa dbang po gzhan du 'gro ba med par
translated: Because according to the opponent’s scriptures, the cognitions that perceive form and so on arise from the faculties such as the eyes, and since the self is all-pervading, it is not the case that the seer and so on go to other faculties.

original: yang grub pa'i phyir skyon der thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang grub pa'i phyir skyon der thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore the opponent does not accept that the self is the appropriator of the faculties such as the eyes.

original: gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gi gzhung las mig la sogs pa dbang po gang dang gang nas gzugs dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa de dang de dag nye bar len pa po'i bdag thams cad du song ba snga na gnas
analyzed: gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gi gzhung las mig la sogs pa dbang po gang dang gang nas gzugs dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa de dang de dag nye bar len pa po'i bdag thams cad du song ba snga na gnas
translated: According to the scriptures of the Vātsīputrīyas, the eye consciousness and so on that perceive form and so on arise from the faculties such as the eyes, and the self that is the appropriator of those is all-pervading and exists prior to the faculties.

original: pa'i phyogs su 'du zhing des yul nyams su myong bar 'dod pas /🔽lta ba po lnga sogs pa dbang po gzhan du 'gro ba med par yang 'grub pa'i phyir gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas skyes bu skar khung tha dad par 'gro ba bzhin du /
analyzed: pa'i phyogs su 'du zhing des yul nyams su myong bar 'dod pas / lta ba po lnga sogs pa dbang po gzhan du 'gro ba med par yang 'grub pa'i phyir gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas skyes bu skar khung tha dad par 'gro ba bzhin du /
translated: And since it is asserted that the object is experienced by that,🔽it is established that the seer and so on do not move to other sense faculties.

original: bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bshad pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bshad pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the elder Buddhapalita's explanation that it would follow that the self would move to other sense faculties, like a person moving from one window to another, is not applicable.

original: gzhan yang grangs can dag gi gzhung las kyang rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa sgra la sogs par snang ba dag yod na rna ba la sogs pa snang ba'i nang gi byed pa yod cing shes pa yod par snang ba'i gzugs brnyan 'char bas phan 'dogs par
analyzed: gzhan yang grangs can dag gi gzhung las kyang rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa sgra la sogs par snang ba dag yod na rna ba la sogs pa snang ba'i nang gi byed pa yod cing shes pa yod par snang ba'i gzugs brnyan 'char bas phan 'dogs par
translated: Moreover, in the Samkhya scriptures, it is said that when the engagement of the ear and so on appears as sound and so on, the inner agent of the ear and so on appears and the reflection of consciousness appears, which is helpful because it arises.

original: byed pa'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa dbang @202a * //
analyzed: byed pa'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa dbang @202a * //
translated: Therefore, seeing and so on are not the self.

original: po gzhan du 'gro ba med par yang 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir de dag la yang skyon der thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: po gzhan du 'gro ba med par yang 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir de dag la yang skyon der thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But since it is said that they are established without going elsewhere, the error does not apply to them.

original: grangs can dag gi gzhung las sgra thos pa la sogs pa na rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya ba rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba dag skye'o //
analyzed: grangs can dag gi gzhung las sgra thos pa la sogs pa na rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya ba rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba dag skye'o //
translated: In the Samkhya scriptures it says that when sound is heard and so on, the engagement of the ear and so on arises, which is the consciousness of the ear and so on appearing in the aspect of sound and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par snang ba nang gi byed pa zhes bya ba blo skye'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par snang ba nang gi byed pa zhes bya ba blo skye'o //
translated: After that, the appearance of the engagement of the ear and so on arises, which is the inner agent.

original: de'i 'og tu dper na gzugs la brten nas gzugs brnyan 'byung ba dang 'dra bar nang gi bye brag gi ngo bo nyid ci 'dra ba de kho na 'dra bar shes pa yod pa zhes bya ba skyes bu skye zhing des yul gyi longs spyod nyams su myong🔽bar byed pas /
