analyzed: de'i 'og tu dper na gzugs la brten nas gzugs brnyan 'byung ba dang 'dra bar nang gi bye brag gi ngo bo nyid ci 'dra ba de kho na 'dra bar shes pa yod pa zhes bya ba skyes bu skye zhing des yul gyi longs spyod nyams su myong🔽bar byed pas /
translated: After that, just as a reflection arises in dependence on a form, the person arises, which is called the existence of consciousness that is similar to the specific nature of the inner agent, and it experiences the enjoyment of objects.

original: lta ba po la sogs pa dbang po gzhan du 'gro ba med par yang 'grub pa'i phyir gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas bshad pa'i skyon der thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba po la sogs pa dbang po gzhan du 'gro ba med par yang 'grub pa'i phyir gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas bshad pa'i skyon der thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is established that the seer and so on do not move to another sense faculty, the error explained by the elder Buddhapālita does not arise.

original: gzhan yang grangs can dag las kha cig gi gzhung las /
analyzed: gzhan yang grangs can dag las kha cig gi gzhung las /
translated: Moreover, according to some of the Samkhyas’ texts,

original: 'gyur bas lta ba po dang nyan pa po nyid la sogs pa dag 'grub pas bdag thams cad du song ba la dbang po gzhan gyi phyogs su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa dbang po gzhan du 'gro ba med par yang 'grub po zhes
analyzed: 'gyur bas lta ba po dang nyan pa po nyid la sogs pa dag 'grub pas bdag thams cad du song ba la dbang po gzhan gyi phyogs su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa dbang po gzhan du 'gro ba med par yang 'grub po zhes
translated: because the seer and the hearer and so on are established through transformation, since the self does not move to another place, it is established that the seer and so on do not move to another sense faculty.

original: 'byung ba'i phyir yang de dag la skyon der thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i phyir yang de dag la skyon der thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the error does not arise for them.

original: de dag gi gzhung las yul dmigs nas dbang po'i 'jug pa yul gyi rnam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung las yul dmigs nas dbang po'i 'jug pa yul gyi rnam par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because according to their texts, when the object is observed, the operation of the sense faculty is transformed into the aspect of the object.

original: 'jug pa dmigs nas nang gi byed pa de'i rnam par 'gyur zhing skyes bu yang nang gi byed pa'i rnam par 'gyur bas bdag thams cad du song ba de la dbang po gzhan gyi phyogs su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas bshad
analyzed: 'jug pa dmigs nas nang gi byed pa de'i rnam par 'gyur zhing skyes bu yang nang gi byed pa'i rnam par 'gyur bas bdag thams cad du song ba de la dbang po gzhan gyi phyogs su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas bshad
translated: The master Buddhapalita explains that the self is not all-pervading because the internal agent is observed to engage in action and the person is observed to be born in the aspect of the internal agent.

original: pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid zer ro //
analyzed: pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid zer ro //
translated: The author of the commentary says that this is illogical.

original: de'i phyir de lngar re re'i snga rol na yod pa nyid mi 'thad pas gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid ma nyams so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lngar re re'i snga rol na yod pa nyid mi 'thad pas gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid ma nyams so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is untenable that it exists prior to each of the five, the fault of the reason remains unrefuted. This is the conclusion.

original: lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na nye bar len pa po yod pa nyid mi 'thad pas nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon de nyid ma nyams so //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na nye bar len pa po yod pa nyid mi 'thad pas nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon de nyid ma nyams so //
translated: Since it is untenable that the appropriator exists prior to each of seeing and so on, the fault that the reason the appropriator exists is not established remains unrefuted.

original: skyes bur smra ba gang dag phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag las gzhan pa'i skyes bu de nyid lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang sems pa po yin par smra @202b ba de dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya bas ni skyes
analyzed: skyes bur smra ba gang dag phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag las gzhan pa'i skyes bu de nyid lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang sems pa po yin par smra @202b ba de dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya bas ni skyes
translated: The proponents of purusha who say that the purusha itself, which is different from the aggregates, elements, and media, is the seer, hearer, and thinker, should be refuted in the same way.

original: bur smra ba de dag gi gzhung dgag pa yang sngar /
analyzed: bur smra ba de dag gi gzhung dgag pa yang sngar /
translated: The refutation of the texts of those proponents of purusha is as follows:

original: don dam par nyan pa po ni lta ba po las gzhan ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nyan pa po ni lta ba po las gzhan ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the hearer is not different from the seer,

original: nyan pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i nyan pa po bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i nyan pa po bzhin no //
translated: because he is the hearer, just as, for example, the hearer of a different continuum.

original: nyan pa po nyid la sogs pa gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pa las gzhan ma yin pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: nyan pa po nyid la sogs pa gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pa las gzhan ma yin pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Since the nondifference from the other, the hearer, etc., is inferred, the proposition has the fault of the repudiation of the intrinsic reality of the subject.

original: lta ba po yang gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed de /
analyzed: lta ba po yang gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed de /
translated: The seer does not rely on the eye in order to perceive form.

original: nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nyan pa po bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nyan pa po bzhin no //
translated: because it is not different from the hearer, like the hearer himself.

original: lta ba po nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed pa nyid kyis de bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes ci
analyzed: lta ba po nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir mig la ltos par mi byed pa nyid kyis de bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes ci
translated: Since the seer is inferred to be not different from the hearer, the fault of the thesis being contradicted by the specific property of the subject is present, because the eye does not depend on the seer for the purpose of perceiving form.

original: skad bstan pa de bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: skad bstan pa de bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
translated: How could it be taught? It should be refuted in that way.

original: yang na lta ba po nyid la sogs pa dag mi 'thad par ni skye mched brtag par bstan zin pas yang bstan mi dgos so zhes bya bas ni de dgag pa der bstan zin pas yang bzlas mi dgos so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang na lta ba po nyid la sogs pa dag mi 'thad par ni skye mched brtag par bstan zin pas yang bstan mi dgos so zhes bya bas ni de dgag pa der bstan zin pas yang bzlas mi dgos so zhes bstan to //
translated: Or, since it has already been shown in the examination of the sense bases that the seer and so on are untenable, it is unnecessary to teach it again. This shows that since its refutation has already been taught there, it is unnecessary to repeat it.

original: gal te bdag khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par bsal ba'i phyir de phyogs su byed pa mi rigs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re rigs pa'i mtshan nyid las rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos🔽can khas blangs nas de la bsgrub par bya ba chos bsgrub par bya'o zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: gal te bdag khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par bsal ba'i phyir de phyogs su byed pa mi rigs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re rigs pa'i mtshan nyid las rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can khas blangs nas de la bsgrub par bya ba chos bsgrub par bya'o zhes 'byung bas /
translated: The opponents say, “In the definition of logic, it is said that one should accept a subject that is renowned to both parties in a debate and then prove a property of that subject.

original: khyed dbu ma pas bdag yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par gcig pa nyid la sogs pa dag bsal ba'i phyir bdag de phyogs su byed pa ci ltar rigs zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas bdag yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par gcig pa nyid la sogs pa dag bsal ba'i phyir bdag de phyogs su byed pa ci ltar rigs zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Since you Mādhyamikas do not assert that a self exists, how could it be logical to take that as a subject in order to clear away its attributes, such as being one?”

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that, Bhāviveka says,

original: spyi dang dmigs kyis ma bsal ba mdzad pa'i mtha' gzhan las yongs su bzung ba tha snyad du khas blangs pa phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: spyi dang dmigs kyis ma bsal ba mdzad pa'i mtha' gzhan las yongs su bzung ba tha snyad du khas blangs pa phyogs su byas te /
translated: “We take as a subject something that is not excluded by general or specific characteristics, that is accepted in other treatises, and that is conventionally accepted.

original: de'i khyad par ma grags pa sel bas skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ma grags pa sel bas skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since we clear away its attributes that are not renowned, there is no fault.”

original: kho bos phung po lnga dag la kho bo cag la rnam par shes pa zhes grags pa dang khyed la bdag ces grags pa spyi tha snyad du khas blangs pa phyogs su byas te de'i @203a * //
analyzed: kho bos phung po lnga dag la kho bo cag la rnam par shes pa zhes grags pa dang khyed la bdag ces grags pa spyi tha snyad du khas blangs pa phyogs su byas te de'i @203a * //
translated: We accept as our position that the so-called consciousness is renowned to us and the so-called self is renowned to you, and that both are conventionally accepted as mere nominalities.

original: khyad par kho bo cag la ma grags pa bdag ce 'am gcig pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa sel bas skyon med do //
analyzed: khyad par kho bo cag la ma grags pa bdag ce 'am gcig pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa sel bas skyon med do //
translated: Since we refute the attributes of that self, such as its singularity and so on, which are not renowned to us, we are without fault.

original: gzhan yang rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba'i phyogs dmigs kyis ma bsal ba grub pa'i mtha'i lo rgyus gzhan las yongs su bzung ba'i bdag dang nye bar len pa po zhes bya bar grags pa tha snyad du khas blangs pa phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba'i phyogs dmigs kyis ma bsal ba grub pa'i mtha'i lo rgyus gzhan las yongs su bzung ba'i bdag dang nye bar len pa po zhes bya bar grags pa tha snyad du khas blangs pa phyogs su byas te /
translated: Moreover, we accept as our position that the so-called self and the so-called appropriator are renowned conventionally, and that they are accepted as mere nominalities, without specifying the positions of the challenger and the opponent.

original: bdag de'i khyad par gcig pa nyid la sogs pa sel bas kho bo'i phyogs la skyon med do //
analyzed: bdag de'i khyad par gcig pa nyid la sogs pa sel bas kho bo'i phyogs la skyon med do //
translated: Since we refute the attributes of that self, such as its singularity and so on, we are without fault.

original: de ltar re zhig lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin par mi 'thad par brtag pa dang por bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yin par mi 'thad par brtag pa dang por bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, it has been demonstrated in the first chapter that it is untenable that the seer is the hearer and the feeler.

original: da ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang tshor ba po dag gzhan yin par rtog pa mi 'thad par brtag pa gnyis par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang tshor ba po dag gzhan yin par rtog pa mi 'thad par brtag pa gnyis par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the second chapter, which shows that it is untenable to conceive of the seer, hearer, and feeler as different,

original: ci ste nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag ji skad bstan pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod las lta ba po yang gzhan nyan pa po yang gzhan /
analyzed: ci ste nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag ji skad bstan pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod las lta ba po yang gzhan nyan pa po yang gzhan /
translated: if the proponents of the existence of appropriators wish to completely avoid the faults that have been presented, they may conceive of the seer as different from the hearer,🔽and the hearer as different from the feeler.

original: tshor ba po yang gzhan yin par rtog na de lta na yang /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang gzhan yin par rtog na de lta na yang /
translated: But in that case,

original: gal te lta po gzhan nyid la //
analyzed: gal te lta po gzhan nyid la //
translated: if the seer is one thing,🔽the hearer another,

original: nyan pa po gzhan tshor gzhan na //
analyzed: nyan pa po gzhan tshor gzhan na //
translated: and the feeler another,

original: zhes bya bar yongs su rtogs pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya bar yongs su rtogs pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what would be the consequence of this thorough investigation?

original: lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
analyzed: lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
translated: It would follow that when there is a seer, there is a hearer.

original: ces bya bar 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: ces bya bar 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
translated: This is what has been said.

original: lan 'ga' ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe yul nye bar gyur pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe yul nye bar gyur pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: “Sometimes” means when the object is present.

original: ci'i phyir lta ba po yod pa'i tshe na nyan pa po yang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lta ba po yod pa'i tshe na nyan pa po yang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Why is it that when the seer exists, the hearer also exists?

original: de'i phyir gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras so //🔽gzhan yin na gang gi tshe yul nye bar gyur pa de'i tshe na lta ba po yod pa'i tshe nyan pa po yang yod par 'gyur ba'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras so // gzhan yin na gang gi tshe yul nye bar gyur pa de'i tshe na lta ba po yod pa'i tshe nyan pa po yang yod par 'gyur ba'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “because they are different” is supplied.🔽In order to demonstrate the validity of the statement that when the object is present, the hearer exists because the seer exists, if they are different,

original: 'di na gang zhig gang las gzhan yin par shes pa de ni lan 'ga' de yod na yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di na gang zhig gang las gzhan yin par shes pa de ni lan 'ga' de yod na yod par 'gyur te /
translated: he says, “For example, when one thing exists, the other is sometimes seen to exist.”

original: dper na bum pa yod na kham phor yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa yod na kham phor yod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when a pot exists, a saucer exists.

original: de bzhin du nyan pa po yang lta ba po las gzhan yin na lta ba po yod pa'i tshe na nyan pa po yang yod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan pa po yang lta ba po las gzhan yin na lta ba po yod pa'i tshe na nyan pa po yang yod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In the same way, if the hearer is different from the seer, then when the seer exists, the hearer also exists.

original: nyan pa po ci lta ba bzhin du snom pa po dang myong ba po dang reg pa po dang sems pa po dag kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: nyan pa po ci lta ba bzhin du snom pa po dang myong ba po dang reg pa po dang sems pa po dag kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The one who smells, the one who tastes, the one who touches, and the one who cognizes are also like that, just as the one who hears is.

original: de ltar gyur na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the error if that is the case?

original: de'i phyir des na /
analyzed: de'i phyir des na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: bdag kyang mang @203b po nyid du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smras so //🔽rgyud so so la'o zhes bya ba ni sems can spyi'i rgyud la bdag mang por 'gyur ba la skyon med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag kyang mang @203b po nyid du 'gyur // zhes bya ba smras so // rgyud so so la'o zhes bya ba ni sems can spyi'i rgyud la bdag mang por 'gyur ba la skyon med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The self would be manifold.🔽The self would be manifold in the continuum of each sentient being.🔽The error of the self being manifold in the continuum of one person would not be taught,

original: gcig gi rgyud la bdag mang por 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gcig gi rgyud la bdag mang por 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: but the error of the self being manifold in the continuum of many sentient beings would be taught.

original: de ltar ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir don dam par rgyud tha dad pa dag gi lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang snom pa po la sogs pa dag gzhan nyid yin par mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir don dam par rgyud tha dad pa dag gi lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang snom pa po la sogs pa dag gzhan nyid yin par mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Since that is not accepted, therefore it is not tenable that the one who sees, the one who hears, the one who smells, and so on, in different continua are different. This is the presentation of the thesis.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang skabs kyi don la phan pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa mtshon par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang skabs kyi don la phan pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa mtshon par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very inference, here the inference that is helpful for the meaning of the context is illustrated.

original: skabs kyi don ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa dag gis gzhan nyid dgag pa'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi don ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa dag gis gzhan nyid dgag pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the context is the refutation of difference by the seer, hearer, etc.

original: de la phan pa nyid ni rjes su dpag pa ste nges so //
analyzed: de la phan pa nyid ni rjes su dpag pa ste nges so //
translated: The helpfulness is the inference.

original: nye bar len pa po lhas byin gyi nyan pa po ni lta ba po las gzhan ma yin te /🔽rgyu dang 'bras bur 'grel pa'i nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na lta ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas gzhan nyid du smra ba rnams la rjes su dpag pas gnod do zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po lhas byin gyi nyan pa po ni lta ba po las gzhan ma yin te / rgyu dang 'bras bur 'grel pa'i nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na lta ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas gzhan nyid du smra ba rnams la rjes su dpag pas gnod do zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
translated: The hearer of the appropriator Devadatta is not different from the seer,🔽because of being the appropriator who is the commentator on cause and effect, like, for example, the seer’s own self. Thus, the proponents of difference are harmed by inference.

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the position, the example, and the conclusion are to be applied in order.

original: dper na lta ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid ni skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir lta ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du nye bar len pa
analyzed: dper na lta ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid ni skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir lta ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du nye bar len pa
translated: For example, the self of the seer is not different from the self of the seer because it is the appropriator that is related to the prior and subsequent moments as cause and effect.

original: po lhas byin gyi nyan pa po yang skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir lta ba po las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: po lhas byin gyi nyan pa po yang skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir lta ba po las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the hearer of Devadatta is not different from the seer because it is the appropriator that is related to the prior and subsequent moments as cause and effect.

original: 'dir ci'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa zhes bya ba dang / nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi khyad par gnyis smos she na /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa zhes bya ba dang / nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi khyad par gnyis smos she na /
translated: Why are the two specific reasons stated here: “because it is related to the prior and subsequent moments as cause and effect” and “because it is the appropriator”?

original: gal te nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig smos na /
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig smos na /
translated: If only the reason “because it is the appropriator” were stated,

original: rgyud tha dad pa'i nye bar len pa po bzhin no zhes bya bar yang 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa'i nye bar len pa po bzhin no zhes bya bar yang 'gyur bas /
translated: it would follow that it is like the appropriator of a different continuum.

original: des na ci re zhig rgyud tha dad pa'i nye bar len pa po bzhin du gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: des na ci re zhig rgyud tha dad pa'i nye bar len pa po bzhin du gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, is the seer at that time different from the hearer, like the appropriator of a different continuum?

original: 'on te lta ba po'i rang gi bdag @204a * //
analyzed: 'on te lta ba po'i rang gi bdag @204a * //
translated: Or is it not different from the hearer, like the seer’s own self?

original: nyid bzhin du gzhan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba ma nges par 'gyur bas de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i phyir khyad par smos te /
analyzed: nyid bzhin du gzhan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba ma nges par 'gyur bas de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i phyir khyad par smos te /
translated: Since it is not definite, he says “because they are related as cause and effect,”

original: des na rgyud tha dad pa'i nye bar len pa po nyid 'dir gtan tshigs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: des na rgyud tha dad pa'i nye bar len pa po nyid 'dir gtan tshigs su bzung ngo //
translated: and therefore, the appropriator of a different continuum is taken as the reason here.

original: rjes su dpag pa des na gzhan nyid du smra ba rnams la dam bcas pa nyams pa'i gnod par 'gyur bas lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa bdag gzhan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des na gzhan nyid du smra ba rnams la dam bcas pa nyams pa'i gnod par 'gyur bas lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa bdag gzhan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since the opponent’s thesis is undermined by this inference, the seer and hearer and so on are not different from the self.

original: yang na / lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
analyzed: yang na / lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
translated: Or, when there is a seer, there is a hearer.

original: ces bya ba ni lta ba po la brten nas nyan pa po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'di rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni lta ba po la brten nas nyan pa po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'di rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
translated: The second half of the verse is explained in a different way by the phrase “and so on.”

original: dper na sa bon la brten nas myu gu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du lta ba po la brten nas nyan pa po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon la brten nas myu gu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du lta ba po la brten nas nyan pa po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: For example, just as a sprout arises in dependence on a seed, the hearer would arise in dependence on the seer. This is the meaning intended.

original: de ltar gyur na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the error if that is the case?

original: de'i phyir de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Thus the self would be plural.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the past and so on are different times.

original: dper na rgyu sa bon zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus su 'byung la /
analyzed: dper na rgyu sa bon zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus su 'byung la /
translated: For example, the so-called seed that is the cause arises in the past.

original: 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir bdag nyid mang po nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du lta ba po ni 'das pa'i dus su 'byung la /
analyzed: 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir bdag nyid mang po nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du lta ba po ni 'das pa'i dus su 'byung la /
translated: The effect called “sprout” arises in the present, and since the time of the cause and the time of the effect are different, the self would be multiple.

original: nyan pa po ni da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bas dus tha dad pa'i phyir bdag mang po nyid du thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar gyur na 'dir yang phyir smra bar nus te zhes bya bas ni de ltar brten nas 'byung zhing bdag mang po nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: nyan pa po ni da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bas dus tha dad pa'i phyir bdag mang po nyid du thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro // de ltar gyur na 'dir yang phyir smra bar nus te zhes bya bas ni de ltar brten nas 'byung zhing bdag mang po nyid du gyur na /
translated: Similarly, the seer arises in the past, and the hearer arises in the present, and since the times are different, the error of the self being multiple would ensue.🔽In this way, one could also argue in response to this, and so on.

original: 'dir yang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa smra bar nus te zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'dir yang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa smra bar nus te zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that if one were to arise in dependence and the self were multiple, one could also argue in response to this, that is, one could also state an inference refuting the appropriator and the appropriated.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par nye bar len pa po ni nye bar len pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par nye bar len pa po ni nye bar len pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very proof, he says, ultimately, the appropriator is not the entity of the appropriator.

original: brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na nye bar len pa po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na nye bar len pa po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they arise in dependence, like the self that is the appropriator.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba'i bdag nyid dag ni brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa @204b po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba'i bdag nyid dag ni brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa @204b po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are applied in order.🔽For example, the appropriator of seeing and so on is not the entity of the appropriator because it arises in dependence.

original: lta ba po la sogs pa nye bar len pa po dag kyang brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: lta ba po la sogs pa nye bar len pa po dag kyang brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the appropriator of the seer and so on is not the entity of the appropriator because it arises in dependence.

original: des ni nye bar len pa po'i dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni nye bar len pa po'i dgag pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the refutation of the appropriator.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi lta ba la sogs pa ni nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba'i nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi lta ba la sogs pa ni nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba'i nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the seeing and so on of Devadatta is not the appropriated object of the appropriator called Devadatta.

original: lta ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi lta ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi lta ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi lta ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni lta ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba nye bar blang ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi lta ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni lta ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba nye bar blang ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the self of the seeing and so on of a sacrifice is not the appropriator Devadatta because it is seeing and so on.

original: lhas byin gyi lta ba la sogs pa yang lta ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba'i nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi lta ba la sogs pa yang lta ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba'i nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, Devadatta’s seeing and so on are not the appropriated of the appropriator Devadatta because they are seeing and so on.

original: des ni nye bar blang ba dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni nye bar blang ba dgag pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the refutation of appropriation.

original: de ltar nye bar len pa po nyid dang nye bar blang ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir yang ci skad smras pa'i skyon dang ma bral lo zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pa po nyid dang nye bar blang ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir yang ci skad smras pa'i skyon dang ma bral lo zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon ci skad smras pa de nyid so na gnas so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon ci skad smras pa de nyid so na gnas so //
translated: The fault of the reason being unestablished that was stated above still stands for those who assert the existence of the appropriator.

original: gal te nye bar len pa po ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa po ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re /
translated: If you say that there is no fault because the appropriator is not to be expressed as the same or different,

original: kho bo cag gi gzhung las nye bar len pa po bdag snga na gnas pa ni phung po dang gcig pa nyid dang / tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid kyi phyogs sun phyung ba'i skyon de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi gzhung las nye bar len pa po bdag snga na gnas pa ni phung po dang gcig pa nyid dang / tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid kyi phyogs sun phyung ba'i skyon de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: We say that the appropriator, the self, which exists prior to the appropriated aggregates, is not to be described as either the same as or different from the aggregates. Therefore, we do not commit the error of refuting the positions of sameness and difference.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: bdag gi yin par brjod pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag gi yin par brjod pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is not without fault because it is said to be mine.

original: khyed kyi gzhung las rnam par shes pa bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan nyid la phyogs par brjod pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyi gzhung las rnam par shes pa bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan nyid la phyogs par brjod pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not without fault because your texts say that consciousness is mine, like a servant, and so on. This is because it is said that it is different.

original: yang na gang dag bdag lta ba po la sogs par brjod pa dag phung po las gzhan pa nyid du ston pa de dag gi phyogs la @205a * //🔽lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
analyzed: yang na gang dag bdag lta ba po la sogs par brjod pa dag phung po las gzhan pa nyid du ston pa de dag gi phyogs la @205a * // lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
translated: Or else, in the context of those who assert that the self is the seer and so on, but is different from the aggregates,🔽the remainder of the sentence is “when there is a seer, there is a hearer.”

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang dag nye bar len pa po bdag de phung po las gzhan pa nyid du ston pa de dag gi phyogs la yang lta ba po yod pa'i tshe na nyan pa po yang yod🔽par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang dag nye bar len pa po bdag de phung po las gzhan pa nyid du ston pa de dag gi phyogs la yang lta ba po yod pa'i tshe na nyan pa po yang yod par 'gyur bas /
translated: The remainder of the sentence is “when there is a seer, there is a hearer.”

original: des na bdag mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung bar ston to //
analyzed: des na bdag mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung bar ston to //
translated: Thus the error of the self being multiple is shown to be untenable.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di la lta bar byed pas lta ba po de gzugs dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin pa la /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di la lta bar byed pas lta ba po de gzugs dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin pa la /
translated: To demonstrate that, it is said: Since the seer is one who sees form,

original: de ni sgra dmigs pa dang mi ldan te /
analyzed: de ni sgra dmigs pa dang mi ldan te /
translated: it is not endowed with the apprehension of sound.

original: gcig la ngo bo nyid gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gcig la ngo bo nyid gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is impossible for a single thing to have two natures.

original: des ni lta ba po gang kho na yin pa nyid nyan pa po dang tshor ba po ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: des ni lta ba po gang kho na yin pa nyid nyan pa po dang tshor ba po ma yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that the seer is not the hearer or the feeler.

original: de lta na lta ba po dang nyan pa po dag gzhan nyid du 'gyur bas lta ba po yod pa'i tshe na nyan pa po yang yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas bdag mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na lta ba po dang nyan pa po dag gzhan nyid du 'gyur bas lta ba po yod pa'i tshe na nyan pa po yang yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas bdag mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since in that case the seer and the hearer would be different, the error would arise that when the seer exists, the hearer would also exist. To demonstrate that it would follow that the self would be multiple, he says:

original: lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
analyzed: lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
translated: When there is a seer, there is a hearer.

original: ces bya ba de bzhin du snom pa po dang myong ba po dang reg pa po dang sems pa po dag kyang yod par gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya ba de bzhin du snom pa po dang myong ba po dang reg pa po dang sems pa po dag kyang yod par gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Similarly, if the smeller, the taster, the toucher, and the thinker existed, what would be the consequence?

original: bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The self would be multiple.

original: lus dang dbang po'i tshogs gcig la'am /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po'i tshogs gcig la'am /
translated: In the collection of bodies and faculties,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs gcig la za ba po zhes bya ba'i bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs gcig la za ba po zhes bya ba'i bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: or in the collection of causes and effects, the self called “the experiencer” would be multiple.

original: de yang mi 'dod pas zhes bya bas ni rgyud gcig la bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur ba de yang mi 'dod pas de'i phyir gang dag bdag lta ba po la sogs par brjod pa dag phung po las gzhan pa nyid du ston pa de dag gis bdag
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pas zhes bya bas ni rgyud gcig la bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur ba de yang mi 'dod pas de'i phyir gang dag bdag lta ba po la sogs par brjod pa dag phung po las gzhan pa nyid du ston pa de dag gis bdag
translated: Therefore, those who teach that the self is the seer and so on, but is different from the aggregates,

original: gcig pu rtag pa khyab par 'dod pa de mi 'grub po zhes ston to //
analyzed: gcig pu rtag pa khyab par 'dod pa de mi 'grub po zhes ston to //
translated: demonstrate that it is not established that they assert a single, permanent, and pervasive self.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir de'i phyir bdag ni gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir de'i phyir bdag ni gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not established that the self is one,

original: dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir rgyud du ma'i lta ba po bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir rgyud du ma'i lta ba po bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, because the focal object is different, like the seer of many mindstreams.🔽The subject, the probandum, the proof, and the example are respectively

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: the subject, the probandum, the proof, and the example.

original: dper na rgyud du ma'i lta ba po dag ni dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub pa de bzhin du phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag de yod lta ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub
analyzed: dper na rgyud du ma'i lta ba po dag ni dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub pa de bzhin du phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag de yod lta ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub
translated: For example, just as the viewer of many continua is not established as one because of the difference of focal objects, so too the self that is different from the aggregates is not established as one because of the difference of focal objects such as seeing.

original: ste / phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag med do //
analyzed: ste / phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag med do //
translated: Therefore the self does not exist as different from the aggregates.

original: des na @205b lta ba la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa po gzhan nyid du rtog pa yang mi 'thad de gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na @205b lta ba la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa po gzhan nyid du rtog pa yang mi 'thad de gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is also untenable to conceive the appropriator of seeing and so on as different because the basis does not exist.

original: nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba gzhan dag 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba gzhan dag 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: Others who assert the existence of the appropriator say this:

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces gsungs pa de la gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag yin pas de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces gsungs pa de la gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag yin pas de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug 'byung la /
translated: In this regard the Bhagavān said, “The condition of name-and-form is the six sense bases.” Since form is the four great elements, the six sense bases arise due to the condition of the four great elements.

original: 'byung ba de dag kyang nye bar len pa po'i nye bar blang ba yin pas de'i phyir nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa lta ba la sogs pa skye mched drug dang ldan pa snga na gnas pa'i rim gyis tshor ba la sogs pa dag 'byung🔽ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul yin na /
analyzed: 'byung ba de dag kyang nye bar len pa po'i nye bar blang ba yin pas de'i phyir nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa lta ba la sogs pa skye mched drug dang ldan pa snga na gnas pa'i rim gyis tshor ba la sogs pa dag 'byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul yin na /
translated: And since those elements are appropriated by the appropriator, therefore the Tathāgata’s mode is that the six sense bases such as seeing arise in sequence prior to the appropriator, and feeling and so on arise later.

original: khyed kyis nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med de /
analyzed: khyed kyis nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med de /
translated: But you say that the appropriator does not exist prior to the appropriated such as seeing,🔽because it is an object of imputation, just as a cloth does not exist prior to its thread.

original: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa bzhin no zhes brjod pas tshul de dang 'gal bar byed pas de'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pas gnod par gyur pa'i phyir de ni legs pa ma yin
analyzed: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa bzhin no zhes brjod pas tshul de dang 'gal bar byed pas de'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pas gnod par gyur pa'i phyir de ni legs pa ma yin
translated: Since this contradicts the Tathāgata’s mode, it is not correct because it is undermined by the former position.

original: no zhes bya ba ni de ltar nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag lta ba la sogs pa skye mched rnams kyi snga rol na nye bar len pa po yod par ma grub pa dang / 'dir lung las ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces gsungs la /
analyzed: no zhes bya ba ni de ltar nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag lta ba la sogs pa skye mched rnams kyi snga rol na nye bar len pa po yod par ma grub pa dang / 'dir lung las ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces gsungs la /
translated: but here scripture declares that the six sense bases are conditioned by name and form.

original: gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag yin pas skye mched rnams kyi snga rol na 'byung ba rnams yod la /
analyzed: gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag yin pas skye mched rnams kyi snga rol na 'byung ba rnams yod la /
translated: Since form is the four great elements, the elements exist prior to the sense bases.🔽Since the elements are conditioned by the self, the appropriator of the elements, the self exists prior to the elements.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi snga rol na 'byung ba nye bar len pa po bdag ces bya ba yod ces pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi tshul yin na /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi snga rol na 'byung ba nye bar len pa po bdag ces bya ba yod ces pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi tshul yin na /
translated: This is the way of the scriptures of the Tathāgata.

original: khyed kyis sngar rjes su dpag pa ci skad bstan pa dag gi nye bar len pa po snga na med par bsgrubs pa ni /
analyzed: khyed kyis sngar rjes su dpag pa ci skad bstan pa dag gi nye bar len pa po snga na med par bsgrubs pa ni /
translated: But the prior nonexistence of the appropriator that you have inferred is not correct,

original: gsung rab kyi tshul dang 'gal bas legs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi tshul dang 'gal bas legs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: because it contradicts the way of the scriptures.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains this:

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
translated: Seeing, hearing, and so on, and also feeling and so on,

original: gang las 'gyur ba'i 'byung de la'ang //
analyzed: gang las 'gyur ba'i 'byung de la'ang //
translated: arise from the primary elements.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that appropriator does not exist in those.

original: rdzas su yod pa nye bar len pa po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nye bar len pa po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is not established as a substantial appropriator.

original: lta ba la sogs pa skye mched rnams rkyen gang dag las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'byung ba chen po de dag la yang nye bar len pa po snga na gnas pa de yod pa ma yin te /🔽nye bar len pa po rdzas su yod par 'dod pa de nye bar @206a * //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa skye mched rnams rkyen gang dag las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'byung ba chen po de dag la yang nye bar len pa po snga na gnas pa de yod pa ma yin te / nye bar len pa po rdzas su yod par 'dod pa de nye bar @206a * //
translated: The primary elements from which the sense spheres such as seeing arise do not have that prior appropriator existing in them.

original: len pa po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: len pa po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because that which is asserted to substantially exist as an appropriator is not established as an appropriator.🔽This is the intended meaning.

original: 'o na ci lta bu yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'o na ci lta bu yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'o na lung las ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces gsungs pa de'i tshul ci lta bu yin zhe na zhes 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'o na lung las ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces gsungs pa de'i tshul ci lta bu yin zhe na zhes 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: One may say: But how is it that the scriptures declare: 'The six sense-fields have name-and-form as their condition'?

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The answer to this is:

original: tha snyad du ming dang gzugs dang de la brten nas nye bar len pa po nyid du gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: tha snyad du ming dang gzugs dang de la brten nas nye bar len pa po nyid du gdags par zad kyi /
translated: Name-and-form and the one who appropriates it are merely designated conventionally,

original: don dam par nye bar len pa po rdzas su yod pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs khas ma blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa po rdzas su yod pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs khas ma blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: but since, ultimately, the phase of name-and-form of a substantially existent appropriator is not accepted, the opponent's position is not harmed.

original: nged dbu ma pas kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du ming dang gzugs su gdags pa dang / ming dang gzugs de la brten nas de'i nye bar len pa po nyid du gdags par khas blangs par zad kyi /
analyzed: nged dbu ma pas kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du ming dang gzugs su gdags pa dang / ming dang gzugs de la brten nas de'i nye bar len pa po nyid du gdags par khas blangs par zad kyi /
translated: We Centrists merely accept that, conventionally, name-and-form is designated and that, based on name-and-form, the one who appropriates it is designated.

original: don dam par nye bar len pa po rdzas su yod pa snga na gnas pa'i nye bar blang ba ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams yin par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir kho bo cag la phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa
analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa po rdzas su yod pa snga na gnas pa'i nye bar blang ba ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams yin par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir kho bo cag la phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa
translated: Because we do not accept that the appropriator substantially exists prior to the appropriated, the fault of contradicting our own tenets does not

original: med do // des ni nye bar len pa po rdzas su yod pa nyid du 'dod pa ma grub pa'i phyir 'byung ba dag la yang de yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: med do // des ni nye bar len pa po rdzas su yod pa nyid du 'dod pa ma grub pa'i phyir 'byung ba dag la yang de yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: incur. Therefore, since the substantial existence of the appropriator is not established, it is shown that it does not exist in the elements.🔽Moreover: Seeing, hearing, and so on, and also

original: yang na / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: yang na / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
translated: feeling and so forth,

original: gang las 'gyur ba'i 'byung de la'ang //
analyzed: gang las 'gyur ba'i 'byung de la'ang //
translated: from what do they arise?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist in the elements.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag gi nye bar len pa po nyid du grub pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa skye mched rnams rkyen gang dag las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'byung ba chen po de dag la yang
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag gi nye bar len pa po nyid du grub pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa skye mched rnams rkyen gang dag las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'byung ba chen po de dag la yang
translated: are not established as the self that is the appropriator of those.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs na de dag la ci zhig yod pa ma yin zhe na /🔽'byung ba de dag la de dag gi nye bar len pa po nyid du grub pa'i bdag snga na gnas pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs na de dag la ci zhig yod pa ma yin zhe na / 'byung ba de dag la de dag gi nye bar len pa po nyid du grub pa'i bdag snga na gnas pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If it is said that “they do not exist,” what is it that does not exist?🔽The self that is the appropriator of those elements does not exist prior to them.

original: des ni 'byung ba dag gi snga rol na de dag nye bar len pa po'i bdag med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'byung ba dag gi snga rol na de dag nye bar len pa po'i bdag med do zhes bstan to //
translated: This teaches that prior to the elements, the self that is the appropriator of those does not exist.

original: gal te 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po de ci ltar lta ba la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub ce na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po de ci ltar lta ba la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub ce na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug
translated: If you ask, how is it that the appropriator of the appropriated elements is not established as the appropriator of seeing and so on?

original: ces gsungs pas gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag yin la /
analyzed: ces gsungs pas gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag yin la /
translated: The opponent says: Since it is said that the six sense bases have the condition of name and form, form is the four great elements.

original: de dag nye bar len pa'i @206b bdag snga na gnas pa yang yod pas 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po de ci ltar lta ba la sogs pa skye mched rnams kyi nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub ces zer ba yin
analyzed: de dag nye bar len pa'i @206b bdag snga na gnas pa yang yod pas 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po de ci ltar lta ba la sogs pa skye mched rnams kyi nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub ces zer ba yin
translated: Since the self that appropriates them exists prior to them, how is it that the appropriator of the appropriated elements is not established as the appropriator of the six sense bases such as seeing?

original: no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'byung ba nye bar blang ba nye bar len pa'i nye bar len pa po ni lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag nye bar len par byed par mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'byung ba nye bar blang ba nye bar len pa'i nye bar len pa po ni lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag nye bar len par byed par mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical that the appropriator of the appropriated elements appropriates the appropriated seeing and so on.

original: de dag las gzhan nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they are other than those elements, they are not the appropriator of the elements that are appropriated by a different mindstream, like the appropriator of the elements appropriated in a sacrifice.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na mchod sbyin gyi 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po ni lta ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag nye bar
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na mchod sbyin gyi 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po ni lta ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag nye bar
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are applied in order.🔽For example, the appropriator of the elements appropriated in a sacrifice is the appropriator of elements other than those elements such as seeing because the elements appropriated in a sacrifice are not the appropriator of the elements appropriated by Devadatta.

original: len par byed par mi rigs pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi 'byung ba nye bar blang ba nye bar len pa'i nye bar len pa po yang /
analyzed: len par byed par mi rigs pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi 'byung ba nye bar blang ba nye bar len pa'i nye bar len pa po yang /
translated: In the same way, the appropriator of the elements appropriated by Devadatta is not the appropriator of the elements of Devadatta.

original: lta ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag nye bar len par byed par mi rigs so //🔽'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i dus na lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar blang ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar blang ba'i dus na yang 'byung ba nye bar blang ba dag nye bar blang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa bstan ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag nye bar len par byed par mi rigs so // 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i dus na lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar blang ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar blang ba'i dus na yang 'byung ba nye bar blang ba dag nye bar blang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa bstan ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gzhan ma yin te /
translated: It is illogical that the appropriator appropriates the appropriated such as seeing, etc., because the appropriator is a different substantial entity from those such as seeing, etc.🔽The reason that has just been explained by inference is not different from the meaning of the reason stated in the commentary: because at the time of appropriating the elements, seeing, etc., are not appropriated, and at the time of appropriating seeing, etc., the elements that are appropriated are not appropriated.

original: de'i phyir yang 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, the appropriator of the appropriated elements is not established as the appropriator of seeing, etc.🔽If you think that the appropriator of the elements is the appropriator of seeing, etc.,

original: gal te gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe /
translated: because it is said:🔽Seeing, hearing, and so on,

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
translated: and also feeling and so on,

original: nye bar blang ba dag yin pa de'i tshe na nye bar len pa po zhes smra'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba dag yin pa de'i tshe na nye bar len pa po zhes smra'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the appropriated aggregates are the self, then the appropriator of the aggregates would not exist.🔽If the appropriator of the aggregates existed prior to the appropriation of the aggregates, then the appropriator would be without appropriated aggregates.🔽If the appropriator of the aggregates existed prior to the appropriation of the aggregates, then the appropriator would be without appropriated aggregates.

original: pha rol po dag na re gang gi tshe lta ba la sogs pa skye mched rnams nye bar blang ba yin pa de'i tshe na de dag nye bar len pa'i bdag de nye bar len pa po yin no zhes zer ba yin no //🔽de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /🔽de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re gang gi tshe lta ba la sogs pa skye mched rnams nye bar blang ba yin pa de'i tshe na de dag nye bar len pa'i bdag de nye bar len pa po yin no zhes zer ba yin no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / de ni bzang po ma yin te /

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar blang ba yin pa'i tshe na yang lta ba la sogs pa dag 'dus pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin @207a * //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar blang ba yin pa'i tshe na yang lta ba la sogs pa dag 'dus pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin @207a * //
translated: If the appropriator of the aggregates existed prior to the appropriation of the aggregates, then the appropriator would be without appropriated aggregates.

original: no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If the appropriator of the

original: lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba yin par lung las gsungs pa ni 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas de dag nye bar len pa'i bdag snga na gnas pa yang yod pa🔽ma yin te /🔽sngar / ci med gang zhig ga la yod //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba yin par lung las gsungs pa ni 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas de dag nye bar len pa'i bdag snga na gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin te / sngar / ci med gang zhig ga la yod //
translated: This is because the following has already been explained:🔽If one does not exist, how can the other exist?

original: gang med ci zhig ga la yod //
analyzed: gang med ci zhig ga la yod //
translated: If the other does not exist, how can the one exist?🔽This response has already been given.

original: ces bshad pa nyid kyis de'i lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa nyid kyis de'i lan btab pa yin no //
translated: If you say that it is as you assert,

original: gal te ci ltar 'dod pa de bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re lta ba la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i bdag snga na med kyang lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag ni rdzas su yod pa nyid🔽yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te ci ltar 'dod pa de bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re lta ba la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i bdag snga na med kyang lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag ni rdzas su yod pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: the opponent says that although the self that appropriates such things as seeing does not exist previously, such things as seeing that are appropriated substantially exist.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de'i phyir /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: gang gi yin pa gal te med //
analyzed: gang gi yin pa gal te med //
translated: If that which is the appropriator does not exist,

original: de dag kyang ni yod pa min //
analyzed: de dag kyang ni yod pa min //
translated: those that are appropriated also do not exist.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus,

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa nyid dang rdzas nyid du yod pa ma yin na nye bar len pa po nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon de nyid kyi lan gdab par dka'o zhes bya ba smras te
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa nyid dang rdzas nyid du yod pa ma yin na nye bar len pa po nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon de nyid kyi lan gdab par dka'o zhes bya ba smras te
translated: if the self does not exist as the appropriator and as substance, then it is difficult to respond to the faults that you have stated, such as the reason’s meaning is not established.

original: / lta ba la sogs pa dag gang gi yin pa'i bdag de gal te med na lta ba la sogs pa de dag kyang yod pa ma yin pas nye bar len pa po'i bdag snga na yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa dang 'gal ba'i skyon ma
analyzed: / lta ba la sogs pa dag gang gi yin pa'i bdag de gal te med na lta ba la sogs pa de dag kyang yod pa ma yin pas nye bar len pa po'i bdag snga na yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa dang 'gal ba'i skyon ma
translated: If the self that is the support of seeing and so on does not exist, then seeing and so on also do not exist. Therefore, the fault that the reason’s meaning is not established and the fault that the reason is contradictory are

original: spangs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de'i phyir de ltar ci skad bstan pa'i sgrub pas brtags na /
analyzed: spangs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de'i phyir de ltar ci skad bstan pa'i sgrub pas brtags na /
translated: not abandoned.🔽Thus, when one analyzes in this way, as has been taught,

original: gang zhig lta la sogs pa yi //🔽snga rol da lta phyin med //
analyzed: gang zhig lta la sogs pa yi // snga rol da lta phyin med //
translated: then the conceptions

original: de la yod do med do zhes //
analyzed: de la yod do med do zhes //
translated: that it exists or does not exist

original: rtog pa dag ni ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtog pa dag ni ldog par 'gyur //
translated: will be reversed.

original: nye bar len pa po gang zhig lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol dang da ltar dang phyi na rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub cing 'byung ba'i rdzas bzhin du med pa de lta bu'i de la don dam par gcig pa nyid dang gzhan
analyzed: nye bar len pa po gang zhig lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol dang da ltar dang phyi na rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub cing 'byung ba'i rdzas bzhin du med pa de lta bu'i de la don dam par gcig pa nyid dang gzhan
translated: The appropriator does not exist substantially prior to, simultaneous with, or subsequent to seeing and so on. It is like the substance of the elements.

original: nyid du yod do med do zhes bya bar rtog pa dag ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: nyid du yod do med do zhes bya bar rtog pa dag ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The conception that such an appropriator ultimately exists as the same or different from seeing and so on is stopped.🔽This is the conclusion of the chapter.

original: sngar phung po brtag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: sngar phung po brtag pa'i skabs su /
translated: Previously, in the chapter on the aggregates, it was said:

original: gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the cause of form,

original: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Form is not observed.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from what is called form,

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
translated: The cause of form is not seen.

original: zhes bya bas 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs gcig gis gcig bsal te rdzas su med pa la yod pa dang med par rnam par rtog pa dag ldog pa de bzhin du nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba gcig gis gcig bsal
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs gcig gis gcig bsal te rdzas su med pa la yod pa dang med par rnam par rtog pa dag ldog pa de bzhin du nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba gcig gis gcig bsal
translated: Thus, the conceptual thoughts of existence and nonexistence are reversed in regard to the non-substantial existence of primary and secondary matter, which are mutually exclusive.

original: @207b te / rdzas su med pa gang dag la yang yod pa dang med pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa dag ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @207b te / rdzas su med pa gang dag la yang yod pa dang med pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa dag ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the conceptual thoughts of existence and nonexistence are reversed in regard to the non-substantial existence of the appropriator and the appropriated, which are mutually exclusive.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir de la re zhig yod do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir de la re zhig yod do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to explain that in detail, the reversal of the conceptual thought of existence is because of the non-substantial existence of the appropriator and the appropriated.

original: med do zhes rtog pa ldog pa ni brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: med do zhes rtog pa ldog pa ni brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The reversal of the conceptual thought of nonexistence is because of the designation in dependence on the aggregates.

original: / yang na yod do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni don dam par yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / yang na yod do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni don dam par yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the reversal of the conceptual thought of existence is because there is no inference that reveals ultimate existence.

original: med do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni yod pa bsal bas med par rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba de med pas med par rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: med do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni yod pa bsal bas med par rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba de med pas med par rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The cessation of the conception of nonexistence is because the conception of nonexistence arises from the elimination of existence, and that nonexistence does not exist, so the conception of nonexistence also does not exist.

original: de'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of that,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: the Bhagavat said in the noble Lankavatara-sutra:

original: blo yis rnam par gzhig na ni //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par gzhig na ni //
translated: When the mind is destroyed,

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med //
translated: the essence is not apprehended.

original: de phyir de dag brjod med dang // ngo bo nyid ni med par bstan //
analyzed: de phyir de dag brjod med dang // ngo bo nyid ni med par bstan //
translated: Therefore, they are taught to be inexpressible and essenceless.

original: zhes ci skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes ci skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag gi rjes su dpag pa las nye bar len pa po yod de /🔽de yang nye bar len par byed pas nye bar len pa po zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag gi rjes su dpag pa las nye bar len pa po yod de / de yang nye bar len par byed pas nye bar len pa po zhes bya zhing /
translated: In that regard, those who assert the existence of the appropriator argue as follows: The appropriator exists because of inference.🔽Moreover, it is called the appropriator because it appropriates,

original: des nye bar blang ba yin pas nye bar blang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des nye bar blang ba yin pas nye bar blang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: and it is called the appropriated because it is appropriated by that.

original: de gnyi ga grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sngar smras pa grub pa zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhung bsnan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sngar smras pa grub pa zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhung bsnan pa yin no //
translated: Since both of those are established, it is illogical to say that the previously stated reason is established.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni nye bar len pa po yod pa'i gtan tshigs sun phyung ba brjod pa dang / rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa brjod pas nye bar len pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni nye bar len pa po yod pa'i gtan tshigs sun phyung ba brjod pa dang / rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa brjod pas nye bar len pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is to demonstrate the essencelessness of the appropriator by refuting the argument for the existence of the appropriator and by stating the autonomous syllogism. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dgu pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dgu pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba de /
translated: Here, in the context of the ninth chapter, the analysis of the appropriator and the appropriated, the meaning of the chapter is seen to be the result of the valid cognition.

original: pha rol pos sngar nye bar len pa po yod par bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa'i snga rol na gnas pa yod de /
analyzed: pha rol pos sngar nye bar len pa po yod par bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa'i snga rol na gnas pa yod de /
translated: Previously, the opponent argued that the appropriator exists, and the prior position is that the appropriator exists prior to seeing and so on.

original: nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de dag gi gtan tshigs sun phyung ba brjod pa dang / bstan bcos mdzad @208a * //🔽pa rang gi rjes su dpag pa brjod pas nye bar len pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de dag gi gtan tshigs sun phyung ba brjod pa dang / bstan bcos mdzad @208a * // pa rang gi rjes su dpag pa brjod pas nye bar len pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: and so on, and the refutation of the reasonings that they adduce, and the statement of the independent syllogism of the author of the treatise, demonstrate the essencelessness of the appropriator.

original: nye bar len pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / nye bar len pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang /🔽bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / nye bar len pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang / bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: To demonstrate what benefit there is in demonstrating the essencelessness of the appropriator, and to dispel the claim of others that this is merely a dry treatise of sophistry, we will also establish this by means of a scriptural source that can be trusted.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: To this end, the Questions of Suvikrāntavikrāmin Prajñāpāramitā Sūtra says:🔽Suvikrāntavikrāmin, it is thus.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la shes pa po'am shes par byed pa po med do //🔽tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la shes pa po'am shes par byed pa po med do // tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la /
translated: Subhūti, form is not a knower or a seer.

original: shes pa po'am shes par byed pa po med do //
analyzed: shes pa po'am shes par byed pa po med do //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not a knower or a seer.🔽Subhūti, form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not a knower or a seer.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la shes pa po'am shes par byed pa po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la shes pa po'am shes par byed pa po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: That is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs la shes pa po'am mthong ba po med do //
analyzed: gzugs la shes pa po'am mthong ba po med do //
translated: Subhūti, form is not a knower or a seer.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la shes pa po'am mthong ba po med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa la shes pa po'am mthong ba po med do //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not a knower or a seer.
