analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gsungs pa 'grel pa byed pas ci skad bstan pa de lta bu rang gi phyogs la thal bar 'gyur ba dag yongs su spang bar 'dod pas de dag gal te 'di snyam du gang gi phyir mes khyab cing sreg bzhin
translated: If you think that since it is pervaded by fire and is being burned, it is called fuel, and that since fuel that is dependent on fire is established as fuel, there is no error of the consequence, then what is the response to the following?

original: pa de bud shing yin pa de'i phyir me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin yang me la bud shing med pa ma yin gyi bud shing dang bcas pa nyid yin pas de la bud shing med par thal bar gyur na skyon gang dag bstan pa de dag
analyzed: pa de bud shing yin pa de'i phyir me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin yang me la bud shing med pa ma yin gyi bud shing dang bcas pa nyid yin pas de la bud shing med par thal bar gyur na skyon gang dag bstan pa de dag
translated: Because that which is being burned is fuel, therefore, even though fire and fuel are different, fire does not lack fuel, but rather possesses fuel.

original: tu mi 'gyur bar sems na de yang mi rung bar ston pa'i phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: tu mi 'gyur bar sems na de yang mi rung bar ston pa'i phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: If you think that the error previously explained does not apply to you, then that is also illogical.🔽This is the opponent’s position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir @214a * //🔽'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir @214a * // 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: That is not good.🔽If you assert that fire and fuel are different, then the error of being causeless and so on would ensue.

original: me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du khas blangs na rgyu med pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon yod par mi 'dod pas sreg bzhin pa nyid na bud shing yin pas me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin yang rgyu med pa la sogs pa'i
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du khas blangs na rgyu med pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon yod par mi 'dod pas sreg bzhin pa nyid na bud shing yin pas me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin yang rgyu med pa la sogs pa'i
translated: Since you do not assert that, since that which is being burned is fuel, even though fire and fuel are different, the error of being causeless and so on does not arise.

original: skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de mi rung ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de mi rung ngo zhes ston to //
translated: The response to this is that it is not tenable to say that the consequence of error does not apply.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na glags yod pa'i tshig nye bar gzhag pa brjod pas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pas glags yod pa'i skyon gyi bzhi po gzhan nyid mi 'dod na dam bcas pa nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na glags yod pa'i tshig nye bar gzhag pa brjod pas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pas glags yod pa'i skyon gyi bzhi po gzhan nyid mi 'dod na dam bcas pa nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Why? Because if you do not assert the four errors of the consequence of error that are stated in the four types of inference, then your thesis is undermined.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du khas len pa la glags yod pa'i tshig nye bar bzhag la /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du khas len pa la glags yod pa'i tshig nye bar bzhag la /
translated: The master Nāgārjuna states the consequence of error in the assertion that fire and fuel are different:

original: gal te shing las mi gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te shing las mi gzhan na //
translated: If fire is different from fuel,

original: shing med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shing med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: it would arise even without fuel.

original: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: It would always be burning,

original: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung //🔽rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung // rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
translated: arising without a cause of burning.🔽If that were so, then it would be pointless to make an effort to light it.

original: de lta yin na las kyang med //
analyzed: de lta yin na las kyang med //
translated: If that were so, then it would not be a product.

original: ces bya ba dag brjod pas me dang bud shing dag gzhan ma yin par rjes su dpag pa rnam pa bzhi po don dam par me ni bud shing las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba dag brjod pas me dang bud shing dag gzhan ma yin par rjes su dpag pa rnam pa bzhi po don dam par me ni bud shing las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: In terms of the ultimate, fire is not different from fuel,🔽because it is related to it, like the nature of fuel itself.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bud shing gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par bud shing yang me las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bud shing gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par bud shing yang me las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, in terms of the ultimate, fuel is not different from fire,🔽because it is related to it, like the nature of fire itself.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par me ni bud shing las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par me ni bud shing las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: In terms of the ultimate, fire is not different from fuel,🔽because it is related to it, like the nature of fuel itself.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dang rtsom pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang las dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bud shing gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par bud shing yang me las gzhan ma yin te rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dang rtsom pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dang rtsom pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang las dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bud shing gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par bud shing yang me las gzhan ma yin te rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dang rtsom pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Similarly, in the ultimate truth, fuel is not different from fire because it has a cause, because it is initiated, and because it has an object, like the nature of fire itself.

original: las dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag bstan pas pha rol po dag 'jigs nas glags yod pa'i skyon bzhi po me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du sngar khas blangs pa de da 'dir mi 'dod na de
analyzed: las dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag bstan pas pha rol po dag 'jigs nas glags yod pa'i skyon bzhi po me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du sngar khas blangs pa de da 'dir mi 'dod na de
translated: Because the opponent is frightened by these arguments, he now fears the four faults of the position that fire and fuel are different, which he previously asserted.

original: lta na pha rol po dag gis dam bcas pa nyams pa'i phyir de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lta na pha rol po dag gis dam bcas pa nyams pa'i phyir de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If he does not assert that, then because he has violated his own beliefs, he is not good.

original: gzhan yang nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pas kyang gal te pha rol po dag na re gang gi tshe mos khyab cing sreg bzhin pa de tsam bud shing zhes bya'i me med @214b cing mi sreg pa'i tshe bud shing zhes mi bya bas des na me
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pas kyang gal te pha rol po dag na re gang gi tshe mos khyab cing sreg bzhin pa de tsam bud shing zhes bya'i me med @214b cing mi sreg pa'i tshe bud shing zhes mi bya bas des na me
translated: Again, listen to this and so on, indicates that if the opponent says, when it is just that which is pervaded by and burning with fire, it is called fuel, but when fire does not exist and it is not burning, it is not called fuel, therefore,

original: dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin yang rgyu med pa la sogs pa'i skyon gang dag bstan pa de dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na de la yang skyon gzhan dag yod kyis nyon cig ces ston to /
analyzed: dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin yang rgyu med pa la sogs pa'i skyon gang dag bstan pa de dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na de la yang skyon gzhan dag yod kyis nyon cig ces ston to /
translated: even though fire and fuel are different, the errors of causelessness and so on that have been presented do not occur, then listen to this, which indicates that there are other errors.

original: gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
analyzed: gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
translated: When it is just that, it is that.

original: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
analyzed: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
translated: By what is that fuel burned?

original: gang gi tshe me'i rkyen gyis 'bar ba dang bcas pa de tsam bud shing de yin par brjod na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe me'i rkyen gyis 'bar ba dang bcas pa de tsam bud shing de yin par brjod na /
translated: When it is said that when it is just that which is burning with fire due to the condition of fire, it is called fuel,

original: gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed ces bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar gang gi tshe mes khyab cing sreg bzhin pa de tsam bud shing zhes bya ba na de nyid me yin par gyur bas de las logs shig na me🔽zhes bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir me gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed de mi byed do //
analyzed: gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed ces bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar gang gi tshe mes khyab cing sreg bzhin pa de tsam bud shing zhes bya ba na de nyid me yin par gyur bas de las logs shig na me zhes bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir me gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed de mi byed do //
translated: “By what fire is that fuel burned?” If, as the opponent asserts, that which is pervaded by fire and being burned is called fuel, then it is fire itself.🔽Therefore, since there is no other fire apart from that, by what fire is that fuel burned? It is not burned.

original: me gang gis khyab cing sreg bzhin pa de nyid me yin pa de las logs shig na bud shing yin pas brtag pa'i sreg bzhin pa gzhan yang med pas de'i phyir gang gi tshe mes khyab cing sreg bzhin pa de tsam du bud shing zhes bya'o zhes zer🔽ba de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: me gang gis khyab cing sreg bzhin pa de nyid me yin pa de las logs shig na bud shing yin pas brtag pa'i sreg bzhin pa gzhan yang med pas de'i phyir gang gi tshe mes khyab cing sreg bzhin pa de tsam du bud shing zhes bya'o zhes zer🔽ba de mi rung ngo //
translated: If that which is pervaded by fire and being burned is fire itself, then since there is no other fuel apart from that, there is also no other fuel that is being burned. Therefore, when that which is pervaded by fire and being burned is called fuel, that is untenable.

original: sreg bzhin pa bud shing yin par mi rung ba'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang 'ba' zhig byung ba la ni bud shing zhes brjod cing 'bar ba dang bcas pa la ni me zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sreg bzhin pa bud shing yin par mi rung ba'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang 'ba' zhig byung ba la ni bud shing zhes brjod cing 'bar ba dang bcas pa la ni me zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Conventionally, only that which is called “fuel” is what is being burned, and that which is called “fire” is what burns.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang de skad brjod pa'i phyir sreg bzhin pa bud shing yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang de skad brjod pa'i phyir sreg bzhin pa bud shing yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: Since this is said even in terms of conventional expressions, it is untenable that what is being burned is fuel.🔽Since ultimately arising is refuted, he says:

original: don dam par ni skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni don dam par ni dngos po thams cad kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir me dang bud shing dag gi tha snyad kyang med pas des de sreg bzhin pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad med do
analyzed: don dam par ni skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni don dam par ni dngos po thams cad kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir me dang bud shing dag gi tha snyad kyang med pas des de sreg bzhin pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad med do
translated: Since ultimately the arising of all things is refuted, even the conventions of fire and fuel do not exist. Therefore the convention “that which is being burned” does not exist.

original: // skyes bu zin na yang de tsam de yin pa'i phyir gang gis gang la khyab par byed par 'thad de /
analyzed: // skyes bu zin na yang de tsam de yin pa'i phyir gang gis gang la khyab par byed par 'thad de /
translated: Since the person who is grasped does not exist, it is not tenable that he is pervaded by that which is grasped.🔽Since the object that is grasped does not exist, it is not tenable that it is pervaded by that which grasps it.

original: de'i phyir tshig de ni rang gi blo gros yangs par ston pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du me dang bud shing dag skyes par khas blangs pa'i phyogs la yang me'i rkyen gyis 'bar ba dang bcas pa de tsam bud
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig de ni rang gi blo gros yangs par ston pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du me dang bud shing dag skyes par khas blangs pa'i phyogs la yang me'i rkyen gyis 'bar ba dang bcas pa de tsam bud

analyzed: yang na 'di ni rnam par bshad pa'i brnag pa gzhan yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma shos de'i rnam par @215a * //

original: de'i phyir 'di la byed pa po me'i mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig gis sreg bzhin pa na bud shing zhes bya grang na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la byed pa po me'i mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig gis sreg bzhin pa na bud shing zhes bya grang na /
translated: Therefore, if the fuel is being burned by some characteristic of the agent fire, it is called fuel.

original: de yang sgrub pa sngar bstan pas rdzas su yod pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir med pas /
analyzed: de yang sgrub pa sngar bstan pas rdzas su yod pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir med pas /
translated: But since the refutation of substantial existence has already been presented, it does not exist.

original: gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
analyzed: gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
translated: If it is just that, then

original: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
analyzed: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
translated: by what is the fuel being burned?

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam dro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi reg pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa de tsam sreg pa dang tshos pa dang snang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de ni yin pa'i tshe na'o zhes bya ba smras
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam dro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi reg pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa de tsam sreg pa dang tshos pa dang snang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de ni yin pa'i tshe na'o zhes bya ba smras
translated: If it is just that, that is, the mere assembly of form and so on that possesses the special contact characterized by heat, then it is the cause of the effects such as burning, cooking, and shining.🔽Therefore, when it is just that, then🔽if the fuel is being burned by some characteristic of the agent fire, it is called fuel.

original: te / des ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar sreg bzhin pa bud shing yin par brtag na byed pa po me'i mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig gis las bud shing gzhan zhig sreg bzhin pa na bud shing zhes bya grang na /
analyzed: te / des ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar sreg bzhin pa bud shing yin par brtag na byed pa po me'i mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig gis las bud shing gzhan zhig sreg bzhin pa na bud shing zhes bya grang na /
translated: But if you think that the fuel is being burned,

original: de yang sngar phung po brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su /🔽gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de yang sngar phung po brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: it was proven that🔽form is not observed

original: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: apart from the cause of form.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from what is called form,

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //🔽zhes sgrub pa sngar bstan pas gzugs rdzas su yod pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir me yang rdzas su med pas gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam gang la dro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi reg pa'i khyad par yod pa de tsam sreg pa dang tshos pa
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo // zhes sgrub pa sngar bstan pas gzugs rdzas su yod pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir me yang rdzas su med pas gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam gang la dro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi reg pa'i khyad par yod pa de tsam sreg pa dang tshos pa
translated: the cause of form is not seen.🔽Since this proof was previously presented, the substantial existence of form is refuted. Therefore, since fire is also not a substance, when the mere assembly of form and so on has the special feature of contact characterized by heat, that mere thing is the cause of the effects of burning, cooking,

original: dang snang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de me yin pa'i tshe na byed pa po me'i mtshan nyid 'ga' yang rdzas su med pas gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed de /
analyzed: dang snang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de me yin pa'i tshe na byed pa po me'i mtshan nyid 'ga' yang rdzas su med pas gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed de /
translated: light and so on. Therefore, when it is fire, since the agent characterized by fire does not exist as a substance in any way, what burns that fuel?

original: mi byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mi byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: It does not burn it.

original: yang na bud shing ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag las me shas che bar ma gyur pa'am gsum po dag yin par brjod la /🔽'byung ba chen po bzhi 'am /
analyzed: yang na bud shing ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag las me shas che bar ma gyur pa'am gsum po dag yin par brjod la / 'byung ba chen po bzhi 'am /
translated: Or else fuel is the four primary elements, or the three primary elements, in which the fire element is not predominant.

original: gsum po de dag kyang bsreg par bya ba dag yin gyi /
analyzed: gsum po de dag kyang bsreg par bya ba dag yin gyi /
translated: The four primary elements or the three primary elements are what is burned.

original: sreg par byed pa dag ma yin la /🔽me yang byung ba'am 'byung ba 'dus pa yin par pha rol po dag gis kyang shes pas de'i phyir nges par byar nus te zhes bya bas ni bud shing ci 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag cha mnyam pa 'am /
analyzed: sreg par byed pa dag ma yin la / me yang byung ba'am 'byung ba 'dus pa yin par pha rol po dag gis kyang shes pas de'i phyir nges par byar nus te zhes bya bas ni bud shing ci 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag cha mnyam pa 'am /
translated: They are not what burns.🔽And fire is the primary element or the combination of the primary elements.🔽Since the opponent also understands this, it is said that it is possible to ascertain that fuel is not fire.🔽Fuel is the four primary elements in equal measure or the three primary elements excluding the fire element.

original: yang na me'i khams ma gtogs pa gsum po dag yin par brjod la de dag kyang bsreg par bya ba dag yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na me'i khams ma gtogs pa gsum po dag yin par brjod la de dag kyang bsreg par bya ba dag yin gyi /
translated: They are what is burned.

original: sreg par byed pa dag ma yin la me yang me'i khams kyi 'byung ba 'ba' zhig gam 'byung ba bzhi car 'dus pa yin par pha rol po dag gis kyang shes pas de'i phyir me dang bud shing zhes tha snyad gdags pa gnyi ga yang 'byung ba'i ngo
analyzed: sreg par byed pa dag ma yin la me yang me'i khams kyi 'byung ba 'ba' zhig gam 'byung ba bzhi car 'dus pa yin par pha rol po dag gis kyang shes pas de'i phyir me dang bud shing zhes tha snyad gdags pa gnyi ga yang 'byung ba'i ngo
translated: And fire is not the agent of burning because both fire and fuel are by nature the four elements,🔽since the opponent understands that fire is either the primary elements alone of the fire element or the four elements combined.

original: bo nyid yin pas sreg pa'i byed @215b pa po ma yin pa'i phyir mes bud shing sreg par mi byed par ston to //
analyzed: bo nyid yin pas sreg pa'i byed @215b pa po ma yin pa'i phyir mes bud shing sreg par mi byed par ston to //
translated: Therefore it is taught that fire does not burn fuel because fire is not the agent of burning since both fire and fuel are by nature the elements.

original: de'i phyir don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore ultimately fire is not the agent of burning fuel

original: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is an element, like water and so on.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na chu la sogs pa gsum ni 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du me yang 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na chu la sogs pa gsum ni 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du me yang 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, the three elements such as water are not fuel because they are elements, and likewise fire is not fuel because it is an element.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid dang rags pa nyid dang gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa nyid dang phyi rol pa nyid dang skye ba can nyid dang rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid dang rags pa nyid dang gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa nyid dang phyi rol pa nyid dang skye ba can nyid dang rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang
translated: And likewise, the reasonings that form and so on are possessed, are gross, are included in the form aggregate, are external, are produced, and have causes should be stated.

original: brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma'i sgrub pa'i chos ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma'i sgrub pa'i chos ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar te /
translated: The predicate of the former inference is also applied to these.

original: don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Fire does not burn fuel ultimately.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang phyi rol pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang phyi rol pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because it is associated with form and so on, because it is gross, because it is included in the form aggregate, because it is external, because it is produced, and

original: rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bur sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bur sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: because it has a cause, it is like water and so on.

original: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par me ni sreg par byed pa nyid yin par mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par me ni sreg par byed pa nyid yin par mi 'thad pas /
translated: Therefore, in this way, it is untenable that fire ultimately burns.

original: gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
analyzed: gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
translated: When it is just that,

original: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
analyzed: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
translated: by what is that fuel burned?

original: gang gi tshe skye ba'i khyad par la ltos nas tha snyad du me 'am bud shing zhes brjod pa'i tshe 'byung ba 'dus pa de tsam me 'am bud shing de yin na gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga
analyzed: gang gi tshe skye ba'i khyad par la ltos nas tha snyad du me 'am bud shing zhes brjod pa'i tshe 'byung ba 'dus pa de tsam me 'am bud shing de yin na gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga
translated: When it is conventionally called fire or fuel in dependence on the specific arising of fire and fuel, if that mere collection of elements is fire or fuel, by what is that fuel burned?🔽This is a subsequent inference.

original: ma de'i don tshig le'ur byas pa dang sbyar ba yin te /🔽gang gi tshe 'byung ba chen po bzhi po cha mnyam pa'am me ma gtogs pa gsum po dag skye ba'i khyad par la ltos nas tha snyad du bud shing zhes brjod la /
analyzed: ma de'i don tshig le'ur byas pa dang sbyar ba yin te / gang gi tshe 'byung ba chen po bzhi po cha mnyam pa'am me ma gtogs pa gsum po dag skye ba'i khyad par la ltos nas tha snyad du bud shing zhes brjod la /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse, and it is applied to the metrical version.🔽When the four great elements are in equilibrium, or when the three elements except for fire are in a particular state of generation, they are conventionally called fuel.

original: me 'ba' zhig gam bzhi char las me shas che bar gyur pa skye ba'i khyad par la ltos nas tha snyad du me zhes brjod pa'i tshe 'byung ba 'dus pa de tsam me 'am bud shing de yin na bsreg par bya ba dang sreg par byed pa dbyer
analyzed: me 'ba' zhig gam bzhi char las me shas che bar gyur pa skye ba'i khyad par la ltos nas tha snyad du me zhes brjod pa'i tshe 'byung ba 'dus pa de tsam me 'am bud shing de yin na bsreg par bya ba dang sreg par byed pa dbyer
translated: When only fire or the four elements are in a particular state of generation in which the element of fire predominates, they are conventionally called fire.

original: med pas me gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed de mi byed do //
analyzed: med pas me gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed de mi byed do //
translated: If that much is the fire or fuel, then since the fuel and the fire are not different, by what fire is that fuel burned? It is not burned.

original: de lta bas na sreg bzhin pa na bud shing yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya @216a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na sreg bzhin pa na bud shing yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya @216a * //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say that when it is being burned, it is fuel.

original: ba ni // mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: ba ni // mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: pha rol po dag na re sreg bzhin pa bud shing yin pas me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin yang rgyu med pa la sogs pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re sreg bzhin pa bud shing yin pas me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin yang rgyu med pa la sogs pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The opponent says: Since that which is being burned is fuel, fire and fuel are different from each other, but the error of causelessness and so on does not arise.🔽That is illogical.🔽If you say that the example is not established because the fire element that burns fuel exists in earth and so on that remain undifferentiated,

original: gal te sa la sogs pa dag dbyer med par gnas pa la sreg par byed pa me'i khams yod pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pas sngar don dam par me
analyzed: gal te sa la sogs pa dag dbyer med par gnas pa la sreg par byed pa me'i khams yod pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pas sngar don dam par me
translated: the opponent says: The Mādhyamika previously presented the following refutation:

original: ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Fire does not burn fuel🔽because it is an element, like water and so on.

original: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i dpe de mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i dpe de mi rung ste /
translated: That example is not correct.

original: sa dang chu dang rlung gi khams dbyer med par gcig tu gnas pa la sreg par byed pa me'i khams yod de /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang rlung gi khams dbyer med par gcig tu gnas pa la sreg par byed pa me'i khams yod de /
translated: The fire element that burns fuel exists in earth, water, and wind elements that remain undifferentiated and are one.

original: 'di ltar sa'i dong du shing tog btsug pa dag smin par 'gyur bas sa'i khams la yang me yod la chus phog na rtsva sha na dang dar bha dag tshos par 'gyur ba'i chu'i khams la yang me yod cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa'i dong du shing tog btsug pa dag smin par 'gyur bas sa'i khams la yang me yod la chus phog na rtsva sha na dang dar bha dag tshos par 'gyur ba'i chu'i khams la yang me yod cing /
translated: Thus, since fruit planted in a pit in the earth ripens, the earth element has fire. Since grass and reeds are cooked when they are struck by water, the water element has fire.🔽Since grain struck by wind ripens, the wind element has fire.

original: rlung gis phog pa'i 'bru dag smin par 'gyur bas rlung gi khams la yang me yod pas khyed kyi dpe chu la sogs pa dag la me yod pa'i phyir bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te zhes bsgrub par bya ba chos de de dag la med🔽pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan pas dper mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: rlung gis phog pa'i 'bru dag smin par 'gyur bas rlung gi khams la yang me yod pas khyed kyi dpe chu la sogs pa dag la me yod pa'i phyir bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te zhes bsgrub par bya ba chos de de dag la med pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan pas dper mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Therefore, since your examples of water and so on have fire, they are not fuel that burns.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The response to that is that the author of the commentary says:

original: de yang bsgrub par bya ba rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de yang bsgrub par bya ba rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: That is also included in the category of that which is to be established by a similar type.

original: sa la sogs pa dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dpe nyid du grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dpe nyid du grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Earth and so on are established as examples by their own characteristics, so there is no fault.

original: sa la sogs pa dag la me yod pa de yang don dam par mes bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin pa bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de dag kyang bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dag la me yod pa de yang don dam par mes bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin pa bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de dag kyang bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin
translated: The existence of fire in earth and so on is similar to the probandum, that fire does not burn fuel, because it is included in that. Therefore they also do not burn fuel.

original: pas dpe'i skyon med do //
analyzed: pas dpe'i skyon med do //
translated: Thus there is no fault in the example.

original: yang na sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba nyid yin /
analyzed: yang na sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba nyid yin /
translated: Or else, the intrinsic characteristic of earth is solidity,

original: chu'i ni gsher ba nyid /
analyzed: chu'i ni gsher ba nyid /
translated: that of water is fluidity,

original: rlung gi ni yang zhing g-yo ba nyid yin pas de dag sreg par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis don dam par mes bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin pa'i dpe nyid du grub pa'i phyir yang dpe'i skyon med do //
analyzed: rlung gi ni yang zhing g-yo ba nyid yin pas de dag sreg par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis don dam par mes bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin pa'i dpe nyid du grub pa'i phyir yang dpe'i skyon med do //
translated: and that of wind is lightness and movement. Since they do not burn, they are established as examples by their own characteristics of the ultimate, that fire does not burn fuel. Thus there is no fault in the example.

original: gal te 'di skad ces mes bud shing sreg par 'jig rten la grags pa dang / lung las gsungs pa dang // mngon sum du mthong bzhin pa las khyed dbu ma pa me ni bud shing sreg par byed @216b pa ma yin te zhes sgrub par byed pa la grags pa'i gnod pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan
analyzed: gal te 'di skad ces mes bud shing sreg par 'jig rten la grags pa dang / lung las gsungs pa dang // mngon sum du mthong bzhin pa las khyed dbu ma pa me ni bud shing sreg par byed @216b pa ma yin te zhes sgrub par byed pa la grags pa'i gnod pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan
translated: If someone says, “Since it is well known in the world that fire burns fuel, it is stated in the scriptures, and it is seen by direct perception, your argument that ‘fire does not burn fuel’ is undermined by what is well known and so on,”

original: du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: in response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: grags pa'i gnod pa la sogs pa dag gi skyon yang med de sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod pa la sogs pa dag gi skyon yang med de sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “There is also no fault of undermining what is well known and so on, because a response has already been given earlier.”

original: don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can byas pas grags pa'i gnod pa dang lung gi gnod pa dang mngon sum gyi gnod pa med do zhes sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can byas pas grags pa'i gnod pa dang lung gi gnod pa dang mngon sum gyi gnod pa med do zhes sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the distinctive thesis “ultimately, fire does not burn fuel” is stated, there is no undermining of what is well known, no undermining of scripture, and no undermining of direct perception.

original: bye brag pa dag na re rdul phran bdag gi phyogs dang phrad pa la bdag dang ldan pa'i ma mthong bas bskyed pa'i las kyis rdul phran de bdag gi phyogs dang phral nas /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag na re rdul phran bdag gi phyogs dang phrad pa la bdag dang ldan pa'i ma mthong bas bskyed pa'i las kyis rdul phran de bdag gi phyogs dang phral nas /
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas say: We do not see the self that is conjoined to the part of the atom that is in contact with the self.

original: rdul phran gzhan dang phrad par byas te /
analyzed: rdul phran gzhan dang phrad par byas te /
translated: The karma that generates it separates the atom from the part of the self and causes it to contact another atom.

original: phrad pa rdul phran gnyis kyi gnas su byed do //
analyzed: phrad pa rdul phran gnyis kyi gnas su byed do //
translated: Contact is created in the place of the two atoms.

original: rdul phran phrad pa dang bcas pa de gnyis kyis rdul phran gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: rdul phran phrad pa dang bcas pa de gnyis kyis rdul phran gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed do //
translated: The two atoms that have contact create a substance called two atoms.🔽The two atoms also create a substance called two atoms of two atoms by contacting two atoms in the manner already explained.

original: rdul phran gnyis pas kyang ci skad bstan pa'i rnam pas rdul phran dang phrad pas rdul phran gnyis pa'i rdul phran zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis snang byed kyi rdzas brtsams pa me nyid dang 'brel ba'i phyir me yin la de
analyzed: rdul phran gnyis pas kyang ci skad bstan pa'i rnam pas rdul phran dang phrad pas rdul phran gnyis pa'i rdul phran zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis snang byed kyi rdzas brtsams pa me nyid dang 'brel ba'i phyir me yin la de
translated: In this way, the substance of fire is created in stages. Since it is related to fire, it is fire.

original: bzhin du bsreg bya yang bud shing dang 'brel pa'i phyir bud shing yin te de gnyis ni rgyu dang rgyu can yin pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzhin du bsreg bya yang bud shing dang 'brel pa'i phyir bud shing yin te de gnyis ni rgyu dang rgyu can yin pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since these two are cause and effect, they are mutually dependent.

original: bye brag pa dag me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid kyang yin la phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pas ltos pa med pa la sogs pa'i skyon sngar bstan pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i gzhung yin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid kyang yin la phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pas ltos pa med pa la sogs pa'i skyon sngar bstan pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i gzhung yin te /
translated: This is the treatise of the Vaiśeṣikas, who say that since fire and fuel are different and they are mutually dependent, the previously explained errors of independence and so on do not apply to our position.

original: de dag gi gzhung las 'jig rten 'jig pa'i dus na sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po dag zhig cing rdul phran du gnas pa dag 'chags pa'i dus na rdul phran gang bdag gi phyogs dang phrad pa de la bdag de dang ldan pa'i ma mthong ba
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung las 'jig rten 'jig pa'i dus na sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po dag zhig cing rdul phran du gnas pa dag 'chags pa'i dus na rdul phran gang bdag gi phyogs dang phrad pa de la bdag de dang ldan pa'i ma mthong ba
translated: In their treatise, when the world is destroyed, the great elements such as earth disintegrate and remain as subtle particles. When the world is formed, the subtle particles that contact the self are seen to possess that self.

original: zhes bya ba chos dang chos ma yin pas bskyed pa spyi mthun gyi las kyi rdul phran bdag gi phyogs dang phrad pa de bdag gi phyogs dang phrad nas rdul phran gzhan dang phrad par byas te /🔽phrad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don de rdul phran pa dag gi phyogs dang bral ba de dang gzhan dang phrad par byas pa de gnyis kyi gnas su byed do //🔽rdul phran phrad pa dang bcas pa de gnyis kyi rdul phran gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba chos dang chos ma yin pas bskyed pa spyi mthun gyi las kyi rdul phran bdag gi phyogs dang phrad pa de bdag gi phyogs dang phrad nas rdul phran gzhan dang phrad par byas te / phrad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don de rdul phran pa dag gi phyogs dang bral ba de dang gzhan dang phrad par byas pa de gnyis kyi gnas su byed do // rdul phran phrad pa dang bcas pa de gnyis kyi rdul phran gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed do //
translated: The meaning of the term contact is that the atoms of general karma generated by virtue and nonvirtue that contact the part of the self cause the atoms to contact other atoms.🔽The meaning of the term contact is that the atoms that are devoid of contact with other atoms are caused to contact other atoms and they are made to occupy the location of those two.🔽The two atoms that possess contact form a substance called a dyad.

original: rdul phran gnyis pa des kyang rdul phran gnyis pa'i rdul phran zhes bya ba @217a * //
analyzed: rdul phran gnyis pa des kyang rdul phran gnyis pa'i rdul phran zhes bya ba @217a * //
translated: The dyad forms a substance called a dyad of dyads.

original: rdul phran gsum pa'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis snang byed kyi rdzas zhes bya ba me rtsom pa'i rgyu'i rdul phran dag brtsams pa de dag me nyid dang 'brel cing mer gyur pa ni me yin la /🔽rdul phran gnyis pa des rdul phran gsum pa'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsreg bya'i rdzas zhes bya ba bud shing rtsom pa'i rgyu'i rdul phran dag brtsams pa de dag kyang bud shing nyid dang 'brel cing bud shing du gyur pa ni bud
analyzed: rdul phran gsum pa'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis snang byed kyi rdzas zhes bya ba me rtsom pa'i rgyu'i rdul phran dag brtsams pa de dag me nyid dang 'brel cing mer gyur pa ni me yin la / rdul phran gnyis pa des rdul phran gsum pa'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsreg bya'i rdzas zhes bya ba bud shing rtsom pa'i rgyu'i rdul phran dag brtsams pa de dag kyang bud shing nyid dang 'brel cing bud shing du gyur pa ni bud
translated: The cause particles of fire that form the substance called the illuminator, which is composed of three particles and so on, are related to fire and become fire.

original: shing yin te /
analyzed: shing yin te /
translated: The cause particles of fuel that form the substance called the combustible, which is composed of two particles and so on, are related to fuel and become fuel.
